loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Carmen, socia del BC Las Trabajadoras, vive en la Región San Martín, provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, distrito de  Juanjui. Tiene 56 años de edad y vive con su esposo y dos de sus 6 hijos, los cuales 4 de ellos ya son independientes y 2 están estudiando y aún dependen de ella. 

Se dedica a la venta de menestras sancochadas, verduras picadas para sopas y ensaladas y esencias de diferentes frutas para la preparación de chupetes o refrescos. Tiene su puesto de venta en el mercado central de la ciudad.

Con este préstamo de S/.2,000, el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, comprará menestras de diferentes variedades, leña para la sancochar las menestras, frutas en cantidad par la preparación de esencias y verduras para tener todo lo necesario para la preparación de sus productos que vende y así poder quedar bien con sus clientes. 

Carmen manifiesta que Manuela Ramos es un apoyo para ella y para su familia, así como para las demás mujeres emprendedoras. Trabaja duro cada día porque quiere comprar un carro para que su esposo tenga una herramienta de trabajo y así como también ella pueda salir a otros mercados.
texts.en:
Mrs. Carmen is a member of the BC Las Trabajadores. She lives in the region of San Martín, Mariscal Cáceras province, Juanjui district. She is 56 years old and lives with her husband and two of her 6 children. Four of them are already independent and two are students and still depend on her. She sells menestras sancochadas, diced vegetables for soups and salads, and fruit extracts for making snow cones and sodas. She owns a stand in the central market of the city. With this loan of 2,000 soles, which will be paid back in 6 months, she will purchase menestras of different varieties, firewood to cook the menestras, fruit in large quantities to prepare extracts and vegetables. This way she will have all that is necesary to prepare her products she sells and satisfy her clients. Carmen says that Manuela Ramos is a big support to her and her family, much like it is to many other entrepenourial women. She works hard each day because she wants to buy a car so that her husband can have a tool to work with, and so that she can go out to other markets.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy menestras of different varieties, firewood, fruits, and vegetables

loans.name: Carnen Rosa

texts.es:
La señora Carmen Rosa, socia del BC Mujeres Activas, vive en la Región San Martín, provincia y distrito de Bellavista. Tiene 46 años de edad, es madre de 9 hijos y vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos que aún dependen de ella. 

Se dedica a la venta anticuchos de carne de pollo asados al carbón y Juanes. Desarrolla el negocio en el Jr, Huallaga C-03, es una de las calles céntricas de la ciudad. Se inició con un primer préstamo de Manuela Ramos con el cual compró una parrilla y empezó a vender.  

Con este crédito de S/.1,700, el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, comprará los insumos para la preparación de los alimentos como, arroz, azúcar, carnes de res, pollo y cerdo en kilos, también cecina y chorizo que le permitirá variar los platos que ofertará a sus clientes y atenderá la petición de sus clientes, además desea comprar una refrigeradora que le hace mucha falta para su negocio. 

Carmen Rosa manifiesta que Manuela Ramos es un apoyo para ella y para su familia, así como para las demás mujeres que quieren salir adelante. Más adelante piensa buscar un local para dar una mejor atención a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mrs. Carmen Rosa is a member of the communal bank Mujeres Activas. She lives in the region of San Martín, in the Bellavista province. She is 46 years old, a mother of 9 children and lives with her husband and three children who are still dependent upon her. She sells beef and chicken kebabs made on the grill in addition to Juanes. She develops her business in the Jr, Huallaga C-03- it is one of the central streets in the city. She started with her first loan from Manuela Ramos with which she bought a grill and started selling. With this loan of 1,700 soles, which she plans to pay back in 6 months, she will purchase ingredients to prepare foods, such as rice, sugar, beef, chicken and pork in kilos, jerky, and sausage. These items will help her vary the dishes she prepares for her customers, and will be able to make custom dishes. In addition, she would like to purchase a refrigerator which she needs for her business. Carmen Rosa says that Manuela Ramos is a support to her and her family, much like it is to other women who want to suceed. In the future, she would like to find a shop to better serve her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar, beef, chicken, jerky, sausage

loans.name: Julia Mercedes

texts.es:
La señora Julia Mercedes Z. V. tiene 39 años y pertenece al Banco Comunal Santa Elena II, vive en Mz A 39 lote 45 Manuel Arévalo II etapa,  distrito de La Esperanza provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad Perú.
Estudió en Lima en la Universidad Garcilaso de la Vega hasta tercer ciclo de la especialidad de Educación Primaria, pero se casó y su primera niña es sordo muda, por lo tanto ya no pudo continuar con sus estudios porque tuvo que dedicarse a ella. Tiene 3 hijos hombres que son estudiantes.
Anteriormente tenía un cafetín en el Centro Médico de su localidad pero ahora su negocio consiste en la compra venta de ropa interior, hace y vende chocolatería,  tortas por temporada y pedidos de dulces para decoración de tortas.
Con su primer préstamo de 100 soles devuelto en 4 cuotas compró insumos para chocolatería.
Con este crédito de 1200 soles que será cancelado en 6 cuotas piensa poner un negocio de compra venta de gas.
Julia hace énfasis que en su Banco nadie se atrasa en los pagos, son muy cumplidas y además son muy unidas, son familia, sin estar unidas por vínculos de sangre.
Ella sueña con tener un negocio grande donde solo se dedique a administrar.
texts.en:
Mrs. Julia Mercedes Z. V. is 39 years old and is a member of the Santa Elena II Village Bank. She lives in Mz A 39 lot in the 45 Manuel Arévalo II stage in the La Esperanza district of the Trujillo province in the La Libertad department of Peru. She studied in Lima at the Garcilaso de la Vega University until the third cycle in primary education, but then she got married and their first child is deaf-mute. Therefore, she could not continue with her studies because she had to devote herself to her daughter. She also has three boys who are students. Previously, she owned a cafeteria in the Medical Center of her neighborhood, but now her business consists of buying and selling undergarments, making and selling chocolate, and making seasonal cakes and candy orders for decorating cakes. With her first loan of 100 soles, which she returned in four installments, she bought ingredients for her chocolate shop. With this loan of 1200 soles, which she will repay in six installments, she plans to install a business of buying and selling gas. Julia emphasizes that no one in her bank is behind in payments, that they are very satisfied and are very united, and lastly, that they are family, without being bound together by ties of blood. She dreams of having a big business where her only role will be in the management of the business.

Translated from Spanish by Larissa Kravanja, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Implementing a new business: The purchase / sale of gas.

loans.name: Denise

texts.es:
La señora Denise, socia del BC Las Trabajadoras, vive en la Región San Martín, provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, distrito de Juanjui. Tiene 44 años de edad y vive con su esposo y dos de sus 3 hijos que aún dependen de ella. 

Se dedica a la confección y venta de tarrafas para la pesca, así como también cría y vende gallinas de corral. Sus clientes llegan hasta su casa para adquirir sus tarrafas que son muy requeridas porque la ciudad está junto al río Huallaga facilitándoles la pesca. Las gallinas los lleva a vender en el mercado a las personas que venden comida. 

Con este préstamo de S/.1,000, el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, comprará hilo nylon en gran cantidad de diferentes pulgadas para la confección de tarrafas que muchas veces también envía a otros lugares cuando sus clientes lo solicitan, también comprará maíz para el engorde de sus gallinas y estar lista para la venta. 

Denise está contenta con el apoyo recibido de Manuela Ramos y los préstamos le permiten crecer en su negocio y obtener ingresos para ella y para su familia. más adelante desea comprar un terreno para construir su casa, porque vive en casa alquilada.

El desembolso de su préstamo fue el 11/10/08
La tasa de interés  de su préstamo es del 3.5%
El monto de su cuota mensual es de S/.  201.70
texts.en:
Mrs. Denise is a member of Workers Communal Bank and lives in the San Martín region, in the province of Mariscal Cáceres, district of Juanjui. She is 44 years old and lives with her husband and two of her three children who are still dependent on her. She works making and selling fishing nets and also raises and sells chickens. Her customers come to her house to buy nets that they need because the city is located next to the Huallaga River, which facilitates fishing. She takes the chickens to the market to sell them to people who sell food. With this loan of 1,000 soles ($325), which she will repay over 6 months, she will buy a large quantity of nylon thread of different sizes to make fishing nets. Many times she sends the nets to customers who live in other places. She will also buy corn to feed her chickens and fatten them for sale. Denise is happy with the support she has received from Manuela Ramos and the loans have permitted her to grow her business and make additional income for her family. In the future she would like to buy a plot of land to build a house because she house she lives in is rented. This loan was disbursed on 10/11/08. The interest rate for the loan is 3.5%. The monthly payment is 201.70 soles ($66).

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy nylon thread and corn

loans.name: Martha Esperanza

texts.es:
Esta señora Martha Esperanza E. P. tiene la edad de 48 años, su estado civil es soltera, tiene 3 hijas sus edades son: la mayor tiene 24 años y estudia recientemente ciencias médicas, otra de 21 años la cual trabaja en la empresa ARNECOM y la menor que tiene 6 años y cursa el 3 nivel de primaria, los deseos de ella es de construir y ampliar  unos cuartos  con el fin de que estos sean alquilados y generar ingresos para su familia  que lo necesita, otros de sus deseos es de instalar una maquina de coser de tipo industrial  por lo que ella posee conocimiento de la costura y así ofrecer estos productos y proporcionarle un futuro de estudios a sus hijos.



 Su actividad económica es una pulpería en la vende los productos como: hilo, zipper, golosinas y pasta de dientes el tiempo que tiene de poseer este negocio es de 18 años, Doña Martha inicia este negocio por la necesidad de obtener ingresos a su familia ya que otro de los oficios que tiene conocimientos es de costura, pero lo que la impulso a establecer una pulpería  fue ella misma y a medida que pasaba el tiempo decidió invertir mas ya que no tenia competitividad  en su cuadra es por esa circunstancia que necesita el financiamiento para la compra de sus productos que estos serian: cartulinas, lápices de colores cartulinas y cuadernos ya que dice que sus clientes le hacen estos tipos de pedidos.
texts.en:
This woman, Martha Esperanza E. P., is 48 years old. She is single and has three daughters; the eldest is 24 years old and is most recently studying medical sciences, another is 21 years old who works for the company ARNECOM, and the youngest is six years old and is in level three of primary school. Martha wishes to build and expand some rooms in her home with the goal of renting them and generating needed income for her family. She also wishes to install an industrial-grade sewing machine because she is familiar with sewing and that way, she could offer these extra products and provide a future for her children where they can study. Her business is a shop where she sells products such as thread, zippers, candy and toothpaste. She has been conducting this business for 18 years. Mrs. Martha initially started this business because she needed to earn income for her family. She was also familiar with the sewing trade, but the initial momentum was to establish a shop. Now that time has passed, she decided to invest in her shop more because there is not any competition on her block. It is for this circumstance that she needs funding to purchase products such as cards, colored pencils, and notebooks since her customers have said that they will order these kinds of products.

Translated from Spanish by Larissa Kravanja, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Fanny Auxiliadora

texts.es: La señora Fanny D. tiene la edad de 30 años habita en el sector de la Borgoña ubicado en municipio de Ticuantepe junto a su esposo eh hijo, el esposos de ella trabaja como técnico y la apoya con los gastos de casa ya que tienen un hijo a su cargo de diez año de edad, el pequeño estudia su primaria. La señora fanny tiene su propio negocio ya que ella vende y compra ropa de primera y segunda .Esta señora trabaja por encargos y a vez sale  vender .La señora empezó su negocio con sus propios esfuerzos y su marido que la apoyo para que ella salga adelante. Esta señora su gran sueño es llegar a tener su propia tienda y administrarla ya que ella acaba de cursar su secundaria y estudiara administración de empresas en la universidad de Managua.
texts.en:
Fanny D. is 30 years old and lives in the area of Borgoña located in the municipality of Ticuantepe along with her spouse and son. Her husband works as a technician and supports her with the household expenses as their son is 10 years old and he is in primary school. Fanny has her own business where she buys and sells new and used clothing. This woman works per orders placed as well as going out and selling. She began her business through her own efforts and her husband supported her so that she could be successful. This woman has a great dream to have her own store and manage it as she finished secondary school and would study business administration in the university of Managua.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothing

loans.name: Lilia Gregoria

texts.es:
La señora Lilia Gregoria Ucañán  D. C. tiene 54 años, pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Empresarias al Éxito II y vive en la calle Lambayeque Mz C  lote 41 del Puerto D. Salaverry provincia D. Trujillo departamento D. La Libertad Perú.
Estudió Secretariado Ejecutivo y trabajo en lo mismo durante muchos años pero se casó a los 29 años y dejó el trabajo para dedicarse a su hogar. 
Tiene una hija y un hijo, depenD. D. ella solo el hijo varón ya que su hija se casó.
Actualmente trabaja en servicio alimentario D. Wuawua Wuasi (casa D. atención para niños y personas D. bajos ingresos).
Además, para ayudarse económicamente también trabaja en sociedad con su hija haciendo parrilladas (carne a la parrilla) los días domingo, lo mismo que Papa a la Huancaína (comida típica D. la zona)  para repartir.
Su primer crédito D. 300 soles que devolvió en 4 cuotas, le sirvieron para empezar con sus polladas.
Con este crédito D. 500 soles que será cancelado en 4 cuotas, implementará su local con diversos insumos.
Lilia sueña con terminar D. construir su casa y arreglar un lugar para restaurant propio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Lilia Gregoria Ucañán D. C. is 54 years old and belongs to Business to Success II Village Bank. She lives on Lot 41 of the Lambayeque Mz C Street in the Puerto D. Salaverry section of the Trujillo province of the La Libertad department in Peru. She studied in a secretarial course and worked in the same job for many years, but got married when she was 29 years old and left the job to devote herself to her home. She has a daughter and a son, and at this time, only her son depends on her since her daughter got married. She currently works in food service for Wuawua Wuasi (home care for children and low-income individuals). In addition, in order to help financially she also works in partnership with her daughter to make barbeque food (grilled meat) on Sundays, as well as enough “Papa a la Huancaína” (food typical of the area) to go around. Her first loan of 300 soles, which she repaid in four installments, helped her to get started with their chickens. With this loan of 500 soles, which she will repay in four installments, she will implement new various ingredients into her business. Lilia dreams of finishing the construction of her house and setting up a place for her own restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Larissa Kravanja, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients in bulk.

loans.name: Deysi Fiorela

texts.es:
La señora Deysi Fiorela, socia del BC Mujeres Activas, vive en la Región San Martín, provincia y distrito de Bellavista. Tiene 33 años de edad y vive con su esposo que es albañil y con sus 2 hijos que aún dependen de ella. 

Se dedica a la venta de pollos y gallinas eviscerados en su puesto de venta en el mercado central de la ciudad. Sus clientes son las señoras que venden comida y los restaurantes de la zona. Tiene 3 años trabajando con el banco comunal y eso le permitió crecer en su negocio.  

Con este préstamo de S/.3,000, el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, comprará pollos y gallinas en gran cantidad para luego sacrificarlos y venderlos en el mercado y repartirlos a sus clientes que le solicitan diariamente. 

Deysi Fiorela manifiesta que Manuela Ramos es un apoyo para ella y para su familia, así como para las demás mujeres trabajadoras. Trabaja duro cada día porque quiere poner una bodega bien implementada en su casa.
texts.en:
Mrs. Deysi Fiorela, a member of the Active Women Communal Bank, lives in the San Martín region, in the province and district of Bellavista. She is 33 years old and lives with her husband who is a bricklayer and her two children who are still dependent on her. She works selling chickens and hens with their organs removed at her sales stall in the central market of the city. Her customers are the women who sell food and the restaurants of the area. She has worked for 3 years with the communal bank and this has allowed her to grow her business. With this loan of 3,000 soles ($975), which she will repay over 6 months, she will buy large quantities of chickens and hens in order to slaughter and sell them in the market, and deliver them to her customers who request them daily. Deysi Fiorela says that Manuela Ramos is a support for her and her family, as it is for the rest of the working women. She works hard every day because she wants to put a well-stocked general store in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a large quantity of chickens and hens

loans.name: Mauricio Jose

texts.es: El señor Mauricio José P. Martínez tiene la edad de 31 años habita en el reparto Juan Ramón padilla en el municipio de Ticuantepe junto a su esposa e hijo. El señor P. trabaja como ebanista en un taller de su papá desde hace 10 años  por lo cual solicita un monto de C$ 5,000.00 córdobas para compra de zinc y cuartones para mejorar la infraestructura de su negocio, los sueños de este señor es llegar a tener su propia mueblería y darle una mejor condición de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Mauricio Jose P. M. is 31 years old and he lives in the neighborhood of Juan Ramon Padilla in the county of Ticuantepe with his wife and child. Mr P. has been working as a cabinet-maker in his father's workshop for 10 years, and he would like the loan of $5,000.00 cordobas to buy zinc and timber to improve the business' infrastructure. This man's dream is to have his own furniture store and to give his family better living conditions.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials to make furniture/Comprar materiales para hacer muebles

loans.name: Lucero

texts.es:
La señora Lucero T. V. tiene 24 años de edad y pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Emprendedoras II , vive en la calle Augusto B. Leguía 221 balneario  de Buenos Aires distrito de Víctor Larco provincia de Trujillo departamento de La Libertad Perú.
Estudio secundaria completa, pero ya no continuo estudiando debido a que tuvo su hijo a los 16 años. Actualmente tiene 2 hijos uno de 8 años y el otro de 4 meses.
Lucero durante la tarde prepara  papa rellena y empieza a vender apartir de  las cinco, lo realiza en su casa.
Con el primer préstamo de 300 soles devueltos en 4 cuotas compró un saco de papas un bidón de aceite de 10 litros.
Con este crédito de 500 soles que será cancelado en 4 cuotas, mejorará su negocio comprando, papas, aceite y platos descartables.
Lucero sueña con tener una casa propia y ver profesionales a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Lucero T. V. is 24 years old and belongs to the Community Group Mujeres Emprendedores II. She lives on the Augusto B Leguia 221 street, in Buenos Aires, in the district of Victor Larco in the province of Trujillo, in the department of La Libertad in Peru.

She finished high school but she could not finish studying as she had her son when she was 16. She now has 2 sons who are 8 years old and 4 months old.

In the afternoon, Lucero makes filled potatoes and starts to sell them from 5pm onwards. She does this at her house. With the first loan of 300 soles, which she repaid in 4 installments, she bought a sack of potatoes, a 10 liter barrel of oil. With this loan of 500 soles, which she will repay in 4 installments, she will improve her business buying potatoes, oil and disposable plates. Lucero dreams of having her own house and seeing her kids become professionals.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy potatoes, oil and disposable plates in bulk/Compra de papas, aceite y platos descartables al por mayor.

loans.name: Gudelia

texts.es:
La señora Gudelia, socia del BC Las Trabajadoras, vive en la Región San Martín, provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, distrito de Juanjui. Tiene 45 años de edad y vive con su esposo y dos de sus 3 hijos que están estudiando y aún dependen de ella. 

Se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de videos, películas, musicales entre otros. Vende de manera ambulatoria y generalmente está en la puerta del mercado central. Complementa su negocio con la venta de gaseosas y mercería.   

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,700, el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, comprará videos (películas y musicales) actuales para asegurar sus ventas, también comprará gaseosas de diferentes marcas, tamaños y sabores, así como también mercería  para poder surtir su negocio. 

Gudelia manifiesta que Manuela Ramos es un apoyo, tanto para ella y compo para su familia, y también para otras mujeres emprendedoras. Trabaja duro cada día porque quiere crecer en su negocio y ver a sus hijos profesionales.
texts.en:
Gudelia is a member of the group BC Las Trabajadoras. She lives in the region of San Martin, a province of Mariscal Caceres, a district of Juanjui. She is 45 years old and lives with her husband and 3 sons who are studying and still depend on her.

She works selling all types of videos; films, musicals among others. She is a wandering saleswoman and generally sells in the entrance of the central market. She complements her business selling fizzy drinks and haberdashery.

With the loan of S/ 1700, which she will repay over a period of 6 months, she will buy recent videos (films and musicals) to assure their sales, as well as buying different brands, sizes and flavors of fizzy drink, as well as haberdashery, so that she can stock her business.

Gudelia shows that Manuela Ramos is a form of support, as much for her as for her family, and also for other industrious women. She works hard each day because she wants to see her business grow and her kids become professionals.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy videos (films and musicals), fizzy drinks and haberdashery/Comprará videos (películas y musicales), gaseosas y mercería.

loans.name: Luz Verónica

texts.es:
La  señora  Luz Verónica tiene 36 años, pertenece al Banco Comunal Dios Guía Nuestros Pasos II y vive en la Avenida 28 de Julio  121 del distrito Florencia de Mora en la provincia de Trujillo en el departamento de la Libertad.
Estudió hasta tercer año de secundaria, se casó de 17 años con el señor Manuel Rodríguez con quien tiene 2 hijos hombres y una mujer. La hija mujer ya está casada, los varones son estudiantes.
Su negocio, consiste en la fabricación de faldas y blusas, las que las envía a Quiruvilca, ciudad de la sierra, donde las vende otra persona. También hace arreglos de ropa a sus conocidos y vecinos.
Con su primer crédito de 300 soles que devolvió en 4 meses compró hilos, telas, adornos, aplicaciones.
Con este crédito de 500 soles que será cancelado en 4 cuotas comprará telas hilo, aplicaciones, entretela, panqueques, etc. 
Luz Verónica sueña con tener una remalladora, para poder confeccionar, polos, buzos, uniformes escolares de tela sintética.
texts.en:
Luz Veronica is 36 years old and she belongs to the Community Bank 'Dios Guia Nuestros Pasos II', and she lives on the 28th of July Avenue in the district of Florencia de Mora in the province of Trujillo in the department of La Libertad.

She studied until the third year of secondary school, and she married Manuel Rodriguez when she was 17, with whom she has 2 boys and a girl. Her daughter is already married and her two sons are still studying.

Her business consists of making shirts and skirts, which she sends to Quiruvilca, a city in the mountains, where someone else sells them. She also makes clothing adjustments and does mending for her friends and neighbors.

With the first credit of 300 soles, that she paid back over a period of 4 months, she bought thread, fabric, patterns and clothing adornments. With this credit of 500 soles, that she will repay in 4 installments, she will buy fabrics, thread, adornments, backing fabric etc

Luz Veronica dreams of having a sewing machine to be able to make polo shirts, track suits, and school uniforms from synthetic fabrics.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabrics, thread, adornments and backing fabric in bulk/Compra de telas, hilos, aplicaciones, entretela, panqueques al por mayor.

loans.name: Llany

texts.es:
La señora Llany, socia del Banco Comunal Las Trabajadoras, vive en el  departamento de San Martín, provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, distrito de Juanjui. Vende cosméticos y presta servicio de transporte urbano con dos motocarros. Tiene 45 años de edad, es separada y vive con sus 3 hijos quienes la apoyan en el manejo y cuidado de las motos.

Con este crédito de  S/.2,000, el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, invertirá en la compra de piezas, bajada de motor y en la renovación de algunas partes de la moto, y de esa manera dar seguridad y tranquilidad a sus clientes, también comprará productos en oferta para luego venderlos a precio de catálogo y así generar mayor ganancia.

Llany tiene 7 años trabajando con el banco comunal, el cual le permitió crecer en su negocio. Está contenta con los logros alcanzados hasta la fecha. Más adelante desea ampliar su casa para poner un negocio, así como también desea ver profesionales a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Llany, a member of the Community Group 'Las Trabajadores', lives in the department of San Martin, in the province of Mariscal Caceres, in the district of Juanjui. She sells cosmetics and lends out 2 motorbike-cars to the urban transport service. She is 45 years old, she is separated and loves with her 3 kids who help her out with looking after and maintaining the motorbikes.

WIth this credit of S/2000, which she will repay over a period of 6 months, she will invest in buying parts, changing the motor and in the renovation of some parts of the motorbike, thereby offering her clients safety and security. She will also buy products that are on special offer to resell them at the original price so she can generate more income.

Llany has been working with this community group for 7 years, and it has allowed her to enlarge her business. She is happy with her achievements to date. In the future she would like to extend her house to run a business there, and she would like to see her kids become professionals.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy motorbike parts and invest in a motor change and in the renovation of certain parts of the bike/Comprará piezas para la moto e invertirá en la bajada de motor y en la renovación de algunas partes de la moto

loans.name: Olga Marleni

texts.es:
Olga es socia de Banco Comunal Mar del Plata.
Olga es conviviente, tiene 31 años y 1 hijos de 10 años que está en el colegio.
Olga tiene su negocio de venta de cosméticos , vende solo los productos de belleza de Esika. Empezó con este negocio desde hace 2 meses, ella antes vendía ropa (lencería) .
Olga necesita un préstamo de 400 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de cosméticos para su stock.
Olga desde que recibe los préstamos ha mejorado , se siente tranquila.  
Olga sueña con tener un bazar, para poder vender diversos artículos.
texts.en:
Olga is a partner in the Sea of Silver Community Bank. She is 31 years old and lives with her partner. Olga has one son who is 10 years old and attends primary school. Olga sells Esika brand cosmetics. She used to sell clothing (lingerie) and started this cosmetics business two months ago. She needs a loan of 400 soles, which she'll use to buy cosmetics for her stock. Since she's been receiving loans Olga's situation has improved, and she feels peaceful. She dreams of having a bazar, so that she can sell a variety of products.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Olga needs a loan of 400 soles, which she'll invest in cosmetics for her stock.

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es:
Marlene es socia de Banco Comunal Mar del Plata. 
Marlene es casada, tiene 39 años y 1 hijo de 22 años, el ya terminó el colegio y solo trabaja.
Marlene tiene varios negocios: en la mañana tiene un jugueria en su casa (desde marzo), en la noche vende hamburguesas en su casa (desde muchos años) y también tiene un combi con su esposo. 
Marlene necesita un préstamo de 800 soles, dinero que será invertido en su mercadería, comprará insumos para su negocio.
Marlene desde que recibe los préstamos ha podido invertir mas.
Marlene sueña con crecer con  sus negocios.
texts.en:
Marlene is a member of the communal bank Mar del Plata. Marlene is 39 years old, is married and has a 22 year old son. Her son is out of school and only works. Marlene has several businesses: in the mornings she sells juices from her home (since March); in the evenings she sells hamburgers from her home (she has done this for several years) and she also has a taxi service with her husband. Marlene needs a loan in the amount of $275 which she will invest in her merchandise and buying supplies for her business. Since she has received these loans Marlene has been able to invest more. She dreams of expanding her businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in merchandise and supplies for her business.

loans.name: Maria Virginia

texts.es:
La señora María Virginia tiene 44 años, pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Empresarias de Éxito II  y vive en la calle Manuel Cox 107  del Asentamiento Humano Aurora Díaz del Puerto de Salaverry provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad Perú.
María estudió primaria completa, pero no le gustaba estudiar se inclinó siempre por los negocios y no continuó estudiando. Se casó de 15 años y tiene 2 hijos, cada uno con su compromiso, ella actualmente cuida a un  nieto.
María trabaja haciendo almuerzos para vender, lo que normalmente llamamos menú, además vende gaseosa, el negocio se ubica en su casa.
Con el primer préstamo de 300 soles que devolvió en 4 cuotas compró arroz, azúcar y aceite.
Con este crédito de 800 soles que será cancelado en 6 cuotas comprará, arroz, azúcar, gaseosa y cerveza, para los piqueos de los sábados y domingos, manifiesta.
María Virginia tiene una casa que aun está inconclusa por falta de medios económicos, sueña con terminarla y ponerla muy bonita, para poder cobijar a sus hijos y nietos.
texts.en:
Maria Virginia is 44 years old and she belongs to the Community Group 'Las Empresaias de Exito II'. She lives on Manuel Cox 107 road in the settlement of Aurora Diaz in the Port of Salaverry in the province of Trujillo, in the department of La Libertad, Peru.

Maria finished primary education but she did not like studying, and always preferred business so she decided to stop studying. She got married when she was 15 years old and she has 2 kids, each one with a serious commitment, and she currently looks after her grandson. Maria works making lunches to sell, which is normally called 'menu', as well as selling fizzy drinks. This business runs from her house.

With the first loan of 300 soles, that she repaid in 4 installments, she bought rice, sugar and oil. With this credit of 800 soles, which she will repay in 6 installments, she will buy rice, sugar, fizzy drinks and beer for the Saturday and Sunday picnics.

Maria Virginia has a house that is not yet finished due to lack of funds. She dreams of finishing it and doing it up nicely, so that she can house her kids and grandkids.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, fizzy drinks and beer in bulk/Compra de azucar, arroz, bebidas gaseosas, cerveza al por mayor.

loans.name: Luciana

texts.es:
La señora Luciana, socia del BC Mujeres Activas,  vive en la Región San Martín, provincia y distrito de Bellavista. Tiene 23 años de edad, vive con su esposo que es electricista y con sus dos hijos que aún dependen de ella. 

Se dedica a la venta de repuestos de los artefactos que su esposo repara. Su negocio está ubicado en su domicilio, lo que le permite estar al cuidado de sus pequeños hijos. Inició su negocio con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos. Tiene 4 años trabajando con el banco comunal y eso le ha permitido crecer en su negocio.  

Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000, el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, comprará diferentes tipos de repuestos, los que generalmente requieren sus clientes en los trabajos que realiza su esposo. 

Luciana manifiesta que Manuela Ramos es un apoyo para ella y para su familia, así como para las demás mujeres emprendedoras. Trabaja duro cada día porque quiere construir  un local para su negocio.
texts.en:
Ms. Luciana R., a member of the Mujeres Activas (Active Women) microfinance institute, lives in the San Martín region of the province and district of Bellavista. She is 23 years old and lives with her husband, who is an electrician, and her two dependent children.

She sells spare parts for the devices that her husband repairs. Her business is located in her home, which allows her to look after her young children. She started the business with a loan from Manuela Ramos. She has been working with the microfinance institute for 4 years, and it has allowed her business to grow.

With this 3,000.00 PEN loan, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will purchase several kinds of spare parts, the ones which her customers usually request from her husband for repairs.

Luciana states that Manuela Ramos offers support for her and her family, as well as for other enterprising women. She works hard everyday because she wants to build an office space for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase assorted spare parts

loans.name: Paula Alicia

texts.es:
Paula es socia de Banco Comunal Mar del Plata.
Paula es casada, tiene 35 años y 2 hijos de 13 y 10 años.sus dos hijos están el  colegio
Paula tiene su negocio de venta de comida: dulces, galatinas, papa rellena, refrescos, helados, ella vende desde hace 10 años.
Paula necesita un préstamo de 800 soles, dinero que será invertido en su mercadería insumos para los dulces que va a preparar.
Paula sueña con poner un local  de dulcería .
texts.en:
Paula is a member of the communal bank Mar del Plata. She is 35 years old, is married and has two children ages 13 and 10. Her two children are in school. Paula's business is selling food: she sells candies, stuffed potatoes, soft drinks and ice creams. She has had this business for 10 years. Paula needs a loan in the amount of $275 which she will invest in ingredients to prepare her candies. Paula dreams with opening a candy store.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients to make candies.

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
Maria es socia de Banco Comunal Mar del Plata.
Maria tiene 32 años y 1 hijo de 2 años. 
Maria tiene un bodega en la casa de su padre, empezó hace 3 años. Empezó  vendiendo  solamente gaseosas pero fue  aumentado su negocio poco a poco y ahora vende mas productos gaseosas, golosina, arroz, azúcar, etcétera. Maria trabaja sola, su esposo se fue a Argentina para buscar trabajo. Con su negocio apoya a su padre y hermana con quien ella vive. 
Maria necesita un préstamo de 800 soles, dinero que será invertido en su mercadería productos diversos, (golosinas, abarrotes).
Maria sueña con aumentar su negocio y también  poner un librería.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the communal bank Mar del Plata. Maria is 32 years old and has a two year old son. She has a grocery store in her father's home which she established 3 years ago. She started selling only soft drinks but started slowly expanding her business and now sells more products such as candies, rice, sugar, etc. Maria works alone since her husband left for Argentina in search of work. With her business she supports her father and sister whom she lives with. Maria needs a loan in the amount of $275 which she will invest in various merchandise (candies, groceries). Maria dreams of expanding her business and also of opening a bookstore.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in various merchandise for grocery store.

loans.name: María Isabel

texts.es:
La señora María Isabel tiene 43 años, pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Empresarias al Éxito II y vive en la Mz E lote 10 del Asentamiento Humano Fujimori Fujimori en el Puerto de Salaverry  provincia de Trujillo departamento de La Libertad Perú.
Estudió hasta primer año de secundaria pero no tuvo apoyo económico departe de sus padres por tal motivo no pudo seguir estudiando.  Se casó a los 19 años y tiene 3 hijos de los cuales se casaron dos y ella tiene a su cargo a un hijo de 14 años.
María Isabel vende gelatina, cerveza helada y los sábados y domingos hace comida para vender en su casa, a lo que popularmente  le llaman piqueos.
Con su primer crédito de 300 soles devueltos en 4 cuotas compro cerveza y gaseosa, manifiesta que estaba recién incursionando en este negocio y le fue muy bien porque vendió absolutamente todo, de tal manera que continuó y piensa ampliarlo un poco más.
Con este crédito de 500 soles que cancelará en 4 cuotas, ampliará su negocio, comprará más cosas como por ejemplo, vasos, banquitos (sillas), cerveza y gaseosa.
María Isabel sueña con tener un bonito y elegante restaurant.
texts.en:
Maria Isabel is 43 years old and is a member of the communal bank Las Empresarias al Exito II. She lives at Mz E lote 10 of Asentamiento Humano Fujimori Fujimori in the Puerto de Salavery in the Trujillo province in the La Libertad Peru department. She finished her first year of secondary school but did not have the economic support from her parents in order to keep studying. She got married at 19 years old and has three children. Two of her children are married and she cares for her 14 year old son. Maria Isabel sells jell-o and beer and on Saturdays and Sundays she makes food, commonly called "piqueos", which she sells from her home. She repaid her first loan in four installments and she used it to purchase beer and soft drinks. She had just started her business when she received this loan and business went well as she sold absolutely everything which allowed her to stay in business and to start thinking about expanding. She will repay this loan in four installments and will use it to expand her business and purchase supplies such as cups, stools, beer and soft drinks. Maria dreams with having a beautiful and elegant restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies such as cups, stools, soft drinks and beer.

loans.name: Maria Susana

texts.es:
Maria es socia D. Banco Comunal Mar del Plata.
Maria es casada, tiene 54 años y 3 hijos D. 35, 34 y 29 años. Los tres trabajan. 
Maria tiene una bodega, venD. gaseosas, cervezas y varios  productos mas. Tiene la tienda en su propia casa , empezó con este negocio desD. hace 3 años. Anteriormente  vendía pollo en el mercado durante 15 años, después decidió poner un negocio en su propia casa.   
Maria necesita un préstamo D. 600 soles, dinero que será invertido D. mercadería para su bodega como gaseosas,  coca-cola, kekes, huevos, arroz, azúcar. Quiere comprar en porciones grandes porque así los productos son mas baratos. 
Maria sueña con aumentar su negocio y apoyar a su familia., especialmente quiere contribuir con la  educación D. su nieto.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the communal bank Mar del Plata. Maria is 54 years old and is married with three children ages 35, 34 and 29 years. All three of her children work. Maria has a grocery store where she sells soft drinks, beer and various other products. Her store is located in her home. She started this business three years ago. Prior to opening her grocery store, Maria had sold chickens for 15 years at the market. She then decided to start her own business in her home. Maria needs a loan in the amount of $200 which she will invest in merchandise for her store such as soft drinks, eggs, rice and sugar. She wants to purchase these products in larger quantities in order to get better prices. Maria dreams of increasing her business and supporting her family. She especially wants to contribute to the education of her grandson.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing merchandise for her store such as soft drinks, eggs, rice and sugar.

loans.name: Mily

texts.es:
La señora Mily, socia del BC Mujeres Activas, vive en la Región San Martín, provincia y distrito de Bellavista. Tiene 37 años de edad y vive con su esposo y sus con dos hijos que aún dependen de ella. 

Se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en general. El negocio está ubicado en su casa en el Jr. Augusto B. Leguía No 298. Tiene 5 años trabajando con el banco comunal, el cual le ha ayudado a crecer en su negocio.  

Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000, el cual será cancelado en  6 meses, comprará productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar en saco, leche, aceite, conservas en cajas de diferentes tamaños, papel higiénico en paquetes y otros productos que tienen mayor rotación, de esa manera podrá surtir bien su negocio y sus clientes encontrarán lo que buscan. 

Mily manifiesta que Manuela Ramos es un apoyo para ella y para su familia, así como para las demás mujeres que quieren salir adelante. Desea crecer en su negocio y piensa ampliarlo con la venta de ropa.
texts.en:
Mily is a member of communal bank Mujeres Activas. She lives in the San Martin region in the province and district of Bellavista. She is 37 years old and lives with her husband and two children who are still dependent on her. Mily dedicates herself to selling groceries. Her business is located in her home at Jr. Augusto B. Leguia No 298. She has been working with the communal bank for five years and the bank had helped her expand her business. She will repay this loan of $975 in six months and will use the loan to purchase necessary products such as rice, sacks of sugar, milk, oil, canned food in different sizes, toilet paper and other products. This will allow her to stock her business so that her clients can find what they are looking for. Mily wants to express that Manuela Ramos is a great support for her and her family as well as to other women that want to get ahead. Mily wants her business to grow and is thinking of expanding it by also selling clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of rice, sugar, milk, oil and canned goods.

loans.name: Benito Porfirio

texts.es:
Benito es socio de Banco Comunal Mar del Plata. 
Benito es conviviente, tiene 36 años y 2 hijos de 13 y 11 años. Los dos estan en la escuela. 
Benito tiene su negocio de venta de ropa, empezó con este negocio desde hace 3 años, él vende en varios mercados, camina ofreciendo su mercadería .Benito trabaja solo.  
Benito necesita un préstamo de 400 soles, dinero que será invertido en su mercadería, va a  comprar ropa.
Benito sueña con aumentar su negocio y construir su casa.
texts.en:
Benito is a member of the Mar del Plata community bank. He's 36 years old, partnered and has 2 children, 13 and 11 years old. Both children are in school. Benito operates a business selling clothing. He began the business 3 years ago. He sells his merchanise in different markets, working as a street vendor. Benito needs a 400-soles loan, money that he will invest in buying clothes for resale. He would like to expand his business and build a house.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Maximita Angela

texts.es:
La señora Maximita Angela tiene 58 años, pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Emprendedoras II y vive en la calle Desamparados 199 balneario Buenos Aires distrito D. Víctor Larco provincia D. Trujillo departamento D. La Libertad. Estudió secundaria completa y se casó a los 19 años con Juan Bautista Vásquez, con quien tiene 6 hijos, los que son casados.

Maximita, venD. perfumería, pero no está conforme por lo que busca hacer otras cosas, ahora también fabríca mermelada D. frutas D. la estación, hace polladas (en base a pollos con especias) mensualmente. Su negocio lo realiza en su propia casa.

Con el primer préstamo D. 300 soles devueltos en 4 cuotas invirtió en su negocio, compró fresa y azúcar. Con este crédito D. 350 que será cancelado en 4 cuotas, invertirá en la elaboración D. una pollada, la misma que acostumbra realizar los días domingos y feriados.

Maximita es una mujer que desea siempre tener unida a su familia y su gran sueño es ambientar su casa para poner un restaurant y vender comida.
texts.en:
Maximita Angela is 58 years old, belongs to the community bank “Mujeres Emprendedoras II” (“Enterprising Women”), and lives at 199 Desamparados Street, near Buenos Aires hot springs in the Víctor Larco district of Trujillo, La Libertad.

She completed secondary school and at age 19 married Juan Bautista Vásquez, with whom she has six children, all of whom are married. Maximita sells perfume, but is not content with just that, and so she has looked for other opportunities. She now makes jam from seasonal fruit and hosts monthly chicken barbecues. She runs her business from her home.

Maximita invested the first loan she received in strawberries and sugar. (The loan was for 300 Peruvian nuevos soles, approximately US $100, and repaid in four months.) She now requests S/350 (US $125), to be repaid in four months, in order to host a chicken barbecue of the sort usually held on Sundays and holidays.

Maximita is a woman who wants her family to be together always and her dream is to develop her home into a restaurant where she can sell food.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of chicken and other ingredients for a barbecue

loans.name: Monica

texts.es:
La señora  Mónica, socia del B C El Abiseo, vive en la Región San Martín, provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, distrito de Juanjui. Tiene 29 años de edad, vive con su esposo y con sus dos hijos que aún dependen de ella. Tiene una cabina de Internet bien implementada, el cual está ubicado en el Jr. Triunfo C–05, es la casa de sus suegros. Tiene 4 años trabajando con el banco comunal, el cual le ha permitido crecer en el negocio.  

Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000, el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, comprará repuestos para sus computadoras, así como también lo implementará con accesorios como cámaras, audífonos que ya tiene que cambiarlos porque ya están malogrados por el demasiado uso, de esa manera podrá dar un buen servicio a sus clientes. 

Mónica manifiesta que Manuela Ramos es un apoyo para ella y para su familia, así como para las demás mujeres emprendedoras. Trabaja duro cada día porque quiere crecer en su negocio y ver a sus hijos profesionales.
texts.en:
Mónica, a member of “El Abiseo” Community Bank, lives in the Juanjui district of Mariscal Cáceres province in the San Martín region. She is 29 years old and lives with her husband and two young children. She has a well-equipped internet café located at C-05 Triunfo Lane, in the home of her in-laws. She has been working with the bank for four years and this has enabled her business to develop. With this loan of S/3,000 (approximately US $975), which will be repaid in six months, she will buy parts for her computers. In order to provide better service to her clients, she will also purchase accessories like cameras and headphones (which need to be replaced due to overuse). Mónica attests that Manuela Ramos is a great support for her and for her family, as well as for other entrepreneurial women. She works hard every day because she want to see her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase parts for computers as well as accessories like webcams and headphones.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
La señora Nancy, socia D. BC Las Trabajadoras, vive en la Región San Martín, provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, distrito de Juanjui. Tiene 37 años de edad y vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos varones que aún dependen de ella. 

Se dedica a la compra, crianza y venta de gallinas y de aves silvestres. Tanto ella como su esposo se dedican a la compra y venta de madera, su esposo es quien se encarga de salir a los pueblos a comprar y ella los vende al por menor a los aserraderos y carpinteros de la ciudad.  

Con este préstamo de S/.3,000, el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, comprará madera en grandes cantidades, así como también comprará gallinas y aves silvestres para criar y vender.
 
Nancy manifiesta que Manuela Ramos es un apoyo para ella y para su familia, así como también para las demás mujeres emprendedoras. Trabaja duro cada día porque quiere hacer crecer su negocio y también desea ver a sus hijos profesionales.
texts.en:
Nancy, a member of “Las Trabajadoras” (“Workers”) community bank, lives in the Juanjui district of Mariscal Cáceres province in the San Martín region. She is 37 years old and lives with her husband and two young sons. She purchases, raises, and sells hens and wild birds. She and her husband also buy and sell wood. Her husband is in charge of purchasing the wood in other towns and Nancy sells the wood wholesale to sawmills and carpenters in the city. With this loan of S/3,000 (approximately US $975), which will be repaid in six months, Nancy will purchase large quantities of wood as well as hens and wild birds to raise and sell. Nancy attests that Manuela Ramos is a support for her and her family, as well as for all other entrepreneurial women. She works hard every day because she wants to develop her business and see her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wood, hens, and wild birds.

loans.name: Sandra Elba

texts.es:
La señora Sandra Elba R. tiene la edad de 38 años, su estado civil es soltera, ella tiene dos hijos de los cuales actualmente cursan la primaria, los propósitos de Doña Sandra es  tener un lugar que represente las condiciones necesarias para la elaboración de su producto como es la tortilla por lo que  necesita su respectivo espacio, otros de sus sueños es contratar a una ayudante para que su mama descanse y proporcionarle la ayuda económica que necesita, dentro de sus metas ofrecerle a sus hijos un porvenir llenos de estudios por lo que esto requiere trabajar fuertemente pero solo así lograría asegurar el futuro de sus hijos y para que en un mañana no pasen dificultades.



La actividad económica a la que Doña Sandra se dedica es la venta y elaboración de tortillas que esta ubicado en león, el tiempo de tener este negocio es de 10 años, ella inicia este negocio por su mama por lo que Doña Sandra tenia experiencia en este oficio desde los 13 años de edad y fue así como ella decidió convertir este oficio en un medio de trabajo y vida y mas tarde toma la responsabilidad de hacerse cargo de este negocio, ella pidió este financiamiento para capital de trabajo ya que la elaboración de este producto requiere de mucha materia prima como es: el maíz, la compra de leña y carbón por lo que esto es el consumo de diario para la elaboración de su producto y agradece trabajar con fundación león 2000 y las diferentes organizaciones que le facilitan este crédito.
texts.en:
Sandra Elba R. is 38 years old, single, and has two children in primary school. Sandra would like to have an appropriate place to make tortillas. Another of her dreams is to hire an assistant so that her mother can rest and Sandra can provide for her needs. She also would like to make sure that her children are well-educated. For this, Sandra must work hard, but she knows that only in this way can she ensure her children's futures so that one day they will not face difficulties. For ten years, Sandra has made and sold tortillas in León, Nicaragua. She learned the profession from her mother and has had experience in making tortillas since she was 13 years old. She decided to commit herself to this way of life and later took over responsibility for the business. Sandra requests this loan as working capital, since the production of tortillas requires many resources: corn, wood, and coal. She is grateful to work with Fundación León 2000 and the other organizations that provide this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Yoli

texts.es:
La señora Yoli, socia del Banco Comunal Las Trabajadoras, vive en la Región San Martín, provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, distrito de Juanjui.

Tiene 32 años de edad, vive con su esposo y con su hijo. Su esposo es chofer y se dedica al servicio de transporte interprovincial y ella se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir para damas, caballeros y niños.

Con este préstamo de S/.3,000, el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, invertirá en la compra de ropa para niñas como blusitas, shorts, pantalones jean de diferentes marcas, polos, camisas para niños y caballeros. Esta inversión le permitirán satisfacer los gustos muy exigentes de sus clientes, así como también le dará mantenimiento a su carro para asegurar la tranquilidad de los pasajeros y del tipo de servicio que ofrece.

La señora Yoli ya tiene 3 años trabajando con el banco y esta muy contenta de haber logrado crecer en su negocio, agradece el apoyo de Manuela Ramos. Más adelante quiere comprar su casa.
texts.en:
Yoli, a member of “Las Trabajadoras” (“Workers”) Community Bank, lives in the Juanjui district of Mariscal Cáceres province in the San Martín region. She is 32 years old and lives with her husband and son. Her husband is a driver on routes throughout the region and she sells clothing for women, men, and children. With this loan of S/3,000 (approximately US $975), which will be repaid in six months, Yoli will invest in clothing for girls (blouses, shorts, various brands of jeans, polo shirts, etc.) as well as shirts for men and boys. This investment will enable her to satisfy the demands of her clients and will also provide for the maintenance of her car to ensure good service and calm for her passengers. Yoli has been working with the bank for three years and is very happy to have been successful in developing her business. She is grateful for the support of Manuela Ramos. In the future she would like to buy her own home.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy blouses, shorts, jeans, polo shirts, and shirts for children and men.

loans.name: Silvia Elena

texts.es: La Señora Silvia Elena V. tiene la edad de 38 años habita en la comunidad las Enramadas ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe junto a su esposo este señor le ayuda con los gastos de la casa el es vigilante y agricultor .Tiene a su cargo 2 hijos que actualmente estudian, los sueños de la señora Silvia es mejorar la condiciones de vida para su familla, esta señora tiene crianza de pollo y a vez los vende  desde hace 3 años ella solicita la cantidad C$ 23,000.00 córdobas   para hacer efectiva la compra de 800 pollitos para críalos y venderlos , ella ya tiene un mercado establecido ya que entrega pollo a pulperías y negocios que tienen comedor .
texts.en:
Mrs. Elena V. is 38 years old and lives in the community of las Enramadas located in the Ticuantepe municipality together with her husband, who helps her with the household expenses and is vigilant and agricultural. They have 2 children who are currently in school and the dream of Mrs. Silvia is to improve the family's living conditions. This woman has a flock of chickens and has sold them for the past 3 years. She is requesting an amount of C$ 23,000.00 córdobas to make the purchase of 800 chicks effective to raise them and sell them. She has an established market as she delivers chickens to grocery stores and businesses that have cafeterias.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase flocks of small chickens

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa tiene 55 años de edad, es madre de 5 hijos que ya son independientes y la apoyan mucho. Ella vive con su esposo, quien esta de acuerdo en todo lo que se propone. Rosa se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad (arroz, azúcar, sal entre otras cosas) formando así su pequeña bodega, esta actividad la viene realizando desde hace 3 años. Lo que le gusta de su labor diaria es tratar mucho con sus clientes, sobre todo con aquellos que hablan de negocios, esta bodega le es rentable, ya que es la única persona que tiene este tipo de negocio por su zona razón por la cual  le va muy bien. Este ya es su préstamo nº 7 en su IMF y es puntual en sus pagos. Con el dinero comprará más productos para implementar su negocio, así como también quiere ampliar y dar una mejor acogida a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Rosa is a 55-year-old mother of five children who are self-reliant and give her a great deal of support. She lives with her husband, who is in agreement with all her decisions. Rosa works selling basic food staples (rice, sugar, and salt, among other things) in a small grocery store which she has run for the past 3 years. She enjoys dealing with her customers, especially with those whom she can talk business. This grocery store is profitable for her; as she is the only person with this type of business in the region, business is going very well. This will be her seventh loan with this bank, and she is punctual with her payments. With the loan money she will buy more products to finish setting up her shop; she would also like to expand her business and be more welcoming to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Martyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing products to stock her store and expand the size of her business

loans.name: Merci

texts.es: Merci tiene 30 años de edad, es madre de un hijo que está estudiando, en la actualidad vive junto con su esposo, quien le da la mano en sus objetivos trazados. Ella se dedica a la venta de cerveza, en su casa desde hace 3 años, le gusta mucho su trabajo porque conoce a mucha gente con quien comparte ideas. Este negocio  le es muy rentable, ya que fortalece un poco más su nivel económico y porque trabaja con una marca muy reconocida que tiene los precios cómodos al gusto del cliente. Su negocio no tiene dificultad alguna y le va excelente. Es su 7mo préstamo en MFP. Con el dinero que pide quiere mandar a construir su pequeño bar al costado de su casa y desde luego implementarse con más productos cerveceros de otras calidades.
texts.en:
Merci is 30 years old, is the mother of one son who is in school, and currently lives with her husband who gives her a hand in the objectives she sets. She has worked selling beer for the past 3 years and she likes her job because she meets many people with whom she shares ideas. This business is very profitable, as it already strengthens her economic level a little and because she works with a very recognized brand that has comfortable prices to her clients' liking. Her business does not have any difficulty and it is going excellently. It is her seventh loan in MFP. With the money that she is requesting she will have a small bar built on the side of her house and then add more beer products of other qualities.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a location for her business

loans.name: Anith

texts.es: Anith tiene 35 años de edad, es madre de 2 hijos que cursan estudios primarios y secundarios, vive con su conviviente, quien le brinda su apoyo incondicional. Ella brinda  servicios de costura para niños y adultos en ambos géneros desde hace 5 años atrás. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es quedar bien con sus clientes y que estos se sientan satisfechos de su buena labor. Esta actividad le es rentable porque cuenta con una gama de clientes que aprecian mucho su trabajo, además es una persona que satisface los gustos diversos. Lo difícil, es no contar con un taller adecuado. Es su 7mo préstamo en MFP. Con el dinero que solicita quiere mandar a construir un taller textil, como también quiere comprar vitrinas para exponer sus trabajos a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Anith, 35, is the mother of 2 school-aged children. She lives with her partner who supports her unconditionally. She makes clothes for both children and adults, a business she's operated for 5 years. The part of her job that she likes best is proving a good service to her customers and seeing how satisfied they are with her work. The business is profitable because she can depend on a range of customers who fully appreciate her work and because she's a person who can meet various demands. The hard part for her is that she doesn't have adequate workspace for the business. This is her 7th loan from MFP. With the loan that she's requested, she wants to build a workshop and buy display cases so that she show her work to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a workshop.

loans.name: Samon

texts.en:
Mrs. Samon S., 47, and her husband, Mr. Yoeun Yi, 49, live on an island on the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.  They were married in 1978 and have eight children: six sons and two daughters. One of their children is married and lives outside the family home. Five children are in school and two sons have full time employment.

Mrs. Samon has been weaving for twenty years, a skill she learned from her parents when she was sixteen years old. She sells her finished products to the middle man in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. Her husband has been growing rice for twenty years. He grows rice in his rice farm a bit far from home for food.

Samon is requesting a loan of 300 to purchase thread and silk for weaving.

loans.use: To purchase thread and silk materials for weaving.

loans.name: Try

texts.en:
Mr. Try S., 44, and his wife, Mrs. Ateykak Ter, 42, live along the National Road Number Six, about twenty Kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1985 and have seven children: three sons and four daughters. Two of their children are married and live with them. One son is a fisherman, other three children are in school and the youngest daughter still stays at home.

Try has been fishing for almost thirty years, a skill he learned from his parents. He fishes from the Mekong River and the lake near his village and his wife sells them in village. He is requesting a loan of $400 to purchase a boat motor for his business.

loans.use: To purchase a boat motor for fishing.

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
Mrs. Mom S., 31, and her husband, Mr. Tev Ros, 34, live on an island on the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.  They were married in 1994 and have two children: one son and one daughter. Both of them are in school.

Mrs. Mom has been weaving for fifteen years, a skill she learned from her parents when she was fourteen years old. She sells her finished products to the middle man, who then takes them to sell in the Phnom Penh market. Her husband is a motor taxi driver in his village.

Mom is requesting a loan of $300 to purchase silk materials to continue her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for weaving.

loans.name: Thol

texts.en:
Mrs. Thol T., 51, and her husband, Mr. T. Kheav, 59, live along National Road Number One, about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh.  They were married in 1979 and have six children: four sons and two daughters. Four of their children were married and live outside the family home and other two children live under their custody.

Thol and her husband have been farming for twenty eight years. They grow tomatoes and papayas in their farmland near the house to sell to the middle man, who takes them to sell in the Phnom Penh market. The couple is in the process of building their new home but lacks the money to finish some parts of the house.

Thol is requesting a loan of $1000 to add in her own money to finish the house.

loans.use: To add in her own money to finish the house.

loans.name: Kannha

texts.en:
Mrs. Kannha S., 29, and her husband, Mr. Sochea Phan,31, live in a small village off of National Road Two about seventeen kilometers south of Phnom Penh. They were married in 2001 and have three children; two sons and one daughter. One of their children studies in the local school and other two children are still young and stay at home.

Kannha has been selling vegetables for one year. She buys them at the Ta Khmao market for selling in her village market. Her husband has full time employment in Phnom Penh. She is requesting a loan of US$500 to purchase a motorbike to carrying vegetables and to lay concrete for her house foundation.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for carrying vegetables and to lay concrete for her house foundation.

loans.name: Kimsol

texts.en:
Mr. Kimsol S., 28, and his wife, Mrs. Tha Ron, 26, were married in 2001 and have one daughter. The family lives along national road number five about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Kimsol has been a mason for ten years. He does his work in the village and the surrounding area. His wife has been a garment factory worker for eight years. The couple is in the process of building their new home.

So, Kimsol is requesting a loan of $300 to purchase wood materials to build his house.

loans.use: To purchase wood materials for building his house.

loans.name: Somaly

texts.en:
Mrs. Somaly N., 24, and her husband, Mr. Veasna Chen, 24, live in a small village off National Road Two, about twenty kilometers south of Phnom Penh.  They have been married for five years and have one daughter.

Mrs. Somaly has been a garment factory worker in Phnom Penh for five years. Her husband has been a mason for five years as well.  Somaly is requesting a loan of US$300 to build staircase of their house.

loans.use: To build staircase of her house.

loans.name: Sophea

texts.en:
Mr. Sophea M., 31, and his wife, Mrs. Sophak Mon, 30, live in a small village along National Road Two, about twenty kilometers south of Phnom Penh.They were married in 1998 and have three children; one son and two daughters. Two of their children are still in school.

Sophea has been a mason for ten years. He does his work in Phnom Penh, while his wife has been a garment factory worker for ten years as well. He is requesting a loan of US$300 to purchase construction materials for expanding their home.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials for expanding his home.

loans.name: Veng

texts.en:
Mr. Veng S., and his wife, Mrs. Chanthy Sim, 25, live in a small village along National Road Two, about twenty kilometers south of Phnom Penh.  They have been married for one year and have one daughter, she is eight days old.

Mr. Veng has been a security guard since 2005. His wife has been a factory worker for five years.  Both husband and wife are working in Phnom Penh City and they usually go to work by motor taxi and the cost is very high. 

Veng is requesting a loan of US$1000 to purchase a motorcycle for going to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for driving to work.

loans.name: Djahid

texts.en:
Djahid (his father is pictured) is married and has 3 children. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan's Fuzuli town and lives in the Fuzuli region's Bala Bahmanli village.
He was born in 1958. Djahid and his father have run the butcher business for 5 years. Now they need a loan of 800 AZN to  buy meat to improve their business.

loans.use: to buy meat

loans.name: Raftar

texts.en:
Raftar was born in 1971. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan's Fuzuli town and lives in the Fuzuli region's Zobcug village.
This single man has sold clothing and shoes for 3 years. Now he needs a loan of 800 AZN to buy clothes and shoes to provide his clients with good services and to get more income.

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes

loans.name: Baybala

texts.en: Baybala is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan's Fuzuli town and lives in the Fuzuli region's Zobcug village. He is 43 years old. This man has been in the tombstone business for 5 years. Baybala is married and has 3 children. Now he needs a loan of 800 AZN to buy materials for making tombstones.

loans.use: to buy materials for making tombstones

loans.name: Nen

texts.en:
Mrs. Nen N., 57, and her husband, Mr. Yen Sao, 61, who live on an Island of the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1979 and have six children: two sons and four daughters. Three of their children are married and live outside the family home. One daughter is a weaver and the other two children study in the local school.

Mrs. Nen has been a silk weaver for twenty five years, a skill she learned from her parents when she was fifteen years old. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village, who then takes it to sell in Phnom Penh. Her husband has been a motor-taxi driver for twenty years. 

Nen is requesting a loan to purchase silk materials for weaving.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving

loans.name: Yan

texts.en:
Mrs. Yan C., 65, and her husband, Mr. Sok Chhun, 67, who live in a small village along national road number two about twenty kilometers south of Phnom Penh, were married in 1968 and have eight children; five sons and three daughters. They all married and live outside the family house.

Mrs. Yan has been selling meals and coffee for six months. Before she started this business, she was a fish seller. Her husband is a motor-taxi driver. She is requesting a loan to expand her business of selling meals and coffee.

loans.use: To expand her business of selling meals and coffee

loans.name: Chreal

texts.en:
Mrs. Chreal A., 52, and her husband, Mr. Phal Proeung, 48, were married in 1984 and have two children; one son and one daughter. Both of them are now married. Their son lives outside the family home and the daughter and her husband live with her parents.

Mrs. Chreal has been weaving mosquito nets and scarves for three years. She buys cotton thread from villagers and sells her finished products at her home. Her husband has been farming and selling mosquito nets since 1993. 
 
Chreal is requesting a loA. to purchase cotton thread to weave mosquito nets and scarves.

loans.use: To purchase cotton thread to weave mosquito nets and scarves

loans.name: Man

texts.en:
Mr. Man K., 42, and his wife, Mrs. Zi Mat, 38, live along national road number six, about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1987 and have five children; two sons and three daughters. Two of their children are silk weavers, their other two children study in the local school, and the youngest one stays at home.

Mr. Man has been fishing since 1985. He fishes in the Mekong river and sells the fish in the local market. His wife has been weaving silk for two years. It is a skill she learned from her mother. She was hired by villagers to weave silk to get extra income. Man is requesting a loan to repair fishing materials.

loans.use: To repair fishing materials

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokha T., 46, and her husband, Mr. Leang Mak, 61, live in a small village off of national road two about seventeen kilometers south of Phnom Penh. They were married in 1984 and have three children; one son and two daughters. The first child is a factory worker, and other two children study in the local school.

Sokha has been selling fruit for one year. She buys fruit from the Dem Kor market and resells it in Toul Tumpong market. Her husband has been farming for seven years.

She is requesting a loan of to purchase fruit for reselling.

loans.use: To purchase fruit for reselling

loans.name: Bunchoeun

texts.en:
Mr. Bunchoeun D., 31, and his wife, Mrs. Chanry Seng, 30, live along National Road Number Five about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1998 and have three daughters; two of whom study in local school. The youngest one stays at home.
 
Bunchoeun has been a Remoque (shown in the picture) taxi driver for eight years. His wife sells fish. She buys the fish from fisherman in the village and resells them at the market. Bunchoeun is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase a motorbike and a trailer to replace the old one.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike and a trailer for taxi driving.

loans.name: Sophal

texts.en:
Mr. Sophal S., 40, and his wife, Mrs. Sokhom Tem, 42, who live in a small village off of national road two about twenty kilometers South of Phnom Penh, were married in 1985 and have five children; three sons and two daughters. All of them study in the local school.

Mr. Sophal has been a mason for ten years. His wife has been selling vegetables for ten years as well. She buys vegetables from Ta Khmao market for resale at her village. Sophal is requesting a loan to purchase vegetables for his wife for reselling.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables for his wife to resell

loans.name: Chhoeun

texts.en:
Mr. Chhoeun T., 49, and his wife, Mrs. Sam-ol Chheng, 38, who live in a small village off of national road two about twenty kilometers South of Phnom Penh, were married in 1991 and have three children; two sons and one daughter. All of them study in the local school.

Mr. Chhoeun has been a mason for three years. His wife has been selling grocery items for one year. She buys grocery items from Ta Khmao market to resell at her home. Chhoeun is requesting a loan to add to his savings to purchase a motorbike for driving to work.

loans.use: To add to his savings to purchase a motorbike for driving to work

loans.name: Bona

texts.en:
Mr. Bona S., 46, and his wife, Mrs. Sambo Keo, 45, who live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1985 and have four children: two sons and two daughters. Three of their children study and the other one daughter is a silk weaver.

Bona has been a carpenter since 1985. He produces beds, looms, and other wooden materials for sale. His wife has been a silk weaver since she was eighteen years old, a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to the middle man in the village, who then takes it to sell in Phnom Penh. 

Bona is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase wood and materials to produce looms to sell.

loans.use: To purchase wood and material to produce looms

loans.name: Sophea

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophea K., 30, and her husband, Mr. Phy Nhem, 42, live on an island in the Mekong river, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1997 and have one daughter who studies in the local school.

Sophea has been a silk weaver since she was sixteen years old. It is a skill she learned for her sister. Her husband has been a silk weaver since he was married. They sell their finished products to the middleman in the village, who then takes it to sell in Phnom Penh.  
 
Sophea is requesting a loan to purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for weaving

loans.name: Vusala

texts.en:
Vusala (her brother is pictured) was born in 1978. She is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan's Fuzuli town and lives in the Fuzuli region's Kayidish village, which is built for IDPs.
Vusala is married and has one child. She and her brother sell electrical goods. Now they need a loan of 800 AZN to buy  stoves, electric irons, etc. for improving their business.

loans.use: to buy  stoves, electric irons

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Mrs. Chan C., 45, and her husband, Mr. Phat Krouch, live in a small village across the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were marred in 1984 and have two children; one son and one daughter. Their daughter is married and lives outside the family home and their son studies in local school. 

Chan has been a silk weaver for twenty-eight years, a skill she learned from her sister. Her husband has been a silk weaver for over ten years, a skill he learned from Chan. They sell their finished products to the middle man in the village, who then takes it to sell in Phnom Penh.    

Chan is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase silk material for weaving.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving.

loans.name: Sothea

texts.en:
Mrs. Sothea S., 27, and her husband, Mr. Sopheap Pol, 32, who live in a small village off national road number two, about twenty kilometers south of Phnom Penh, were married in 1998 and have three children; two sons and one daughter. Two of their children study in the local school, and the youngest one stays at home.

Sothea has been a mason for three years. Her husband has been a mason for one year. The couple works in Phnom Penh and other places that are far from home. Sothea is requesting a loan to purchase a motorbike for driving to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for driving to work

loans.name: Borann

texts.en:
Mrs. Borann P., 47, is a widow with three children; two sons and one daughter. Two of her children are married and live outside the family home and another son assists his mother in her grocery business. 
 
Borann has been a grocer since 1986. She bought grocery items from market to resell from her home. She is requesting a loan of $500 purchase more grocery items to resell and for her stock.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items

loans.name: Oun

texts.en:
