Mrs. Oun T., 39, and her husband, Mr. San Sous, 38, who live in a small village across the Mekong river, about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1987 and have four children; two sons and two daughters. Three of their children study in the local school and their youngest daughter is still young and stays at home. In addition to her children, she also has two brothers living with her as well.

Oun has been a silk weaver since 1996. She sells her finished work to the middleman who then takes it to sell in Phnom Penh market. In addition to silk weaving, she raises pigs as well. Her husband has been a cow seller for twenty years. It is a skill he learned from his parents. He buys cows from other provinces (Battam Bong, Kandal, Prey Veng...) for resale in Phnom Penh.

Oun is requesting a loan to purchase cows for her husband to resell.

loans.use: To purchase cows for resale

loans.name: Sokhen

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokhen S., 25, is single and has four siblings: two brothers and two sisters. Both of her brothers are silk weavers, and the two sisters are married and live outside the family house. Besides her sisters and brothers, her 55-year-old father, Mr. Sorn Phoung, lives with her as well. The family lives on an island on the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

For ten years, Sokhen has been weaving silk, a skill she learned from her neighbor when she was 15 years old. She sells her finished products to a middleman in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. Her father has been a wooden house builder for 25 years; he learned the skill from his father when he was 30 years old.

Sokhen is requesting a loan of $200 to purchase silk materials for weaving.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for weaving

loans.name: Nao

texts.en:
Mrs. Nao R., 44, lives with her husband, Mr. Vuthy Cheng, 45, in a small village near the Mekong River about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1987 and have four children: two sons and two daughters. One of their children is married and lives outside the family house, and the other three children attend a local school. Nao's old mother lives with them as well.

Nao has been a silk weaver for over 10 years. She sells her finished products to a middleman who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. Her husband has been raising pigs and producing rice wine for 15 years. Nao hopes that her business will be able to support her sons to study at as high a level as possible.

Nao is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase silk materials to continue her weaving business and to buy piglets for her husband to raise.

loans.use: To buy silk materials for weaving and to buy piglets to raise

loans.name: Phal

texts.en:
Mrs. Phal C., 43, and her husband, Mr. Min Lay, live on an island on the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1983 and have seven children: two sons and five daughters. Three of their children are married and live outside the family house. Two children attend a local school, one son is employed full-time, and one daughter is a grocery seller.

Phal has been selling silk fabric since 1986. She buys the finished products from weavers in her village for resale in a Phnom Penh market. Her husband assists her in the business and also helps her daughter to buy grocery items for resale.

Phal is requesting a loan of $1000 to buy silk fabric for resale.

loans.use: To buy silk fabric for resale

loans.name: Thach

texts.en:
Mrs. Thach K., 63, lives on an island on the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. She has six children: two sons and four daughters. All of her children are married; five of them live outside the family house. Besides her children, her old father lives with her as well.

Thach has been weaving silk and selling silk fabric since 1979. She buys the finished products from weavers in her village and sells them in other provinces and around Phnom Penh. Thach is requesting a loan of $500 to buy silk fabric for resale.

loans.use: To buy silk fabric for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase silk fabric for resale

loans.name: Tong

texts.en:
Mr. Tong A., 43, and his wife, Mrs. Tin Ry, 38, live on National Road Number One about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1987 and have four children: three sons and one daughter. All of their three sons are in school, and the daughter is employed full-time.

Tong has been a motor taxi driver for 18 years, and he also raises cows. His wife is a garment factory worker. He is requesting a loan in the amount of $1000 to purchase a motorcycle for his children to drive to school.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for his children to drive to school

loans.name: Sovann

texts.en:
Mrs. Sovann P., 46, is a widow with seven children: five sons and two daughters. One of her children is married and lives outside the family house, four of the children are employed full-time, and the other two children are in school. The family lives in a small village off of National Road Two about 20 kilometers south of Phnom Penh.

Sovann has been selling secondhand clothes for 12 years. She buys them from a market in Phnom Penh for resale in her village and a nearby village. She is requesting a loan of $300 to purchase more clothes to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase clothes for resale

loans.name: Kit

texts.en:
Mrs. Kit M., 53, and her husband were married in 1979 and have six children: three sons and three daughters. Two of her children are married and live outside the family home, two others are silk weavers, one works in a garment factory, and one is a student in grade nine. The family lives in a small village near the Mekong River about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Kit has been a silk weaver since 1970; she learned the skill from her mother. She sells her finished products to a middleman in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. Her husband cannot work because he has a serious illness.

Kit is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her weaving business

loans.name: Thi Thuy

texts.vi: Chị Đặng Thị Thùy là thành viên của Quỹ ình thương từ năm 2003. Những năm đầu tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương chị Thùy đều vay vốn và sử dụng để chăn nuôi. Hiện tại ngoài chăn nuôi, tranh thủ thời gian nông nhàn hai vợ chồng chị Thùy còn đi làm thuê để tăng thu nhập cho gia đình. Với mức thu nhập 3.000.000đ/ tháng ngoài chi tiêu và hoàn trả vốn cho Quỹ tình thương theo quy định gia đình chị Thùy còn có thể tiết kiệm được một khoản tiền nhỏ dành để đầu tư cho con cái ăn học và mua sắm thêm đồ dùng gia đình cải thiện cuộc sống. Vòng vốn tới chị Thùy  mong muốn được vay 9.000.000đ để đầu tư mua 6 con lợn giống về nuôi, số vốn còn lại gia đình sẽ đầu tư mua sắm thêm dụng cụ lao động phục vụ cho công việc làm thuê.
texts.en:
Mrs. D. Thi Thuy has been a member of the TYM Fund since 2003. She frequently borrowed from the Fund to raise livestock in the earlier years. Currently, besides farming and raising livestock, she and her husband also work as hired workers to increase their income. With the monthly income of 3,000,000VND (about 200USD), not only can she repay the loan weekly and settle daily expenses, but she also can save a small amount to send her children to school and to purchase more household applications, thus improves the standard of living. This time, she would like to borrow 9,000,000VND (550USD) to purchase 6 more pigs to breed, as well as to buy working tools for their job as hired workers.

Translated from Vietnamese by Yen Thanh Pham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase breeding pigs

loans.name: Ellada

texts.en: Ellada was born in 1985. She lives in Khachmaz town. 2 years ago she started a beauty salon business. Ellada is single. Now she needs a loan of 970 AZN to buy the necessary things for this beauty salon.

loans.use: to buy the necessary things for this beauty Salon

loans.name: Bich

texts.vi: Chị Nguyễn Thị Bích năm nay 33 tuổi, hiện chị đang sống cùng chồng và hai con tại Thị Trấn Ninh Giang tỉnh Hải Dương.Hiện nay công việc đem lại nguồn thu nhập chính cho gia đình chị Bích là chăn nuôi và buôn bán thịt lợn. Hàng ngày anh Lân chồng chị đi mua lợn về thịt còn chị Bích bán trực tiếp cho bà con tại chợ. Công việc tuy vất vả nhưng lại đem về cho gia đình chị  nguồn thu nhập rất ổn định. Với mức thu nhập 3.000.000đ/ tháng việc hoàn trả vốn của gia đình chị Bích cũng có rất nhiều thuận lợi. Vòng vốn tới chị dự định xin vay 9.000.000đ để đầu tư mua 7 con lợn thịt về chăn nuôi sau đó sẽ cung cấp thịt lợn cho bà con trong dịp Tết nguyên đán sắp tới.
texts.en:
Ms. N. Thi Bich is 33 years old. She lives with her husband and 2 children in the town of Ninh Giang, province of Hai Duong. Presently their main source of income is from raising pigs and selling their meat. Every day her husband, Mr. Lan, would go purchase the pigs, and she would sell the meat at the local market. The work is hard but it brings them a stable income. With their income of 183 USD per month, it helps her family in repaying the loans. For this loan, she wishes to borrow 550 USD to buy additional 7 pigs to raise, and subsequently to sell their meat for the upcoming Tet Holiday.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thu Ostrander, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Greetings from Daniel in Kigali, Rwanda! Daniel is 39 years old, with 4 children and 1 adopted child.

Daniel runs a small retail shop. Besides that shop,he also owns a public phone where people make phone calls and he charges them money for the service. This entrepreneur employs two people to help him run the business.

He is looking for a loan worth 500,000 Frws to increase his stock. The loan repayment period is 8 months, on a monthly basis.

loans.use: Increase his stock

loans.name: Pham Thi

texts.vi:
Tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2003 hiện nay chị Xiêm đã trở thành một trong những thành viên sử dụng vốn vay rất  hiệu quả  tại thị trấn Ninh Giang Hải Dương. Khi mới tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương chị Xiêm chỉ vay mức vốn 1.000.000 đ để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi nhưng đến nay sau 5 năm tham gia vào Qũy gia đình Xiêm đã có một cửa hàng ăn cho thu nhập 3.000.000đ/ tháng. Bên cạnh kinh doanh hàng ăn gia đình chị Xiêm còn chăn nuôi thêm nên kinh tế gia đình chị đang ngày càng ổn định và phát triển, nhờ đó gia đình chị ngày  càng có điều kiện hơn để đầu tư cho hai con ăn học.
Vòng vốn tới chị Xiêm mong muốn được vay 9.000.000 đ để đầu tư sửa sang , mở rộng cửa hàng ăn nhằm giúp cho công việc kinh doanh của gia đình ngày càng đạt được hiệu quả cao hơn.
texts.en:
Mrs. X. joined TYM fund in 2003, and has been using the loans very effectively since then. She is currently living in Ninh Giang town, Hai Duong province. In the first round, Mrs. X. only asked for 1.000.000 VND to invest in poultries. However, after five years of membership, she now has her own small restaurant, which helps her earn 3.000.000 VND per month. As a result, her family’s income has been improved a great deal, which has given her chances to invest in her children’s education. In the next round of loan, Mrs. X. would like to borrow 9.000.000 VND ($550) to improve her restaurant to make more income for her family.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khoa Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Sudaba

texts.en: Sudaba is a mother of 2 children. She lives in the Khachmaz region in Garagurtlu village. This 45-year-old woman has been in the dairy business for 10 years. Now she needs a loan of 970 AZN to buy 2 cows for improving her dairy business.

loans.use: to buy 2 cows

loans.name: Dao Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Đào Thị Vệ tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2003. Hiện tại chị đang sống cùng chồng và hai con đã trưởng thành tại huyện Ninh Giang tỉnh Hải Dương. Hàng ngày ngoài chăn nuôi và trồng trọt  chị Vệ đi  buôn bán hoa quả tại chợ, chồng chị ở nhà đan cót bán cho người dân địa phương. Do chăm chỉ và biết cách làm ăn nên sau 5 năm tham gia Quỹ tình thương hiện tại kinh tế gia đình chị Vệ đã có sự phát triển rõ rệt. Với mức thu nhập khá ổn định từ buôn bán, chăn nuôi  ngoài việc hoàn trả và chi tiêu trong gia đình chị Vệ còn đầu tư sửa sang  được nhà cửa, mua được xe máy phục vụ cho công việc kinh doanh buôn bán của gia đình.
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 6.000.000, một phần chị đầu tư mua 30 bó tre nứa phục vụ cho công việc đan cót của chồng, số còng lại chị sẽ sử dụng để đầu tư thêm vốn vào kinh doanh hoa quả phát triển kinh tế gia đình
texts.en:
Mrs. Dao Thi V. joined TYM Fund in 2003. She is living with her husband and her two grown-up children in Ninh Giang town, Hai Duong province. Mrs. V. breeds poultries and plants fruits at home, and then sells them in the market. Her husband makes baskets at home and sells them for people in the town. After fiV. years of membership, her family’s income has become much more stable. She has been able to renovate her house and buy motorbike to facilitate the family’s business. In the next round of loan, Mrs. V. would like to borrow 6.000.000 VND ($375), part of which will be used to buy bamboo for her husband to make baskets; the rest will be invested in flowers to sell in the market.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khoa Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi: Chị Nguyễn Thị  C. năm nay 48 tuổi, hiện chị là chủ cửa hàng kinh doanh bia, nước giải khát tại xã Đồng Tâm huyện Ninh Giang tỉnh Hải Dương. Hàng ngày với sự giúp đỡ của chồng công việc kinh doanh của chị có rất nhiều thuận lợi. Ngoài việc bán bia cho khách hàng lẻ cửa hàng của chị còn cung cấp bia cho các cửa hàng nhỏ trong huyện  nên thu nhập rất ổn định. Với thu nhập 4.000.000đ / tháng  việc hoàn trả vốn của  chị C. cũng rất thuận lợi. Chị mong muốn trong thời gian tới chị được vay thêm 20.000.000 để đầu tư mua thêm bia về bán cho các cửa hàng tại địa phương nhằm  tăng thêm nguồn thu nhập cho gia đình, ngày càng có điều kiện hơn để đầu tư cho các con ăn học.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi C. is 48 years old. She currently has a small café shop, selling beer and soft drinks in Dong Tam, Ninh Giang town, Hai Duong province. With the assistance of her husband, the café has been going very well. In addition to selling beer in her café, she supplies it to other café shops in her town, so her family’s income has been relatively stable. With a monthly income of 4.000.000 VND, Mrs. C. is very on time in paying back her loans. In the next round of loan, Mrs. C. would like to borrow 20.000.000 VND ($1200) to stock more beer for her own café as well as to sell it for other shops in her area, thereby earning more money to send her kids to good schools.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khoa Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Claude

texts.en:
Greetings from Claude in Gasabo, Rwanda! Claude is 45 years old, married with 7 children and 1 adopted child.

Claude started his business in 2000. He owns a bakery (making bread) and runs small shop selling milk to the local people in his area. He earns about US$ 366 per month from other business activities. He is looking for a loan worth 515,000 Frws to buy more materials for his businesses such as wheat, cooking oil, etc. He will be repaying the loan in 8 months, on a monthly basis.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients for his small businesses

loans.name: Hoang Thi

texts.vi: Chị Hoàng Thị Ngọc tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2003. Vòng vốn đầu tiên chị vay vốn để sử dụng vào chăn nuôi và cho thu nhập 150.000đ/tháng. Đến nay ngoài chăn nuôi chị Ngọc còn đầu tư vốn để buôn bán hàng tạp hoá. Hàng tháng ngoài thu nhập từ chăn nuôi kinh doanh hàng tạp hoá gia đình chị Ngọc còn có thêm nguồn thu từ lương làm thuê của chồng nên kinh tế gia đình chị khá ổn định. Với mức thu nhập 3.500.000đ/ tháng cuộc sống gia đình chị Ngọc đã ngày càng được cải thiện hơn. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 10.000.000đ để đầu tư vốn mua thêm 5 con lợn về nuôi. Số vốn còn lại chị sẽ sử dụng mua thêm một số mặt hàng phục vụ cho công việc kinh doanh của gia đình.
texts.en:
Mrs. Hoang Thi N. joined TYM Fund in 2003. She invested the loans from the first round in poultries and earned about 150.000 VND per month. Now besides breeding poultries, she also has a small shop selling necessities, which helps the family earn more money. Her husband is a worker with a stable income. Her family’s monthly income is about 3.500.000 VND. In the next round of loan, Mrs. N. would like to borrow 10.000.000 VND ($600) to buy more pigs to raise and more goods for her shop.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khoa Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Elmin

texts.en: This young man lives in the Khachmaz region in Dadali village. He is married and has one child. Elmin was born in 1981. He has run a taxi business for 2 years. Now he needs a loan of 970 AZN to buy the spare parts for his taxi.

loans.use: to buy the spare parts for his taxi

loans.name: Eugene

texts.en:
Greetings from Eugene N. in the eastern province of Rwanda! Eugene is one of Vision Finance's budding entrepreneurs who is 21 years old, nearly married with 2 orphans he is looking after!

Eugene runs a small shop; he sells various items such as bars of soap, sugar, bags of beans, toothpaste, beans, biscuits, exercise books, paraffin for lighting houses during the evening and other household items needed in his area. He goes to Kigali every Friday to buy stock for his shop, travelling by taxi. He employs one person to help him run the shop.

This client is looking for a loan worth 400,000 Frws to increase his stock, targeting Christmas season clients next month. This loan will be repaid in 8 months.

loans.use: Increase his stock, targeting the Christmas season

loans.name: Rosmery

texts.es:
Rosmery vive en casa de su padre en la calle puerto Hilo de la zona de Tupac Katari de la ciudad de La Paz; tiene 19 años de edad y la actividad que realiza es la venta de pollos al spiedo y pollos a la broaster, en un local ubicado en la ciudad de El Alto. Con esta actividad ella cubre sus necesidades de alimentación y vestimenta.
 El crédito que solicita es para comprar un par de máquinas de freir y así ampliar su negocio y poder obtener mayores ingresos y mejorar sus condiciones de vida.

Este será su primer crédito con IMPRO a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Rosmery lives in her father's house in Puerto Hilo street in the area of Tupac Katari of the city of La Paz. She is 19 years old and she sells panned and baked chickens called "spiedo" and "broaster" in a small restaurant located in the city of El Alto. With this activity she covers her food and clothing needs. The loan requested will be used to buy a couple of frying machines. This way she will be able to expand her business and a obtain a bigger income and improve her life conditions. This will be her first loan with IMPRO through Kiva.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy frying machines for the sale of "spiedo" and " Broaster" chicken.

loans.name: Angela

texts.es:
Ángela  vive en la calle “ 1 “  de la zona Santiago Primero en la ciudad de El Alto.
 
Es viuda vive junto a su hija y sus nietos, en su propio domicilio.

 Se dedica a la venta de comida en su puesto callejero ubicado en la parte comercial de la ciudad del Alto. Sus precios son  muy económicos y destinados a gente con escasos recursos.

El crédito lo destinara en la adquisición de en mesón metálico para su mejor atención a sus comensales.
 
 
Es el quinto  crédito con Impro, y el segundo vía KIVA; la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Ángela lives on 1 street in Santiago Primero neighborhood of El Alto city. She is a widow and lives with her daughter and grandchildren in her own home. She sells food froma stand located in the commercial part of El Alto city. Her prices are very inexpensive and aimed at people with few resources. The loan will be used to buy a metal counter to better serve her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a metal counter to better serve her customers

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.es:
La señora Alejandra vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hijo en la calle Caupolican de la zona de Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz; la actividad que realiza es la venta de empanadas, esta actividad la realiza de lunes a sábado, el esposo es chofer asalariado.
El crédito que solicita es para la compra de un horno y así poder ella misma elaborar las empanadas ya que por el momento las obtiene de un horno público; ella indica que elaborando las empanadas en su propio horno mejorara sus ingresos y podrá ayudar a su familia.

Es cliente de Impro y por la actividad que desarrolla puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Alejandra lives in her own home with her husband and son on Caupolican street in the Tembladerani neighborhood of La Paz city. She sells empanadas Mondays through Saturdays, her husband is a salaried driver. The loan she seeks is to buy an oven so that she herself can make the empanadas because at the moment she gets them from a public oven. She tells us that making the empanadas in her own oven will improve her income and she will be able to help her family. She is a client of Impro and because of the work that she is developing she can access a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy an oven to bake her empanadas

loans.name: Richard

texts.es:
El  señor Richard vive en casa de sus suegra con su esposa y su hija  en la calle Eduardo Avaroa de la zona de tacagua de la Ciudad de La Paz. Trabaja como policía y la esposa se dedica a la elaboración de papas fritas las cuales vende ambulando en la calle.
El crédito que solicita es para la compra de una computadora y seguir estudiando de esta manera mejorar sus ingresos y poder dar un nivel de vida adecuado a su familia

Esta será la primera vez que IMPRO aprueba un crédito para Richard, pues su interés por continuar sus estudios lo hacen merecedor de esta oportunidad.
texts.en:
Mr Richard lives with his wife and daughter in his mother-in-law house located in Eduardo Avaroa street of the Tacagua area of the City of La Paz. He works as police officer and his wife makes French fries which she sells on the street. The requested loan will be used to buy a computer and to keep on studying. He wants this way to improve his income and be able to give a better standard of living to his family. This is the first time that IMPRO has approved a loan for Richard. Since he is interested in continuing his studies, this has made him deserving of this opportunity.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a computer to continue his studies.

loans.name: Theoneste

texts.en:
Greetings from Theoneste R. in Rwamagana, Rwanda! Theoneste is 33 years old, married with 2 adopted children.

Theoneste runs a shop selling new clothes in the local market. He wishes to open another shop selling used clothes in a different local market. He needs a loan of 300,000 Rwf in order to expand his business. Theoneste says that due to the loans from Vision Finance Company, he will be able to feed the family and pay the school fees for the children.

loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Ronald

texts.es:
Ronald vive en casa de sus suegros con su esposa y sus cuatro hijos en la calle San Cristóbal de la zona de   Bajo Tacagua de la Ciudad de La Paz , en su domicilio tiene ubicado un pequeño taller donde se dedica a la elaboración de chamarras; con esta actividad mantiene a su familia ya que es su único medio de ingresos, la esposa realiza la venta de comida en la calle para ayudar a su familia y alivianar los gastos de la casa.
El crédito que solicita es para compra de material (cuero, hilos, cierres, etc.).

Es cliente de Impro y por la actividad puede acceder a un nuevo crédito, además de que el análisis de su flujo de caja le permite pagar las cuotas a tiempo.
texts.en:
Ronald lives with his wife and four children in his in-laws house, located in San Cristobal street in the Bajo Tacagua area of the city of La Paz. He has a small workshop in his house where he makes jackets. He supports his family with this activity since he is the only one that has an income. His wife sells meals on the street to help his family and the house expenses. The loan requested will be used to buy materials (leather, threads, zippers, etc.). He is an IMPRO client and he can have access to a new loan because his commercial activity, besides the analysis of his cash flow allows him to pay the quotas on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy leather, threads, zippers for this leather making business.

loans.name: Bernardo

texts.es:
Bernardo  vive junto a sus dos hijos, con los cuales trabaja en su taller de confección de zapatillas y botines ubicado en una zona céntrica de la cuidad de La Paz .
 
Vive en la calle Gral  J. Sever de la zona Los Andes de La ciudad de La Paz.


El crédito lo destinara en la compra y provisión de materiales como ser  cuero, plantillas y otros, que por cercanías a las fiestas de navidad elevan de precio los proveedores.
 
 
Es el tercer  crédito con Impro, y el segundo vía KIVA la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Bernardo lives with his two children with whom he works in his shoe and boot cobbler business located in the center area of La Paz city. He lives on Gral J. Sever street in the Los Andes zone of La Paz city. The loan will be used to buy and stock materials such as leather, insoles, and more, as the upcoming Christmas holidays the suppliers raise their pries. This is the third loan with Impro, and the second through KIVA. The evaluation qualifies him to receive this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy leather, insoles, etc. for his shoe business

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy  vive actualmente junto a su esposo y su pequeño hijo de 6 años de edad en la calle Puerto Rico de la zona Brasil en la ciudad de El Alto.

Ella se dedica al comercio de ropa femeN. que trae de la frontera del Brasil y  distribuye en diferentes sectores de la ciudad. Su esposo se dedica a la confección de buzos deportivos en su pequeño taller de costura de su domicilio
 

El crédito lo destinara en la compra de materiales de construcción en un terreno de su propiedad que se encuentra totalmente vacío ubicado en una zona periférica de la ciudad el cual primeramente quieren amurallarlo y construir una habitación. 
 
Es el primer  crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
At present, Nancy lives with her husband and her 6-year-old small son in Puerto Rico street of the Brazil area in the city of El Alto. She sells women clothing that she brings from the border of the Brazil and she distributes in different areas of the city. Her husband is in the sport suit dressmaking business. He has a small workshop at home. The loan will be use to buy construction materials for a lot of her property that is completely empty located in a peripheral area of the city; where they plan to build a wall around it and construct a room. This is the first loan with with Impro, the evaluation performed qualifies her to obtain the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy constrution materials to build a wall and a room in her lot.

loans.name: Teodocio

texts.es:
Teodocio vive en la calle Felipe Estrella de la zona  de Vino Tinto de la ciudad de La Paz

Vive junto a su esposa quien trabaja en una imprenta en el centro de la ciudad, tiene un hijo pequeño de 4 años de edad.
 

El trabaja como chofer propietario de servicio publico en su minibús en una de las líneas centrales de la ciudad.

El crédito lo destinara para la reparación del motor,  ya que por el constante uso presenta fallas mecánicas que le impide realizar sus jornadas de trabajo completas. 
 
Es el primer  crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Teodocio lives on Felipe Estrella Street in the Vino Tinto area of the city of La Paz.

He lives with his wife who works in a printing shop in the centre of town and has a 4 year old son. He works as a public service driver of his own minibus on one of the main lines of the city.

The loan will go towards repairing his motor as it currently has some mechanical faults due to constant use, which are keeping him from working full days. This is his first loan with Impro and the evaluation carried out has qualified him for this loan.


Translated from Spanish by Ines Teles, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repairing his minibus motor to allow him to continue his job as a public service minibus driver

loans.name: Francois

texts.en:
Greetings from Francois M. in Rwamagana, Rwanda! Francois is 52 years old and married with 6 adopted children.

Mr. M. operates a shop selling food items such as cassava, beans, maize, etc. Mr. M. hires a small truck which helps him to carry his products to town where he finds his customers. Mr. M. is requesting a loan of 500,000 rwf.

Furthermore, he says that this loan will increase his profit, which will enable him to satisfy the needs of his customers.

loans.use: To increase his inventory

loans.name: Ernest

texts.en:
Amakuru (Greetings) from Ernest S. in Ruhengeri in the northern part of Rwanda! Ernest is 29 years old, married with 2 children.

Ernest owns a stock of sorghum. He buys the sorghum during the harvest time and keeps it in the store until the prices increase when it is in short supply and he can sell it to local breweries for making beer and to small local beer producers. The common local brew produced out of sorghum is Urwagwa, which is mostly drunk by local people in rural areas especially during wedding celebrations.

Besides the buying and selling of sorghum, Ernest also grows potatoes, which are commonly produced in the area where he lives because of the fertile volcanic soils in the region. He earns about US$ 140 every month from all his commercial activities. He employs 4 people in both his farm and in the selling of sorghum.

He is looking for a loan worth 515,000 Frws to buy more sorghum to increase his stock since he has the market to sell it to the local breweries, who otherwise make banana beer. This loan will be repaid in 8 months.

loans.use: To Increase his stocks of sorghum

loans.name: Jean Damascene

texts.en:
Greetings from Jean Damascene B. in Burera, in the northern province of Rwanda! This entrepreneur who is 43 years old is married with 5 children.

Jean Damascene owns a shop where he sells various items such as bags of sugar, beans, maize flour, cassava flour, exercise books and pens for school children, powdered soap, household utensils, etc. He employs one person to help run the business. Besides running his shop, he also grows various food crops such as potatoes, cabbage, and tomatoes for sale to increase his income.

He is applying for a loan worth 515,000 Frws to increase his stock by buying more household utensils and also manure to fertilize his garden for more production. This loan wil be repaid in 8 months.

loans.use: To expand his stock

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Greetings from Emmanuel B. in Nyamagabe District, in the southern province of Rwanda! Emmanuel is 31 years old, married with 6 children and 1 orphan, adopted after the 1994 Genocide.

Emmanuel sells timber to the local builders and carpenters. Many houses in the rural areas and in his home town are built with timber and also, carpenters buy his timber to make chairs, tables, beds, windows, doors, etc. Besides the timber business, he also sells charcoal, which is used for cooking by many families in his hometown.

With the income, he has been able to buy plot of land where he grows trees for timber to be sold in the future. He has been able to build a house for his family. Recently, he was able to buy himself a mobile phone to communicate with his customers.

He is applying for a loan worth 350,000 Frws to buy more sacks of charcoal to be sold in the nearby local market and buy more timber, which is in demand by carpenters in his town. This loan will be repaid in 8 months.

loans.use: To buy more timber for re-sale

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Chị L. năm nay 33 tuổi,. Gia đình chị hiện có 3 con trong đó 2 con đang tuổi đến trường. Năm 2002 chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương để vay vốn đầu tư thêm vào cửa hàng kinh doanh xe máy của gia đình. Đến nay qua hơn 5 năm sử dụng vốn hiệu quả kinh tế gia đìnhchị đã có sự phát triển rõ rệt. Hiện tại cả hai vợ chồng chị đều kinh daonh buôn bán xe máy và đây cũng là công việc đem lại thu nhập chính cho gia đình chị. Với mức thu nhập 3.500.000đ chị L. tin tưởng rằng công việc kinh doanh xe máy sẽ giúp kinh tế gia đình chị ngày càng phát triển hơn.
Vòng vốn tới chị xin vay 20.000.000đ để đầu tư mua thêm phụ tùng thay thế khi khách hàng có nhu cầu
texts.en:
Mrs L. is 33 years old. She has 3 children, 2 of them are still in school. In 2002 she joined TYM fund to get capital to invest in a motorcycle shop that her family owns. After 5 years with TYM it is apparent that her family finance has improved a lot. Today she and her husband both work in the shop selling/trading motorcycle. This is the main revenue for her family, about 3.500.000 VND a month. Mrs L. is confident that her business will continue to grow. This time she is requesting a loan of 20.000.000 VND to buy spare parts to better serve her customers.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy spare parts

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi: Chị Hường năm nay 35 tuổi và đã tham gia quỹ tình thương được hơn 5 năm. Trước khi tham gia Quỹ tình thương thu nhập của gia đình chị chủ yếu dựa vào chăn nuôi, trồng trọt nên kinh tế gia đình chị rất khó khăn. Sau khi tham gia Quỹ được vay vốn chị đã đầu tư để buôn bán thịt lợn. Công việc kinh doanh  phát triển thuận lợi cộng với tiền lương làm thầu điện thắp sáng của chồng đã giúp cho thu nhập của gia đình chị ngày càng ổn định hơn. Hiện nay với mức thu nhập 3.500.000/ tháng  cuộc sống của gia đình chị đã được cải thiện hơn. Vòng vốn tới chị xin vay 10.000.000đ để mua lợn nuôi và đầu tư thêm vốn vào công việc buôn bán thịt lợn.
texts.en:
Mrs Hường is 35 years old and she is with TYM fund for more than 5 years. Before joining TYM fund, her family income was from pig raising and vegetable cultivation. It was difficult time for her family. Her loan from TYM was used to start a new business: sell pork. This proves to be a successful business providing her a stable income and combining with her husband`s salary, it helps her family to overcome financial difficulties. In this round of loan she is requesting 10.000.000 to buy piglets to raise and investing more in her pork sale.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy piglets

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Quế tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2002. Gia đình chị vốn là gia đình thuần nông nên từ khi tham gia Quỹ đến nay các vòng vốn vay chị đều sử dụng để  đầu tư vào chăn nuôi. Hiện tại ngoài chăn nuôi lợn, vịt gia đình chị còn đào ao thả cá. Thu nhập từ chăn nuôi của gia đình chị đạt khoảng 3.500.000/ tháng, ngoài ra gia đình chị còn có thêm nguồn thu nhập từ công việc buôn bán rau của chị và sự hỗ trợ thêm của người con lớn nên kinh tế ngày càng ổn định hơn
 Vòng vốn tới chị xin vay 10.000.000đ một phần chị sử dụng để mua lợn về nuôi, phần còn lại chị sử dụng để mua thức ăn phục vụ cho công việc chăn nuôi của gia đình
texts.en:
Mrs Quế is a TYM fund member since 2002. She and her family are farmers. All the loans received from TYM were used to raise pigs. They also have a pond to farm fishes. Their income is 3.500.000 VND a month. Mrs Quế also sells vegetables to gain more money. Her oldest child is working and contributing to the family`s budget. This time Mrs Quế is requesting a loan of 10.000.000 VND to buy piglets and feed for her animals.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed

loans.name: Dinhthi

texts.vi:
Chị L. tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2002. Gia đình chị có 6 người con trong đó 5 người con đã trưởng thành. Hiện nay gia đình chị đang chăn nuôi ngan vịt để phát triển kinh tế gia đình. Hàng tháng với mức thu nhập từ chăn nuôi gia đình, lương làm cán bộ của chồng và sự hỗ trợ của con đi lao động xuất khẩu khoảng 5.000.000đ  kinh tế gia đình chị  rất ổn định, việc hoàn trả vốn cũng rất thuận lợi.
 Vòng vốn tới chị xin vay 10.000.000đ một phần chị sử dụng để mua ngan, vịt  về nuôi, phần còn lại chị sử dụng để mua thức ăn phục vụ cho công việc chăn nuôi của gia đình
texts.en:
Mrs L. is a TYM fund member since 2002. She has 6 children, 5 of them are grown up. She and her family raise barbary ducks for a living. Her husband is an officer. Her family has a stable income: his salary, their children's salaries and revenue from the suck business total 5.000.000 VND a month. She does not have problem making the weekly payment. This time she is requesting a loan of 10.000.000 VND to buy feed and baby ducks to raise

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy baby ducks and feed

loans.name: Thai Thi

texts.vi: Chị Thái Thị Hậu năm nay 48 tuổi, chị là thành viên của Quỹ tình thương tư năm 2001. Cũng giống như nhiều gia đình khác ở nông thôn  nguồn thu nhập chủ yếu của gia đình chị là từ chăn nuôi. Hiện nay gia đình chị đang chăn nuôi vịt, cá  theo mô hình trang trại cho thu nhập 3.000.000đ/ tháng. Ngoài thời gian cùng chồng làm công việc chăn nuôi chị Hậu còn tranh thủ nấu rượu để bán tận dụng bã rượu chăn nuôi lợn nhằm tăng thêm thu nhập cho gia đình.Với mức thu nhập ổn định gia đình chị Hậu cũng có điều kiện hơn để đầu tư cho 3 người con ăn học và cải thiện cuôc sống. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 15.000.000đ để đầu tư mua lúa làm thức ăn chăn nuôi vịt đẻ.
texts.en:
Mrs Thái Thị Hậu is 48 years old. She is a TYM fund member since 2001. Like most of the families in the region, she and her family live from raising poultry, pigs. Today, they farm fishes, raise ducks & pigs. Their income is 3.000.000 VND a month. They also brew rice wine and use the waste as feed for the pigs. Their income is stable which allows them to provide a good education for their 3 children and have a good life. This time around Mrs Hậu is requesting a loan of 15.000.000 VND to buy rice grains to feed her ducks.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy feed for her ducks

loans.name: Aida

texts.pt:
Aida D. é natural da cidade do Maputo e tem 38 anos de idade, mãe de 4 filhos e abandonada pelo pai dos filhos, dado que em 2004 saiu de casa indo a africa do sul em busca de emprego e nunca voltou. Para alem dos seus quatros filhos sustenta também 3 sobrinhos que os pais perderam a vida vítimas do HIV mora com eles.

Aida estudou até 5ªclasse e parou por falta de condições financeiras, em 2005 mudei me da cidade de Maputo para Ponta em busca de melhores condições, lá vendia vários produtos mas éramos muitos de mais e decide vir cá na ponta quando soube dos preços na companhia da minha prima que morava cá a muito tempo e até agora vivo na casa dela.

Aida é vendedeira no mercado da ponta tendo um pequeno estabelecimento no mercado onde vende mais tomates cebolas adquirindo-os na  africa do sul e vai três vezes por semana, aprendeu esta actividade desde pequena antes de ir ao lar já vendia peixes fritos. Tem um rendimento diário de 800,00mt.

Este é o segundo empréstimo para Aida e nunca solicitou noutras instituições, e conheceu a hluvuku-adsema  através de amigas que já eram  clientes. Assim tem como grande sonho aquisição do um talhão para construção da sua própria casa..
texts.en:
Aida D. was born in the city of Maputo. She is 38 years old and mother of 4 children. She was abandoned by her husband who went to South Africa in 2004 to look for work, and never returned. Besides supporting her 4 children, she also supports and houses 3 nieces and nephews who lost their parent as victims to HIV. Aida studied until the 5th grade, and then had to stop due to lack of finances. In 2005 she moved from the city of Maputo to Ponta, looking for better conditions. In Maputo she sold many products, but the family was too big. She decided to go to Ponta when she heard of the prices in her sister’s company, who had lived there for many years. Aida now lives at her sister’s house. Aida is a vendor at the Ponta market. She has a small establishment where she sells mostly tomatoes and onions, purchased in South Africa, three times a week. Aida has been doing this kind of activity since she was a child, when she sold fried fish. Aida earns about 800,00 MT a day. This is Aida’s second loan, although she has never requested one through another institution. She discovered Hluvuku-Adsema through friends who were already clients. Her greatest dream is to acquire a piece of land on which to build her own home.

Translated from Portuguese by Jill Haring, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying and selling basic goods

loans.name: Palmira João Da Costa

texts.pt:
Palmira Joao da costa M. é natural de Macaneta   distrito de Boane província do Maputo, tem 49 anos de idade, divorciada e mãe de dois filhos gémeos com 15 anos de idade que estudam. Para alem dos filhos sustenta 4 sobrinhos que vive com eles.

Palmira estudou até 6ªclasse e deixou por falta de condições para continuar dado que na sua zona o ensino ia até esta classe e os pais não tinham condições para pagar o internamento fora do distrito. Desde a sua infância nunca mudou se para outra zona.vive na casa propria

Palmira é negociante onde vende vários produtos ente Amendoim, feiao, Açúcar, óleos, etec. Tem um rendimento diário 1500,00mt, este é o Quarto empréstimo na Hluvuku e primeiro no Kiva, conheceu a hluvuku a traves do trabalho de divulgação que os promotores da Hluvuku fizeram no mercado.

Palmira está confiante que pagara antes do tempo dado que tem um projecto na vista de construir dependências para aluguer no seu quintal e conta com o credito.
texts.en:
Palmira Joao da Costa M. was born in Macaneta in the district of Boane in the province of Maputo. She is 49 years old, divorced, and mother of twin sons who are 15 years old and in school. Besides her children, she supports 4 nieces and nephews who live with her. Palmira studied until the 6th grade and then stopped because she lacked the conditions to continue. The education in her zone only went up to 6th grade, and her parents weren’t able to send her to boarding school outside the district. Since her childhood, Palmira has never lived in another zone. She lives in her own house. Palmira is a businesswoman and sells a variety of products ranging from peanuts, beans, sugar, oil, etc. She has a daily income of 1500 MT. This is Palmira’s fourth loan with Hluvuku and her first with Kiva. She found out about Hluvuku through advertising done by Hluvuku promoters at the market. Palmira is confident she can pay before the estimated time because she has a project of building rooms for rent in her yard. She is counting on the credit.

Translated from Portuguese by Jill Haring, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying and selling basic goods

loans.name: Maria Da Graça

texts.pt:
Maria da Graça M. é natural de Maputo cidade, 38 anos de idade, separada  e mae de 3 filhos com idades entre 18, 13 e 4 anos respectivamente, o primeiro estuda na africa do sul e o segundo esta na 7ªclasse e o terceiro na escolinha ambos em Moçambique. Para alem dos seus filhos sustenta a mãe que vive com ela.

Maria estudou até 6ªclasse e parou por falta de condições financeira. Até aos 18 anos ela viveu no bairro jardim na cidade de Maputo e depois foi a africa do sul onde conheceu o pai dos seus filhos, este que veio a separar se dele e dai volta a Moçambique e para o seu sustento optou por abrir um negocio que consiste na venda de produtos diversos tais como alimentícios, bebidas e roupas de cama. Onde destaca os djuvetes que compra a R200,00 ( 600,00mt) e vende por 1800,00mt este adquira  na africa do sul.

Este é o seu primeiro empréstimo na Hluvuku e no Kiva, com este valor pretende aumentar as mercadoria de forma a responder positivamente as compras dos seus clientes neste fim do ano que se avizinha. 

Tem como grande sonho ver o seu negocio bem crescido e poder com os lucros começar a organizar o material de construção para construir  a sua própria casa, dado que neste momento vive na casa da sua mãe.
texts.en:
Maria da Graça M. was born in the city of Maputo. She is 38 years old, separated, and mother of 3 children aged 18, 13, and 4 respectively. The oldest studies in South Africa, the second is in 7th grade, and the third is in pre-school. Besides her children, she supports her mother who lives with her. Maria studied until the 6th grade, but was unable to continue due to lack of financial conditions. She lived in the Jardim neighborhood in the city of Maputo until she was 18 years old, and then went to South Africa where she met the father of her children. They later separated and Maria moved back to Mozambique. To support herself she chose to open a business selling a variety of food products, drinks, and bedclothes. Her best sellers are duvets, which she buys for R200.00 (600,00 MT) and sells for 1800.00 MT. These are purchased in South Africa. This is Maria’s first loan with Hluvuku and Kiva. With the money she plans on increasing her merchandise to meet the demand of her clients’ purchases in a positive way during the end of the year that is approaching. Maria’s dream is to see her business thriving and be able to use her profits to begin organizing the construction materials necessary to build her own house. Today she lives in her mother’s house.

Translated from Portuguese by Jill Haring, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying and selling basic goods

loans.name: Ilda Carolina

texts.pt:
Ilda Carolina M. é natural de Manhiça um distrito nortenho da província do Maputo, tem 44 anos de idade, casada maritalmente e mãe de 4 filhos com idades entre 26, 22, 20 e 15 anos respectivamente, para alem dos filhos sustenta uma neta que vive com ela.

Ilda estudou ate 6ªclasse e não continuou por falta de condições,   Ilda vive basicamente de negocio, onde  destaque  a Cerveja que compra por 250,00mt a caixa e vende por 360,00mt, refrescos  que adquira a caixa por 148,00mt e vende por 240,00mt. Tem um rendimento mensal de 8000,00mt e consegue poupar mensalmente 4000,00mt.

Para Ilda este é o seu primeiro empréstimo na Hluvuku e no Kiva e pretende pagar antes do tempo para solicitar outro afim de abrir outro tipo de negocio que consistira na venda de produtos de mercearia.
texts.en:
Ilda Carolina M. is from Manhiça, a northern district of Maputo province. She is 44 years old, married, and mother of four children, aged 26, 22, 20, and 15. Besides her children, she supports a granddaughter that lives with her. Ilda studied until sixth grade and didn't continue, because of lack of finances. Ilda basically lives off her business. She sells beer, which she buys at 250 meticais per case and sells for 360 meticais, and soft drinks, which she buys at 148 meticais and sells for 240. She has a monthly income of 8000 meticais, of which she manages to save 4000 monthly. For Ilda, this is her first loan from Hluvuku and Kiva, and she plans to pay it off in advance in order to make another loan with the intention of opening another type of business, a general store.

Translated from Portuguese by Ilse Ackerman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of soft drinks

loans.name: Anita

texts.en: Anita J. lives with her husband, Mr. Jems J., in the town of Tikhidewal, Lalitpur. Both husband and wife are engaged in herbal medicine. They opened their shop nine months ago. They sell Ram Dev medicine in their store. Ram Dev is one of the most popular gurus of India who teaches yoga. Now Mrs. J. is requesting a loan in the amount of Rs. 10000.00 to buy necessary herbal medicines for their shop.

loans.use: To buy necessary herbal medicines for re-sale

loans.name: Bishuna Kumari

texts.en:
Bishuna Kumari R., a resident of Tikhidewal, lives in a single family home with her husband and one son. Her husband, Mr. Hukum Singh Gurung, is a plumber. Her son is studying in grade 1.

Mrs. R. is a shopkeeper in the town of Tikhidewal. She opened her cosmetic shop few months ago to strengthen the economic conditions of her family. She sells different types of cosmetics in her shop, such as cream, body spray, and glass bangles. 

Because this month is in the festivals season in Nepal, the demand for the cosmetics is increasing rapidly. So, Mrs. R. is requesting her first loan of Rs 10000.00 ($150 USD) to buy cosmetics to meet the increasing demand of her customers.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics

loans.name: Sushila

texts.en: Miss Sushila S. is a single woman living in Tikhidewal, Lalitpur. Most of the people in this region are engaged in small businesses. Sushila lives with her mother and two brothers. Both of her brothers are working in a private office.  S. and her mother opened small hotels ten years ago. They sell different varieties of Nepali and Newari foods at their hotels. Newari food is very popular in that area. Due to lack of capital, they cannot expand their business.  Hence, S. is requesting for a loan of R10000.00 to buy food supplies for her business.

loans.use: To buys food supplies for her business

loans.name: Cacilda Angelina

texts.pt:
Cacilda Angelina C. nasceu em Maputo e tem 41 anos de idade, casada maritalmente e mãe de 2 filhas, a primeira com 19anos de idade e a segunda com 15 anos de idade, apenas uma que estuda e sustenta somente as filhas

Cacilda estudou até 5ªclasse e parou por falta de condições, os pais separaram ela ainda muito nova, onde teve que viver com o seu pai, ajudava ao pai a cuidar da machamba para conseguir o seu sustento, em 1989 juntou se com o marido casamento que resultou neste dois filhos. Em 1994 decide abrir um negócio como auto emprego para ajudar ao marido nas despesas da casa. O marido é mineiro trabalha na africa do sul.

Cacilda é criadora de frango a mais de 10 anos e tem apoio das filhas, onde compra o pinto por 16,00mt e vende o frango por 80,00mt a 110,00mt variando por tamanho ou idade. Tem tido um rendimento mensal 4000,00mt, ainda não faz poupança dado que os lucros investem no crescimento do negócio e na educação da filha.

Este é o primeiro empréstimo da Cacilda na Hluvuku e no Kiva. E conheceu a Hluvuku através dos vizinhos que já são clientes, cacílda tem como planos para futuro a educação das filhas.
texts.en:
Cacilda Angelina C. was born in Maputo and is 41 years old. She is married and has 2 daughters, ages 19 and 15. Only one of her daughters goes to school. Cacilda went to school thorugh the 5th grade when she had to drop-out as she could not afford it any longer. Her parents separated when she was young and she lived with her father where she helped support the family by helping her father take care of the farm. She got married in 1989, had her 2 daughters and in 1994 decided to start her own business to help her husband with the household expenses. Her husband is a miner working in South Africa. Cacilda has raised chickens for over 10 years with the help of her daughters. She buys each chick for 16.00MT and sells the grown chicken from 80.00MT to 110.00MT depending on size and age. Her monthly profit is around 4000.00MT, but she is unable to save money, as this income is used to grow her business and on her daughter's education. This is Cacilda's first loan from Hluvuku and Kiva. She learned about Hluvuku through her neighbors who are customers already. Her plan for the future is to send both of her daughters to school.

Translated from Portuguese by Camila Vasconcelos, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Criaçao de Frangos

loans.name: Helena Bernardo

texts.pt:
Helena Bernardo M. natural do distrito da manhiça um dos distritos nortenhos da província do Maputo, tem 54 anos de idade, mãe de 3 filhos com idade entre o primeiro tem 30 anos e o ultimo tem 25 anos. Para alem dos filhos vive com mais duas pessoas na sua casa que ela sustenta.

Helena estudou até 9ºclasse e parou por situações profissionais, dado que ela fez as ultimas classes enquanto trabalha. Helena vive de negocio que consiste na venda de carne qual compra o quilo por 80,00mt e vende por 95,00mt;   Amendoim que compra o saco por 900,00mt e vende por 1600,00mt. Tem um rendimento mensal de 28000,00mt.

Para Helena este é o primeiro empréstimo na Hluvuku e no Kiva, com este pretende aumentar a mercadoria para responder a demande na quadra festiva que se avizinha. Futuramente pretende melhorar as condições habitacionais.
texts.en:
Helena Bernardo M., originally from the district of Manhiça – one of the Northern districts of the province of Maputa – is 54 years old and has 3 children, the oldest of which is 30 and the youngest, 25. As well as her children, she also lives with another two people whom she supports.

Helena studied until the 9th grade, stopping for professional reasons and then finished the last few years whilst working at the same time. Helena lives off her business selling meat, which she buys for 80,00 MZN and sells for 95,00 MZN as well as peanuts, which she buys at 900,00 MZN per bag and sells at 1600,00 MZN per bag. She has a monthly income of 28000,00 MZN.

This is Helena’s first loan from Hluvuku and from Kiva. She intends to increase her stock in order to meet demand in the coming festive season. In the future, she hopes to improve her living conditions.


Translated from Portuguese by Ines Teles, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase stock of food for sale in festive season

loans.name: Eugénio Horácio Moisés Silva

texts.pt:
Eugénio Horácio Moisés S. nasceu na província da Zambézia ao centro de Moçambique, tem 26 anos de idade, casado e pai de um filho com um ano de idade. Eugénio estudou até 9ªclasse e parou por falta de condições, mudou se da província de Maputo a 4 anos em busca de emprego e veio sozinho.

Eugénio não conseguiu emprego dai que optou por criar seu próprio emprego abrindo um negocio de venda de artigos de celulares ( baterias e carregadores). Onde compra um carregador por 25,00mts e vende por 60,00mts, uma bateria por 75,00mts e vende 150,00mts .  com estas vendas tem um rendimento diário de 1200,00mt .

Para Eugénio este é o 6º empréstimo na hluvuku-adsema e nunca solicitou noutras instituições, sempre aplicou neste negocio, aprendeu exercer actividades do género desde pequeno vendendo diversos produtos para conseguir dinheiro para compra de material escolar.

Eugénio neste momento vive numa casa de aluguer, com os lucros do seu negocio esta comprando material de construção para edificação da sua própria residência e contara com apoio do credito. Para tal pretende pagar este empréstimo antes do tempo para solicitar outro de início da construção.
texts.en:
Eugénio Horácio Moisés S. was born in the province of Zambézia in central Mozambique, is 26 years old and is married with a one-year-old son. Eugénio was in school until the 9th grade when he stopped due to a lack of conditions and moved to the province of Maputo by himself 4 years ago in search of a job.

Eugénio couldn’t find a job so he opted for creating his own by starting a business selling cellular phone accessories (batteries and chargers). He buys his chargers for 25,00 MZN and sells them for 60,00 MZN and buys his batteries for 75,00 MZN and sells them for 150,00 MZN. With these sales he has a monthly income of 1200,00 MZN.

This is Eugénio’s 6th loan from Hluvuku-Adsema, he has never borrowed from another institution and has always invested his loans into this business. He learnt how to carry out this kind of activity when he was little by selling various products in order to raise the money to buy school books and materials.

Eugénio currently lives in a rented house and is buying construction materials with the profits he makes from his business to build his own. He will also rely on further loans for this. As such, he intends to pay off this loan before it is due in order to request a new loan to begin the building works.


Translated from Portuguese by Ines Teles, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase stock of cellular phone accessories to sell

loans.name: Sandra Alberto

texts.pt:
Sandra Alberto M. é natural de cidade de Maputo e tem 31 anos de idade, casada maritalmente e mae de 3 filhos com idades entre 11, 4 e 6 meses respectivamente. Sandra estudou até 7ªclasse e não continuou por falta de condições financeiras da sua família.

Sandra trabalha como servente num acampamento turístico na ponta de ouro, uma zona turística ao sul de Moçambique que faz fronteira com africa do sul. Ela entra as 7:00 e despega as 15:30h, com um salário mensal de 2368,00mt. Nos tempos livres dedica se a vende de refrigerantes onde tem um rendimento médio mensal de 4000,00mt.

Para Sandra este é o quarto empréstimo na Hluvuku e primeiro no Kiva, conheceu a Hluvuku através do marido também informado pelos amigos. Assim com este empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção para edificar a sua residência e o plano futuro é oficializar o seu casamento.
texts.en:
Sandra Alberto M. is from Maputo, married and the mother of 3 children, aged 11, 4 and 6 months. Sandra was in school until the 7th grade and didn’t continue with her studies due to her family’s financial difficulties.

Sandra works as a servant in a tourist camping site in Ponta de Ouro, a tourist region in Southern Mozambique which shares a border with South Africa. She starts at 7:00 and finishes at 15:30, with a monthly salary of 2368,00 MZN. In her free time she sells sodas from which she makes around 4000,00 MZN a month.

This is Sandra’s fourth loan with Hluvuku and her first with Kiva. She heard about Hluvuku from her husband who in turn heard about it from friends. With this loan she intends to buy construction material to build her house and her plan for the future is to officialize her marriage.


Translated from Portuguese by Ines Teles, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials

loans.name: Luís Fiosse

texts.pt:
Luís Fiosse José é natural de Tete uma das províncias do centro de Moçambique que faz fronteira com Zimbabwe,  tem 39 anos de idade, casado e pai de 5 filhos com idade entre 19, 14, 9, 5 e 2 anos respectivamente. Para alem da sua família sustenta um sobrinho que vive com ele na sua casa.

Luís estudou até 10ªclasse e parou quando teve que se incorporar se no serviço militar, mudou se da província de Tete para Maputo no distrito de Boane quando foi transferido para o quartel general de Boane. Onde é militar a 16 anos e trabalha das 7:00h as 15:30h com um salário mensal de 5200,00mt, possui casa própria.

Para luís este é o terceiro empréstimo na Hluvuku e primeiro no kiva e conheceu  a hluvuku através da sua tia que é cliente a bastante tempo, os valores emprestados sempre aplicou na compra de material de construção da sua própria casa e este também vai comprar material para construção do muro e fazer acabamentos da sua obra.
 
Luís pretende pagar antes do tempo para solicitar outro empréstimo para compra de mobília e tinta para pintar a casa.
texts.en:
Luís Fiosse José is a native of Tete, one of the provinces in the center of Mozambique that boarders with Zimbabwe. He is 39 years old, married, and the father of 5 children with ages 19, 14, 9, 5, and 2 respectively. Besides his family he supports a nephew who also lives with him in his house. Luís studied until the 10th grade and stopped when he had to join the military service. He moved from the province of Tete to Maputo in the district of Boane when he was transferred to headquarters. He has been in the military 16 years and works from 7:00am to 3:30pm with a monthly salary of 5,200MT. He has his own home. This is Luís' third loan through Hluvuku and his first with Kiva. He came to know Hluvuku through an aunt who has been a client for a long time. The loan proceeds have always applied to the purchase of construction materials for his own home as well as materials to construct a wall and finish his work. Luís intends to pay off the loan before maturity so he can solicit another loan to purchase furnishings and paint for his house.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials

loans.name: Judite Fernando

texts.pt:
Judite Fernando M. é natural da cidade de Maputo tem 26 anos de idade, casada maritalmente e mãe de 2 filhos com idade entre 5 anos o primeiro e 5 meses o segundo, o primeiro estuda na primeira classe.

Judite estudou ate 7ªclasse e parou por falta de condições,  dado que muito cedo perdeu o seu pai e a sua mãe não trabalhava. Em 2005 se casou. Judite vive principalmente de negocio onde é dona deste a 3 anos. O negocio consiste na compra e venda de frangos e produtos enlatados. Tem um rendimento mensal de 5000,00mt.

Para Judite este é o seu primeiro empréstimo na Hluvuku e no Kiva, tomou conhecimento da existência através da sua tia. Com este valor de 15000,00mt pretende aumentar o seu estoque, constitui grande sonho para Judite a conclusão da sua obra e formação dos seus filhos.
texts.en:
Judite Fernando M. is a native of the city of Maputo. She is 26 years old, married, and the mother of 2 children. The first is 5 years old, and the second is 5 months old. The oldest is in the 1st grade. Judite studied until the 7th grade and stopped because of poor conditions given that she lost her father very early and her mother did not work. In 2005 she got married. Judite lives mainly by her business that she has owned for 3 years. The business consists of selling chicken and canned products. She has a monthly income of 5,000MT. This is Judite's first loan through Hluvuku as well as with Kiva. She came to know of Hluvuku's existance through her aunt. With these funds of 15,000MT she intends to increase her stock. Her dream is to finish her work and provide education for her children.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase variety of products (yogurt, chicken...etc.)

loans.name: Sokpum

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokpum U., 25, and her husband, Mr. Hun Sum, 28, live in a small village near the Mekong River about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 2002 and have two children: one son and one daughter. Sokpum's father also lives with them.

Sokpum has been selling fruit for three years. She buys the fruit from a Phnom Penh market for resale in her village. Her husband has been a fisherman since 2002. He fishes in the lake near the village.

Sokpum is requesting a loan of $400 to purchase fruit for resale.

loans.use: To purchase fruit for resale

loans.name: Heng

texts.en:
Mr. Heng S., 48, and his wife, Mrs. Thary Noun, 44, live on an island on the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1986 and have four children: three sons and one daughter. The eldest son is studying to be a dentist in Kampong Cham Province, one daughter assists her father by selling medicine, and the other children attend a local school.

Heng has been a village doctor since 1984. His wife used to sell medicine at home, but then she started another business selling fruit at the village market and transferred her medicine shop to their daughter.

The couple also opened a shop in the village market where their daughter can sell medicine. They lack the money to finish some parts of the shop. Therefore, Heng is requesting a loan of $1000 to add to his own money to buy a door and a roof for their medicine shop at the village market.

loans.use: To help buy a door and a roof for his medicine shop

loans.name: Fotima

texts.en:
Fotima is an enterprising woman with a great desire to improve her family's quality of life. She is a widow and mother of two children. Fotima has been a seamstress since she was very young, learning in her mother's office. With a lot of effort, she has been able to open her own home based shop and has been successful because her customers have recognized the high quality of her products. Her business continues to grow and add customers.

Fotima is now applying for a loan for the second time. She is requesting a loan of 2600 Somoni ($775 USD) for the term of 4 months to be used for purchasing new modern fabrics for sewing national dresses. Fotima and her children are grateful for your generosity and support.

loans.use: Purchasing fabrics for sewing national dresses.

loans.name: Nazirjon

texts.en: Nazirjon A.  is 50 years old, married and the loving father of 5 children. For 10 years, Nazirjon has been raising cattle and growing wheat on his land. He is requesting a loan to purchase mineral fertilizer as well as fuels and lubricants used  to process the  land. He and his daughter (pictured) also care for cows, sheep and goats and part of the loan would be spent remaking a cattle-shed. Nazirjon is asking for a loan of 1000 Somoni ($300 USD) for the term of 12 months. He deeply appreciates the trust and support you are giving him.

loans.use: Purchase of fuels and lubricants and also for remaking a cattle-shed.

loans.name: Bahridin

texts.en: Bahridin is a hard working person who tries to provide the best for his 3 beloved children. He decided to stay in his homeland so that he could develop it. He carries out his everyday chores with a lot of love and affection as he cultivates the land and feeds his animals. For the past 4 years, he has gained experience in the purchase and sale of cattle which has brought stability to his family. He would now like to purchase more cattle that can create more income for his large family and is requesting 2100 Somoni ($625 USD) for the term of 12 months. Bahridin thanks you very much.

loans.use: Purchasing cattle to expand the business.

loans.name: Grace Women’S Group

texts.en: James K. is 35 years old and the dedicated father of four children who are between 3 months and seven years old.  Along with his wife, a primary school teacher, he is also responsible for his niece.  Since graduating from trade school six years ago, James has owned a consumer electronics repair services shop that serves about twenty customers each week.  James is eager to expand his shop and eventually hire a helper, but first needs to purchase a large quantity of replacement parts and tools that will allow him to serve customers in a timely and efficient manner.  Therefore, he is requesting a loan of $2850, which will allow him to keep his shop stocked for longer periods of time.

loans.use: To maintain a stock of replacement parts and purchase tools.

payments.comment: Correction due to underpayment for business #73756

loans.name: Grace Women’S Group

texts.en: Dezilantah P. is a 43-year-old mother of nine children and the foster parent of her late brother's daughter, all of whom are either currently students or graduates.  Having worked as a tailor for 15 years, Dezilantah is talented at making school uniforms, gomeses (traditional Ugandan dresses), shirts, trousers, and other articles of clothing.  Each week, Dezilantah makes about ten dresses and earns a comfortable wage for each dress or other article.  Although Dezilantah currently rents her small shop from a clothing boutique, she still finds the time to teach orphans to sew so that they, too, will one day be self-sufficient. Every few years, Dezilantah has taken out and successfully repaid a loan.  Recently, she decided that she was ready to open her own shop, and has therefore requested a loan of $2800.

loans.use: To purchase materials and prepare for purchasing shop.

loans.name: Nile Lending Group

texts.en: Monica L. is a 36-year-old widow raising six children, who are all in school except for the eldest who recently graduated.     She has owned and managed a restaurant at a nearby market for 12 years, serving local food 12 hours each day, every day, to about 20 patrons at a time.  Since recieving her first microcredit loan, Monica has been able to purchase non-perishable items in bulk and thereby save time, money, and interest on her credit balance.  In order to further increase the efficiency of her restaurant and earn more profit, which will be used to continue educating her children, Monica is requesting a loan of $2425.  She will use the loan to purchase a refrigerator so that she can offer cold drinks, and also to buy sugar, rice, beans, maize flour, sauces, chicken, fish and other ingredients for her menu.

loans.use: To purchase a refrigerator and non-perishable ingredients in bulk.

loans.name: Maropat

texts.en:
Maropat A.  is 42 years old, married and is the loving mother of two children. Maropat buys small cattle on the market at a low price, feeds them and then resells them at the same market at a more profitable price. Her elder son is involved with this business. Maropat works hard in order to make the business successful and generate a stable income for the family.

Maropat is planning to purchase additional cattle to raise and later sell. She is requesting 2100 Somoni ($625 US Dollars) for the term of 12 months. Maropat would like to thank everyone for support and promises to manage the loan without violations and delinquency.

loans.use: Purchasing of cattle for breeding and selling.

loans.name: Sabohat

texts.en:
Sabohat A.  is a woman with a great drive to better herself, and this positive outlook on life has helped her build her  business. She is married and the loving mother of 3 children. For the past 10 years, Sabohat has been devoted to animal sales activities which has allowed her to provide a considerable amount of the household income. She exerts herself daily so that all of her children have access to an adequate education and grow up to become good men.

 Sabohat is requesting a loan of 2100 Somoni ($625 USD) for the term of 12 months to expand her business and buy more cows. She kindly thanks you for your generosity.

loans.use: Purchasing small cattle to expand the business and improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.name: Gavhar

texts.en:
Gavhar A.  is 52 years old is married and the mother of 5 older children. Only theyoungest child remains unmarried. Gavhar’s husband is retired and receives a pension so Gavhar's business is the main source of income for the family. After receiving proper training, Gavhar opened her business embroidering and selling national skull caps for men and women. She has been working really hard at building this business for the past 10 years.

Gavhar is dreaming of arranging the marriage of her younger son. With this purpose in mind, Gavhar has plans to expand her business and is requesting 2000 Somoni ($600 USD) for the term of 12 months. Gavhar is planning to use the loan to purchase fabrics for embroidering the national skull-cap. Gavhar had shown herself as a reliable client as this is her third loan from IMON. Your support will really help her.

loans.use: Purchase of fabrics for embroidering the national skull-cap.

loans.name: Zuhur

texts.en:
Zuhur M. is 33 years old, married and has three children. Zuhur has a middle special education in engineering but he earns his living in agriculture. He earns a small salary used to feed his family and pay for his children’s education. Zuhur works hard to cultivate his products such as apples, pear, and grapes. He works from early morning until late at night hoping to have a rich harvest. Zuhur sells his harvest in the market where they are always in high demand due to their good quality. His works fills him with great optimism and allows him to help his beloved children. His goal is to improve the quality of his agricultural products even more and to grow his business. 

 Zuhur is requesting a loan of $750 USD for the term of 12 months to buy necessary materials for storing his products so that he can sell them at a later date when the price for them will increase.

loans.use: Purchasing necessary materials for storing his products

loans.name: Yusuf

texts.en:
Yusuf N. is 56 years old and is married with six children all of whom are married. For the past 38 years, Yusuf has been providing taxi services with his car. Yusuf has always provided a high quality service at an attractive price. Yusuf is does his best to keep his business stable and profitable as he is the main bread-winner in his large family. He works from early morning until late at night in order to keep his customers and obtain new ones.

 Since the price of petrol is rising everyday, Yusuf is planning to replace the fuel supply system with one using gas which is less expensive. To make the change, he is requesting 2500 Somoni ($750 US Dollars) for the term of 12 months. He thanks everyone supporting him and promises to repay the loan in a timely manner.

loans.use: Purchasing of the kapron gas-cylinder for a fuel supply system.

loans.name: Suhbatjon

texts.en:
Suhbatjon P. is married and is a young father of two children. Suhbatjon’s children are small now, but he is already working hard in order to ensure the best future for them. For the past 9 years, Suhbatjon has been selling brooms in the market. He owns land where he grows the material required for making brooms.

Suhbatjon is requesting 2700 Somoni ($800 USD) for the term of 12 months. The loan will be used to buy necessary materials for processing his land and growing broom materials. The loan will enable Suhbatjon to earn more and accomplish his dreams of educating his children. He also dreams of someday buying car to be able to look after his parents.

loans.use: Purchasing necessary materials for making brooms

loans.name: Siona

texts.en:
Siona is divorced with two children; she lives near Bamenda, Cameroon.  With this loan, Siona plans to invest in her businesses of knitting pullovers, farming, and making homemade yogurt.  She will invest her loan in purchases of thread for knitting, fertilizer for farming, and a deep freezer for her yogurt.  She plans to contribute 40,000 CFA ($80 USD) of her own savings towards her business plan.

This is Siona's second loan with GHAPE.  Her experience in this market has taught her that there is a strong demand for these goods that she plans to provide.  She also has a strong client base already; she hopes to expand her client base with the business skills that GHAPE has taught her.  Her yogurt will provide a source of protein for those in her community.  She plans to pass her knitting skills to other in her community, so that they can also knit and develop another source of income.

The profits from this loan will be used to pay for Siona's children's school fees; this has been somewhat difficult for her after divorcing her husband.  She will also ensure that her family eats well, is clothed well, and can be cared for in times of ill health.  She hopes to use some of her profits to reinvest in her business.  She plans to increase her profits using the skills she has learned in her business and management training from GHAPE.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To buy thread, fertilizer, and a deep freezer

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To increase the stock of his beauty shop.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria M., 32, is married with three children, one aged 11 and twins aged 7, and also cares for her mother.  For the past two years Maria has owned a general store where she sells food items, kangas and vitenge (traditional Swahili fabrics). Working daily from 9 a.m. until 9:30 p.m., she is able to earn a monthly profit of about $204.

This will be Maria’s fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. The first three, which she used to increase the stock in her shop, have been repaid, and she intends to use this new loan for the same purpose - to increase her stock of vitenge and kangas. Maria is a member of the Kinyerezi loan group, whose members guarantee the repayment of each others' loans.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of kangas and vitenge.

loans.name: Shemu John's Kinyerezi Group

texts.en:
Shemu J., 31, is married with two children, ages three and two, and also cares for two dependents – his sister-in-law and niece. He has a shop where he sells beauty supplies in an area called Banana. He started this business in 2007 and works daily from 8 a.m. until 8 p.m., earning a monthly profit of around $81.

This will be Shemu’s third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans, which he promptly repaid, to increase the stock of his shop, and now hopes for a third loan to buy more stock, such as lotions and jewelry.

Shemu will share this loan with his loan group, Kinyerezi, whose members hold each other accountable in repaying their loans. In the picture, Shemu is standing second from the right and is wearing a black shirt. Also pictured are J. N. (fruit and vegetable stand owner), Vitus S. (butchery owner) and Christian M. (bar owner).

loans.use: To increase the stock of his beauty supplies shop.

loans.name: Zoirjon

texts.en:
Zoirjon Y. is 39 years old and is married with three children. For the past 5 years, Zoirjon has been selling dried fruits in the central local market. Dried fruits are very popular in Tajikistan and can be found in most homes to serve guests.  Moreover, dried fruits are, as a rule, served during all  family occasions like wedding parties, birthday parties and others. The constant demand for these kinds of goods has allowed Zoirjon to run a successful business and provide a stable income for his family.

 Zoirjon’s wife, who is pictured in the photo, is also engaged in this business. Zoirjon would like to increase the stock of his goods in order to be able to supply all the demands of his buyers. He is requesting 2700 Somoni ($800 US Dollars) for the term of 12 months to purchase dried fruits like raisins, apricots and nuts like almonds and  pistachios.  Zoirjon has already demonstrated himself as a reliable client with a positive credit history and he would like to thank everyone for their support and promises to pay the loan on time.

loans.use: Purchasing of dried fruits and nuts like raisins, dried apricots, almonds and pistachios.

loans.name: Muhammad

texts.en:
Muhammad A. is 63 years old and married with six children. He lives in Khewa Nangarhar province and is an educated man. He lives in his village and works in agriculture processing, but he doesn't have animals for his land. He is also a regent of Parliament in Khewa. Mr. A. lives in a village and has a big house because he has a very big family.

He says, "I have grassland, but I am buying 50AF ($1 US) of milk every morning." Because of this, he wants to buy his own animals.
