"Everyone who lives in the village should have animals for milk and yogurt," he says. For this, he needs 50000AF ($1100US) in individual loans for 27 months.

"We are poor people, but we should pay this money back in a short time. Thanks Kiva and thanks so much to the lenders."

loans.use: To buy livestock for milk and yogurt production.

loans.name: Sanoat

texts.en:
Sanoat S. is 38 years old and lives with her spouse and 4 children. Sanoat works every day, starting very early in the morning, so that she can get ahead and achieve her goal of having her 4 children successfully finish school and enter University. She sells children clothes in the central market of Istaravshan town. Thanks to the support of her spouse, and her own effort, she has been able to expand and grow her business.

With a loan of 2700 Somoni ($800 USD), which she will repay in 12 months, she will buy a greater variety of clothing styles, for a variety of occasions, and a few specific requests from her customers.

loans.use: To purchase more children's clothing for sale.

loans.name: Abdujabor

texts.en:
Abdujabor K.  is 49 years old. He is married with five children. Abdujabor is a market vendor. For the past 14 years he has been working selling clothing and sport shoes for men in the local market. His elder son who is pictured in the photo is also engaged in this business. 

Abdujabor’s wife is a homemaker, thus his business is the only source of income for his family. For this reason he works hard to bring sustenance back to his home. Abdujabor wants his children to get a good education, thus allowing them to have a better chance to succeed in the future - this is what makes his sacrifice worthwhile. 

In order to grow his business, Abdujabor is requesting a loan of 500 USD, which he will use to purchase merchandise to be able to offer a wider selection to his customers and increase his income. With the rotation of supplies in his business, he plans to repay the loan within 3 months. The well-being of Abdujabor’s family and his business are in your hands. Abdujabor and his family are sincerely grateful for your support.

loans.use: Purchasing the new clothing for teenagers

loans.name: Younis

texts.en:
A young man, Younis K. is 34 years old and married with three children. He owns a petrol pump in Jalalabad city. He lives in Khewa Nangrahar province and he is an educated man. He has agricultural land and grassland in his village.

He says, "If I can buy animals for our own home, I can solve some of my problems at home and on the agricultural land." For this, he has applied for a 50000AF ($1000 US) individual loan for 25 months from AFGS so he can buy animals. He says, "It is very good that I can buy animals for our home. Thanks, lenders of Kiva."

loans.use: To buy farm animals.

loans.name: Rose

texts.fr: Rose B. est revendeuse des légumes à womé, un village au nord-ouest de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Cette activité étant sa seule source de revenu, elle souhaite accroître sa capacité par ce crédit qu’elle bénéficiera afin de contribuer aux dépenses du foyer. Rose est âgée de 33 ans, mariée et mère de 2 enfants.
texts.en:
Rose B. sells vegetables in Wome, a village to the northwest of Lomé, the capital of Togo. This business being her only source of income, she hopes to increase the size of it with this loan, which she seeks in order to contribute to her household expenses. Rose is 33 years old, married, and a mother of 2.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy vegetables to resell

loans.name: Khanifa

texts.en:
Khanifa K.  is 48 years old, is married and the loving mother of 7 children. She worked for 2 years in a gift shop, and thanks to the savings of her husband, she was able to start her own business 15 years ago. She now sells clothing for teenagers and receives help from her husband, who takes care of the store in the afternoon (see picture). 

Thanks to Khanifa's hard work, her customer base has increased and she has had to rent the store next door to expand and offer a better variety. She is now requesting a loan of $600 USD which she will use to buy additional clothing for the upcoming cold season. She commits to repay the loan over a period of 3 months. Khanifa is thankful for your generosity and help.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Christina Semindu's Songa Group

texts.en:
Christina Semidu, 28, is married with two children aged five and two. The owner of a salon and a cafe business, she works from 8 a.m. to 8 p.m. daily, earning a month profit of about $64.

Chrisina has taken out two previous loans from Tujijenge Tanzania to expand both businesses, and now hopes for a new loan to buy a dryer for her salon. Christina will share this loan with her loan group, Songa, which totals 19 members. These members hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

In the picture Christina is second from the left, sitting on the swing.

loans.use: To purchase another dryer for salon.

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr: Akouvi G. est une couturière de profession. Pour faire de belles coupes pour mieux satisfaire la clientèle, Akouvi souhaite avec ce crédit acquérir nouvelle machine à coudre et des tissus pour les revendre à la clientèle. Ceci lui permettra da gagner plus d’argent pour mieux subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants. Akouvi est mariée et mère d’un enfant. Dans la photo, elle est habillée en t-shirt raillé. Les autres personnes sont ses apprentis.
texts.en:
Akouvi G. is a seamstress by profession. To produce stylish clothing that satisfy her customers, she would like to use this loan to acquire a new sewing machine and some fabrics to resell to them. This will enable her to earn more money to provide for her children better. Akouvi is married. In the photo, she is the one dressed in a striped T-shirt. The others are her apprentices.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and some fabrics to resell

loans.name: Sojida

texts.en:
Sojida A.  is a 48 year old married woman with 4 children. She owns a specialized fabrics store at the central market in Dushanbe city. Sojida works in an area of trade where the demand is very consistent and high. She is one of the leading fabric vendors for national dresses in Tajikistan which are a very popular and very important item of the dowry of any girl. Sojida is very skilled entrepreneur and is determined in all of her business endeavors, which has helped to sustain her venture for 4 years. 

In order to continue the growth of her business, Sojida is requesting a loan of 4000 Somoni ($1200 USD) for a term of  9 months. The loan will be used to increase her assorted inventory and possibly open a new vending location. One of her personal goals is to generate additional profit so that she can remodel a new apartment she recently bought for her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional fabrics for her inventory.

loans.name: Taanga Oliver

texts.en:
Talanga Oliver N. was born in 1974. She is single and a mother of three children, all of whom are below the ages of 15. Due to the untimely death of her father and the imminent poverty, Oliver was unable to continue her education. She became pregnant twice, and for these reasons she sought help from GHAPE in order to take care of herself and her two kids.

She joined GHAPE in 2005 and has successfully borrowed and repaid loans two times amounting to 70.000 FRS.  She invested these loans in selling puff-puff and beans. The profit of these loans were used to pay school fees, buy books, feed and clothe her children and herself. 

Oliver is requesting a loan to buy two bags of flour, a bucket of beans, a tin of groundnut oil, two tins of palm oil, a dozen cartons of sugar and 10 packets of yeast. The above items will be used in preparing puff-puff and beans. She plans to use the profit to educate her children and also to build a house for her family. She is convinced that her business is going to succeed because she is very hard-working, has a lot of customers, has experience, and has being doing this business for a very long time now.  She plans to repay this loan in 18 months, with the first installment repayment begins four months after disbursement.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To purchase of flour, beans, groundnut oil, and sugar

loans.name: Antoinnette

texts.fr: Antoinnette K. est âgée de 42 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle est propriétaire d’une boutique d’alimentation générale depuis 7 ans à Wome, un village situé à environ 130 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Elle désire par ce crédit accroître la taille de son commerce en approvisionnant sa boutiques afin de mieux satisfaire la clientèle. Cette opportunité lui permettra de mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Antoinnette K., 42, is married and the mother of 3 children. For 7 years, she has been the owner of a general store in Womé, a village situated about 130 km from Lomé, the capital of Togo. She wants to use this loan to expand the size of her business by stocking her store so that she can better satisfy her clientele. This opportunity will permit her to better support her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase merchandise for re-sale

loans.name: Rahmat Ulla

texts.en:
Rahmat Ullah has been living for long time in Khewa, Nangrahar province. He is 27 years old, married, and the father of five children. He is an educated man and a teacher at Khewa Children's School. He is teaching math, geography and history. He is also a good farmer.

Rahmat grows different vegetables on his land, and after that, he brings them to the bazaar for selling. Because his salary is just 4,000AF ($8 US) per month, it is not enough for his whole household. Therefore, he wants to buy some animals and he needs a 50,000AF ($1000 US) individual loan for 27 months. For this, he contacted the lenders of AFSG to give him a 50,000AF individual loan for 27 months so he can buy some animals for his land.

He says, "By selling milk and yogurt, my income will increase and my problems will be solved. Thanks a lot to the lenders of Kiva."

loans.use: To purchase livestock for milk and yogurt production.

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr: Akouvi X. est une vaillante commerçante de cola depuis 5 ans à Wome, un village situé à 130 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Son activité consiste à acheter des noix de cola auprès des agriculteurs et les exporte vers le Niger. Elle aimerait par ce crédit augmenter la taille de son commerce, ce qui lui permettra de gagner plus de fonds pour la survie de sa famille
texts.en:
Akouvi X. is a hard-working businesswoman who has been selling kola nuts for 5 years in Womé, a village situated about 130 km from Lomé, the capital of Togo. Her business consists in buying kola nuts from the growers and exporting them to Niger. She would like to use this loan to increase the size of her business venture, which will help her to earn more money to allow her family to survive.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of kola nuts for re-sale

loans.name: Aliah Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela is married with two children; she lives in Musang, a town just outside of Bamenda, Cameroon. She plans to invest this loan in rearing pigs and farming yellow yams and sweet yams. She plans to use her own savings to rent the land for farming her yams; she will use this loan to purchase all the necessary farming supplies for yams and to begin her pig business.

This is Pamela's third loan from GHAPE. She has never invested in pigs before; however, her husband has experience in this area and has passed his knowledge on to her. She feels she can have large profits in this business because of her husband's support. There is a high demand for yams, both sweet and yellow, in this region of Cameroon; she hopes her yams will fill some of this demand. She also plans to sell some of the manure from her pigs to people in her community.

With the profits from this loan, Pamela hopes to build a proper pit latrine for her family. She also hopes to save some money to purchase her own home; her family is currently living with her brother-in-law. She lost her home due to her brother's debt. She recently remarried after divorcing her first husband; many of those in her family have disowned her for this act. She hopes this loan provides her with enough profit to begin to improve her family's living standards and recoup her losses.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: raising piglets and buying yellow yam and sweet yam seeds to grow

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr: Adjo D. est une commerçante dynamique. Elle est revendeuse des légumes  au marché de Wome, un village situé à environ 130 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale du Togo. Cette activité étant sa principale source de revenu, elle souhaite accroître sa capacité avec le crédit qu’il va bénéficier. Adjo espère améliorer ses conditions de vie avec cette opportunité
texts.en:
Adjo D. is an energetic merchant, a retailer of vegetables at the marketplace of Wome, a village located about 130 km from Lomé, which is the capital of Togo. This business being her principal source of income, she would like to grow her capacity by using the loan obtained. Adjo hopes to improve her living conditions with this opportunity.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy vegetables for resale

loans.name: Mwajuma Mohamed's Kanga Group

texts.en:
MwaJ. M., 38 and single with two children, aged 11 and 6, operates a business selling kangas and vitenge (traditional Swahili fabrics) door-to-door. She started this business in 2002 and is able to earn a monthly profit of about $122.

This will be MwaJ.’s second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, the first one, since repaid, having been used to increase the stock of her business. She intends to use this new loan for the same purpose.

MwaJ. will share the money with her loan group, Kanga, whose 20 members hold each other accountable in repaying their loans. In the picture, MwaJ. is standing in the center and holding a blue purse.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of kangas and vitenge.

loans.name: Ticana Gaspar

texts.pt:
Ticana nasceu em Manhiça, tem 41 anos de idade estudou ata a 8ª classe vive maritalmente é mãe de 5 filhos com idades compriendidas entre os 29 aos 22 anos, 3 dos seus filhos estão na universidade e os restantes estão empregados.
 Ticana após de concluir a 8ª classe  teve que interroper os estudos  devido a má condiçao financeira dos pais. Sai de Manhiça para Marracuene  com o seu esposo em emisão de serviço este que era Director da agricultura daquele Distrito e governou durante 5 anos. Ticana porque tinha um bom nivel de escolaridade o administrador convida-lhe para trabalhar como secretaria particular dele dois anos depois  o seu esposo é  transferido para  trabalhar em Namaacha uma vila na fronteira de Swazilandia e assim abandona o seu emprego.. Chegado a Namaacha ticana pede emprestado um valor a sua  irma mais velha e começa a praticar negócio de criaçao de pintos  com ajuda do seu esposo que é tecnico agrónomo uma actividade que exerce ate hoje. Além de ser uma  grande criadora de frangos é dona de uma barraca de refeiçoes, mas porque os pintos precisam de muita atençao ela não tem horario fixo de trabalho, tem criado no maximo 5x100 caixas de pintos a 35.000.00mt e revende cada a 85.00mt  cria em fases para poder   vender alternadamente. Tem como melhor produto o frango já preparado que vende em sua barraca tem tido um lucro de 4.000.00mt mensalmente consegue poupar por mês 500.00mt porque tem que pagar dispesas dos seus filhos que se encontram a estudar na universidade, uma vez que o seu marido teve problrmas no seviço e perdeu o emprego.
Este é o segundo empréstimo de Ticana  na hluvuku e primeiro no kiva. O primeiro de 15.000.00mt usou para comprar pintos, conseguiu pagar sem nenhuma dificuldade e pede este segundo de 12.000.00mt para reforcar o seu negocio . Esta confiante que vai desembolsar antes do prazo e pedir outro emprestimo para a construcao do murro da sua residencia.
texts.en:
Ticana was born in Manhiça. She is 41 years old and attended school until the 8th grade. She is married and the mother of 5 children between the ages of 22 and 29. Three of her children are in college, and the others are working. After finishing the 8th grade Ticana had to interrupt her studies due to the poor financial conditions of her parents. She left Manhiça for Marracuene with her husband who served as the Director of Agriculture in that district for 5 years. Because she had a good level of schooling, Ticana was invited by the administrator to work as his secretary. Two years later her husband was transferred to work in Namaacha, a town on the border of Swaziland, so she abandoned her job. Having arrived in Namaacha Ticana got a loan from her oldest sister and began her business of raising chickens with the help of her husband who is an expert agronomist; an activity that they continue today. Besides being a great chicken farmer she is also owner of a food shack, but because the chicks require a lot of attention she does not have fixed hours of work. She makes at a maximum 5X100 boxes of chickens at 35MT and resells each one for 85MT. She raises them in phases to be able to sell alternatingly. Her best product is a ready-prepared chicken that she sells from her stand. She makes 4,000MT per month but is only able to save 500MT because she has to pay expenses for her children who are studying at the university, and her husband had problems in the service and lost his job. This is Ticana's second loan with Hluvuku and her first with Kiva. The first loan of 15,000MT was used to purchase chickens and she was able to repay without any difficulties. She is requesting this second loan of 12,000MT to reinforce her business. She is confidant that she can pay off the loan before maturity so she can ask for another loan to construct a wall around her residence.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising chickens

loans.name: Odette

texts.fr: Odette D. est âgée de 41 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle est propriétaire d’une boutique d’alimentation générale bientôt un an à Wome, un village du nord-ouest de Lomé, la capitale du Togo. Afin de mieux répondre aux besoins de sa clientèle et par conséquent tirer plus de profits de son commerce, Odette souhaite avec ce crédit bien alimenter sa boutique
texts.en:
Odette D. is 41 years old, married, and a mother of 3. She has owned a general food shop for about a year in Wome, a village northwest of Lomé, the capital of Togo. In order to better meet the needs of her clientele and thus earn more profits, Odette hopes to use this loan to better supply her shop.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise to sell in her store

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr: Yawa N. est une couturière renommée à Wome, un village du nord-ouest de Lomé, la capitale du Togo. Agée de 39 ans, Yawa est mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Passionnée par son métier, elle cherche à la promouvoir par le  crédit qu’il va bénéficier en achetant une machine  à coudre et aussi des tissus afin de vendre ces derniers à la clientèle.
texts.en:
Yawa N. is a renown dressmaker in Womé, a village located northwest of Lomé, the capital of Togo. Yawa is 39 years old, married, and the mother of two. Her work is her passion, and she is seeking to advance it with the loan, to be received, that will be used to buy a sewing machine and also some fabrics to sell to customers.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and fabrics to sell

loans.name: Gift Mlaki's Mungu Tubariki Group

texts.en:
Gift M., 30 years old and married with three children aged seven, four and one, has a grain milling machine business which he stared three years ago. Working from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m. daily, he is able to make a monthly profit of about $320.

Gift has taken out two previous loans from Tujijenge Tanzania to buy land upon which he started building a small house, and now hopes for a new loan to continue its construction. Gift will share this loan with his group, Mungu Tubariki, whose 15 members hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

In the picture, Gift is the first on the left in the first row.

loans.use: To continue to build his house.

loans.name: Young Strikers Group

texts.en:
These people are Ahmed F., Mariama B., Osman F. and Isatu K.. They named their group Young Strikers. This will be their third loan from SMT. The previous loans have made tremendous impacts on the lives of these people. The last loan they received was for Le 800,000.00 each. Now, they are requesting a loan for Le 1,000,000.00 each to enable them to further strengthen their businesses.

Ahmed (right) is the leader of this group. Ahmed is thirty-two years of age. He was born in Makeni City, in northern Sierra Leone. He is married to a businesswoman who sells rice. The two have two children, both of whom are in primary school.

Ahmed has been in business for seven years now. Previously, he solely depended on running “Okada” (motor-bikes used for transportation) as his business. But with consistent loans through SMT, he has today diversified his business. Now, he owns a small kiosk where he sells both soft and hard drinks, cans of milk, sardines, bars of soap, and top-up cards (for all four mobile networks used here – Celtel, Tigo, Commiun and Africell). He also recharges mobile batteries for a fee of one thousand Leones. Both his wife and brother-in-law assist him in running the kiosk as he is still engaged in the Okada work.

He travels to Bamoi Junction (200 miles round trip) and Freetown (390 miles round trip) to buy the goods he sells. With a loan of Le 1,000,000.00 he will be able to buy four crates of soft drinks to add to the four crates he currently has in stock. He can also buy two crates of beer to add to the four he has today. A crate of soft drinks costs him Le 24,000.00, a crate of beer is Le 40,000.00 and a crate of stout costs him Le 66,000.00.

The most difficult challenge facing Ahmed is building up capital with his business. With only a small amount of capital, he is short many items that customers want. But with SMT by his side, he is optimistic that he will one day be able to get a large shop with a lot of goods.

With this loan and the profit it will generate for him, Ahmed will be able to solve most of his household problems, including the paying of school fees for his children, feeding the family, clothing them and providing medical care in case anyone in the family falls sick.

loans.use: Buy at least four crates of soft drinks and two crates of beer

loans.name: Hard Work Group

texts.en:
This is Haja J., Emmanuel M. T., Gbassay K. and Isatu K.. They named their group 'Hard Work'. This will be their third loan from SMT. The previous loans have made tremendous impacts in their lives. The last loan they received from Kiva through SMT was for Le 1,000,000.00 each. Now, they are requesting a loan of Le 4,000,000.00 to enable them to further strengthen their businesses.

Haja J. (third from left) is the leader of this group. Haja is forty-seven years of age. She was born in Sanda, about thirty-five miles from Makeni, in the northern part of Sierra Leone. She now resides in Makeni City together with her husband. She has six children. One is in college, two in secondary schools and the last in primary school. The other two are no longer attending schools. Her husband is a 'fitter' – a locally trained motor repairer. 

Haja sells ground-nuts and has been in this business for over twenty years now. With this loan, Haja will buy about thirteen bags of ground-nuts from her home town of Sanda. A bag of ground-nuts costs her Le 90,000. 

Currently, Haja faces no major challenges worth noting in her business. Business is going fine and she is doing well in her business and loves doing it. When her profit increases as a result of this loan, Haja will be able to render greater assistance to her school-going children. She will also be able to feed the family (as her husband is now getting tired due to age), clothe herself and her children, and also provide them with medical attention in case anyone becomes ill.

loans.use: Expand business by adding at least thirteen bags of ground-nuts

loans.name: Concern Group

texts.en:
This loan group, called Concern, consists of Kadie C., Amie B., Safie C., Isatu K. and Aminata T., who are now applying for their fifth loan from SMT.  The previous loans have had meaningful impacts on their lives, enabling them to strengthen their respective businesses, the same goal of their latest request. 

Kadie C. (left in the photo), the leader of this group, is 32 years old. She was born in the eastern town of Kono, Sierra Leone but in 1992 the rebel war brought her to the town of Makeni, where she eventually found her soul mate. She has one child who is still not of school age.  Her husband is a principal in one of Makeni’s secondary schools.

Kadie has been in business for five years now, previously selling “gara lappers” (locally dyed clothes) as her primary business, but with consistent loans from Kiva through SMT, she has diversified. Now she sells both a locally made drink called Bitter Kola and bottled water. She decided to incorporate this new business because the new products sell faster, which enables her to repay her monthly loan on time. 

She travels to Freetown (a 390 mile return trip) to buy the cartons of Bitter Kola drinks she sells. With the loan she is requesting, Kadie will be able to buy as many as 44 cartons to add to the 20 cartons she is currently trading, thereby resulting in greater profit given the transportation costs each trip incurs.  

Kadie uses part of her profits to repay her loan, reinvests some in her business and uses the remaining to help take care of her family.

loans.use: To increase her stock of Bitter Kola drinks

loans.name: Sabanoh Ii Group

texts.en:
The loan group Sabanoh II consists of  Pa Hassan K., Yeabu V., Abdul R. K., Adama K. and James C., all local entrepreneurs in the village of Mokonta, about nine miles from Makeni.  A previous loan from Kiva through SMT had a meaningful impact on their lives, as the members used it to pay for their children’s school fees, feed themselves and their families and buy seeds to enlarge their farms. Today, they are requesting another loan to buy more goods to add to their businesses.

Pa Hassan K. (on the left in the photo), 45, the leader of the group, has sold dried pepper for the last 15 years and is the married father of five children. Three of his children are in secondary school and two are in primary school. His wife is a subsistence farmer who usually grows rice, cassava and potatoes. 

While he usually trades with only two bags of pepper, this new loan will allow Pa Hassan to expand his business by purchasing about six bags of dried pepper on his buying excursions to Masombiri village, a distance of about 36 miles round trip. As well, he would also like to invest part of the loan in farming. 

For the entire group, an increase in profit means increasing their business stock and investing in subsistence farming.  They thank you for your support.

loans.use: To expand his business by buying six bags of pepper.

loans.name: Beatrice Mfinanaga's Mwaminifu Kibamba Group

texts.en:
Beatrice M., age 40, is married with three children (ages 21, 18, and 14). She also has one dependent sister who is 21 years old. She owns a clothing shop for ladies' wear. She started this shop three years ago in an area called Kibamba. She works from 7am to 8pm daily and is able to make a monthly profit of around US$ 240.

In the past, Beatrice has taken out three loans from Tujijenge Tanzania to increase her "vitenge" sales (traditional Swahili fabrics) and tailoring (sewing ladies' clothes). She now hopes for a new loan to increase her tailoring business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members who have businesses selling charcoal, fish, and vegetables or own small shops. Beatrice belongs to a loan group called Mwaminifu Kibamba, whose members monitor each other in paying back the loan.

In the picture, Beatrice is the 1st on the right in the front row.

loans.use: To increase the inventory of her clothing shop

loans.name: Beatrice Sirri

texts.en:
Beatrice is married with seven children; she lives in Ntahsene, just outside of Bamenda, Cameroon. She plans to invest this loan in her farm where she grows yams, cassava, and beans. More specifically, this loan will be used to pay for the farm to be cleared, hoed and weeded, for someone to replant yams, and for new seeds.

This is Beatrice's seventh loan; she has been a member of GHAPE since 2001. She is used to working on the farm and working with all these crops. All of her previous loans have been put towards the same project and have provided her with gains.

The profits from this loan will be used to provide for Esther's family. She will continue to pay her children's school fees and keep them educated. She enjoys the low interest rate and long repayment terms that GHAPE provides her.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Clearing of farm, labour for weeding, yams seedlings, sticking of yams

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es: Alejandro tiene 29 años, convive con su pareja Carmen de 22 años y sus dos hijos Alex de 7 y Luz de 6. Desde hace 7 años trabaja en una ferretería, donde vende material para la construcción. Le gusta su trabajo, ya que el vender es su gran habilidad, su gran poder de convencimiento han hecho que Alejandro genere buenos ingresos para la manutención de su hogar, lo más complicado es que el trabajo es duro, por tener que cargar y trasladar el material, pero él es un hombre joven, que piensa en trabajar a favor de su familia hasta que le den las fuerzas. Es su primer préstamo en Microfinanzas PRISMA. Con el dinero del préstamo Alejandro quiere comprar algunos materiales de la misma ferretería en la que trabaja, para ir juntando materiales para construir posteriormente una pequeña casa propia.
texts.en:
Alejandro is 29 years old and lives with his domestic partner, Carmen age 22, and their two children, Alex age 7 and Luz age 6. For 7 years, he has worked at a hardware store in which construction supplies and building materials are sold. He likes his job because retail is his biggest skill. His great power of persuasion has made Alejandro generate good earnings to support his household. The most difficult thing about his job is that it requires heavy labor, as he has to lift and move the material. Nevertheless, he is a young man who always thinks about working for his family as long as he is physically able to do so. This is his first loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA. With this loan, Alejandro wishes to purchase some building materials from workplace so that he can begin to stockpile supplies in order to build his own little house.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to start building his own house

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen tiene 28 años, es soltera, vive en casa de su familia. Gracias a sus dones en la cocina, ha logrado poner su puesto ambulatorio de venta de Ceviche, negocio que le genera buenos ingresos económicos, ya que trabaja desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana hasta las 3 de la tarde.
Siendo el ceviche un plato muy cotizado en el Perú por su rico sabor, su venta es asegurada, es así que al día termina todo lo preparado sin sobrarle nada. Lo más difícil de su trabajo es la preparación del plato que requiere de mucha dedicación para que salga con el sabor adecuado, pero Carmen lleva 5 años de experiencia que hacen que la clientela se vaya muy contenta después de haber degustado este riquísimo plato. Carmen se encuentra en su primer préstamo en Microfinanzas PRISMA.  Con el dinero comprará algunos instrumentos de cocina, mayor cantidad de pescado y otros ingredientes para preparar este delicioso plato.
texts.en:
Carmen is 28 years old, single, and lives in her family’s home. Thanks to her talents in the kitchen, she has managed to set up her own cart in which she sells ceviche—citrus-marinated fish. This business generates good profits for her because she works from very early in the morning until 3 in the afternoon. Because ceviche is a very popular dish in Peru due to its delicious flavor, her sales are guaranteed, which is why at the end of the day, she sells everything she has prepared without having anything left over. The most difficult aspect of her job is preparing the dish, which requires a lot of dedication so that the flavor comes out just right. Nevertheless, Carmen has 5 years of experience, which means that her customers leave satisfied after tasting this mouth-watering dish. This is Carmen’s first loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA. With this loan, she will purchase kitchen utensils, a greater quantity of fish, and other ingredients necessary to prepare this delectable dish.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase kitchen utensils, fish, and other ingredients

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos es estudiante universitario en la carrera de informática y se dedica en sus horarios libres a dar clases se calculo, matemáticas y estadística y también realiza mantenimiento de computadoras.
Es soltero y los ingresos provenientes de las actividades que realiza alcanzan para cubrir sus costos de universidad 
Su domicilio esta ubicado en la zona de Alto Obrajes de la ciudad de La Paz,  en la casa de sus padres.
El crédito será destinado para el pago de un curso de informática que Carlos necesita para actualizar sus conocimientos.
Es la tercera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, su historial le califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimento bueno en el pago de su crédito.
texts.en:
Carlos is a computer science major in college. In his spare time, he gives calculus, mathematics and statistics lessons. He also repairs computers. He is single, so the income he earns from his business activities is sufficient to cover his university fees. He lives in his parents’ home in the Alto Obrajes district of the city of La Paz. This loan will be used to pay for one of his computer science courses, which he needs in order to bring his computer skills up to date. This is the third time he requests a loan from Impro. His credit history qualifies him as a client 1, which means he pays off his loans on time.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for a computer science course

loans.name: Miryagub

texts.en: You can see in the picture Miryagub's wife. Miryagub was born in 1954. He has 5 children. 10 years ago he started a farming business. The A. family lives in the Khachmaz region the Charkhi village. Now they need a loan of 970 AZN to buy fertilizer, seedlings and pesticides for improving their farming business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seedlings and pesticides

loans.name: Jose

texts.es: José tiene 22 años, es soltero y vive en casa de unos familiares. El servicio de mototaxi es el oficio al que se dedica desde hace ya 2 años, incursionando en este negocio porque es un trabajo dinámico y no rutinario, se traslada por las diferentes calles de la ciudad de Juliaca transportando a sus pasajeros. Para José lo más difícil es tener que realizar este trabajo durante casi todo el día, pero felizmente sus ganas y empeño que pone a su trabajo han hecho que sea muy perseverante y siga trabajando muy duro cada día. Este es  su primer préstamo en Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero del préstamo refaccionará su motocarro para un mejor servicio.
texts.en:
José is 22 years old, is single and lives in a relative's house. His motor-taxi service is the business he has worked in for the past 2 years, starting up this business because it is a dynamic job and is not routine as he goes through the city of Juliaca's different streets transporting his passengers. For José the most difficult thing is to have to carry out this work almost all day long, but happily the will and effort that he puts into his work have made him very persevering and he continues working very hard everyday. This is his first loan with Prisma Microfinance. With the money from this loan he will refurbish his motor-taxi for better service.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To refurbish his motor-taxi

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria tiene 35 años, es soltera, vive en una casa en calidad de cuidadora. Se dedica a la venta de golosinas de forma ambulatoria, desde hace ya 5 años, en un primer momento trabajando para otras personas, pero gracias a su empeño y en base a mucho trabajo, hace un año ha logrado contar con su propio puesto de venta de golosinas, negocio que es su único sustento económico.
La venta usualmente es buena, dándole a María buenas ganancias, pero muchas veces el tener que pasarse todo el día vendiendo sus golosinas le resulta muy cansado, pero las ganas de salir adelante y progresar son mucho mayores que esas pequeñas vicisitudes, haciendo que Maria ejerza su oficio con mucha alegría y fe en el futuro. Este es su primer préstamo en Microfinanzas Prisma.  Con el dinero del préstamo comprará más golosinas para vender y así obtener mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Maria is 35 years old, is single, and lives in a house as a caretaker. She has worked selling sweets as a traveling salesperson for 5 years, at first working for other people, but thanks to her effort and based on a lot of work a year ago she was able to have her own stand for the sale of sweets, a business which is her only economic support. The sales usually are good, giving Mara good earnings, but many times having to spend the entire day selling her sweets she ends up very tired. But her desire to get ahead and progress is much greater than these small vicissitudes, making Maria exercise her job with much happiness and faith in the future. This is her first loan with Prisma Microfinance. With the money from the loan she will buy more sweets to sell and through this obtain greater income.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the quantity of sweets that she sells

loans.name: Janeth

texts.es:
Janeth es enfermera pero por las condiciones de trabajo en Bolivia se ve obligada a realizar el trabajo de costura ya que su esposo realiza buzos y el crédito que ahora solicita será destinado para la compra de una maquina de coser.
Este crédito será de gran ayuda ya que al comprar la maquina tendrá la oportunidad de ayudar a su esposo y generar mayores ingresos para mejorar su calidad de vida
Vive en la zona de Tembladerani de la ciudad de La paz.
Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, las ganas de superarse le dan la oportunidad de acceder a este crédito.
texts.en:
Janeth is a nurse but due to the lack of work in Bolivia, she finds herself forced to work as a seamstress. Her husband makes athletic wear and the loan Janeth is requesting will go towards buying a sewing machine.

This loan will be a great help as in buying the sewing machine Janeth will be able to help her husband and generate more income to improve her quality of life.

She lives in the area of Tembladerani in the city of La Paz. This is her first loan from Impro and her desire to excel has given her the opportunity to gain access to this loan.


Translated from Spanish by Ines Teles, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a sewing machine to help her husband in his athletic wear making business

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es:
Alberto es chofer tiene un minibús en el sindicato san Cristóbal de la ciudad de La Paz.
Vive en la zona de Villa san Antonio; tiene dos hijos que están a su cargo y es el único que genera ingresos para la alimentación y demás gastos de su familia ya que es viudo.
El crédito será destinado para el mantenimiento de su minibús( arreglo de sillas y compra de llantas)
Es la cuarta vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, su  historial le califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimento bueno en el pago de su crédito.
texts.en:
Alberto is a minibus driver in the San Cristóbal transportation union of the city of La Paz. He lives in the Villa San Antonio district with his two dependent children. He is the family’s sole source of income for living expenses because he is a widower. The loan will be used for bus maintenance (seat upholstery and new tires). This is the fourth time he requests a loan with Impro. His credit history qualifies him as a client 1, which means he pays off his loans on time.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Seat upholstery and purchase new tires for minibus

loans.name: Fatuma Jumbe's Mabibo Freedom Group

texts.en:
Fatuma J., 51, married with 6 children aged 25, 18, 16, 14, 12 and 10, has a tailoring business which she began 15 years ago. Working from 8 a.m. to 5 p.m. daily, she is able to make a monthly profit of about $80.

She has taken out three previous loans, all since repaid, from Tujijenge Tanzania to buy vitenge (traditional Swahili fabrics) to sell at her sewing shop and now hopes for a new loan to buy an interlocking machine.

Fatuma will share this loan with her loan group, Mabibo Freedom, whose 15 members hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, Fatuma is sitting on the left in the front row.

loans.use: To buy an interlocking machine.

loans.name: Mwazani

texts.en:
Mambo (greetings) from Dar es salaam Tanzania. This is 43-year-old Mwazani M M.. She is a married woman with two children between 16 and 18 years old.

Mwazani has been running a tomato business since 2000. She buys tomatoes from farmers, brings them into town, and sells them at a higher price. Tomatoes are very common in Tanzania. Roasted tomatoes with onions can be mixed with cooked meat or fish or anything to make food more delicious. Mwazani’s business is able to make a monthly profit of about 500 USD. Now Mwazani is requesting a loan of 1300 USD in order to purchase more tomatoes. She is planning to open another business in the coming days. She thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, so they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use their equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more tomatoes for resale

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.es:
El señor Alfredo vive en casa propia con su esposa e hijos en la calle Docweiler de la zona de Tacagua de la Ciudad de La Paz; tiene por actividad la confección de chamarras las mismas que su esposa las vende por la mañana  ambulando por la calle, también trabaja con pedidos, el crédito que solicita es para aumentar su capital y comprar más insumos (tela, hilos, cuero, cierres, etc.) y de esta manera poder mantener y aumentar  su clientela y mejorar sus ingresos.

Su antecedente histórico es bueno y califica para obtener un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Mr. Alfredo M. lives in his own house with his wife and childen on Docweiler Street in the Tacagua district of the City of La Paz. He is in the business of making jackets, which his wife sells in the morning as a street vendor. His customers also place orders with him. He is requesting this loan in order to increase his capital and purchase more supplies (fabric, thread, leather, zippers, etc.), thus he will be able to both maintain and expand his clientele and boost profits. He has good credit history, which qualifies him for a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase leather, fabric, lining, thread, and other supplies for jacket production

loans.name: Islam

texts.en: Islam (his brother is pictured) has sold discs for 2 years. He was born in 1981 and is single. Islam lives in Khachmaz town. Now this young man needs a loan of 970 AZN to buy a computer and discs for improving his business.

loans.use: to buy discs and a computer

loans.name: Fidel

texts.es:
El señor Fidel vive en casa propia con su esposa e hija en la calle Moxos de la zona de Tembladerani de la Ciudad de La Paz; Fidel trabaja como sastre arreglando todo tipo de prendas y también realiza trabajos de confección tanto en trajes de mujer como de hombre, con esta actividad mantiene a su familia.

El crédito que solicita es para compra de material de trabajo (telas para forros, hilo, cierres) y de esta manera no perder clientela y por el contrario aumentarla.

Su antecedente histórico con Impro es bueno y califica para obtener un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Fidel lives in his own house with his wife and daughter on Moxos Street in the Tembladerani zone of the city of La Paz. Fidel works as a tailor altering many types of clothes, and he also makes men’s and women’s garments. With this occupation he supports his family.

The loan he is requesting is to buy raw materials (lining fabrics, thread, clasps) so that he won’t lose customers but, instead, expand his client base.

His previous history with IMPRO is good, and qualifies him to obtain new credit.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase raw materials such as thread, lining fabrics, clasps, etc., for his tailoring business.

loans.name: Franz

texts.es: Franz, de 30 años de edad, de estado civil soltero, vive independientemente en una parte del terreno de sus padres, que éstos le cedieron. Se dedica a elaborar dientes postizos, ya que estudio para ello, a su vez, dentro de su campo de trabajo atiende a personas con problemas dentales, este trabajo lo viene realizando desde hace 2 años. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es demostrar a sus pacientes y clientes su buena labor. Le es muy rentable, ya que cuenta con una clientela selecta que recurren y lo recomiendan. Lo difícil es no contar con un local adecuado. Con este ya es la séptima vez que renueva un préstamo con MFP. El dinero que ahora solicita es para mandar a construir un local adecuado para poner su laboratorio dental y así dar una mejor acogida a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Franz, 30 years old and single, lives independently on a piece of land he inherited from his parents. He dedicates himself to producing dentures, since it was his area of study, and at the same time within his field of work he also helps people with dental problems. He has been doing this work for two years. What he likes about his occupation is demonstrating his excellent abilities to his patients and customers. The enterprise is very profitable for him, given he has select customer base who provide return business and recommend him to others. The difficult part is finding an adequate location. This would be the 7th time he renews a loan with MFP. The funds he is currently seeking are to have a satisfactory locale built where he could install his dental laboratory and, as a result, be able to provide a more comfortable environment for his customers.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a location for his dental laboratory.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.es:
El señor Edwin vive en casa de sus padres con su esposa y hijos en la calle Carlos Romero de la zona de Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz , tiene un taller de mecánica en la calle Jaimes Freyre y con esta actividad el mantiene a su familia.

El crédito que solicita es para comprar un torno y de esta manera poder aumentar su clientela ofreciendo un nuevo servicio y también mejorar sus ingresos.

Su antecedente Histórico es muy bueno y califica para obtener un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Edwin lives in his parents’ house with his wife and children, on Carlos Romero Street in the Templaderani zone of the city of La Paz. He has an auto repair workshop on Jaimes Freyne Street and, with this activity, he supports his family.

The loan he is requesting is to purchase a lathe and, in this manner, be able to increase his customer base by offering a new service and also to augment his earnings.

His previous history is very good, and he qualifies to obtain a new loan.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a lathe to improve the services in his auto repair shop.

loans.name: Zokhrab

texts.en: Zokhrab lives in Khachmaz town. He was born in 1977. He is married and has 2 children. 3 years ago he started a taxi business. Now he needs a loan of 970 AZN to buy spare parts for this car for providing his clients with good service.

loans.use: to buy spare parts

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr: Yawa N. est une couturière renommée à Wome, un village du nord-ouest de Lomé, la capitale du Togo. Agée de 39 ans, Yawa est mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Passionnée par son métier, elle cherche à la promouvoir par le  crédit qu’il va bénéficier en achetant une machine  à coudre et aussi des tissus afin de vendre ces derniers à la clientèle.
texts.en:
Yawa N. est une couturière renommée à Wome, un village du nord-ouest de Lomé, la capitale du Togo. Agée de 39 ans, Yawa est mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Passionnée par son métier, elle cherche à la promouvoir par le crédit qu’il va bénéficier en achetant une machine à coudre et aussi des tissus afin de vendre ces derniers à la clientèle.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Acheter une machine à coudre et des tissus pour la revente

loans.name: Jovita

texts.es: Jovita tiene 33 años, vive junto con su pequeño hijo y con su pareja, quien siempre está de acuerdo en sus decisiones. Se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza (perfumes, colonias, cremas, entre otras variedades) de una línea cosmética muy reconocida a nivel nacional, desde hace ya 5 años atrás. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que trata con muchas personas, con quienes comparte ideas, sobre todo de su trabajo. Le es rentable porque ella es muy activa, además aprendió mucho de este trabajo, y le es fácil captar un cliente. Lo complicado es no contar con una movilidad para visitar a sus clientes de un lugar a otro. Este es su préstamo nº 7 con MFP. Jovita requiere comprarse una vitrina para mostrar sus productos de belleza y para que estén más seguros, posteriormente comprarse una moto para su movilidad.
texts.en:
Jovita is 33 years old, lives with her young son and her partner, who always agrees with her decisions. For the last 5 years she has worked selling beauty products (perfumes, colognes, creams, among other varieties) of a very recognized line on the national level. What she likes about her job is that she interacts with many people, with whom she shares ideas, mostly about her work. It is profitable because she is very active, moreover she has learned a lot from this work and it is easy for her to gain a client. The complicated part is to not have the mobility to visit her clients from one place to another. This is her seventh loan with MFP. Jovita needs to buy a glass display case to show her beauty products and so that they are more secure. Later she will buy a motorcycle for her mobility.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a glass display case to exhibit her products

loans.name: Christine

texts.fr: Christine S. est âgée de 27 ans, mariée et mère d’un enfant. Elle est revendeuse de riz au bord de la route à  Wome, un village du nord-ouest de Lomé, la capitale du Togo. Elle désire par ce crédit acheter des sacs de riz, des bidons d’huiles et autres condiments nécessaires pour la restauration du riz. Christine espère améliorer les conditions de sa vie avec cette opportunité.
texts.en:
Christine S., 27, is married and the mother of one child. She sells cooked rice along the road in Wome, a village northwest of Lomé, the capital of Togo. She wants to use this loan to buy sacks of rice, jerry-cans of oil, and the condiments necessary for preparing cooked rice for sale. Christine hopes to improve her living conditions thanks to this opportunity.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchasing sacks of rice, jerry-cans of oil, etc. to make cooked rice for sale

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Mambo (greetings) from Dar es salaam Tanzania. Diana M. is a married woman who is 27 years old. Since 2006 she has owned a photo studio. She takes picture at different functions and of individual people. She is assisted in her business by her husband and one employee.

Currently Diana is able to make a make a monthly profit of 300 USD. She is requesting a loan of 825 USD in order to purchase additional cameras and other equipment so that she can open the same business in another place. She thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, so they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use their equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional cameras and other equipment

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana tiene 49 años, es madre soltera y vive con sus dos hijos, siendo uno de ellos estudiante y el otro trabaja para apoyarla. Es propietaria de un motocarro, utilizado en el transporte de pasajeros, el mismo que maneja su hijo, labor que viene realizando desde hace 2 años, adicional y esporádicamente se dedica a vender chocolates que elabora ella misma. Su motocarro le genera buenos ingresos y también son muy cuidadosos en su mantenimiento. Le es rentable, ya que su  mototaxi solo trabaja con contratos establecidos. Ella ya ha renovado su 7mo préstamo con MFP. Con el dinero solicitado, esta vez, quiere comprar repuestos para mandar a reparar su motocarro y tenerlo en óptimas condiciones.
texts.en:
Juana is 49 years old, is a single mother and lives with her two children, one of them a student and the other works to help her. She is the owner of a motor-taxi, using it in the transport of passengers and it is driven by her son, work which he has been doing for the past 2 years. In addition, she sporadically works selling chocolates that she makes herself. Her motor-taxi generates good income and they are also very careful in its maintenance. It is profitable as her motor-taxi only works with established contracts. She has already renewed her seventh loan with MFP. With the money requested this time she wants to buy parts to get her motor-taxi repaired and have it in optimal condition.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy parts to repair her motor-taxi

loans.name: Tetyana

texts.en:
Tetyana is married with a 4-year-old daughter. She is from Ivano-Frankivsk, Western Ukraine. Tetyana owns a vending kiosk in the central city marketplace of Ivano-Frankivsk and sells children’s toys. Her business is well-known for affordable prices and a good selection of merchandise. Tetyana has been in trade for 10 months. Presently, she has about 4,000 Grivnas of income a month.   

Tetyana is always on the run. She combines entrepreneurial activity with household chores and family. Tetyana loves owning her business and is hoping to gain more experience in her entrepreneurial endeavors. She is requesting a loan of 6,000 Grivnas to purchase assorted plastic toys for further retail sales. Tetyana is hoping to invest generated profits in the purchase of two more vending facilities.

loans.use: To open a third vending facility and increase the assortment of plastic toys

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
Mario es estudiante de Odontología y esta realizando practicas, por lo cual se decidió abrir un pequeño consultorio dental para que pueda realizar mecánica dental y curaciones y extracciones a los vecinos de la zona de Llojeta-tiwiña y familiares que lo conozcan ya que no cuenta con todo el equipo completo para realizar su actividad.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de un sillón dental; esto le ayudará de gran manera ya que mejorará las condiciones de atención a sus clientes, podrá abarcar a mas clientes y mejoraran sus ingresos.
Es la segunda vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, y la segunda vez que requiere el apoyo de kiva. Su historial lo califica como cliente responsable en el pago de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Mario is a dentistry student who is in his training period and as such, has decided to open a small dental surgery where he can carry out dental procedures, treatments and extractions. He plans to do this for his neighbors in the Llojeta-tiwiña area and his family members who know him well as he doesn't count on having the full equipment for his activities.

He is asking for the loan to purchase a dentist's chair; this will be a great help as it will improve the conditions he offers his clients, enabling him to cope with more clients and improve his revenue.

This is the second time he requests a loan from Impro and the second time he asks for Kiva's help. His loan history qualifies him as a responsible customer who pays his installments.


Translated from Spanish by Ines Teles, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a reclining dentist's chair for his dental surgery

loans.name: Kafui

texts.fr: Kafui T. est propriétaire d’une boutique d’alimentation générale de puis 2 ans. Agée de 26 ans, elle est mariée et mère d’un petit garçon. Elle souhaite redynamiser son activité en s’approvisionnant en marchandises qui lui permettra d’accroître son chiffre d’affaires et par là, ses profits et par conséquent une amélioration des conditions de vie de la famille.
texts.en:
Kafui T., 26, has been the owner of a general store for 2 years. She is married and the mother of a little boy. She is hoping to reinvigorate her business by buying merchandise for re-sale that will help her to increase her turnover and thus, her profit, so that she can improve living conditions for her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of merchandise for re-sale

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania. This is Asha Y. K.. She  is a married woman with two children and one more dependent for whom she is responsible because he is schooling in the area. Asha has been running a cosmetics business since March 2008. Her business is doing well and her currently monthly profit is US$ 180.

 Asha is now requesting  a loan of US$ 425 in order to purchase additional cosmetics for her inventory. She is assisted by her brother in running this business. They work 7 days per week and 10 hours per day. She thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. 

Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. 

One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of cosmetics

loans.name: Lily

texts.es: Lily tiene 26 años, es madre soltera, vive con su hija, quien está estudiando y es su razón de salir adelante. Ella es propietaria de un motocarro, el mismo que lo hace trabajar con un chofer particular desde hace un año, muy aparte trabaja como recepcionista en una institución privada. Se siente contenta porque su chofer mantiene bien cuidada su herramienta de trabajo, su moto, y es muy rentable porque dentro de la zona, para trasladarse a sus trabajos las personas recurren en su mayoría a un mototaxi. Lo difícil es no contar con un lugar apropiado para guardar su vehículo. Esta es la primera vez que solicita un préstamo a MFP. Con este dinero quiere mandar a construir un pequeño garaje al costado de su casa, así como también mandar a refaccionar su motocarro para que trabaje en óptimas condiciones.
texts.en:
Lily is 26 years old, is single, and lives with her daughter, who is studying and is her reason for going forward. She owns a motor car, which she has used to work with a particular driver for a year. Apart from this, she works as a receptionist in a private institution. She is glad that her driver maintains the motor car well. This is very profitable because inside the area, people use the motor car a lot to travel to their jobs. The difficult thing is not having an appropriate place to keep her vehicle. This is the first time that she has requested a loan from MFP. With this money, she wants to build a small garage next to her house. She would also like to restore her motor car so that it can work at an optimal level.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Constuction of a garage to park her vehicle

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Mambo (greetings) from Dar es salaam Tanzania.

Ruth P M. is 29 years old and married with one child. She has two businesses: clothing and and soft drinks. She started these businesses in 2008, and they produce a monthly profit of 100 USD. She is requesting a loan of 650 USD in order to purchase additional clothes and soft drinks. She thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, so they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use their equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional clothes and soft drinks

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Sonia trabaja como empleada domestica es casada y tiene dos hijos.
Es la segunda hija por lo cual se hizo cargo de su madre que estaba muy enferma y ahora en etapa de recuperación.
Por los bajos ingresos que tiene recurrió a Impro ya que necesita varios medicamentos para la recuperación completa de su madre.
Es la segunda vez que solicita un crédito y su historial la califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de su crédito.
Vive en la zona de Pasankeri de la ciudad de La paz.
texts.en:
Sonia works as a maid and is married with two children. She is the second child herself so she must look after her mother who has been very ill and is now recovering.

As her income has been low, she has turned to Impro as she needs various medicines for her mother to make a full recovery. This is the second time she has asked for a loan and her credit history qualifies her as a good client who pays her loan installments.

She lives in the Pasankeri area of the city of La Paz.


Translated from Spanish by Ines Teles, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of medicine for her mother's recovery from illness

loans.name: Yawovi

texts.fr: Yawovi S. est un meunier résidant à Wome, à environ 130 kilomètres de la capitale togolaise. Marié et père de 3 enfants, Yawovi est âgé de 35 ans. ayant servi son employeur durant plus de 5 ans, et maîtrisant tous les rouages du métier, il décide d’acquérir son propre moulin afin de gagner plus d’argent pour mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Yawovi S. is a miller residing in Womé, located about 130 km from the Togolese capital. He is 35 years old, married, and the father of three. Having served his employer for over five years, and mastering all the ins and outs of his work, he decided to acquire his own mill to earn more money to provide for his family better.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a milling machine

loans.name: Volodimir

texts.en:
Volodimir offers transportation services in Ivano-Frankivsk where he is originally from. He started his business about 5 years ago after he quit working as a driver in the State Protection Service. This enterprise has been an effective source of income for his family of four. Currently, his daily income is about 200-250 Grivnas. 

Volodimir works many hours a day to provide decent living for his family. This time he’s faced with a need to do some repair work on his vehicle and buy car insurance. He is requesting a 2,500 Grivna loan to fix the body of his car and give it a fresher, nicer look. 

Volodimir has many challenges in his work. However, he doesn’t want to go back to being a hired employee, preferring to work for himself. He is hopeful that with hard work, determination, and financial assistance his business will continue to be successful and provide him and his family with stable, long-term income. One of his long-term plans is to sell his lot of land, buy a second vehicle, hire a taxi driver and expand his business as a result.

loans.use: To purchase insurance and cover car maintenance costs

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mambo (greetings) from Dar es salaam Tanzania.

Mariam A K. is a Tanzanian woman and SELFINA client. She is 27 years old and single. She has a store where she sell clothes, shoes, and bags. Currently her business produces a monthly profit of 200 USD. Mariam is requesting a loan of 425 USD in order to buy additional stocks of clothes, shoes, and bags. In the future she plans to open a new business. She thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, so they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use their equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy additional stocks of clothes, shoes, and bags.

loans.name: Luzmila

texts.es: Luzmila a sus 43 años de edad es viuda, vive con dos sus hijos que son estudiantes. Se dedica a confeccionar ropa para adultos y niños en los distintos géneros, mayormente trabaja para dos instituciones Educativas que se encuentran ubicadas cerca de su casa, y requieren de su servicios constantemente, esta actividad la viene llevando desde hace 6 años atrás. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que sus clientes son fieles, gracias a su buena labor, y sobre todo le encanta darles el mejor de los tratos para que se sientan en familia. Le es muy rentable ya que le produce ingresos que fortalecen su nivel económico y el de su familia. Le  va muy bien.  Ella es una mujer responsable en sus pagos, este es ya su préstamo nº 7. Luzmila desea mandar a construir un taller textil más amplio, donde podrá exhibir  su trabajo elaborado para el público en general.
texts.en:
Luzmila is 43 years old, is a widow, and lives with her two children, who are students. She makes different types of clothes for adults and children. For the most part, she works for two educational institutions that are located near her house. These institutions constantly require her services. She has been pursuing this activity for 6 years. What she likes about her work is that her clients are faithful, thanks to her good work, and, above all, she loves to give them the best deals so that they feel like they are among family. This is very profitable since it yields income that strengthens her economic standing and that of her family; it is going very well. She is a responsible woman with respect to her payments. This is her seventh loan. Luzmila wants to build a bigger textile workshop, where she will be able to display her elaborate work for the public.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a textile workshop

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Afi A. est une revendeuse des agrumes et légumes au marché de Wome, un village situé au nord-ouest de Lomé, la capitale du Togo. Elle est âgée de 33 ans, mariée et mère 3 enfants. Pour accroître le capacité de son commerce, Afi désire par ce crédit diversifier ses fournisseurs afin d’augmenter sa marge commerciale, ce qui lui permettra de gagner plus d’argent pour répondre aux besoins de ses enfants. Dans la photo, Afi est celle situé du côté gauche
texts.en:
Afi A. is a retailer of citrus fruit and vegetables at the marketplace of Wome, a village located northwest of Lomé, the capital of Togo. She is 33 years old, married, and the mother of three. To expand her commerce, Afi would like to use this loan to diversify her suppliers in order to increase her profit margin. This will enable her to earn more money to meet the needs of her children. In the photo, Afi is the one on the left.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruit and vegetables to resell

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Maria, de 57 años de edad, vive con su conviviente y su hija que es madre soltera. Maria se dedica al arte textil desde hace 2 años, por su buena labor, cuenta con una clientela selecta que valoran muy bien su trabajo. Lo que le gusta de su actividad diaria es confeccionar nuevos modelos y desde luego dar un buen trato a sus  clientes, quienes son primero en su negocio. Le es rentable, ya que ella fabrica ropa para llevar a venderla, así como también hay instituciones que requieren de su buena labor textil y le hacen pedidos. En su negocio le va muy bien no muestra dificultad alguna. Es su préstamo nº 7 en MFPrisma. Con el dinero que solicita quiere alquilar un local para poner su tienda de ropa, y desde luego implementarse con más materiales (telas, agujas, blondas, botones etc.
texts.en:
Maria is 57 years old and lives with her partner and daughter, who is a single mother. Maria has worked with textiles for 2 years. Because of her good work, she counts on a select clientele that values her work. She likes making new models and giving her clients, who are her first priority, a good deal. The business is profitable because she makes clothes to sell. In addition, there are institutions that require her good textile work, and they make orders for her work. Her business is going well and doesn’t have any difficulties. This is her seventh loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. With the money that she is requesting, she wants to rent a location so that she can have a clothing store. After a while, she wants to stock it with more materials, like fabric, needles, lace trim, buttons, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To rent a location to sell clothes

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan S. is a Tanzanian woman and SELFINA client who is 36 years old. She is divorced with two children aged 11 and 15.

Since 2006, Joan has been buying crops from farmers to sell in town at higher prices. She is currently making a monthly profit of 300 USD. Joan is requesting a loan of 825 USD in order to purchase additional stocks of crops, such as maize, rice, beans, and ground nuts. In the future she plans to increase the quantity and range of her stock. She thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, so they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use their equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of crops such as maize, rice, beans, and ground nuts.

loans.name: Ganna

texts.en:
Ganna manages to successfully run her own fruit and vegetable sales business in downtown Korolyovo. She started her business 7 years ago. One of the main secrets of her success is its favorable location in a busy neighborhood. Many customers attend regularly and become loyal clients. Ganna loves her work. She manages all her finances herself. Currently, she has about 15,000 Grivnas invested in her business. Her monthly net profit is about 5,000 Grivnas.

Ganna is planning to purchase additional merchandise that would increase her sales and help her earn more. That is why she is requesting a loan of 5,000 Grivnas. With the additional profits, Ganna plans to continue developing her business, providing stable and consistent income for her family.

loans.use: To increase the assortment and inventory

loans.name: Mirzaga

texts.en: Mirzaga (his wife is pictured) lives in the Khachmaz region in Gobu Giragi village. He was born in 1968. He has 2 children. Mirzaga and his wife have been in the farming business for 8 years. Now they need a loan of 970 AZN for fertilizer and seedlings for improving their farming business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seedlings

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
Hilda es socia del Banco Comunal Poder.
Hilda es conviviente, tiene 26 años y 1 hijo, Hilda tiene una mototaxi con el cual realiza transporte urbano para lo cual tiene un chofer, además Hilda tiene terrenos en la selva ayacuchana en donde cultiva café, cacao, la época de mayor cosecha es abril y mayo, sus productos los vende en el mismo lugar.
Hilda necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la reparación de su mototaxi.
Hilda sueña con construir su casa, comprar un carro para realizar transporte publico.
texts.en:
Hilda is a member of the Poder (Power) Community Bank. She lives with her partner, is 26 years old, and has one son. Hilda has a motorcycle taxi with which is used for transportation in the city; a driver operates it. In addition, Hilda has land in the Ayacuchana Jungle, where she grows coffee and cocoa. The time for the best harvest is April and May. She sells her products in the same place. Hilda needs a loan of 2000 soles, which will be invested in the repairs of her motorcycle taxi. Hilda dreams of building a house and buying a car for public transport.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repaird her motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Yuster

texts.en:
Mambo (greetings) from Dar es salaam Tanzania. Yuster R Mwakanyemba is a married woman with three children between the ages of 13 and 19. Yuster is 35 years old. She started a charcoal business 5 months ago. Charcoal is produced by burning wood under limited air. It is commonly used as a fuel for cooking food in Tanzania because it is cheap to buy.

Yuster’s business is making a monthly profit of 100 USD. She is requesting a loan of 825 USD in order to purchase additional stocks of charcoal. In the future she plans to open another business. She thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, so they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use their equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of charcoal

loans.name: Cassien

texts.en:
Cassien N. sends his greetings from Musanze, Ruhengeri, the northern province of Rwanda! He is 49 years old, married with 9 children.

This entrepreneur sells various items in local markets such as cooking pots, cassava flour, sandals, and clothes for young children, household utensils, foodstuffs, etc. Besides this business, this client owns various plots of land and grows potatoes, beans, and sorghum both for home consumption and for sale to increase his income. He employs 2 people to help him in the business.
