He is applying for a loan worth 515,000 Frws to increase his inventory. He will be repaying this loan over 7 months.

loans.use: expand his inventory

loans.name: Mary

texts.es: Mary tiene 28 años, es madre soltera y tiene una pequeña hija que está estudiando,  vive en la casa de su madre, también con su hermana menor. Se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad, complementado con golosinas y bebidas desde hace 5 años atrás, dentro de su casa. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es dar un buen trato a sus clientes y ver crecer día a día su negocio. Le es muy rentable porque se encuentra ubicada en una zona muy transitable y concurrente. Lo difícil para ella son los robos mínimos y constates que tiene por personas desconsideradas, que ingresan a su negocio y cuando ella no lo nota, toman productos a escondidas. Este es el septimo préstamo con MFP. Con el dinero que solicita quiere mandar a construir rejas de protección para su negocio, como también quiere implementarse de más productos y posteriormente llegar a tener un minimarket.
texts.en:
Mary is 28 years old, is a single mother, and has a young daughter who is studying. She lives in her mother’s house with her younger sister. She has sold essential products, in addition to sweets and drinks, for 5 years inside her house. She likes being able to give a good deal to her clients and to see her business grow day to day. The business is very profitable because it is located in a busy area. The difficult thing for her is that there are often small robberies by inconsiderate people. They enter her business, and, when she’s not looking, they take products in secret. This is her seventh loan with MFP. With the money that she is requesting, she wants to build bars to protect her business. She also wants to supply more products to her business and, later, to have a mini-market.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her merchandise and to build bars for protection

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
La señora Maria Elena vive en Anticrético con su esposo e hija en la calle Ramos Gavilán de la Zona de Achachicala de la ciudad de La Paz, el esposo trabaja como chofer de transporte publico; la actividad de ella es la venta de electrodomésticos, frazadas, y artefactos eléctricos los cuales entrega al crédito ganando un porcentaje.
El crédito que solicita es para aumentar su capital, comprar más mercadería y de esta manera estabilizar su negocio y mejorar sus ingresos.

Su antecedente con Impro es bueno y califica para obtener un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Elena lives in Anticrético with her husband and daughter on Ramos Gavilán Street in the Achachicala area of the city of La Paz. Her husband works as a driver in public transport and Maria Elena sells white goods, blankets and electrical items on credit, earning interest from her customers.

The loan she requests is to increase her capital in order to buy more merchandise so she can establish her business and improve her income. Her credit history with Impro is good and qualifies her for a new loan.


Translated from Spanish by Ines Teles, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing more merchandise to increase her business, selling electrical items

loans.name: Merly

texts.es: Merly, de 30 años, vive con su pareja y su pequeño hijo quien cursa estudios primarios. Se dedica a vender comida a los trabajadores de una empresa ladrillera desde hace 7 años, ganándose la confianza de todos ellos, quienes degustan de su buena sazón. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es dar a sus clientes lo mejor, para que se sientan satisfechos y desde luego preparar variedad de platos. Este negocio le es rentable, ya que es ella sola que vende dentro de esta empresa, que le dio la oportunidad de trabajar para ellos. Le va muy bien. Está en su 7mo préstamo de MFP. Lo que desea hacer con el dinero que pide es comprar mesas, sillas y otras cosas indispensables para implementar su pequeño restaurante y dar mayor comodidad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Merly is 30 years old and lives with her partner and their young son, who is in primary school. She has sold food to workers from a kiln company for 7 years and, over time, has won their confidence because of the good taste of her food. She likes giving her clients the best food, so that they feel satisfied. She also enjoys making a variety of dishes. This business is profitable, because she is the only one that sells food inside this company, which gives her the opportunity to work for them. It is going very well. This is her seventh loan from MFP. With the money that she is requesting, Merly will buy tables, chairs and other necessary items to stock her small restaurant and make her clients more comfortable.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tables, chairs, and other items for her restaurant

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Mambo (hello!) from Dar Es Salaam, Tanzania. This is Betty P. L.. She is 25 years old. She is a Tanzanian woman and a SELFINA client. She has run a tailoring business since 2007. Her business is to make and sell cloth. She is able to make a monthly profit of $300 USD. 

She requesting a  loan of $825 USD in order to buy additional cloth and sewing machines. In the future, she plans to expand her business. She thanks for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy additional cloth and sewing machines.

loans.name: Nora

texts.es: Nora, de 40 años de edad, vive con sus 2 hijos que estudian y su esposo quien la apoya incondicionalmente. Ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad desde hace un año atrás. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es dar una buena atención a sus clientes, ya que ellos son el factor principal de su negocio. Esta bodega le es rentable porque es la única persona  en  su zona que vende estos productos. Lo difícil para ella, son los cambios climatológicos que afectan su negocio cuando llueve fuertemente, pues no tiene venta. Este es su préstamo nº 7. Con el dinero quiere acondicionar mejor el espacio de su tienda, para así ampliar su negocio y dar una mejor acogida a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Nora is 40 years old and lives with her two children who study and her husband who supports her unconditionally. She has sold groceries and basic goods for a year. What she likes about her job is giving good care to her customers, since they are the main factor of her business. The winery is profitable because she is the only person in her neighborhood who sells these products. The difficult part for her is that climate changes affect her business when it rains heavily, and then she does not have sales. This is her seventh loan. With the money, she wants to acquire a better retail space to improve her business and provide better service to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To grow and improve the location of her wine business

loans.name: Khuraman

texts.en: Khuraman is a mother of 2 children. She lives in Khachmaz town. Khuraman has raised sheep for 10 years. She is 46 years old. Now she needs a loan of 970 AZN to buy 2 calves and fodder.

loans.use: to buy 2 calves and fodder

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is divorced and lives with her daughter and aunt. She sells women's clothing at the central market in Simferopol. Since she is self-employed and doesn't have to pay hired salespeople, she can keep low prices and attract many customers.  

Elena has been in this business for four years. She is a hard-working person. She leaves her workplace at 5 p.m., while her competitors usually leave at 3 p.m., and she knows it gives her a great advantage in business. Elena was able to increase her monthly gross income to 25,000 UAH.

Elena is requesting a loan of 3,000 UAH in order to increase the variety of goods during seasonal changes. She believes that having more goods at this time can bring her additional income that she needs for medical treatment for her aunt.

Note: this is a short-term seasonal loan that will be repaid in a month.

loans.use: To purchase more goods for selling

loans.name: Muslima

texts.en:
Mambo (greetings) from Dar es salaam Tanzania. This is Muslima S., a married woman with one child. She is a Tanzanian entrepreneur who runs a cosmetics business, selling lotions, perfumes, girls handbags, etc. Her husband helps her to run this business.

Muslima is able to make a monthly profit of 200 USD. She is requesting a loan of 625 USD in order to purchase additional stocks of lotions, perfumes, and handbags. In the future she plans to increase the quantity and range of the stock. She thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, so they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use their equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of lotions, perfumes, and handbags

loans.name: Ananias

texts.en:
Greetings from Ananias K. in Gikongoro, the southern province of Rwanda! Ananias is 44 years old, married with 5 children and 1 adopted children from the Genocide of 1994.

Ananias and his wife have been running their restaurant business for a number of years. This family gets up very early at 5 am, goes to the local market to buy foods like potatoes, carrots, beans, beef, onions, and tomatoes to prepare meals for the customers. They sell the food to the local residents who work in this small town. They employ 3 people in the business who help them to cook and serve food to the customers.

Besides owning a restaurant, Ananias sells stones for concrete for building houses, which earns him about US$ 110 per month. Ananias has been able to buy a plot of land in Gikongoro town and he hopes to build a commercial building to rent out on this plot. He is looking for a loan worth 400,000 Frws to buy more equipment for the restaurant: tables, spoons, plates, and cooking pots to meet the demand of his growing clientele. This loan will be repaid over 7 months.

loans.use: To buy more equipment for his little restaurant

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana is divorced and lives with her son and daughter-in-law. She owns a small booth at the central market in Simferopol and sells women’s clothes and warm jackets. She used to work as a salesperson at a store. However, she decided that it was time to start one of her own.

Tatyana has had this business for 2 years. She dreams about developing her business, hoping to become independent and be able to pay for her apartment. She has about 12,000 UAH of working capital in business, and her monthly profit is about 3,000 UAH. Along with this business she works part-time as a manager in a small store.

Tatyana would like to get a loan for 5,000 UAH to buy more goods for her business. She believes that additional income would help her develop her business to the point she would be able to pay her mortgage completely.

loans.use: To increase the assortment and inventory

loans.name: Dolibeth

texts.es:
La señora Dolibeth, socia del BC Mujeres Activas, vive en la Región San Martín, provincia y distrito de Bellavista. Tiene 31 años de edad,  es madre de 2 niños quienes son la razón de lucha constante porque ella los cría sola. 

En la actualidad se dedica a la venta de refrigerios y bebidas gasificadas en el puerto de la ciudad. Está aprovechando la construcción del puente por la cantidad de personas que trabajan en dicha obra para incrementar sus ventas.  Empezó vendiendo sólo golosinas. Tiene 3 años trabajando con el banco comunal y eso le permitió crecer en su negocio.  

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,700, el cual será cancelado en  6 meses, comprará arroz y azúcar en saco, aceite en galón, harina para keres y gaseosas de diferentes tamaños y sabores, sobretodo lo que mayor salida tiene entre sus clientes, también quiere comprar una refrigeradora para preparar chupetes y congelar sus gaseosas.  

Dolibeth es una mujer emprendedora quien está agradecida de Manuela Ramos por la confianza que le dio al brindarle un préstamo, el cual ayudó a crecer en su negocio. Más adelante desea contar con un local para atender mejor a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Dolibeth, a member of the communal bank “Mujeres Activas” (“Active Women”), lives in the San Martín region of the Bellavista province. She is 31 years old and the mother of two children, who are the reason that she struggles constantly as she is raising them on her own.

Currently, she dedicates herself to selling perishables and sodas at the city’s port. She is taking advantage of the construction of a bridge which has brought a number of people to work on this project, and this has allowed her to increase her sales. She started selling only sweets/snacks. She has been working with the communal bank for three years, and this has allowed her to grow her business.

With the loan of 1,700.00 soles, to be canceled in six months, she will buy sacks of rice and sugar, cooking oil by the gallon, flour, and different sizes and flavors of sodas. Most of all, she would like to buy a refrigerator so she can make popsicles and cool her soft drinks.

Dolibeth is a very enterprising woman, who is thankful to Manuela Ramos for the confidence they showed in providing her with a loan that helped her to grow her enterprise. In the future, she would like to have her own location so she can tend to her customers more efficiently.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase sacks of rice and sugar, cooking oil by the gallon, flour, different sizes of sodas, etc.

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Luz is a member of the Poder ("Power") Communal Bank. She is 32 years old and married with two children. Luz and her husband own a store, where they offer printing and photocopying services. The business is located one block from Ayacucho's main plaza. Luz also has a degree in Accounting, and provides accounting services to various businesses.

Luz needs a loan of 3000 soles to buy paper and ink. Her dreams are to build her own home, to open branches in other provinces and to improve her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva volunteer

Luz es socia del Banco Comunal Poder.

Luz es conviviente, tiene 32 años y 2 hijos, Luz tiene una tienda en donde brinda servicios de impresión de planos, fotocopias, su local es alquilado y esta ubicado a 1 cuadra de la plaza principal de la ciudad de Ayacucho, actividad que realiza con su esposo. Además Luz es de profesión contadora y brinda asesoría contable a diferentes empresas.

Luz necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de papel y tintas. Los sueños de Luz son construir su casa, tener sucursales en diferentes provincias y mejorar su calidad de vida.

loans.use: Buy paper and ink for print shop

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es:
La señora Raquel, socia del BC El Abiseo, vive en la Región San Martín, provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, distrito de Juanjui. Tiene 39 años de edad, está separada de su esposo y vive con sus 5 hijos que aún dependen de ella y son la razón para su lucha constante porque ella es quien vela por ellos . 

Se dedica a la venta de pollos y gallinas eviscerados en su puesto de venta en el mercado central de la ciudad. Sus clientes son las señoras que venden comida y los restaurantes de la zona. Tiene 3 años trabajando con el banco comunal y ello le ha permitido crecer en su negocio.  

Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000, el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, comprará pollos y gallinas en gran cantidad para luego sacrificarlos y venderlos en el mercado y repartirlos a sus clientes que le solicitan diariamente. 

Raquel manifiesta que Manuela Ramos es un apoyo para ella y para su familia, así como para las demás mujeres trabajadoras. Trabaja duro cada día porque quiere poner otro negocio de venta de ropa y zapatos y sobre todo quiere ver profesionales a sus hijos.

El desembolso de su préstamo fue el  20/10/08
La tasa de interés  de su préstamo es del 3.5%
El monto de su cuota mensual es de S/. 605.00
texts.en:
Raquel, a member of BC El Abiseo, lives in the San Martin region, Mariscal Cáceres province, district Juanjuí. She is 39 years old, separated from her husband, and lives with her five children who still depend on her and are the reason for her constant struggle because she is their caretaker. She sells chickens and gutted chickens in the central market of the city. Her customers are the women who sell food and restaurants in the neighborhood. She has three years experience working in the community bank, and this has enabled her to grow her business. With this loan of S /. 3000, which will be paid in 6 months, she will buy chickens in large quantities to later slaughter and sell them on the market and distribute to her customers who ask for them on a daily basis. Raquel declares that Manuela Ramos is a support for her and her family, as well as for other working women. She works hard every day because she wants to start another business selling clothes and shoes, and she especially wants to see her children as professionals. The loan disbursement was on 20/10/08 The interest rate on the loans is 3.5% The amount of the monthly fee is S /. 605.00

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase chickens in large quantities

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es: Yolanda tiene 33 años, vive junto a su esposo, de esta unión, tienen 4 hijos muy educados y respetuosos. En horas de la mañana prepara los alimentos para toda su familia, después, a eso de la 10.00 am ya está lista para partir a la chacra con el almuerzo de su esposo. Con esta rutina lleva 5 años, para la educación de sus hijos. Su esposo y ella han sembrado hectárea de café y en menor cantidad, frutos cítricos, ellos siembran estos productos porque con ellos no pierden, siempre recuperan lo que invierten. Pero en estos momentos están pasando momentos muy difíciles porque su esposo está enfermo, tiene cáncer en primer grado, Yolanda tiene la esperanza de que se va a recuperar con los tratamientos de quimioterapia. Esta es la primera vez que solicita un préstamo con MFP. El dinero que solicita Yolanda invertirá para incrementar su producción agrícola y así poder solventar los gastos del tratamiento de su esposo.
texts.en:
Yolanda is 33 years old and lives with her husband; from this marriage, she has four children who are very well-mannered and respectful. In early morning hours, she prepares food for the entire family. Later, at about 10:00 a.m., she is ready to leave the ranch with her husband's lunch. She has performed this routine for five years for the education of their children. She and her husband have planted a hectare of coffee and a lesser amount of citrus fruits. They plant these products because they do not lose and only recover what they invest. But at the moment, they are going through difficult times because her husband is sick with cancer in the early stages. Yolanda’s hope is that he will recover through chemotherapy treatments. This is her first time applying for a loan with MFP. Yolanda asks for the money to increase her agricultural production in order to cover the costs of treating her husband.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her agricultural production

loans.name: Francois

texts.en:
Greetings from Francis N. from the southern province of Rwanda! He is 31 years old, married with 3 children and 2 adopted orphans of the 1994 Genocide.

He has been in the business of selling of timber and charcoal since 2003. He owns a charcoal store in Nyamabage town where he sells charcoal to various local restaurants. He employs 3 people to help him run the business. Besides this business, he also grows green peas, sorghum, and beans that he later sells in local markets to increase his income.

He is requesting a loan worth 200,000 Frws to buy more bags of charcoal for his business. This loan will be repaid over 8 months.

loans.use: To increase his stock of charcoal

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana is a member of the Poder ("Power") Communal Bank. She is 29 years old and married with two children. She owns a centrally-located store in the city of Ayacucho where she sells office supplies and offers photocopying services to individuals and institutions. She rents the space and works alongside her husband.

Juana needs a loan of 1000 soles to buy CDs, DVDs, and tapes. She dreams of building her own home and of expanding her business.

Translated by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva volunteer

Juana es socia del Banco Comunal Poder.

Juana es conviviente, tiene 29 años y 2 hijos, Juana tiene una tienda en una calle céntrica de la ciudad de Ayacucho, local que es alquilado en donde vende artículos de librería, servicios de fotocopiado, también vende a instituciones, actividad que realiza junto a su esposo.

Juana necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cds, dvds, cintas. Juana sueña con construir su casa, ampliar su negocio.

loans.use: Buy CDs, DVDs and tapes

loans.name: Kodzo

texts.fr: Kodzo M. est conducteur de taxi. Agé de 42 ans, Kodzo est marié et père de 3 enfants. Il aimerait par ce crédit réparer sa voiture afin de pouvoir relancer son activité ; étant donné que le moteur de sa voiture est usée, ce qui lui cause éventuellement d’énormes charges. Avec cette chance, Kodzo espère mieux travailler pour gagner plus afin de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille
texts.en:
Kodzo M. is a taxi-driver. Aged 42, Kodzo is married and the father of 3 children. He would like to use this loan to repair his taxi so that he can get back to business. Since the motor of his taxi is well worn, it may cause him to have huge charges. With this opportunity, Kodzo hopes to be able to work better so as to earn more and support his family appropriately.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: repair his car (used as a taxi)

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es:
La señora Rocio, socia del BC Mujeres Activas, vive en la Región San Martín, provincia y distrito de Bellavista. Tiene 30 años de edad y vive con su esposo quien trabaja como chofer y sus 2 hijas que están estudiando y aún dependen de ella. 

Se dedica a la venta de pescado seco de diferentes variedades en el puesto de venta que tiene en el mercado central de la ciudad. Ya tiene 3 años trabajando con el banco comunal y está contenta con el apoyo brindado.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,700, el cual será cancelado en  6 meses, comprará pescado de diferentes variedades y tamaños para poder variar sus precios y  asegurar sus ventas y así poder pagar bien el préstamo.

Rocio manifiesta que Manuela Ramos es un apoyo para ella y para su familia, así como para las demás mujeres emprendedoras. Trabaja duro cada día por que quiere crecer en su negocio y más adelante desea tener un almacén y distribuir también a los caseríos.
texts.en:
Señora Rocio, a member of BC Mujeres Activas, lives in the San Martín region, Bellavista province and district. She is 30 years old and lives with her husband, who works as a driver, and their 2 daughters, who are studying and still depend on her. She sells dried fish of different varieties in the central market in the city. She has already had three years working with the community bank and is happy with the support they bring. With this loan of $550, which will be paid in 6 months, she will buy fish of different varieties and sizes to be able to vary her prices and ensure sales so that she can repay the loan. Rocio says that Manuela Ramos is a support for her and her family, as well as for other women entrepreneurs. She works hard every day because she wants to grow her business and later wishes to have a store with distribution in the villages.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fish of different varieties and sizes

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es:
La señora Sandra, socia del BC Mujeres Activas,  vive en la Región San Martín, provincia y distrito D. Bellavista. Tiene 37 años D. edad, vive con su esposo  que es chofer. Se dedica a la venta D. pollo y gallinas evisceradas así como  a la venta D. verduras en los 2 puestos D. venta que tiene en el mercado D. la ciudad.  

Con este préstamo D. S/. 2,000, el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, comprará verduras como cebollas, zapallos, zanahoria, tomates, papa, entre otros, también comprará pollos y gallinas para sacrificar y venderlos al menudeo. Quiere contar con todo lo que requieran sus clientes. 

Sandra tiene 5 años trabajando con el banco comunal y cree que Manuela Ramos es un apoyo para ella y para su familia, así como para las demás mujeres emprendedoras. Trabaja duro cada día porque quiere crecer en su negocio y contar con una bodega bien implementada más adelante.
texts.en:
Mrs. Sandra, a member of the BC Mujeres Activas, lives in the San Martín region, Bellavista province and district. She is 37 years old and lives with her husband who is a driver. She sells chickens and hens with their organs removed as well as vegetables in two stalls that are in the central market in the city. With this loan of 2,000 soles ($650), which will be repaid in 6 months, she will buy vegetables such as onions, squash, carrots, tomatoes, potatoes, among others, and also chickens and hens in order to slaughter and sell them in the market. She wants to have all that her customers need. Sandra has 5 years working with the communal bank and believes that Manuela Ramos is a support for her and her family, as well as for other women entrepreneurs. She works hard every day because she wants to grow her business and later have a well-established storeroom.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase vegetables such as onions, squash, carrots, tomatoes and chickens and hens

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Greetings from Daniel R. in Nyamagabe District in the southern province of Rwanda! Daniel is 33 years and married with 2 children.

Since 2001, Daniel owns a shop selling various items such as maize flour, cassava flour, beans, clothes, household utensils, plastic cups, basins, plastic sandals, candles, matches, etc. Besides the shop, he grows coffee, beans, sorghum, and potatoes. He employs 5 people in his business. He has been able to buy three young cows and a piece of land with a forest planted on it for future timber sale. This entrepreneur is looking for a loan worth 200,000 Frws to buy more stock for his shop. He will be repaying this loan over 8 months.

loans.use: To Increase his inventory

loans.name: Justina

texts.en:
Justina is a member of the Poder ("Power") Communal Bank.

Justina is 57 years old. She is separated and has four children. Justina travels to regional markets to sell vegetables and fruits, where she also buys cheese, meat, and trout to resell from a mobile cart in the city of Ayacucho. She also travels to other fairs to sell cheese and meat and buy grains to resell in the city of Ayacucho.

Justina needs a loan of 1000 soles (US$325) to buy wheat, cheese and meat.

Justina dreams of having a stable business in a fixed location that she herself owns, and of having her own capital to invest in her business.

Translated by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva volunteer

Justina es socia del Banco Comunal Poder. Justina es separada, tiene 57 años y 4 hijos, Justina viaja a las ferias D. la región en donD. venD. verduras, frutas y D. las ferias compra quesos, trucha carne, productos que venD. D. manera ambulatoria en el mercado D. abastos D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho, también viaja a otras ferias a donD. lleva quesos, carnes y D. las ferias compra cereales que venD. en la ciudad D. Ayacucho. Justina necesita un préstamo D. 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. trigo, queso y carne. Justina sueña con tener un negocio estable, con local propio y capital propio.

loans.use: Buy wheat, cheese and meat

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana is a member of the Poder ("Power") Communal Bank. She is 48 years old and married with 8 children. Juana and her daughter travel to the Churcampa market every week to sell articles like paints, medicines, and dyes for wool. She also has a mobile cart, from which she sells medicinal herbs on a street adjacent to the market.

Juana needs a loan of 600 soles to buy different colors of dye.

Juana dreams that her children will grow up to work as professionals, of having her own investment capital, and of offering a wider variety of merchandise.

Translated by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva volunteer

Juana es socia del Banco Comunal Poder. Juana es casada, tiene 48 años y 8 hijos, Juana viaja a la feria de Churcampa todas las semanas en donde vende artículos de mercería como pinturas, remedios, anilina (tinte) que es utilizado para teñir las lanas, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de su hija. Además Juana vende hierbas medicinales de manera ambulatoria en una calle adyacente a un mercado. Juana necesita un préstamo de 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de anilina de diversos colores. Juana sueña con que sus hijos sean profesionales, tener capital propio y surtir sus negocios.

loans.use: Dyes for wool

loans.name: Dalmacio

texts.es: Dalmacio tiene 44 años de edad, hace  8 años es separado; desde esa vez, vive  con su hijo en la casa de su padre. Se dedica a la crianza de animales como gallinas de corral,  asimismo aprovecha en juntar los huevos, cada cierta cantidad los lleva al mercado de la ciudad y los reparte en los diferentes puestos. Adicional a ello se dedica a cultivar cítricos, pero en menor escala, ya que hace 8 años atrás sufrió un accidente automovilístico y eso  le dificulta dedicarse plenamente a sus cultivos. Le agrada mucho el cuidado de las aves, para ello se ha dedicado a elaborar un gallinero y un lugar para poner los huevos, esta actividad le es muy rentable porque con el pasar de los años ya tiene una buena clientela, su anhelo es comprar terrenos para su hijo. Es la primera vez que solicita un préstamo con MFP. Con el dinero comprará plantones de cítricos, que le costará un aproximado de 400 soles, quiere trabajar duro e ir creciendo poco a poco para que le de una mejor vida a su hijo.
texts.en:
Dalmacio is 44 years old and has been separated for 8 years. Ever since then, he lives with his son in his father’s house. He raises hens, collects their eggs and sells them to different stands in the market. He also cultivates citrus for a living, but on a much smaller scale because he experienced a car accident 8 years ago, which has made it difficult for him to fully dedicate himself to his agriculture. He really likes raising poultry, and for this, he has made a henhouse and a place in which to store the eggs. This business is very lucrative because over the years he has established a strong client-base. His greatest wish is to purchase land for his son. This is the first time he requests a loan from MFP. With this money, he will purchase citrus plants, which will cost about 400.00 PEN. He wants to work hard and keep making his businesses grow little by little in order to give his son a better life.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase citrus plants

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es: Antonio tiene 40 años, no se casó, pero vive con su pareja, con ella tuvo 5 hijos que son la bendición para su hogar. Hace 10 años atrás llegó a vivir a la comunidad de Capachari, tuvo que empezar desde cero sembrando plátanos, que vende el kilo a 30 céntimos de sol, que le alcanzaba apenas para sus alimentos de primera necesidad. Entonces poco a poco está incrementando sus sembrío con frutos cítricos y ahora ultimo ha sembrado cacao. Antonio se va muy temprano a sus campos y trabaja ahí hasta que cierra la noche porque le es muy rentable cuando los vende por cantidad en la chacra. Es la primera vez que solicita un préstamo. Con este dinero va a comprar pesticidas, para controlar la gusanera del plátano.
texts.en:
Antonio is 40 years old. He is unmarried but lives with his domestic partner, with whom he has 5 children—his household blessings. Ten years ago, he came to live in the Capachari community. He had to start from scratch growing bananas, which he sells at 30 cents a kilogram. This was barely enough for the family’s basic food needs. He later started to increase his crops little by little, by growing citrus. He now grows cacao as well. Antonio heads for his crop fields very early in the morning, and works there until nightfall because it is very lucrative to sell his produce by bulk at the farm. This is the first time he requests a loan. With this money, he will purchase pesticides in order to have the banana pest insects under control.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase pesticides for banana trees

loans.name: Edith

texts.es: Edith, ya cumplidos sus 30 años, convive con su pareja que trabaja como chofer de transporte de pasajeros, tienen 3 hijos. Se dedica al cuidado de sus hijos y de sus estudios de lunes a viernes, los fines de semana acude a sus campos de cultivo de papa, que siembra para consumo propio, ya que nos cuenta lo que compra con dinero en el mercado no le es suficiente. A ella le gusta la actividad de la agricultura porque desde muy niña ha crecido en ese ambiente, sus padres eran agricultores; para ella la chacra ha sido la fuente principal de ingresos  económicos, los productos que cultiva son indispensables para el menú diario. La dificultad que tiene, es que a su pareja, no le gusta la actividad de la chacra, por ellos lo realiza sola. Este es su 7mo préstamo con MFP. Con el dinero que solicita contratará a peones para trabajar en sus tierras, cada uno cobra 15 soles por semana, calcula que serán 20 personas, el resto del dinero lo usará en la compra de herbecidas.
texts.en:
Edith is 30 years old, lives with her partner who works as a chauffer transporting passengers, and they have three children. She dedicates herself to caring for the children and to her studies from Monday to Friday. On the weekends, she tends to her farmland where she cultivates potatoes that she plants for her own consumption since, as she tells us, what she buys at the market is not enough. She likes farming because, since she was a young girl, she was raised in this environment. Her parents were farmers and, for her, this activity has been the primary source of income. The items she grows are indispensable to the daily menu. The difficulty she has is that her partner does not enjoy farming, so she undertakes her activities on her own. This is her 7th loan with MFP. With the funds she is requesting, she will hire laborers to help work her land. Each worker charges 15 soles per week, and she calculates she would need 20 people. The remainder of the funds would be used to purchase herbicides.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Hire laborers to help her work her farmland.

loans.name: Bertha

texts.en:
Bertha is a member of the Poder ("Power") Communal Bank. She is married and lives with her husband; the couple has three children. Three times per week, Bertha travels to various regional markets, where she buys a variety of grains which she brings to Ayaucucho to sell in a market of basic goods. On days she doesn't travel to markets, Bertha works taking care of babies. Her husband is a painter and needs to buy the necessary equipment to outfit his workshop. 

Bertha needs a loan of 1600 soles to buy wheat and corn. She dreams of having a different, more stable business, like a restaurant, and of building her own home. 

Translated by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva volunteer

Berta es socia del Banco Comunal Poder.
Berta es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos, Berta viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región 3 veces a la semana, donde compra cereales variados, productos que transporta a la ciudad de Ayacucho y vende en el mercado de abastos. Además Berta trabaja los días que no viaja a las ferias cuidando bebes. Su esposo es pintor y necesita implementar su taller con maquinarias necesarias.
Berta necesita un préstamo de 1600 dinero que será invertido en la compra de trigo, maíz.
Berta sueña con tener otro negocio estable como restaurante y construir su casa.

loans.use: Buy wheat and corn

loans.name: Elvira

texts.es: Elvira tiene 34 años, ella y su esposo trabajan en la chacra para la educación de sus 4 hijos. Se dedica a la agricultura, desde niña, tiene plantaciones de cítricos de dos hectáreas y hace 2 años ha  plantado también plátanos en otras dos hectáreas.  En horas de la mañana prepara conjuntamente con el desayuno, el almuerzo, y así le da tiempo para ir de a comprar mercadería para su mini bodega, donde se ocupa en tiempos cuando la chacra no requiera mayores cuidados. Lo que le agrada es el tiempo de cosechar los plátanos, que es cada 15 días, ya que es fácil y no necesita emplear mucho tiempo. Y a la vez lo más difícil es que no tiene como transportarlos al mercado, entonces tiene que adecuarse al precio que le pueden dar los compradores que van hasta sus plantaciones. Este es su primer préstamo. Con este dinero contratará peones para que sacan las todas las yerbas de sus tierras, por hectárea le cobran 270 soles.
texts.en:
Elvira is 34 years old. She and her husband work on their small farm for the education of their 4 children. She is dedicated to agriculture. From girlhood, she has had two hectares of citrus plantations and 2 years ago she planted bananas also in two other hectares. In the morning hours she prepares both breakfast and lunch, and thus gives herself time to go to buy merchandise for her small convenience store, where she is occupied in times when the small farm does not require as much attention. What pleases her is harvest time for the bananas, which is every 15 days, since it is easy and does not take a lot of time. And at the same time the most difficult thing is that she does not have a means to transport them to the market, so she has to accept the price that the buyers that come to the plantation will give her. This is her first loan. With this money she will hire laborers so that she can remove all the grass from her lands. They charge her 270 soles per hectare.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay laborers to remove the grasses from her lands

loans.name: Harerimana Cyprien

texts.en:
Cyprien H. says “Mukomere!” (Get strong!)--the greetings from the Northern province of Rwanda! Cyprien is 30 years old, married with 2 children.

This client has been in a credit association since 2005. He sells various items such as clothes, used shoes, household utensils, cooking pots, sandals, blankets, basins, cups, plates, etc. in the local market in his town. He has a small shop where he sells from, and during market days, he transports his items on his bicycle to sell them to the local people who come to the market. He employs 2 people to help him run the business.

He is looking for a loan worth 515,000 Frws to increase his inventory by buying more clothesa and shoes since he is anticipating increased sales during this Christmas season. This loan will be repaid over 8 months.

loans.use: To Increase his assortment of goods

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.en:
Carmen is a member of the Poder ("Power") Communal Bank. She is married and has 6 children, of whom 3 are currently in school. Carmen travels 3 times per week to local markets, where she sells dry goods with the help of her children. Carmen also bakes and sells bread; she starts baking each day at 3am and begins selling the finished product at 5am. Her husband has a workshop where he fixes cars. 

Carmen needs a loan of 1800 soles ($600 USD), which she will use to buy sugar, flour, and oil.

Carmen's dreams are to own her own business and to outfit her husband's workshop with the necessary tools. 

Translated by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva volunteer

Carmen es socia del Banco Comunal Poder.
Carmen es casada y tiene 6 hijos de los cuales 3 están estudiando, Carmen viaja 3 veces a la semana a las ferias en donde vende abarrotes, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de sus hijos. Además Carmen elabora panes actividad que realiza desde las 3 de la mañana y a las 5 de la mañana vende los panes. El esposo de Carmen tiene un taller de reparación de carros.
Carmen necesita un préstamo de 1800 dinero que será invertido en la compra de azúcar, harina, aceite.
Los sueños de Carmen son tener un negocio propio e implementar el taller de su esposo.

loans.use: Buy flour, sugar and oil

loans.name: Koudzo

texts.fr: Koudzo K. est âgé de 48 ans, marié et père de 5 enfants. Il est distillateur de « sodabi », une boisson locale préparée à partir du vin de palme, à Wome, village à environ 130 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale du Togo. Son activité consiste à acheter des palmiers, les abattre et tirer le vin pour la préparation du « sodabi ». Il souhaite par ce crédit acheter des palmiers pour accroître le volume de son activité.
texts.en:
Koudzo K. is 48 years old, married, and a father of 5. He is a distiller of “sodabi,” a local drink prepared from palm wine, in Wome, a village about 130 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo. His business consists of buying palm trees, cutting them down and extracting the wine in order to make “sodabi.” He hopes to use this loan to buy palm trees to increase the volume of his business.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy palm trees

loans.name: Roxana

texts.en:
Roxana is a member of the Poder ("Power") Communal Bank. She is married and doesn't yet have any children. She studies nursing at a community college; she has a year of studies left. Roxana and her husband have a dry goods store in their home in Huascahura, which is located 20 minutes from the city of Ayacucho.

Roxana needs a loan of 800 soles, which she will use to buy sugar and flour.

Roxana dreams of getting ahead in life, improving her business and providing for the child she will have someday.

Translated by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva volunteer

Roxana es socia del Banco Comunal Poder. Roxana es conviviente y aun no tiene hijos, Roxana estudia enfermería en un instituto y le falta un año para terminar con sus estudios, Roxana tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su casa ubicada en Huascahura a 20 minutos de la ciudad de Ayacucho, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de su esposo. Roxana necesita un préstamo de 800 dinero que será invertido en la compra de azúcar, arroz. Roxana sueña con salir adelante, mejorar su negocio y tener lo necesario para el hijo que tendrá en el futuro.

loans.use: Buy flour and sugar

loans.name: Harerimana

texts.en:
C. Harerimana says “Mukomere” (Get strong) the greetings from the Northern province of Rwanda! C. is 30 years old, married with 2 children.

This client has been in a credit association since 2005. He sells different items like clothes, used shoes, home utensils like cooking pots, sandals, blankets, basins, cups, plates etc in the local market in the town. He has a small shop where he sells from and during the market days, he transports his items on his bicycle to sell them to the local people who come to the market. He employs 2 people to run the business.

He is looking for a loan worth 515,000 Frws to increase on his stock by buying more clothes; shoes since he is anticipating increased sales during this Christmas season. This loan would be repaid in 8 months.

loans.use: To Increase his capital

loans.name: Plissiwe

texts.fr: Plissiwe K. est un jeune homme de 30 ans, marié et père de 2 enfants. Il est revendeur des tenues prêts-à-porter au marché de Womé situé à environ 130 kilomètres de Lomé. Il désire par ce crédit accroître la capacité de son activité en s’approvisionnant en d’autres biens qu’exigent les clients. Il compte sur cette opportunité pour améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Plissiwe K. is a young man of 30 years, married, and a father of 2. He sells ready-to-wear clothing at the market in Wome, which is about 130 kilometers from Lomé. He hopes to use this loan to increase the size of his business by stocking up on other goods that his clients require. He is counting on this opportunity to improve his family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise to resell

loans.name: Eudomilia

texts.en:
Eudomilia is a member of the Poder ("Power") Communal Bank. She is married and has seven children, of whom one is still in school and the others are working professionals. Eudomilia used to work professionally, but now runs a dry goods store with her husband. Their store is located near Valdelirios Boulevard.

Eudomilia needs a loan of 1200 soles, which she will use to buy rice, oil, and sugar. She dreams that her son will finish his studies, and to continue working to do everything she can to get ahead in life.

Translated by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva volunteer

Eudomilia es socia del Banco Comunal Poder. Eudomilia es casada y tiene 7 hijos, D. los cuales 1 todavía estudia y los otros 6 ya son profesionales, Eudomilia es profesora cesante, junto a su esposo tienen una tienda D. abarrotes que se ubica cerca D. la Alameda Valdelirios. Eudomilia necesita un préstamo D. 1200 dinero que será invertido en la compra D. arroz, aceite, azúcar. Los sueños D. Eudomilia son que su hijo termine sus estudios, seguir adelante y hacer todo lo que pueda.

loans.use: Buy rice, oil and sugar

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.es: Gerardo cuenta con 33 años de edad, aun no se ha casado, tiene dos hijos con su conviviente que le acompaña en todas sus actividades. Es agricultor, desde niño se ha dedicado a la actividad del cultivo de la tierra, en esta oportunidad tiene sembrado con 50 sacos de semilla, comenta muy feliz, que su mundo es trabajar la tierra, dice que hay que conocer las temporadas para sembrar y mantener un adecuado cuidado, con todo esto la chacra produce muy bien. Gerardo siembra con peones en grades cantidades porque esta es la fuente principal de ingresos económicos para su familia. Lo le incomoda es el precio de los fertilizantes, el alza de estos ha repercutido negativamente, ya que tiene que sembrar en menor cantidad de lo que acostumbra. Es cliente por vez primera en MFP. Con este préstamo comprará herbicidas con un importe de 380 soles, lo que le sirve para fumigar su chacra de papas, ya que las yerbas no dejan desarrollarse bien tubérculo.
texts.en:
Gerardo is 33 years old, still has not married, and has two children with his live-in partner who accompany him in all his activities. He is a farmer, and since childhood has dedicated himself to cultivating the soil. At this opportunity, he has sown 50 sacks of seed and comments that he is very happy as his world is working the land. He tells us that one must know the times to plant and take proper care so that the crop will produce very well. Gerardo works with laborers of varying skill, given that this is the primary source of income for his family. A difficulty for him is the high price of fertilizers, which have impacted him negatively by forcing him to plant less than he normally would. He is a first-time customer with MFP. With this loan, he will purchase herbicides at a cost of 380.00 soles which will allow him to fumigate his potato crop since weeds do not allow the tubers to develop properly.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase herbicides for his farmland.

loans.name: Estela

texts.es: Estela tiene 43 años, hace 5 años se ha quedado viuda, ahora vive con su hija y una sobrinita que quedó huérfana. Hasta antes que falleciera su esposo se dedicaba a las labores en su casa, su esposo era muy comprensivo y cumplía con su responsabilidad de su hogar. Pero debido al accidente que sufrió, no se recuperó y que finalmente falleció. Desde entonces, Estela empezó a preparar comida, refrigerios para vender en el hospital, este negocio se lo sugirió una enfermera. Distribuye los refrigerios desde las 10 hasta las 11 de la mañana, después, en horas de la tarde se dedica a freír papas, para vender “salchipapas”. Por el momento alquila el carrito salchipapero (aparato implementado con hornillas a gas y varios compartimientos para conservar las frituras calientes) este gasto le reduce sus ganancias.  Es la primera vez que solicita un préstamo con MFP. Con el dinero espera comprar su propio carrito salchipapero.
texts.en:
Estela is 43 years old. 5 years ago she was left a widow. Now she lives with her daughter and a little niece that was left an orphan. Until he passed away, her husband was dedicated to working on his house. Her husband was very thorough and he lived up to the responsibility of his home. But due to the accident that he suffered, he did not recover and finally he passed away. Since then, Estela began to prepare food; snacks to sell in the hospital. This business was suggested by a nurse. She distributes the snacks from 10 to 11 in the morning. Later, in the afternoon hours, she is dedicated to frying potatoes, to sell "salchipapas". For the moment she rents a cart called a salchipapero (apparatus fitted with gas fryers and various compartments to conserve hot fried foods). This expense reduces her profits. This is the first time that she has requested a loan with MFP. With the money she hopes to buy her own salchipapero cart.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a cart for selling hot foods.

loans.name: Gladis

texts.es: Gladis tiene 46 años, ella y su esposo se dedican  a la venta de comida con el apoyo de sus 3 hijos. Desde muy joven se ha dedicado a esta actividad, en un inicio vendía como ambulante en la calles, pero hace 15 años atrás administró un lugar de recreo, ello le permitió contar con un capital y poder alquilar un local y poner su propio negocio  en su especialidad, con ello construyó su casa. Ahora, su local convertido en un restaurante denominado “Doña Cristi” prepara los potajes más exóticos de la selva, la bandeja esta a solo 12 soles, prepara 28 platos diferentes platos de lunes a viernes, y los fines de semana, se incrementa la cantidad, lo cual es más rentable para ella. Lo que es dificultoso es conseguir apoyo para la atención. Este es su cuarto préstamo con MFP, y siempre ha sido puntual en sus pagos. Con el dinero que solicita esta vez comprará insumos como el arroz, azúcar, fideos, etc. y algunas bebidas que le hacen falta.
texts.en:
Gladis is 46 years old and, along with the help of her husband and three children, she dedicates herself to selling food. She has conducted this type of activity since she was very young, starting by selling food by foot on the streets. However, 15 years ago she managed a recreational space which permitted her to have capital and rent a location where she could set up her own business in her specialty. With it, she built her house. Currently, her site is converted to a restaurant called “Doña Cristi” where she prepares exotic jungle dishes. A platter costs only 12 soles, and she prepares 28 different dishes from Mondays to Fridays. She increases her quantities on weekends, which prove more profitable for her. What is difficult is finding help to tend to customers. This is her fourth loan with MFP, and she has always been timely with her payments. With the funds she is requesting, she will purchase ingredients such as rice, sugar, noodles, etc., as well as some beverages that she is currently lacking.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies and ingredients for her restaurant.

loans.name: Henrry

texts.es: Henry tiene 23 años, es soltero, vive con sus padres en la comunidad de Capachari, disfrutando de la compañía de sus hermanos menores. Con penurias económicas pudo terminar el colegio, quiso estudiar una carrera técnica, pero la economía fue determinante, desde entonces se ha dedicado de lleno a la agricultura, sembró unos cuantos plantones de plátanos y café, desde allí poco a poco está incrementado sus sembríos. La chacra es muy rentable, solo que se demora en crecer de 2 a 3 años, tanto de plátano y café, pero aun así atacan las plagas y es dificultoso controlarlas. Esta es la primera vez que solicita un préstamo en MFP. Con el dinero comprará insecticidas para que pueda fumigar sus plantones de plátanos, el litro costará mas o menos 192 soles.
texts.en:
Henry is 23 years old, unmarried and lives with his parents in the community of Capachari, enjoying the company of his younger siblings. With economic hardships he could have could finished school. He wanted to study a technical career, but the economy was a determinant. He has since been fully involved in agriculture, planting a few seedlings of bananas and coffee, then gradually increasing his crops. The ranch is very profitable, taking 2 to 3 years to grow both bananas and coffee, but even so insects attack and are difficult to control. This is his first time applying for a loan at MFP. With the money, he will buy pesticides to spray his banana plantation. A liter will cost more or less 192 soles.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase pesticides for his crops

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
"Muraho!" (Greetings!) from Jean N. from Burera, in the northern province of Rwanda! Jean is 35 years old, married with 5 children, and he owns a small local bar selling locally produced beer: “Sorghum beer". He buys it in 5 jerry-cans of 20 litres each and sells it to the local people. Besides selling the local beer, he also roasts goat meat which local people enjoy, especially in the evenings after hard work on their farms.

This client is looking for a loan worth 515,000 Frws to buy more beer for his customers and goats to slaughter for meat to roast. This roasted meat is commonly called "brochettes". He will also buy other equipment for his beer garden such as tables, clean cups, and bottles and increase his beer stocks for this Christmas season! This loan will be repaid over 8 months.

loans.use: To buy equipment for his pub and more sorghum beer

loans.name: Hilmer

texts.es: Hilmer tiene 27 años, es soltero, actualmente vive con sus padres, pero hay temporadas donde viaja a la costa para estar pendiente de las tierras de cultivo que posee en esa zona. Toda su vida se ha dedicado a la agricultura, ya se en su pueblo o de lo contrario en la costa donde también se va a sembrar papa, comenta que para la siembra de este producto hay que tener suerte, porque el año pasado sembró en la costa, pero la papa no tuvo un buen precio. Pero esta vez el tubérculo tiene buen precio en el mercado, su actividad es sembrar y negociar porque trabaja con su capital 50% y el 50% con el banco. Le agrada lo que hace, porque cuando tiene un buen precio se dobla su capital. Es cliente por vez primera en MFP. Con el dinero solicitado primero comprará un insecticida denominad “rejin” que cuesta un aproximado 380 soles que le alcanza para dos hectárea de fumigado.
texts.en:
Hilmer is 27, single, currently living with his parents. Seasonally he travels to the coast to cultivate the farmlands that he possesses in that area. His entire life has been dedicated to agriculture. Whether in his town or on the coast, he already plans to sow potatoes. He comments that he needs luck to plant this crop because the previous year he planted on the coast, but the price for potatoes was low. But at this time tubers are bringing a good price in the market, so his job is to plant and negotiate, because he is working 50% with his own capital and 50% with the bank. He likes what he is doing, because when prices are good he can double his investment. He is a first-time client of MFP. With the money he is requesting, he will first buy an insecticide called "rejin" that costs approximately $125 to cover 2 hecatres with insecticide.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of insecticide for his farmlands

loans.name: Komi

texts.fr: Komi M. est un acheteur des produits café et cacao à Womé, un village situé au nord-ouest de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Son activité consiste à payer les produits auprès des agriculteurs et de les revendre aux exportateurs internationaux. Il espère avec ce crédit accroître le volume de son commerce, ce qui lui permettra de gagner plus pour améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Komi M. is a coffee and cocoa buyer in Womé, a village situated northwest of Lomé, the Togolese capital. His business consists in buying the products from the growers and selling them to international exporters. He hopes to use this loan to expand the volume of his business, which will permit him to earn more in order to improve living conditions for his family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchasing coffee and tea for re-sale

loans.name: Huber

texts.es: Huber tiene 24 años de edad, por el momento está conviviendo con su pareja, de esa relación tienen 2 hijos. Desde que tuvo 11 años, Huber se dedica a la agricultura, y cuando llegó a tener su propia familia empezó a sembrar en grandes cantidades, productos como cítricos y plátanos, le agrada la actividad de la chacra, sobre todo sembrar diversos productos, pero lo que él siembra en mayor  cantidad son los frutos cítricos y cuando llega su temporada, de diciembre a marzo es cuando suben su precio, los demás meses cuestan menos, pero siempre le alcanza para solventar sus necesidades, lo difícil en los cítricos, es que se demoran en desarrollar de 3 a 5 años, por ello, siembra de modo alternado y diversos productos. Por ejemplo, de sus plantaciones de plátano, cosechará de aquí a 5 años. Es la primera vez que solicita un préstamo con MFP. Con este dinero comprará pequeñas plantas de plátano, que luego trasplantará.
texts.en:
Huber is 24 and currently living with his partner and their 2 children. Since he was 11, Huber has worked in agriculture, and when he started his own family, he began to sow crops such as citrus fruit and bananas in larger quantities. Farming pleases him, above all to grow diverse crops, but what he grows the most are citrus fruits. The price goes up when they are in season from December to March, and is lower the rest of the year, but he always earns enough for his necessities. The hard part about citrus is that they take 3 to 5 years to develop, which is why he sows rotating crops and a variety of produce. For example, he will not harvest from his banana plantings until 5 years from now. This is the first time he has requested a loan from MFP. With this money he will buy banana seedlings to transplant.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of banana seedlings

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es: Isabel tiene 41 años, hace 22 años vive con su pareja, tienen 4 hijos, ella y su esposo trabajan juntos en la chacra. Isabel es la primera en madrugar en casa, se levanta a las 5.00 a.m para que prepare un nutritivo desayuno para que puedan soportar el trabajo duro de la chacra, cuando era soltera no se dedicaba mucho a la chacra porque su padre no le permitía, pero desde que tuvo su esposo empezó a trabajar, en inicios en chacras ajenas macheteando y por ello le pagaban. Pero después, ya con el tiempo empezaron a sembrar sus propios cultivos y notaron que les era más rentable. Su dificultad principal es la falta de dinero para transportar los mamones de plátanos, los cítricos y las yucas, no les queda otra opción de vender en sus chacras pero a menor precio. Este es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP. Con el dinero que solicita comprará plantas cítricas, además contratará peones para que a base de macheteo quiten los arbustos de su chacra y poder sembrar otros productos.
texts.en:
Isabel is 41 and has been living with her spouse for 22 years. They have 4 children, and she and her husband work together in agriculture. Isabel is the first to rise in the morning, getting up at 5 a.m. to prepare a nutritious breakfast so they can sustain the hard work of agriculture. When she was single, she did not work much in agriculture because her father would not allow her, but after she married her husband she started to work. In the beginning she was paid to clear other people's fields, but afterwards they started to plant their own fields and realized this was more profitable for them. The main difficulty is the lack of money to transport the bananas, citrus, and yucca, so they have no other option than to sell from the field at a lower price. This is the first loan she has taken with MFP. With the money she is requesting, she will buy citrus seedlings and will hire field workers to clear the brush from her field so she can plant more crops.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of citrus seedlings and to hire field workers

loans.name: Jacinto

texts.es: Jacinto tiene 61 años, es casado, vive en compañía con su esposa y sus dos hijos. Es un padre D. familia muy noble, toda su vida se ha dedicado a labrar L. tierra, actividad que heredó D. su padre, siembra diversos productos, pero en mayor cantidad el café, porque dice que no hay perdida con él. A Jacinto no le gusta que su esposa realice los trabajos pesados D. L. chacra, al llevarle su almuerzo diariamente, se siente contento con ese apoyo. L. responsabilidad que le delega a su esposa, es cuando el café ya está listo para llevar al mercado y comercializarlo. Nos dice, que él cree que los trabajos del campo son para los varones, y esta labor le parece muy divertida. Este es el primer préstamo que solicita. Dinero con el cual comprará semilL. D. cacao y D. café, para que pueda volver a sembrar en otra tierra que ya tiene preparada, para que D. ese modo no se queD. sin tiempos D. cosecha.
texts.en:
Jacinto is 61, married, and living with his wife and two children. He is a noble head of family, dedicating his entire life to working the land, an activity that he inherited from his father. He plants various produce, mainly coffee because he has not lost money on it. Jacinto does not like his wife to do the heavy field work, he is satisfied when she brings him his lunch every day. The responsibility that is delegated to his wife is when the coffee is ready to take to market to be sold. He tells us that he believes field work is for men, and he finds this work enjoyable. This is the first loan he has requested. With the money he will buy cacao and coffee seed so he can sow a different field that he has already prepared, so that he will not be without something to harvest.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cacao seed for his fields

loans.name: Jacinto

texts.es: Jacinto tiene 52 años de edad, es casado, con su pareja tienen la dicha que de sus dos hijos aun solteros los acompañen. Desde los 15 años, Jacinto ayudaba a sus padres en la siembra, con ello podía ganar dinero para pagar sus estudios en la universidad. Cuando se casó ya tenía sus propias chacras ya cultivadas con frutos cítricos y plátanos. El se va muy temprano a sus campos, aun con el ardiente sol permanece en la montaña. Actividad que le es rentable, ya que en tiempos de cosecha llega a vender 400 kilos de cítricos.  Jacinto hace uso de su profesión de agronomía, todos sus conocimientos los emplea en sus plantaciones, y le va muy bien, sin mayores dificultades y siembra gran variedad de productos. Este es el primer préstamo que solicita con MFP. El dinero será invertido en la compra de semilla de café, para la ampliación de sus sembríos de este producto.
texts.en:
Jacinto is 52 and married. He and his wife have the happiness to be assisted by their two unmarried children. For 15 years, Jacinto helped his parents to plant, which is how he was able to earn the money to pay for his university studies. When he got married he already had his own fields already planted with citrus fruits and bananas. He goes to his fields very early, staying on the mountain even in the burning sun. This is profitable for him, since at harvest time he can sell 400 kilos of citrus fruit. Jacinto makes use of his agricultural training, using all his knowledge in his plantings. It is going very well with him, without major problems, and he is growing a wide variety of produce. This is the first loan that he has requested from MFP. He will invest the money in coffee seed, in order to increase his plantings of this crop.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of coffee seed

loans.name: Jocabeth

texts.es: Jocabet tiene 30 años, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos, hace poco tiempo han construido su casa de madera. Ella trabaja en sus campos de cultivo desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde todos los días. Esta actividad la desarrolla desde muy joven, con sus padres que también eran agricultores. Jocabet ha sembrado una hectárea de cacao y tres cuadras de frutos cítricos, está muy contenta con su trabajo, dice que la chacra depende de cómo se le atiende, hay que estar muy al pendiente, para ello se tiene que tener conocimientos de qué tipo de pesticidas se debe utilizar para cada enfermedad y tener en cuenta también las temporadas. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP. Con el dinero solicitado comprará un pesticida contra el “koki” que le costará un aproximado 98 soles el pomo.
texts.en:
Jocabet is 30 and lives with her husband and her two children. Her wood house was built just recently. She works in her fields from 8 in the morning until 5 in the evening every day. She has carried out this work since she was very young with her parents who were also farmers. Jocabet has sown one hecare with cacao and three fields with citrus fruit. She is very content with her work, saying that her farm depends on her care. She has to stay on the lookout, needing the knowledge of which type of pesticide should be used for each disease, and also considering the seasons. This is her first loan from MFP. With the money she will buy a pesticide against "koki" that will cost her about $32 per jug.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of pesticides for her fields

loans.name: José

texts.es: José tiene 53 años de edad, es separado, tuvo 3 hijos, él se ha quedado viviendo con uno de ellos. Desde los 12 años viene labrando la tierra, nos cuenta que cuando se enamoró pensó llevar una vida feliz, pero no fue así, dice que ella se aburrió porque él era agricultor, que no soportó los bajos recursos y lo abandonó hace 8 años. Pero él decidió trabajar con la misma fuerza para darle lo mejor a su hijo. Ha sembrado varias chacras de diversos productos, pero lo que tiene en mayor cantidad es el cacao, este producto es muy rentable, nos dice que no hay pérdida, lo único delicado es que lo tiene que cuidar de la enfermedad del “koki” que acaba con la planta cuando no la fumiga. Es la primera vez que solicita un préstamo con MFP. Con el dinero solicitado comprará el “rejin” producto que usará para fumigar las dos hectáreas de cacao que tiene sembradas.
texts.en:
José is 53 years old, separated and has three children and lives with one of them. For 12 years he has worked the land. He tells us that when he fell in love, he thought that he would live a happy life, but it didn't turn out that way. He says that his wife got bored because he was a farmer. She couldn't live on such a limited income so she left eight years ago. But he decided to work with the same determination in order to give his son the best. He has sown various fields with different crops but what he has the most of is cacao. This product is very profitable - he says there's no way to loose. The only delicate thing is that he has to prevent a disease called "koki" that kills the plants when he doesn't fumigate. This is the first time that he is requesting a loan from MFP. With the money he will buy "rejin," a product he will use to fumigate two hectares of cacao that he has planted.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase the product necessary to fumigate crops

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan tiene 44 años de edad, es separado, tiene 2 hijos que viven con su madre, y él aporta mensualmente para sus gastos. Su única actividad ha sido la agricultura, desde niño trabajó en sembríos de papa, cuando se enamoró de la que fue su esposa se fue a la selva y cambio su ritmo de trabajo en la chacra, desde entonces se dedica a las plantaciones de frutos cítricos, como la naranja, en un inicio trabaja como peón junto a su esposa, ahora desde su  separación, hace 5 años él se solo se prepara sus alimentos y luego se va a su chacra. Particularmente, empezó a plantar plátano y cítricos, de los cuales ahora ya está cosechando, le está yendo bien, esta temporada ha sido baja, pero los próximos meses mejorará, nos dice. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP. Con el dinero que solicita va a comprar 30 sacos de guano orgánico para que pueda abonar su chacra, todo le costará un aproximado 450 soles, ya que cada saco está 15 soles.
texts.en:
Juan is 44 years old, separated and has two children that live with his mother. He supports them by contributing to cover their monthly expenses. His only job has been in agriculture. When he was a child he worked in the potato fields. When he met the woman who would become his wife he went to the jungle to change his work routine from that of the farm. Since then he has worked on plantations of citric fruits like oranges. In the beginning he worked as a laborer alongside his wife. Now, since their separation five years ago, he prepares his meals himself and then goes to work on his farm. In particular, he started planting bananas and citric fruits that he is now harvesting and things are going very well for him. This season has been slow but he says the next few months will be better. This is his first loan with MFP. WIth the money he is requesting he is going to buy 30 sacks of organic fertilizer for his farm. In total it will cost 450 soles because each sack costs 15 soles.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sacks of fertilizer for a farm

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana tiene 56 años, vive con su esposo y de su relación de muchos años solo han tenido un solo hijo, que actualmente vive con ellos. En horas de la mañana es ama de casa, lo cual se levanta a las 5 a.m. para preparar los alimentos, horas más tarde se dirige a sus plantaciones de café y se convierte en agricultora, esta actividad la realiza desde que se casó, trabajan en pareja y el contacto con la tierra le hace bien a su salud, es por ello que le agrada ir a su chacra. Siempre han tenido cultivos de café porque les deja un margen de ganancia muy considerable, que depende del mercado es mayor o menor.
Lo dificultoso es que para la cosecha necesita de mucha gente y a veces no encuentra a los peones para esta labor. Es una nueva clienta en MFP. Con el dinero solicitado comprará una mochila para fumigar “los kokis” que afectan a todas las plantas, la mochila cuesta un aproximadamente 600 soles.
texts.en:
Juana is 56 years old and lives with her husband. From their relationship of many years, they've only had one son who currently lives with them. In the mornings she is a housewife and gets up at 5:00 a.m. to prepare the meals. Hours later she goes to the coffee plantations and becomes a farm worker. She's been doing this work ever since she got married. They work as a team and the contact with the earth is good for their health. For that reason she likes to go to the farm. They have always had coffee crops because it allows them to make a considerable profit that could be more or less depending on the market. The challenge is that for the harvest she needs the help of many people and sometimes she doesn't find the laborers she needs to do this work. She is a new client of MFP. With the money requested she will buy a special backpack needed to fumigate the "kokis," [a disease] that affects all of the plants. The backpack costs approximately 600 soles.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a special backpack used to fumigate crops

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia tiene 53 años, es divorciada, vive en compañía D. 3 D. sus hijos, tuvo 4. Se levanta muy temprano, a las 5.00 a.m., prepara los alimentos D. sus hijos, y después eso D. la 10 acuD. a su chacra D. café y cacao para darles los cuidados respectivos. A Julia le grada mucho trabajar en sus plantaciones, por le es muy relajado, además las ganancias le permiten mantener a su familia. Lo fastidioso  es cuando hace demasiado calor, trabajar con altas temperaturas le produce dolencias en la columna y malestares en el estomago. Esta es la primera vez que solicita un préstamo. Con el dinero, en primera instancia va contratar peones para quitar los arbustos D. otras yerbas D. su chacra D. cacao y sembrar café intermedio para que aproveche mucho mejor el terreno.
texts.en:
Julia is 53 years old, divorced and lives in the company of three of her four children. She gets up very early at 5:00 a.m., prepares food for her children and then around 10:00 goes to her farm to tend to her coffee and cacao plants. Julia likes working with her crops very much because it is relaxing. Besides, the earnings allow her to support her family. The most frustrating thing is when it is too hot. Working in the extreme heat produces back pain and upsets her stomach. This is the first time that she is requesting a loan. With the money, first she will contract laborers to remove the shrubbery and other weeds from her cacao farm and then plant coffee so that she can take better advantage of the land.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Contract laborers to remove weeds from a farm

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es: Lucia tiene 64 años, es divorciada, actualmente vive con una D. sus hijas, quien la acompaña. Hace 12 años se divorció, desD. ese momento empezó a trabajar en chacras D. diferentes personas, pero hace 7 años, con el apoyo D. su hija, decidieron a sembrar frutos cítricos en su propio terreno. Y 10 años atrás, instaló una pequeña bodega, también con el apoyo D. su hija, porque Lucia  es analfabeta, es por ello que cuando no está su hija, tiene que pedir favor a la gente para que le saque la cuenta, ahora gracias al programa D. alfabetización del gobierno, ya pueD. firmar. Lo que más le agrada, es el contacto constante con la gente, es por ello que en su bodega está muy contenta, aun el no saber sumar, no es dificultad para su crecimiento. Esta es la primera vez que solicita un préstamo con MFP. Con el dinero piensa incrementar la mercadería D. su bodega, además D. adicionar a su negocio la venta D. utensilios para el hogar.
texts.en:
Lucia is 64 years old, divorced and currently lives with one of her daughters. She divorced 12 years ago and at that moment started to work on different people's farms. But seven years ago, with the support of her daughter, she decided to grow citric fruits on her own land. And 10 years ago she opened a small store, also with her daughter's help, because Lucia is illiterate. For that reason, when her daughter is not around, she has to ask other people to help her with the accounting. Now, thanks to the government's illiteracy program, she can sign her name. What she enjoys the most is the constant contact with people and it's for that reason that she is very happy in her store. She still doesn't know how to add but it's not a hindrance for her growth. This is the first time that she is requesting a loan from MFP. With the money she plans to increase the amount of merchandise in her store in addition to adding the sale of utensils for the home to her offering.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the amount of merchandise offered in a general store

loans.name: María

texts.es:
Maria tiene 28 años, tiene dos hijos, convive con su pareja y por el momento están viviendo en la casa de sus padres. Maria se levanta a las 4 a.m. para preparar los desayunos y después el almuerzo, a eso de las 10 de la mañana sale rumbo a la chacra, solo así puede aprovechar el tiempo al máximo. A veces su esposo se adelanta y ella va llevando el almuerzo. Lo que más le agrada es sembrar arvejas porque no requieren de mucha inversión, pero la papa si requiere de mayor capital. 
La producción de arvejas es rentable porque se cosecha dos o tres veces de una sola sembrada y el precio con el que se cotiza en el mercado les deja  recuperar más de lo invertido, por otro lado, se hace difícil cosechar cuando llueve, de lo contrario todo esta bien. Es el primer préstamo con  MFP. Con el dinero comprará un producto llamado “fitora” que sirve para curar los cultivos de las enfermedades de las plantas, además adquirirá también herbicidas para el fumigado de sus arvejas.
texts.en:
María is 28 years old, has two children and lives with her husband. For the moment, they are living in her parents' home. María gets up at 4:00 a.m. in order to prepare breakfast and then lunch. Around 10:00 in the morning she leaves for the farm. This is the only way can she maximize the use of her time. Sometimes her husband goes earlier and she then takes their lunch. What she likes most about growing peas is that they don't require much investment, but potatoes do require more capital. The production of peas is profitable because they're harvested two or three times from a single planting and, with the price they get at the market, it allows them to recover more of the investment. On the other hand, it is difficult to harvest when it rains but other times it is fine. This is the first loan with MFP. With the money she will buy a product called "fitora" that is used to cure the crops of plant diseases. She will also acquire pesticides to fumigate her peas.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase products needed to fumigate crops

loans.name: Melisa

texts.es: Melisa tiene 21 años, es madre soltera, vive con su hija en la casa de sus padres,  su negocio está en un local alquilado a dos cuadras de su casa. Hace 2 años trabajaba en una empresa minera, como secretaria. Ahora desde hace 8 meses tiene su propio negocio de cabinas públicas de Internet y centro de llamadas telefónicas, le esté yendo muy bien porque en su  zona no hay mucha competencia y por ello le es muy rentable.
