Esta actividad le agrada, le gusta brindar ayuda a los estudiantes que requieran temas para sus temas escolares. El locutorio de llamadas lo instaló hace un mes para captar más clientes. Es su primer préstamo con MFP. El dinero que solicita, nos dice, es la oportunidad para repotenciar la capacidad de almacenamiento de algunas computadoras, para que funcionen con mayor velocidad.
texts.en:
Melisa is 21 years old, a single mother, and lives with her daughter in her parents' house. Her business is a local shop two blocks from her house. She worked for 2 years at a mining business as a secretary. Eight months ago, she started her own internet cafe and call center. It has been going well so far because her neighborhood does not have much competition, making it a very profitable business. She appreciates her job and would like to support students who require books for their school subjects. She recently installed a telephone booth in order to attract more customers. This is her first loan with MFP. The requested money is her opportunity to increase the data storage capacity of her computers so that they function at higher speeds.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase data storage capacity of computers in her internet cafe

loans.name: Monica

texts.es: Mónica tiene 33 años, es madre soltera, tiene un hijo, por el momento está viviendo en casa de su madre. Mónica ha estudiado cosmetología, pero por falta de dinero no pudo poner su salón de belleza, hace un año pudo instalar una pequeña bodega, a la vez se dedica a la compra y venta de plátanos en su misma bodega. Le agrada mucho estar en contacto con la gente, se divierte en su negocio, y a la vez le permite ganarse el sustento, dijo sonriendo. Para que su bodega sea cada vez más rentable, busca surtirlo con más productos, por ahora lo que le da mayores ganancias, es la venta de plátano. Este es el primer préstamo que solicita a MFP. Con el dinero que solicita incrementará la mercadería de su bodega, con la otra parte va comprar más plátanos.
texts.en:
Monica is 33 years old, a single mother, has a daughter, and is currently living with her mother. Monica studied cosmetology, but could not start a beauty salon due to a lack of money. She started a small market and has made a living by buying and selling bananas. She likes being in contact with people and enjoys her business because she can earn a living, she says smiling. In order to make her market more profitable, she looks to provide more products because right now most of her profit comes from the bananas. This is her first loan with MFP. With the money, she will increase her market's merchandise and will buy more bananas.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her market's merchandise and buy more bananas

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es: Nancy tiene 27 años, no es casada, pero vive en armonía con su pareja, con el que tiene cuatro hijos. Desde hace 4 años, juntos, tomaron la decisión de trabajar arduamente para adquirir sus cosas, desde esa momento esta pareja se levantan muy temprano a preparar sus desayunos y almuerzos, después se van juntos a la chacra. Habían empezado sembrando frutos cítricos, pero ahora ya están incrementando sus sembríos, tanto con café, como con y cacao. Nancy dice que cuando se trabaja en armonía y apoyándose mutuamente, no hay dificultad alguna y todo se hace con mayor facilidad, la gran ventaja es que a esta pareja les agrada a ambos su trabajo como agricultores. Es la primera vez que Nancy solicita un préstamo con MFP. Con este dinero comprará abonos para la chacra de café, y así pueda producir en mayor cantidad y con buenos frutos, lo que le costará será un aproximado de 500 soles.
texts.en:
Nancy is 27 years old, unmarried, and lives happily with her boyfriend who has four children. For the past 4 years, they have worked hard to buy things; they wake up very early to prepare breakfast and lunch and afterwards they go together to the farm. They had started to grow citrus fruits, but they are still seeds and the dirt is still brown. Nancy says that when they work together and support each other mutually, there is no difficulty and everything can be done easier. The big advantage is that they both like agricultural work. This is the first time that Nancy has requested a loan with MFP. With this money, she will buy fertilizer for the brown dirt and in this way, produce a larger quantity of good fruits, which will cost approximately 500 soles.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer for her crops

loans.name: Nilson

texts.es: Nilson tiene 29 años, aun no ha pensado en la posibilidad de casarse, pero sí tiene tres robustos hijos, y su compañera le ayuda a  trabajar la chacra. Trabaja en la agricultura para afrontar su situación económica, es la única actividad que conoce. La labor de cultivar las tierras le agradan mucho porque no siente ningún tipo de presión, su trabajo es independiente y a la vez muy rentable, en ciertas oportunidades su producto llega a tener un buen precio, esto le permite tener sus ahorros para tiempos de sequía. Pero es vez le ha afectado el alza en los precios de los fertilizantes, entonces, ahora con los ahorros  que los tenia para la compra de unos 20 sacos de fertilizante, solo pudo comprar 8 sacos. Es cliente por vez primera en MFP. Con el dinero comprará productos para fumigar sus campos de cultivo.
texts.en:
Nilson is 29 years old and is unmarried, but he has three strong children and his girlfriend helps him work on the farm. He works in farming to cope with his economic situation and it is the only job that he knows. He likes the work of farming because he does not feel any pressure. This business is independent and very profitable. In times when his products sell at a high price, he is able to save for times of drought. Recently the prices of fertilizers have also increased so that he can only buy 9 sacks with his savings instead of the usual 20 sacks. He is a first time customer with MFP. With the requested money, he will buy products in order to fumigate his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase good products to fumigate his crops

loans.name: Noemi

texts.es: Noemí cuenta con 24 años de edad, vive con su esposo, con el cual tiene tres hijos. Noemí y su esposo se dedican a la agricultura, en esta oportunidad tienen sembrado 12 sacos de semilla. Todas las mañanas madruga para que le alcance el tiempo para poder llevar al campo a sus vacas y después ir a trabajar a la chacra. Antes de la agricultura, desde niña lo que más le gustó fue el cuidado de sus animales, durante las temporadas donde la chacra no produce, entonces se dedica a la venta de las vacas que cría. Nos dice que la labor del campo es muy cansada y en tiempos de lluvia es muy tedioso trabajar rápido los  zapatos se deterioran en el lodo. Esta es la primera vez que trabaja con un préstamo de MFP. Con el dinero solicitado comprará abono para sus campos de papa, ya la tierra donde ha sembrado no es muy buena, tampoco a descansado un año, como es lo necesario, entonces necesita ser abonada cuidadosamente.
texts.en:
Noemi is 24 years old, lives with her husband, of who has three children. Noemi and her husband make a living through agriculture and right now they are planting 12 sacks of seeds. Every morning, they bring food to their cows and afterwards, they work the fields. Even before she started farming, Noemi liked to be away from the city with the animals. During seasons with no crops, they sell the cows they raise. They say that the work of the farm is very tiring, especially in times of rain when the work is difficult and their shoes disintegrate into the mud. This is her first loan with MFP. With the requested money, she will buy fertilizer for the potatoe fields and for the land that has not been fertile for the past year, a necessary task that they must do carefully.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer for their crop fields

loans.name: Olga

texts.es: Olga tiene 43 años, es casada y tiene 5 hijos, de los cuales cuatro todavía dependen de ella. Es una madre de familia bastante dinámica, porque se da tiempo primero en atender a su familia, y después en horas, dos veces a la semana se va a las chacras en busca de plátanos verdes, una vez que ha almacenado cierta cantidad, procede a realizar el proceso de maduración con el liquido “etrel”, que lo mezcla con agua en cantidad suficiente para sumergir los plátanos. Esta actividad la viene desarrollando hace 2 años, pero recién en estos tiempos se ha vuelto más rentable, le agrada la actividad que realiza y no tiene grandes dificultades. Este es el primer préstamo que solicita a MFP. Con este dinero comprará plátanos en mayor cantidad, la arroba cuesta S/.15, asimismo comprará plantitas pequeñas de plátanos, para empezar a cultivar sus propios frutos y así pueda tener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Olga is 43 years old, married, and has five children (four of whom are her dependants). She is a mother of a dynamic family because she devotes her time to them first, and then she two times a week she goes to the fields to look for green bananas. Once she has collected a sufficient quantity, she rippens them with a liquid called "Etrel", which is a water based mixture in which she submerges the bananas. She has been developing this trade for two years, but recently it has been more profitable. She likes this job and it does not have many difficulties. This is her first loan with MFP. With this money, she will buy bananas in a greater quantity, a bunch costs S/.15, and she will also buy baby banana plants in order to develop her own fruit to earn more profits.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a large amount of banana plants

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es: Ricardo tiene 61 años, es casado, vive con su esposa y su hija. Él es agricultor, sus padres le enseñaron al  cultivo de las chacras desde que era muy niño, le ha muy bien en la agricultura, el cuidar las plantaciones de plátanos  y cítricos es muy delicado hasta que formen fruto. Cuando consiguen derribar con los hongos que se forman producen buen fruto. En tiempos de verano llegan a tener un buen precio los tanyelos y naranjas. La mayor dificultad es mientras que están en proceso de formación los frutos, los hongos denominados “cogotera” los atacan, empiezan amarilleando las hojas y terminan pudriendo los tallos. Esta es la primera vez que solicita un préstamo. Con el dinero comprará el insecticida de nombre sulfato de cobre con cal, que le costara en un aproximado 300 soles cada uno, pero lamentablemente esto no le alcanzará para una hectárea completa.
texts.en:
Ricardo is 61 years old, married, and lives with his wife and daughter. He’s a farmer, and his parents taught him farming starting at a very young age. He has done very well in agriculture, the care of the banana and citrus plantations requires a delicate touch until the fruit are formed. The fruit produce well when he is able to eradicate the fungi that form. In summer they are able to get a good price for tangerines and oranges. The greatest difficulty is that while the fruit are in the process of forming, the fungi known as “cogotera” attack, begin to yellow the leaves, and end up rotting the stems. This is the first time he has requested a loan. With the funds he will buy copper sulfate with lime insecticide. Each container will cost about 300 soles [US$100], but unfortunately this will not be enough to cover a complete hectare.

Translated from Spanish by Diane Lister, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy insecticide for his farm

loans.name: Rufina

texts.es: Rufina tiene 30 años, vive con su pareja, con la que tienen 3 hijos. Se dedica a la compra y venta de plátanos verdes, que los compra en las diversas chacras, para después realizar el proceso de maduración, esto significa que estén listos para el mercado, lo realiza con un líquido diluido en agua, este líquido se compra de acuerdo a la cantidad que se necesite, esta actividad la realiza hace un año y le va muy bien, por semana ya tiene varios pedidos. Ahora, también quiere dedicarse a la venta de ropa, para que cuando vaya a comprar sus plátanos, al mismo tiempo vaya ofreciendo sus prendas, está segura que le ira muy bien, porque la venta de ropa es un negocio rentable porque por las chacras no tiene competidores, y eso le permitirá tener mucha clientela. Este es el primer préstamo con MFP. Con el dinero va a comprar ropa ligera, apropiada para el trabajo del campo.
texts.en:
Rufina is 30 years old, lives with her spouse, and they have 3 children. She earns a living with buying and selling green bananas. She buys the bananas from various farms and then carries out the ripening process so than they are ready to market. The ripening is done with a liquid diluted in water that she buys in quantities as required. She has been working at this activity for one year; it is going very well and she has several orders per week. Now, she also wants to earn money selling clothes, so that when she goes to buy her bananas, at the same time she will offer her clothing. She is certain that this will go very well because clothing sales is a profitable business and at the farms she will not have competitors, and that will allow her to have a large clientele. This is the first loan with MFP. With the money she is going to buy light clothing appropriate for farm work.

Translated from Spanish by Diane Lister, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and then start selling clothing

loans.name: Sarita

texts.es: Sarita tiene 24 años, estudio agroindustrias alimentarias, actualmente vive con su madre y sus hermanos menores. Se dedica a la crianza de cuyes desde hace un año exactamente, su negocio pertenece también a una organización compuesta de 20 socios que están exportando la carne de cuy, y esto requiere de mayor inversión para la alimentación balanceada del cuy y del conejo, sobre todo un lugar apropiado donde criarlos. La carne del cuy es muy rentable porque tiene cero colesterol y ahora ya no puede abastecerse para cumplir los pedidos por la falta de espacio, no tiene donde criarlos en espacio abierto, porque en jaulas los animales se siente incómodos. Es la primera vez que recurre a MFP para solicitar un préstamo. Con este dinero comprará cuyes y conejas de raza, además preparará un lugar adecuado para la crianza.
texts.en:
Sarita is 24 years old and an agricultural food industry student. She currently lives with her mother and younger siblings. She has earned a living through raising guineas pigs for exactly one year, and her business also belongs to a 20-member organization that is exporting guinea pig meat. This requires a greater investment for a balanced diet for the guinea pigs and rabbits, and above all an appropriate place to raise the animals. Guinea pig meat is very profitable because it has zero cholesterol and now she cannot keep up with orders due to a lack of space. She does not have an open space to raise them, and the animals feel uncomfortable in the cages. This is the first time that she has turned to MFP to request a loan. With this money she will buy bred guinea pigs and rabbits, and will also prepare an adequate place to raise them.

Translated from Spanish by Diane Lister, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of guinea pigs and rabbits of better breeding

loans.name: Laura Isabel

texts.es: Hola mi nombre es Laura Isabel H., tengo 3 años de tener este negocio, soy una persona muy trabajadora y mi primer compromiso es mi familia, tengo todas las energias para mejorar y lograr mejores cosas en la vida, de mi dependen 3 hijos, tengo la ayuda de mi esposo para salir adelante con todos los gastos de mi hogar, en estos momentos que se hacerca la navidad tengo que surtir mi negocio ya que las exigencias de mis clientes son mayores, y para este año quiero tener mayor variedad de productos y poder ampliar mi negocio.
texts.en:
Hi, my name is Laura Isabel H.. I've had this business for the past 3 years. I'm a hard-worker. My first priority is my family. I have all the energy to better myself and to obtain better things in life. My 3 children depend on me financially. I have my husband's help to pay all the family's expenses. Since it's getting close to Christmas, I would like to stock up my business to better serve my clients. This year I would like to have a variety of products and be able to expand my business.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es: Silvia tiene 31 años D. edad, tiene 3 hijos, su esposo es docente, y elL. se dedica a L. agricultura. Sus padres fueron agricultores, por ello que está acostumbrada a L. chacra, pero desD. que se casó ya no  siembra en grandes cantidades, porque también tiene que atender a su esposo que trabaja como profesor y en las noches hace taxi y a sus hijos que están en L. etapa escolar. A elL. le agrada L. chacra, siempre está trabajando en frutos cítricos, tiene 4 hectáreas. A su esposo no le agrada L. actividad agrícoL., por ellos padece durante L. cosecha, entonces ha visto conveniente vender sus productos por chacra, así el comprador es el que cosecha. Esto no le deja grandes ganancias, pero sí las necesarias, pero durante las vacaciones D. sus hijos le apoyarán con L. cosecha, esto permitirá obtener mayores ganancias. Este es su cuarto préstamo con MFP. Con el dinero solicitado contratará peones para sus plantaciones D. cítricos y otra parte invertirá en L. reparación D. su carro, con el cual su esposo hace taxi  D. noche.
texts.en:
Silvia is 31 years old and has 3 children. Her husband is a teacher and she earns a living in agriculture. Her parents were farmers and because of this she is accustomed to the farm. However since she married she doesn’t plant in large quantities because she also has to attend to both her husband who works as a teacher and a taxi driver at night, and to her school-age children. She likes farming, has 4 hectares, and is always working in citrus fruits. Agricultural activity does not appeal to her husband, and it is hard on them during the harvest, so it has seemed best to sell her products by the field, where the buyer is the one that harvests. This doesn’t yield large earnings, but the necessary earnings. But during their vacations her children will help her with the harvest and this will allow for better earnings. This is her fourth loan with MFP. With the money requested she will hire laborers for her citrus plantation and with the other part will invest in the repair of their car that her husband uses for the night time taxi service.

Translated from Spanish by Diane Lister, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To hire workers for her farm fields, and furthermore to repair the car her husband uses for taxi service

loans.name: Liz

texts.es: Liz tiene 39 años, por falta de dinero aun no se ha casado, pero vive muchos años ya con su pareja, con la cual tiene tres hijos. En el pasado Liz trabajaba como empleada en casa, pero hace 6 años a decidió ser una trabajadora independiente, buscó un puesto en el mercado de la ciudad donde paga por el espacio suma  de 15 soles, aparte del agua y la luz. Ella se levanta 3 de la madrugada para alistarse y preparar el menú del día, menciona que en estos tiempos la venta no es tan buena, pero la temporada que viene de diciembre hasta julio mejora su venta, es ahí donde al menos puede ahorrar un poco, porque diario gana 150 soles aparte de su capital. Le agrada lo que hace porque le permite educar a sus hijos, su dificultad es cuando le sobra la comida, pierde y su ganancia baja. Este es su préstamo nº 6 con MFP. Su meta es repara y mejorar el puesto donde vende, también pintarlo para que se vea más atractivo. En el futuro seguir ahorrando para comprar motocarros para hacerlas trabajar en transporte de pasajeros.
texts.en:
Liz is 39 years old, and because of a lack of money she is still not married, but has been living with her partner for many years, and they have 3 kids. In the past Liz worked as a domestic employee, but 6 years ago she decided to work independently and she found a store in the market in the city which she paid 15 soles for, excluding electricity and water. She gets up at 3am to get ready and prepare the day's menu, and she mentions that in this season sales are not very good, but from December to July sales improve and at least at that time she will be able to save a bit as she will earn 150 soles daily. She likes what she does because it allows her to educate her kids, the difficulty is when there are lots of leftovers and her earnings get lower. This is her 6th loan with MFP. Her aim is to repair and improve her store, as well as painting it so it looks more attractive. In the future she will keep saving to buy cars to work in public transport.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To improve the appearance of her store where she sells food/Mejorar la apariencia del puesto donde vende comida

loans.name: Wilber

texts.es: Wilber tiene 23 años de edad, actualmente está viviendo con sus padres y sus 5 hermanos. Desde muy niño ha trabajado en la chacra, sus padres desde muy pequeños les enseñaron a trabajar a todos su hijos. En esta temporada se ha dedicado a cavar hoyos para las plantas de plátanos y cítricos. Tiene anhelos que de aquí a 3 años ya pueda cosechar y ganar dinero, le agrada su trabajo en tiempo de cosecha. Por ahora ya cuenta con dinero que le permita satisfacer sus necesidades, sin tanto sacrificio, solo tiene que esperar la cosecha. Lo más dificultoso es no poder contar con su propia movilidad para que pueda transportar sus productos al mercado. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP. Con el dinero comprará plantones de cítricos que le costará un aproximado de 400 soles, también quiere alternar sembrando para la próxima temporada.
texts.en:
Wilber is 23 years old and he currently lives with his parents and 5 siblings. Since he was a young boy he has worked in the farmhouse. His parents taught all their kids to work when they were every young. In this season he has been digging hollows for the plantain and citrus plants. His wish is that by three years time he will be able to harvest them and make money and he likes working at harvest-time. Right now he has some money which allows him to meet his needs without too much sacrifice, he just has to wait for the harvest. The most difficult thing is not being able to have his own means of transport to take the produce to the market. This is his first loan with MFP. With the money he will buy citrus plants which will cost him approximately 400 soles, and he also wants to alternate his crop for next season.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy citrus fruit plants/Compra de plantas de frutas cítricas

loans.name: Dios Es Amor Group

texts.es:
hola nosotras somos el grupo Dios es Amor, todas somos mujeres muy luchadoras, responsables y con muchos deseos de superarnos, somos vecinas y tenemos mucha experiencia es nuestras actividades, nuestro grupo se integra de esta forma:
Claudis T.: soy la coordinadora del grupo, hace 18 meses que inagure mi negocio, yo me dedico a al venta de productos de consumo popular, tengo mucha clientela, de mi negocio depende mi hija, en estos momentos necesito el credito para poder surtir mas mi negocio ya que las ventas son muy buenas y el producto se me termina rapido.
Lourdes se dedica a la venta de lacteos y cosmeticos, ella el credito lo necesita para comprar mercaderia, ya que en estas epocas navideñas se vende mucho las lociones y los cosmeticos.
Zoila F.: se dedica a la venta de tortillas, ella tiene varios años de dedicarse a esta actividad, de ella dependen sus dos hijos.
todas necesitamos el credito para poder salir adelante en nuetsras vidas y hacer crecer nuestros negocios que son la unica fuente de ingresos que tenemos.
texts.en:
Hello, we are the Dios es Amor (God is Love) group. We are all very hard-working, responsible women with the desire for self-improvement. We are neighbors who have lots of experience in our businesses. Our group is comprised of the following members: Claudia T.: “I am the group coordinator. I established my business 18 months ago. I sell basic need items for a living. I have a strong client-base. My daughter depends on this business. At this time, I need the loan in order to fill my business with more merchandise because sales are going well and my products run out quickly.” Lourdes sells dairy products and cosmetics. She needs the loan in order to purchase merchandise because lotion and cosmetic sales increase during the holiday season. Zoila F. sells tortillas for a living. She has been doing so for several years. Her children depend on her. “We all need the loan in order to get ahead in life and to make our business—our sole source of income—grow.”

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
La señora Elsa pertenece al Banco Comunal Nuevo Edén ubicado en el Jr. 7 de Junio s/n, distrito de Yarinacocha, provincial de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 56 años de edad , es madre de 9 hijos, 8 de ellos mayores de edad y uno que aún depende de ella, es casada y su esposo se dedica a la extracción de madera. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de comida.

En la actualidad cuenta con el mismo negocio, trabaja de Lunes a Domingo en el patio de su vivienda desde las 3 hasta las 10 p.m. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará 6 kilos de arroz, 8 pollos, 5 cabezas de cerdo, 10 kilos de pescado, 3 kilos de cecina, etc.

Gracias a Manuela Ramos su negocio ha crecido y también agradece a Dios y a todas las personas que la apoyan.
texts.en:
Señora Elsa belongs to the New Paradise Communal Bank located in the 7th of June neighborhood, district of Yarinacocha, provincial of Colonel Portillo, department of Ucayali. She is 56 years old and a mother of 9 children; 8 of them of legal age and one that still depends on her. She is married and her husband is dedicated to the extraction of wood. With the first loan that she received of Manuela Ramos of 300 soles, she decided to invest in the sale of food.

Currently she relies on the same business. She works from Monday to Sunday on the patio of her dwelling from 3 to 10 p.m.

With this loan of 2,000 soles, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy 6 kilograms of rice, 8 chickens, 5 hogsheads, 10 kilograms of fish, 3 kilograms of jerky, etc.

Thanks to Manuela Ramos her business has grown and also thanks to God and to all the people that support her.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 6 kilograms of rice, 8 chickens, 5 hogsheads, 10 kilograms of fish, 3 kilograms of jerky, etc.  for her food business

loans.name: Floria

texts.es:
La señora Floria pertenece al Banco Comunal Nuevo Edén ubicado en el Jr. Ruperto Pérez Nº 445, distrito de Yarinacocha, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 58 años de edad y es madre soltera de 9 hijos mayores de edad. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de comida.

En la actualidad cuenta con el mismo negocio y con el apoyo de su hija. Este negocio le brinda ganancias que le permite poder pagar su préstamo puntualmente. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,300, cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará 5 kilos de pescado, 6 pollos, 5 kilos de arroz, 5 kilos de cerdo, etc.

Floria es una mujer trabajadora. Agradece al banco comunal por la oportunidad que le brinda para emprender un negocio propio.
texts.en:
Floria belongs to the communal bank Nuevo Edén (“New Eden”), located at # 445 Ruperto Pérez Street in the Yarinacocha district of the Coronel Portillo province, Ucayali. She is 58 years old and the single mother of nine grown children. With the first loan of 300.00 soles that she received from Manuela Ramos, she decided to invest in the sale of food.

Currently, she counts on the same business and the support of her daughter. This business provides earnings which allow her to make her loan payments on time.

With this loan of 1,300.00 soles, to be repaid in four months, she will buy 5 kilos of fish, 6 chickens, 5 kilos of rice, 5 kilos of pork, etc.

Floria is a very hard-working woman. She thanks the communal bank for the opportunity it provides to launch one’s own business.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase 5 kg. of fish, 6 chickens, 5 kg. of rice, 5 kg. of pork, etc.

loans.name: Floripe

texts.es:
La señora Floripe pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Flores de Nuevo Edén ubicado en el Jr. 2 de Mayo Mz. A Lt. 7 AAHH. Nuevo Edén, distrito de Yarinacocha, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 39 años de edad, es madre de 4 hijos, uno mayor de edad y 3 menores de edad que aún dependen de ella, es casada y su esposo  trabaja como mecánico de carros de empresas de transportes. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de comidas típicas. Tiene 3 años trabajando con el banco comunal.

En la actualidad se dedica a la venta de golosinas. Vende en las tardes de 4:30 p.m. hasta las 10 p.m. en diferentes eventos o fiestas. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,700, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará 10 cajetillas de cigarros de diferentes marcas, 4 cajas de galletas, 5 bolsas de caramelos, 3 cajas de chocolates, etc.

Floripe agradece a Manuela Ramos por el apoyo brindado. Tiene el deseo de triunfar en la vida por el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Floripe belongs to the communal bank Las Flores the Nuevo Edén (“The Flowers of New Eden”), located in Nuevo Edén, in the Yarinacocha district of the Coronel Portillo province in Ucayali. She is 39 years old and the mother of four children; one is grown, and the other three are still minors and dependent on her. She is married and her husband works as a car mechanic at a transportation business. With the first loan of 300.00 soles that she received from Manuela Ramos, she decided to invest in the sale of regional foods. She has been working with the communal bank for three years.

Currently, she dedicates herself to the sale of candies. She sells in the afternoons from 4:30 pm until 10:00 pm at different events or parties.

With this loan of 1,700.00 soles, which will be repaid in four months, she will purchase 10 cartons of cigars of different makes, 4 boxes of cookies, 5 bags of caramels, 3 boxes of chocolates, etc.

Floripe thanks Manuela Ramos for the support it provides. She has the wish to triumph in life, for the well-being of her family.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase 10 cartons of cigars, 4 boxes of cookies, 5 bags of caramels, 5 boxes of chocolates, etc.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
La señora Gloria pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Flores de Nuevo Edén ubicado en el Jr. 2 de Mayo Mz. J Lt.7 AAHH. Nuevo Edén, distrito de Yarinacocha, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 53 años de edad, es madre de 4 hijos, 3 mayores de edad y uno que aún depende de ella, es casada y su esposo se dedica al arreglo de zapatos, es zapatero. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de abarrotes. Tiene 8 años trabajando con el banco comunal.

En la actualidad cuenta con una bodega en casa y con el apoyo de su hija. Mientras Gloria se va al mercado por las mañanas su hija atiende su negocio. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará  un saco de arroz, un saco de azúcar, 4 cajas de leche, 3 cajas de jabón, detergentes, gaseosas, etc.

Gloria manifiesta que recibe el apoyo de Manuela Ramos. Agradece a Dios por la vida y salud que le brinda.
texts.en:
Gloria belongs to the communal bank “Flowers of New Eden” located in New Eden (Nuevo Edén), in the district of Yarinacocha, the province of Coronel Portillo, and the department of Ucayali. She is 53 years old and a mother of four, three of whom are adults and one who still depends on her. Gloria is married and her husband works repairing shoes – he is a cobbler. With the first loan that Gloria received from the Kiva micro-lending partner Manuela Ramos (of S/. 300 Nuevos Soles or approximately $100 US), she invested in the sale of groceries. She has been working with the communal bank for eight years.

Currently she runs a general store in her home with the help of her daughter. While Gloria goes to the market in the mornings, her daughter mans the shop.

With this loan of S/.3,000 ($975 US), which will be repaid in four months, Gloria will purchase a bag of rice, a bag of sugar, 4 cases of milk, 3 cases of soap, detergent, soft drinks, etc.

Gloria shares that she receives assistance from Manuela Ramos. She thanks God for life and for the health that she has been given.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will purchase a sack of rice, a sack of sugar, 4 cases of milk, three cases of soap, detergent, and soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Jehova Es Mi Pastor Group

texts.es:
hola nosotras somos el grupo Jehova es mi Pastor, todas somos mujeres y nos conocemos desde hace mucho tiempo atras, somos muy amigas y nos ayududamos una con las otras, nuestro grupo se integra de esta manera:
Maria Luisa Maradiada: soy la coordinadora del grupo, soy madre y estoy casada, me dedico a vender comida y golosinas como ser tacos, enchiladas, baleadas, vendo refrescos de cola, tambien hago desayunos y almuerzos. esta actividad la realizo hace varios años.
Ana A.: ella se dedica a vender golosinas en el mismo lugar donde vive, asi no descuida su hogar, ella es madre de una niña y esta casada.
Maria de la Paz H.: ella es una señora casada y tiene hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva, la cual vende en eu casa desde hace varios años, con esta actividad ella ayuda a su esposo a salir adelante.
Etelvina M.: ella vive en la aldea de Lajero Blanco, es madre de un niño y es casada, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva, ella tambien le ayuda a su esposo con los gastos del hogar.
todas nosotras necesitamos el credito ya que viene la temporada de navidad y es muy buena para la venta de ropa.
texts.en:
Hi, we are the group called Jehova is my Pastor. We're all women and we've known each other for a very long time. We're friends and we help each other. Our group is made up of the following: Maria Luisa Maradiada who is the group coordinator. "I'm a mother and I'm married. I sell snacks and fast-food such as tacos, enchiladas, dessert and Coca-Cola soft drinks. I also sell breakfast and lunch. I've been doing this for many years." Ana A. sells snacks out of her home. This way she can take care of her children. She has a daughter and she's married. Maria de la Paz H.: She's married and has children. She sells brand new clothes out of her home for many years. She helps her husband with the bills. Etelvina Mardiaga: she lives in Lajero Blanco. She's a mother to a little boy and she's married. She sells brand new clothes. She also helps her husband pay the family expenses. We all need this loan since Christmas is aproaching and it's a good time to sell clothes.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase materials and merchandise

loans.name: Katy Karina

texts.es:
La señora Katy pertenece al Banco Comunal Nuevo Edén, ubicado en el Jr. Callería Nº 670, distrito de Yarinacocha, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 29 años de edad, es madre de  hijas menores de edad que aún dependen de ella, es casada y su esposo es independiente en su trabajo. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de pescado.

En la actualidad cuenta con el mismo negocio, la venta de pescado. Trabaja de Lunes a Sábado de 6 a.m. a 7 p.m. y los Domingos de 6 a.m. a 1 p.m. 

Con este préstamo de S/1,000, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará 4 bandejas de pescado para vender a sus clientes.  

Katy se siente feliz porque pertenece a un banquito comunal de mujeres trabajadoras y responsables. Desea seguir surgiendo en la vida.
texts.en:
Katy belongs to the Community Bank 'Nuevo Eden', located in the Jr Calleria No 670, in the district of Yarinacocha, in the province of Coronel Portillo, in the department of Ucayali. She is 29 years old and she has young kids who depend on her. She is married and her husband is independent in his work. With the first loan that she received from Manuela Ramos of 300 soles, she decided to invest in selling fish.

Currently she has the same business - selling fish. She works from Monday to Saturday from 6am to 7pm and Sundays from 6am - 1pm.

With this loan of 1000 soles, which she will repay over a period of 4 months, she will buy 4 trays of fish to sell to her clients.

Katy is happy because she belongs to a community bank for hard-working and responsible women. She wants to keep going on in life.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy 4 trays of fish/Comprará 4 bandejas de pescado.

loans.name: Keyla

texts.es:
La señora Keyla pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Flores de Nuevo Edén ubicado en el Jr. Francisco del Águila Mz. D Lt. 1 AAHH. Nuevo Edén, distrito de Yarinacocha, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 29 años de edad, es madre de 2 hijos menores de edad que aún dependen de ella, es casada y su esposo se dedica a la extracción de madera. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de pescado. Tiene 4 años trabajando con el banco comunal.

En la actualidad se dedica a la venta de madera y cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo. Este negocio le brinda ganancias que le permite poder pagar su préstamo con puntualidad. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 2,500, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará 3 bidones de combustibles, arreglará su bote, el cual es su herramienta de trabajo, etc.

Keyla se siente contenta porque ha logrado mejorar su negocio y la estabilidad económica de su familia.
texts.en:
Keyla belongs to the Community Bank 'Las Flores del Nuevo Eden', located in Jr Francisco del Aguila Mz D Lt 1 AAHH Nuevo Eden, in the district of Yarinacocha, province of Coronel Portillo, in the department of Ucayali. She is 29 years old and she has 2 young kids who depend on her. She is married and her husband is a woodsman. With the first loan that she received from Manuela Ramos of 300 soles, she decided to invest in selling fish. She has worked with the community bank for 4 years.

She currently sells wood and needs support from her husband. This business gives her earnings which allow her to repay her loan on time.

With this loan of 2500 soles, which she will repay over a period of 4 months, she will buy 3 barrels of fuel, she will fix up her boat which is what she works with etc.

Keyla is happy as she has managed to improve her business and her family's economic stability.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy 3 barrels of fuel and fix up her boat/Comprará 3 bidones de combustible, arreglará su bote, etc.

loans.name: Edith

texts.es: Edith tiene 21 años, convive con su pareja y sus tres hijos Noemí de 6, Yuri de 4 y Roni de 2. Es una joven madre que trabaja muy duro para brindarles a sus hijos un mejor futuro, es así que desde hace 6 años incursionó en el negocio de la venta de combustible con ayuda de su pareja. A Edith se le hace muy gratificante su trabajo, ya que los 6 años de experiencia le han dado ganas de crecer y seguir progresando,  siendo este un negocio muy rentable, ya que tiene muchos clientes, los cuales se han hecho asiduos a su pequeño puesto ambulatorio, lo único complicado es tener que estar constantemente inhalando el olor del combustible que algunas veces llega a marearla, pero estos inconvenientes son mínimos, sabiendo Edith sobrellevarlos. Este es su primer préstamo en Microfinanzas Prisma y es muy puntual en los pagos. Con el dinero solicitado comprará más combustible para poder vender y aumentar sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Edith is 21 years old, and lives with her partner and three children: Noemí who is 6 years old, Yuri who is 4, and Roni, 2 years of age. She is a young mother who works very hard to provide a brighter future for her children. It’s for this reason that, six years ago, she started in the business of selling combustible/fuel with the help of her partner. Her work is very gratifying for Edith given that the six years of experience has made her want to grow her enterprise and continue to progress. It is a very profitable business, and she has many customers who have made themselves regulars at her small ambulatory post. The only complication is that she has to constantly inhale the fuel fumes that, at times, make her dizzy. But these inconveniences are minimal, and Edith knows how to endure them. This is her first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma, and she is very punctual with the payments. With the funds sought, she will buy more fuel to sell and increase her income.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the quantity of combustible/fuel that she sells.

loans.name: Laura

texts.es:
La señora Laura pertenece al Banco Comunal Nuevo Edén, ubicado en el Jr. Callería Nº 670, distrito de Yarinacocha, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 68 años de edad, es madre de 4 hijos mayores de edad, es casada y su esposo es independiente en su trabajo. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de abarrotes.

En la actualidad cuenta con un galpón de crianza de pollos. Tiene el apoyo de su esposo para la administración de su negocio.  

Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará 300 pollos y alimentos para su crecimiento (un saco de inicio, crecimiento y engorde). 

Laura es una mujer luchadora, emprendedora y trabajadora. Agradece a Dios por cuidar de ella y de su familia.
texts.en:
Laura belongs to the Community Bank 'Nuevo Eden', located on the Jr Calleria No 670, in the district of Yarinacocha, in the province of Coronel Portillo, in the department of Ucayali. She is 68 years old and has 4 kids who are over 18. She is married and her husband works independently. With the first loan that she received from Manuela Ramos of 300 soles, she decided to invest in selling groceries.

Currently she has a shed for rearing chickens. She has the support of her husband for her business' administration.

With the loan of 2000 soles, which she will repay over a period of 4 months, she will buy 300 chickens and food for them (a sack of starter, growth and fattening food).

Laura is a fighter and an industrious and hard-working woman. She thanks God for looking after her and her family.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy 300 chickens and food for them to grow/Comprará 300 pollos y alimentos para su crecimiento.

loans.name: Fe Y Esperanza Group

texts.es: hola nosotras somos el grupo Fe y Esperanza en nuestro grupo existe una cualidad las cual es que todas somos muy amigas casi hermanas diria yo, y otra cualidad es que somos muy luchadoras, estamos ubicadas en santa cruz de marcovia, cada una de nosotras contamos con nuestro propio negocio, como ser la venta de tortillas, venta de refrescos, venta de ropa y pulperia, nosotras desarrollando nuestras actividades hemos logrado salir adelante con nuestros hogares, hemos logrado brindarles a nuestros hijos educacion, vivienda, alimentacion y otras necesidades que se nos presentan, con estas actividades contribuimos al desarrollo familiar, con esto ayudamos a nuestros esposos para que salgamos adelante juntos. ahora necesitamos el credito para comprar mucha mercaderia ya que en las epocas de navidad las ventas de ropa son muy buenas y tenemos muchos clientes en nuestra comunidad.
texts.en:
Hi, we're the group called Faith and Hope. One of the greatest quality of our group is that we're all friends, almost like sisters. Another great quality about our group is that we are hard workers. We're located in Santa Cruz de Marcovia. We all have our own businesses such as selling tortillas, selling refreshments, selling clothes and managing a small store. By doing this, we have all been able to move ahead by been able to provide an education to our children, having a roof over our heads, food on the table and other neccessities. We are able to contribute to the well-being of our families and we're able to help our husbands so that we can both move ahead in life. We currently need the loan to purchase lots of merchandise since Christmas is fast approaching and this is when we sell the most, especially selling clothes, to our clients in our community.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Madeleine

texts.es:
La señora Madeleine pertenece al Banco Comunal Nuevo Edén ubicado en el Jr. Callería Nº 751, distrito de Yarinacocha, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 40 años de edad, es madre de 2 hijas, menores de edad que aún dependen de ella, es casada y su esposo trabaja como comerciante. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de abarrotes.

En la actualidad cuenta con una bodega en casa y tiene el apoyo de sus hijas y de su esposo. Se dedica a su negocio y al cuidado de su hogar. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará un saco de arroz, un saco de azúcar, dos cajas de leche, etc.

Madeleine manifiesta que todo lo que ha logrado es producto de su habilidad y esfuerzo. Agradece al banco comunal por la ayuda brindada.
texts.en:
Madeleine belongs to the Community Bank 'Nuevo Eden', located in the Jr Calleria No 751, in the district of Yarinacocha, in the province of Coronel Portillo, in the department of Ucayali. She is 40 years old and has 2 kids who are young and depend on her. She is married and her husband is a salesman. With the first loan that she received from Manuela Ramos of 300 soles, she decided to invest in groceries.

She currently has a store in her house and her daughters and husband support her. She dedicates herself to her business and looking after her home.

With this loan of 1000 soles, which she will repay over a period of 4 months, she will buy a sack of rice, a sack of sugar, 2 cartons of milk etc.

Madeleine states that everything she has achieved is a product of her skill and effort. She thanks the community bank for the support they have offered her.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy a sack of rice, a sack of sugar, 2 cartons of milk etc/Comprará un saco de arroz, un saco de azúcar, dos cajas de leche, etc.

loans.name: Martha Luz

texts.es:
La señora Martha pertenece al Banco Comunal Nuevo Edén, ubicado en el Jr. Aguaytía Nº 441, distrito D. Yarinacocha, provincia D. Coronel Portillo, departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 49 años D. edad, es madre D. 2 hijos mayores D. edad, es casada y su esposo trabaja como fotógrafo profesional. Con el primer préstamo que recibió D. Manuela Ramos D. S/. 300 deciD. invertir en la venta D. pasamanería.

En la actualidad se dedica a la venta D. pasamanería y cuenta con una fotocopiadora en casa. Este negocio le brinda ganancias que le permite pagar su préstamo con puntualidad. 

Con este préstamo D. S/. 2,000, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará 6 cajas D. lapicero, 4 docenas D. cuadernos, 3 docenas D. papel lustre, arreglará la fotocopiadora, etc.

Martha se siente feliz con todo lo que ha logrado. Gracias al apoyo del banco comunal su estabilidad económica ha mejorado.
texts.en:
Martha belongs to the Nuevo Eden (New Eden) Communal Bank, located on #441 Jr. Aguaytia, Yarinacocha district, Coronel Portillo province, Ucayali department. She is 49 years old, is the mother of 2 grown-up children ans she is married. Her husband works as a professional photographer. With the first loan that she received from Manuela Ramos of 300 soles (Peruvian currency) she decided to invested in selling stationery and school supplies.

Currently, she is dedicated to sell stationery and school supplies and has a copy machine at home. This business proviD. her earnings that allow her to pay her loan back on time.

With this loan of 2,000 soles (Peruvian currency), which will be paid back in 4 months, Martha will buy 6 boxes of ballpoint pens, 4 dozen notebooks, 3 dozens of luster paper, fixing the copy machine, etc.

Martha feels happy with everything that she has been able to accomplish. Thanks to the support of the communal bank her economic stability has improved.


Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Will buy 6 boxes of ballpoint pens, 4 dozen notebooks, 3 dozensof luster paper and will fix the copy machine.

loans.name: Norma Luz

texts.es:
La señora Norma pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Flores de Nuevo Edén ubicado en AAHH. Teodoro Binder 1 Mz. A Lt.3, distrito de Yarinacocha, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 29 años de edad, es madre de 5 hijos menores de edad que aún dependen de ella, es casada y su esposo trabaja de manera independiente. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de abarrotes. Tiene 2 años trabajando con el banco comunal.

En la actualidad cuenta con una pequeña bodega en casa. Se dedica a su hogar y a la atención de su negocio.

Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará ½ saco de arroz, una caja de leche, ½ saco de azúcar, etc.

Norma se siente contenta porque gracias a la ayuda de Manuela Ramos su negocio será ampliado y tendrá la oportunidad de apoyar a sus pequeños hijos.
texts.en:
Norma belongs to the Las Flores de Nuevo Eden (The Flowers of the New Eden) Communal Bank located in AAHH. Teodoro Binder 1 Mz. A Lt. 3, Yarinacocha district, Coronel Portillo province, Ucayali department. She is 29 years old, has 5 young children that still depend on her. She is married and her husband works independently. With the first loan that she received from Manuela Ramos of 300 soles (Peruvian currency), Norma decided to invested in selling groceries. She has been working with the communal bank for 2 years.

Currently, she has a small grocery store at home. She takes care of her home and tends to her business. With this loan of 2,000 soles (Peruvian currency), which will be paid back in 4 months, she will buy 1/2 sack of rice, 1 box of canned milk, 1/2 sack of sugar, etc.

Norma feels happy because thanks to the help from Manuela Ramos her business will expand and she will have the opportunity to support her young children.


Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying 1/2 sack of rice, 1 box of canned milk, 1/2 sack of sugar, etc.

loans.name: Rosa Corina

texts.es:
La señora Rosa pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Flores D. Nuevo Edén ubicado en el PSJ Virgen D. Lourdes Mz. A Lt. 6 AAHH. Nuevo Edén, distrito D. Yarinacocha, provincia D. Coronel Portillo, departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 45 años D. edad, es madre D. 6 hijos, 2 D. ellos mayores D. edad y 4 que aún depenD. D. ella, es casada y su esposo se dedica a la extracción D. madera. Con el primer préstamo que recibió D. Manuela Ramos D. S/. 300 deciD. invertir en la venta D. madera. Tiene 5 años trabajando con el banco comunal.

En la actualidad cuenta con el mismo negocio, viaja con su esposo a extraer madera para luego venderla a sus clientes. Este negocio le brinda ganancias que le permiten pagar su préstamo con puntualidad.  

Con este préstamo D. S/. 2,300, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará 4 bidones D. combustible y construirá dos botes para ampliar más su negocio D. madera.

Gracias a la ayuda del banco comunal su negocio ha mejorado y también le brinda la oportunidad D. darles una mejor educación a sus queridos hijos.
texts.en:
Rosa belongs to the Las Flores D. Nuevo Eden (The Flowers of New Eden) Communal Bank located in the PSJ Virgen D. Lourdes Mz. A Lt. 6 AAHH. Nuevo Eden, Yarinacocha district, Coronel Portillo province, Ucayali department. She is 45 years old and has 6 children; two of them are grown-ups and 4 still depend on her for support. She is married and her husband works on wood extraction. With the first loans that she received from Manuela Ramos of 300 soles (Peruvian currency), she decided to invest it on selling wood. She has been working with the communal bank for 5 years.

Currently, she still running the same business. She travels with her husband to extract wood to sell it to her customers afterwards. This business offer her earnings that allow her to pay the loan on time.

With this loan of 2,300 soles (Peruvian currency), which will be paid back in 4 months, Rosa will buy 4 drums of gasoline and she will build 2 boats to expand her wood business more.

Thanks to the communal bank's help, her business has improved and also has given her the opportunity to proviD. her dear children with a better education.


Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy 4 drums of gasolines and will build a pair of boats.

loans.name: Fortunita

texts.en: Fortunita D. L. C. P. is a member of community bank Las Gaviotas, which means “the seagulls” in Spanish. Fortunita lives with her husband and their three children who are all in school. With the help of her brother, Fortunita sells videos, cassettes and DVDs. With her loan of 400 soles, she will invest in her business by purchasing more videos, cassettes and DVDs. She is saving to be able to continue investing in her business. She also dreams of opening another store and having another business.

loans.use: Purchasing more videos, cassettes and DVDs

loans.name: Genara

texts.es:
La señora Genara, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres al Progreso D. la provincia D. Yungay.

Ella tiene 48 años, D. su matrimonio ha tenido 5 hijos y que con el apoyo D. su esposo que es empleado público también ha podido educar a sus hijos e iniciar su negocio, debido a que su mayor dificultad fue no tener un trabajo con el cual ella pudiera apoyar a su esposo, es por esta razón que inició su negocio en el campo ferial D. Yungay en el stand Nº 13, donD. día a día venD. sus productos D. ferretería, comenta que ha crecido mucho porque inició su negocio con s/.1000.00  y ahora comenta que tiene invertido en toda su ferretería un monto aproximado D. s/ 100 000.00, ella viaja hasta la ciudad D. lima para poder abastecerse D. sus productos o D. lo contrario hace los pedidos desD. la ciudad capital.

Con este préstamo D. S/. 3,000.00, el cual cancelará en 8 cuotas, comprará tubos, chapas, candados y accesorios D. agua y desagüe.

Ella menciona que le gustaría capacitarse en cuestiones D. crecimiento D. negocio así mismo agradece al movimiento Manuela Ramos, por haberla apoyado en el crecimiento D. su negocio.

loans.use: compra de tubos, chapas, candados, accesorios, etc.

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.es:
Narcisa tiene 30 años, es madre soltera de tres hijos Mayela de 9, Everson de 7 y Marisol de 4. Se dedica a la venta de verduras de manera ambulatoria para poder sacar adelante a sus tres hijos, los cuales cursan sus estudios primarios y requieren cada vez de mucho más cosas y por ende de mayores gastos.
Lo que agradece Narcisa es que el negocio va progresando, haciendo que ella quiera expenderse mucho más, lo complicado está en que al ser la verduras alimentos perecibles, tiene que vender toda su mercadería en el día y no puede guardarla, haciendo que si le sobra mercadería la tenga que consumir ella misma, o dejar que perezca, lo cual sucede muy pocas veces, ya que en su mayoría termina la venta de todas las verduras. Narcisa se encuentra en el primer préstamo con MFP siendo ella una cliente muy puntual. Con el dinero comprará mayor cantidad de verduras para comercializar en su puesto.
texts.en:
Narcisa is a 30-year-old single mother of three, Mayela (9), Everson (7), and Marisol (4). She works as a street vendor selling vegetables in order to give her children a good start in life. They are currently in primary school and always need more and more things, which requires more spending. Narcisa would be grateful if her business could keep expanding, allowing her to sell much more. The problem is that since she sells perishable vegetables, she must sell all her products in one day and cannot store any. This means that she must consume all the leftover merchandise herself or leave it to spoil, which happens infrequently as she generally sells all of her vegetables. Narcisa is requesting her first loan from MFP and is a very punctual client. With the money she will buy more vegetables to sell from her cart.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Martyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of vegetables for resale

loans.name: Aurora

texts.es:
La señora Aurora pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Esmeraldas ubicado en la Av. Aviación Mz. A Lt. 14 AAHH. El Encanto, distrito de Callería, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 34 años, es madre de 3 hijos menores de edad que aún dependen de ella, es casada y su esposo se dedica a la pesca. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de pescado. Tiene 3 años trabajando con el banco comunal.

En la actualidad cuenta con el mismo negocio y con 2 botes pescadores. Trabaja con la ayuda de su esposo. Sus ganancias han aumentando en estos últimos meses.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará 60 kilos de pescado de diferente calidad.

Aurora manifiesta felicidad porque todo lo que ha logrado es gracias a su esfuerzo y voluntad para el trabajo.
texts.en:
Ms. Aurora A. is a member of the Las Esmeraldas (The Emeralds) microfinance institute, located on Aviación Avenue, Block A, Lot 14 AAHH, El Encanto, district of Callería, in the Coronel Portillo province of the department of Ucayali. She is a 34-year-old mother of three underage children. Her husband is a fisherman. She decided to invest her first 300.00 PEN loan from Manuela Ramos in fish sales. She has been working with this microfinance institute for 3 years. She currently owns this business, along with 2 fishing vessels. She works with the help of her husband. Their profits have increased over the past few months. With this 1,500.00 PEN loan, which will be repaid in 5 months, she will purchase 60 kilograms of different types of fish. Aurora expresses her joy because everything that she has achieved is due to her efforts and her willingness to work.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase 60 kilograms of fish

loans.name: Lina

texts.es:
La señora Lina pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Esmeraldas ubicado en el Jr. Ucayali Nº 150, distrito de Callería, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 56 años de edad, es madre de 3 hijos mayores de edad, es casada y su esposo trabaja como mecánico de máquinas pesadas. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de golosinas. Tiene 3 años trabajando con el banco comunal.

En la actualidad cuenta con la venta de productos de belleza (UNIQUE) y tiene el apoyo de su esposo para los gastos del hogar.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,400, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará productos de belleza (colonias para bebes, cremas de manos y cuerpos, etc.).  

Lina agradece a todas esas personas que lo apoyan, sobre todo a Dios por darle vida y salud.
texts.en:
Lina belongs to the Las Esmeraldas (The Emeralds) Communal Bank located in the Jr. Ucayali #150, Calleria district, Coronel Portillo province, Ucayali department. She is 56 years old, mother to 3 grown-up children, and married. Her husband works as a heavy machinery mechanic. With the first loan that she received from Manuela Ramos of 300 soles (Peruvian currency), she decided to invest in selling sweets and candies. She has been working with the communal bank for 3 years.

Currently, she sells beauty products(UNIQUE) and she counts with her husband's support for the household expenses. With this loan of 1,400 soles (Peruvian currency), which will be paid back in 5 months, she will buy beauty products (colognes for babies, creams for the body and hands, etc.)

Lina thanks all the people that supports her but she thanks God above everything for giving her life and health.


Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy colognes for babies, creams for hand and body, etc.

loans.name: María Bertola

texts.es:
La señora Maria pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Esmeraldas ubicado en el Jr. José Balta Mz. E Lt. 3 AAHH. San Juan del Ucayali, distrito de Yarinacocha, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 62 años de edad, es madre de 12 hijos mayores de edad, es casada y su esposo trabaja como agricultor (pequeño ganadero). Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de productos de belleza. Tiene 5 años trabajando con el banco comunal.

En la actualidad cuenta con un galpón de crianza de pollos. Este negocio le brinda ganancias que le permite cumplir con su pago del préstamo. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará 500 pollos y alimentos para su crecimiento (un saco de inicio, crecimiento y engorde).  

Maria es una mujer trabajadora quien desea seguir adelante con la bendición de Dios y la ayuda del banco comunal.
texts.en:
Maria belongs to Las Esmeraldas (The Emeralds) Communal Bank located in the Jr. Jose Balta Mz. E Lt. 3 AAHH. San Juan del Ucayali, Yarinacocha distrcit, Coronel Portillo province, Ucayali department. She is 62 years old. She is also the mother of 12 grown-up children. She is married and her husband works as a farmer (small cattle farmer). With the first loan that she received from Manuela Ramos of 300 soles (Peruvian currency), she decided to invest it in selling beauty products. She has been working with the communal bank for 5 years.

Currently, she has a shed where she raises chickens. This business provides her with the money that allows her to pay her loan on time. With this loan of 2,000 soles (Peruvian currency), which will be paid in 5 months, she will buy 500 chickens and feed for their growth (one sack at the beggining for growth and fattening).

Maria is a hard working woman who wishes to keep going with God's blessing and the help from the communal bank.


Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Will buy 500 chickens and feed for their growth.

loans.name: Mayra  Eunice

texts.es:
MAYRA ES UNA GRAN MUJER RESPONSABLE, CON UN GRAN CORAZON Y UNAS INMENSAS GANAS DE SALIR ADELANTE 
ELLA LABORA PARA UNA COMPAÑÍA IMPORTANTE COMO SECRETARIA, SOLICITA ESTE CREDITO PARA LA COMPRA DE UNIFORMES DE SU HIJO YA QUE SE LOS ESTAN PIDIENDO EN LA ESCUELA; MAYRA ESTA BUSCANDO UN MEJOR FUTURO PARA SU HIJO Y ES POR ELLO QUE DIA TRAS DIA LO ESTA LOGRANDO.
texts.en:
Mayra is a very responsible woman with a big heart and immense desire to succeed. She works as a secretary for an important company. She requests this loan to buy school uniforms for her son. Mayra wants a better future for her son, and for this reason she works hard day after day.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase school uniforms

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es: Rocio tiene 20 años, es soltera y vive en una casa alquilada con su madre. Al ver Rocío que su madre siempre ha trabajado por su bienestar, optó por ayudarla y dedicarse a la venta de ajos, desde 5 años atrás, decidiéndose por este rubro, ya que ella trae gran cantidad de ajos al por mayor y los vende por bolsitas, lo cual hace que la venta sea satisfactoria. No se le hace complicado realizar su trabajo, ya que es una chica joven con muchas ansias de superación. Este es su primer préstamo en Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de ajos para continuar vendiéndolos y sacar mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Rocio is 20 years old, single, and lives with her mother in a rented home. Seeing that her mother had always worked for her well-being, Rocio decided to help her out and began selling garlic five years ago. She gets large quantities of garlic wholesale and sells them in small bags so her sales will be satisfactory. It has not been difficult for her to do this work as she is a young girl who is eager to improve herself. This is her first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. With the money she has requested, she will buy more garlic in order to continue selling and make higher profits.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Martyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of garlic for resale

loans.name: Edwin

texts.es: Edwin tiene 22 años, es soltero y vive en la casa con su madre y hermanos. Gracias al apoyo de su madre trabaja actualmente en la venta de aceites, aceitunas y mermeladas, actividad que realiza desde hace 1 año para poder solventar sus gastos, así como para ayudar en su hogar. En el año que lleva trabajando en esta actividad ha podido observar que  el negocio da buenas ganancias, dándole ánimos para seguir adelante y obtener mayor capital. A Edwin no se le hace complicado realizar su trabajo, ya que cada vez se va haciendo más diestro a la hora de comercializar sus productos.  Es su 1er préstamo solicitado en Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero comprará más aceite y así poder aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Edwin is 22 years old, single, and lives in the house with his mother and brothers. Thanks to his mother’s support, he currently works selling oils, olives, and marmalades. He has undertaken this activity for the past year, in order to meet his expenses and also to help out the household financially. In the year that he has been working in this enterprise he has been able to observe that the business provides good income, which has animated him to forge ahead and obtain more capital. For Edwin, it has not been difficult to realize this work since over time he has become more skilled at selling his products. This is the first loan he is requesting with Microfinanzas Prisma. With the funds, he will buy more oil which will allow him to increase his sales.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a greater quantity of oil to sell.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana tiene 21 años, vive en casa de sus padres. Es una muchacha muy trabajadora, se dedica desde hace 3 años a realizar trabajos de Artesanía, arte que aprendió de su madre, la cual le enseño desde niña los singulares bordados que realiza. Lo que le gusta a Juana de su trabajo es que ella puede dar rienda suelta a su imaginación cuando realiza cada uno de estos trabajos, pero no es tan fácil como parece, ya que debe dedicarle tiempo y mucha precisión, lo cual hace que la clientela prefiera su trabajo, resultándole muy rentable, ya que las ventas cada vez son mejores. Este es su primer préstamo en Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero solicitado Juana comprará material para seguir realzando sus bordados e incursionar en otro tipo artesanías.
texts.en:
Juana is 21 years old and lives at home with her parents. She is a very hardworking young woman and has worked for the past 3 years making handicrafts. She learned this from her mother, who has taught her this unique embroidery since childhood. Juana likes that her work allows her imagination to run free when she creates a piece, but it's not as easy as it looks. She requires a lot of time and precision, which is why her clients prefer her work. Because of this her work is very profitable and her sales are getting better and better. This is her first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. With the money requested Juana will buy material to continue her embroidery and expand into other types of craftwork.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Martyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing materials for embroidery

loans.name: Nurali

texts.en:
Nurali B. is 53 years old and is married with three children. Nurali works in agriculture and has always been efficient in his labors. For the past 6 years, he has grown potatoes, onion and wheat. Nurali's dream is to educate all of his children and to ensure them a bright future. 

Nurali would like a loan of 2000 Somoni ($600 USD) for the term of 12 months so that he can buy seed and mineral fertilizer. Part of the loan will be spent for the hired workers and transportation.

loans.use: To purchase seed and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Bobomurod

texts.en:
S. Bobomurod is 30 years old. He is married with two adorable children. Bobomurod has always opted to make his life in his land, and work hard and grow with it. That is how he decided to rear cows and dedicated himself to agriculture. He has been doing this kind of work for a very long time, for he comes from a family with an entirely agricultural background.

Today he wishes to increase the number of his cattle and for this reason he would like to buy cows. He hopes to increase his income and the well-being of his home with the innumerable benefits that these special animals provide him. That’s why he is requesting a loan of 1700 Somoni (US$500) for the term of 12 months.

Extend your solidarity to Bobomurod so that he can move forth successfully and accomplish all his goals.

loans.use: Purchasing of the small cattle to expand the business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase yames, potatoes and additional staple foods.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy kerosene and fuel

loans.name: Akuwa

texts.en: Mrs. A. is the leader of a group called UNION. She is receiving the loan on behalf of the whole group. The group is composed of three dynamic women, who are Batchassi Pierrette, A. Akouwa and Passai Celestine. Like A., the other members of the group also specialize in charcoal businesses. The entire group is requesting a loan of 900 dollars, to share the total amount equally among the three members. Because the market is flourishing and they have been selling charcoal for years, they are sure that they could sell and make some profit. They will use half of the profit of each month for their families' basic needs (food, particularly) and the other half to pay back the loan. They estimate to pay back the total amount within 18 months. Thank you for supporting their small businesses.

loans.use: To buy charcoal from a rural area and sell it in town

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy maize and additional food products

loans.name: Gulbahar

texts.en: Gulbahar (her husband is pictured) is a mother of 3 children. She lives in the Khachmaz region the Gusarchay village. 6 years ago, this family start this business. They sell fruits, vegetables and nuts. They buy walnuts and hazelnuts to prepare for selling. Gulbahar was born in 1966. Now this family need a loan of 970 AZN to buy fruits, vegetables, walnuts and hazelnuts.

loans.use: to buy fruits, vegetables, walnuts and hazelnuts

loans.name: Helida

texts.en:
Helida A. O., a 30-year-old resident of Rongo, Kenya, has operated a dressmaking business located on a side street off the main market for five years. The soft hum from four sewing machines fills the air of the shop, and the tin walls are hung with fashion patterns and a variety of colored cloth. Three other women also work in the shop – Helida is currently training two of them.

Her enterprise is doing well, and twice a month she travels to Nairobi, which is about six to eight hours by bus, to purchase the cloth and materials she needs.

Helida is requesting a loan to purchase two more sewing machines, thereby increasing her total to six, as well as sewing supplies. In the future, she hopes to move to a bigger building in order to keep up with the expansion of her business and the demands of her customers.

Helida, married with three children, also supports two orphans and her grandmother. She uses the profits from her business to pay for school fees and living expenses. Helida is a dedicated businesswoman committed to the continual expansion of her dressmaking shop.

loans.use: To purchase two sewing machines and sewing materials

loans.name: Osman

texts.en: Osman (his wife is pictured) lives in the Khachmaz region in the Kohna-Khacmaz village. He was born in 1950. This family has run this business for 4 years. Osman has 3 children. Now the O. family need a loan of 970 AZN to buy clothes, shoes, bags and perfumes for improving their business.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes, bags and perfumery

loans.name: Zabit

texts.en: Zabit was born in 1983. He lives in Khachmaz town and is single. This man transports foodstuffs to villages for sale. 2 years ago he started this business. Now he needs a loan of 970 AZN to buy spare parts for this car for improving his business.

loans.use: to buy the spare parts for this car

loans.name: Jenipha

texts.en:
Jenipha A. O. has been selling shoes in Rongo, Kenya for three years. Shoes of many types and sizes are laid out on sacking near the entrance to a busy street where people walking to the market can stop to browse the selection.

In addition to selling shoes, Jenipha plans to build a brick-making business at her home on the land she owns. For about five years, she has been making bricks herself, but now wants to expand it into a larger business that will see her hire 15 people to make the bricks and purchase a machine that will aid in the process. Ideally, Jenipha will hire someone to take over for her in selling the shoes and she will be able to oversee the brick making processes.

Jenipha is requesting a loan to help her purchase the brick-making machine, pay the salaries of her future workers, and buy more shoes to increase her inventory.

As a widow, Jenipha is the sole breadwinner for seven children - two are her own and the other five are orphans who she also cares for. She says that she would like to be able to provide more for them, so she hopes that by expanding into a brick-making business she will increase her profits.

loans.use: To help pay for a brick-making machine, the salaries of workers, and shoes for her other business

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela A. O. has been selling women’s used clothing in Rongo, Kenya for eight years, varying her location between two local markets in order to reach more of the community. Twice a month, she takes a bus to Nairobi to purchase additional stock.

Pamela is requesting a loan both to increase her inventory of clothing and allow her to offer more choices to her customers. She wants to increase her revenue so that in the future she can have an even larger stock of clothing to sell.

Pamela and her husband provide for three children of their own as well as two orphans. Three of the children are in school, while the other two have completed their schooling, one now learning the craft of tailoring while the other works in town.

loans.use: To purchase more women's used clothing.

loans.name: Djiguissèmè Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Djiguissèmè (4 mariées et 2 veuves) ont en moyenne 45 ans, 3 enfants et vivent dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le quartier Ganabougou de la préfecture de Yanfolila (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Unies par des relations de parenté et de voisinage, elles ont décidé de nouer un partenariat avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant 5 ans. Elles sont à leur dizième prêt et tous les prêts anterieurs ont été remboursés sans difficulté.
Le prêt actuel permettra d’acheter, 20 sacs de maïs et d’arachide, 400 kg d’oignons (frais et séchés), et une importante quantité de condiments. Les  vendeuses de céréales s’approvisionnent sur place (surtout les Mardi jour de foire) à Yanfolila auprès des producteurs venant des villages environnants. Pour les vendeuses de condiments alimentaires, elles se ravitaillent chaque semaine à Sikasso auprès des grossistes de cette localité.
Ces articles sont revendus au détail, au comptant et quelques fois à crédit à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes de la ville de Yanfolila.
De ce commerce chacune des membres du groupe espère réaliser un bénéfice par cycle de 50.000 FCFA.qui leur permettra de rembourser les intérêts du prêt et subvenir à certaines dépenses du foyer telles que la scolarité des enfants, les soins de santé et l’habillement. Les membres de Djiguissèmè veulent à l’avenir ouvrir des magasins de stockage et de vente de céréales et de condiments alimentaires à Yanfolila.
texts.en:
The members of Djiguissèmè group (four married and two widows) are on average 45 years old, have 3 children, and live in traditional extended families in the Ganabougou neighborhood of Yanfolila prefecture (the third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Joined together by family and neighborhood ties, the women decided to establish a partnership with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso five years ago. They are now on their tenth loan and all previous loans have been reimbursed without problems. The current loan will allow them to buy 20 bags of corn and peanuts, 400 kg of onions (fresh and dried), and a significant amount of seasonings. The grain retailers get their supplies on-site (especially on Tuesdays, market day) in Yanfolila from producers coming from surrounding villages. The seasoning sellers get their supplies each week in Sikasso from wholesalers in that area. These items are resold as retail, for cash, and sometimes on credit to customers who are mostly women from the town of Yanfolila. From their business activities, each member of the group hopes to make a profit of 50,000 FCFA per loan cycle, which will allow them to repay interest and meet certain household needs such as children's education, healthcare, and clothing. The members of Djiguissèmè would like in the future to open stores to stock and sell grains and seasonings in Yanfolila.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of grains and seasonings

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohamad lives in Keb Elias in the Bekaa valley. A young man of 29 years, Mohammad takes care of a small butchery in his home town. Working since he was 18 years-old, this young man helps his dad take care of his sisters and mother.

In 2006, Mohammad decided to go out on his own and opened his own butchery to provide meat and poultry to the whole neighborhood.

Mohammad requests a loan of $800 to stock up with basic necessities for his butchery.

loans.use: To buy additional stock for his butchery.

loans.name: Koly (Pauvreté) Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre femmes du groupe Koly (2 veuves et  2  mariées) ont en moyenne 40 ans, 4 enfants et vivent dans des foyers polygames dans le quartier Bounoukobougou de la préfecture de Yanfolila (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
