Her work is profitable because she keeps clients and always gets new ones. Things go well and she has no complains. This is the first time she requests a loan to MFP. With the money she wants to buy tables and chairs to provide better service to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tables and chairs for her small restaurant

loans.name: Melina

texts.es: Melina tiene 19 años, es soltera, vive junto con sus padres, quienes la apoyan mucho. Ella se dedica a la venta de golosinas y refrescos, dentro de su casa, aprovechando un pequeño negocio de servicios de cabinas de Internet que tienen sus padrinos. Esta actividad, de la venta de golosinas, la viene realizando desde hace un año atrás. Le gusta mucho porque está en contacto con todo tipo de personas, dar una buena atención es lo que hace a diario y le agrada. Le es rentable, ya que gracias al negocio que pusieron sus padrinos acude mucha gente que compran golosinas y refrescos. Este es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP. Esta cantidad de dinero le dará la oportunidad de comprar una vitrina más grande, para adquirir más golosinas de tipo variado para sus clientes.
texts.en:
Melina is 19 years old and is single and lives with her parents who support her very much. She works selling candy and sodas from her house thanks to a small internet cafe owned by her godparents. She has been selling candy for a year already. She likes working in this very much because she is in contact with all kind of people and she likes providing them with good attention. It is very profitable because thanks to the business set up by her godparents many people goes and buys candy and sodas. This is the first loan she is requesting to MFP. She sill use the money to buy a larger showcase and more candy of different kinds for her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a larger showcase to present her products

loans.name: Nimia

texts.es: Nimia tiene 62 años, es madre soltera, en la actualidad vive con 4 de sus 8 hijos. Se dedica a la venta de frutas regionales, las vende durante todo el día fuera de su casa, este negocio lo tiene desde hace un año. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es dar una buena atención a sus clientes y que estos se sientan satisfechos al momento y después de comprar sus productos. Este negocio le es muy rentable, ya que es la única persona que vende estos productos regionales en su zona, muy aparte de encontrarse ubicada en un lugar muy transitable. Le va muy bien en su negocio. Es la primera vez que solicita un préstamo con MFP. Con el dinero que solicita quiere mandar a construir un kiosco para proteger sus frutas de los rayos solares u otras impurezas y así vender tranquilamente.
texts.en:
Nimia is 62 years old she is a single mother and currently lives with 4 of her 8 children. She works selling fruits during the day outside her house, for the past year. What she enjoys most is to provide good service to her clients so they feel satisfied when they buy her products. The business is very profitable because she is the only person selling regional products on her location, which has lots of transit also, so her business is going very well. Is the first time she solicits a loan with MFP. With the money she wants to build a kiosk to protect her fruits from the sunshine and other impurities and sell her products with calm.

Translated from Spanish by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a kiosk to sell her products

loans.name: Noga

texts.es: Noga tiene 18 años, vive junto a su pareja, quien se dedica al transporte de pasajeros y la apoya mucho. Ella se dedica a la venta de licores regionales (a base de raíces de árboles maceradas en aguardiente), desde hace ya 2 años, ocupándose en ello casi todo el día. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es dar un buen trato a sus clientes. Le es rentable, ya que las personas compran estas bebidas frecuentemente, algunas para tratar alguna dolencia y otras para consumirlas entre amigos o festividades. También son buscadas por los visitantes de otras regiones. Es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP. Utilizará el dinero en la construcción de un kiosco, ambientarlo adecuadamente y dar una mejor acogida a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Noga is 18 years old and lives with her partner, who works driving passangers and supports her on her business. She works selling regional beverages (made out of tree’s roots mixed with liquor) for the last 2 years, working almost all day long. She likes to provide good service to her clients. Business is very profitable because some people buy beverages to reduce pain and others to consume them with friends or during holidays. Her beverages are also well known to visitors from other regions. This is the first time she solicits a loan from MFP. She will use the money to build a kiosk to provide better attention to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a kiosk to sell her products

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es: Oscar, de 45 años de edad, es padre de 5 hijos, siendo 3 de ellos independientes, vive en la actualidad con los dos últimos y su esposa quien lo apoya mucho. Él se dedica a la venta de accesorios y lubricantes, servicios de rebobinados y reparación de motos, las 24 horas del día. Esto lo viene realizando desde hace 2 años en forma independiente. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es estar en contacto directo con sus clientes. Le es muy rentable, ya que se encuentra en una zona muy transitable. Lo más difícil para él es no contar con el local adecuado. Es el primer préstamo con MFP. El dinero que solicita será usado para mandar a construir un local con los ambientes necesarios para su negocio, al que ha llamado "Lubricentro El Gordo y Servicios Técnicos Popeye Motors"
texts.en:
Oscar is 45 years old and is the father of 5 children, 3 of them are already independent, and he currently lives with the last two and her wife, who supports him on his business. He works selling parts and lubricants to repair motorcycles 24 hours a day. He has been working on this for the last 2 years. He likes to be in contact with his clients and the business is very profitable because it is located on very transited area. He doesn’t have a proper shop. With the money he is soliciting he will build a better local with all necessary items for his business, he will call his business “ Lubricant Place the Fat guy and Technical Services Popeye Motors”.

Translated from Spanish by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To Build a place for his body shop business

loans.name: Paul

texts.es: Paúl, de 30 años de edad, es soltero y de profesión contador, vive solo en la casa de su abuelita. Tiene una pequeña bodega donde vende productos de primera necesidad (leche, arroz, fideos, conservas, entre otras variedades), sin embargo, muy a aparte trabaja como administrativo en una empresa de aerolíneas. Su bodega la tiene desde hace  3 años y quien se encarga de atender durante los días hábiles es su hermana, ya que en los días de descanso y feriados es él quien está en su negocio. Le es muy rentable, ya que se encuentra en una zona muy concurrida y le va muy bien. Este es el primer préstamo con MFP. Solicita este dinero para comprar más productos y poder implementar su negocio, además quiere ampliar, para que se muestre más acogedor y llamativo.
texts.en:
Paul is 30 years old and is single; he is an accountant and lives alone with his grandmother. He has a little warehouse where he sells first need products (milk, rice, pasta, canned food, among others), also he works as clerk at an airline. His grocery store has been opened for the last 3 years and is his sister who attends the store during the week; Paul attends the store during the weekend and holidays. The business is very profitable because is located on a very busy area. This is his first loan with MFP, he is requesting the loan to buy more products and upgrade the store so it will be more comfortable and presentable for his clients.

Translated from Spanish by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To upgrade his grocery store and buy more products

loans.name: Kwamé

texts.fr:
Né le 1er mai 1957 à Accra, Monsieur A. Kwamé est marié et père de 4 enfants. Mécanicien d’entretien dans une société de la place, il a pour activité secondaire la vente de jus de fruit glacé et eau minérale glacée. Dans l’intention d’agrandir son activité secondaire qui génère d’important revenu, il sollicite un crédit afin d’acheter un congélateur et quelques ustensiles pour son activité.
Ceci l’aidera beaucoup à accroître sa production et augmenter son chiffre d’affaire. Les revenus ainsi dégagés contribueront à améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Born on May 1, 1957 in Accra, Mr. Kwamé A. is married and the father of four. A maintenance mechanic in a local company, his other work involves selling iced fruit juice and mineral water. With the intention of expanding this other work, which generates sizable revenues, he is requesting a loan to buy a freezer and a few utensils. This will assist him a great deal in raising his production and increasing his sales figures. The income thus derived will help improve his family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a freezer and some utensils

loans.name: Rhema Group

texts.en:
Georgine M. is a 52 year old widow with seven children who are between the ages of 16 and 32. She sells fabric and sewing accessories at the central market in Kinshasa. She has been active in her business since 1996.

Since her husband passed away in 2000, Georgine has been dedicated to her business. It is the only source of income she has to support her family. She joined a Hope DRC group called Rhema in January and has already received and successfully repaid two loans. The group consists of 29 members and thanks to Hope’s loans, the group members’ businesses have prospered. 

Georgine plans to use this loan to generate more profit by purchasing items of good quality that are needed by her clients. Other Rhema members would use this loan to meet their clients’ needs and improve their business facilities in order to generate more profit to support their families.

loans.use: To purchase additional goods to sell.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
Yaa N. received a high school education. She is married and has 5 dependents. Her husband sells yams.

Yaa has been selling clothing and fabrics since 2002, and she also has a grocery store at Praso market in Elmina, Ghana. She is responsible for paying utility bills and other expenses. She will use her loan to buy more fabrics and clothing to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to help her husband build a family house.

loans.use: Buy more fabrics and clothing to sell

loans.name: Bapane

texts.en: Bapane N. is married and has 4 dependents. She has received no formal education. Bapane sells yams at Praso market in Elmina, which she has done since 1998. Her husband is a farmer. Bapane uses her income to pay utility bills and other family expenses. Bapane will use the loan to purchase more yams to increase her sales to meet her increased customers' needs. With the new profits from her expanded business, Bapane plans to help her husband build a family house.

loans.use: purchase more yams to increase her sales

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua M. has received no formal education. She is married and has 2 children, and her husband farms for a living.

Efua has been selling sells yams since 1998. She sells her yams to retailers, who resell them in a smaller quantity at Praso market in Elmina, Ghana.

Efua uses her income to pay for utility bills and other expenses. Efua will use her loan to purchase larger quantities of yams that are less expensive from another area further from her home. With the new profits from her expanded business, Efua plans to help her husband build a house for the family.

loans.use: Buy yams less expensively

loans.name: Djekafo (Soyons Ensemble Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Djekafo sont des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 23 ans et 3 enfants .Elles vivent dans de familles traditionnelles élargies avec leur mari, des coépouses, les enfants, les beaux frères, les beaux parents et autres parents dans le village de Marka-Coungo (Région de Koulikoro République du Mali)
Ce groupe a opté pour l’achat et la vente des produits cosmétiques, du quinqueliba et quelques fois des condiments alimentaires. Le quinqueliba est une plante qui sert de substitue au café et est utilisé pour ses vertus thérapeutiques. Reconnu et réputé pour la qualité des produits fournis, ce groupe ne cesse d’augmenter le nombre de sa clientèle. Afin donc de maintenir et de satisfaire les besoins cette clientèle, elles décidèrent ensemble de travailler avec le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant 4 ans. Après sept prêts solidaires (prêt de groupe) tous correctement remboursés, Djekafo est à son huitième prêt qui sera utilisé pour acheter, 500 boites de pommade, 330 bouteilles de parfums de différentes qualités et une importante quantité de quinqueliba. Elles achètent le quinqueliba dans les villages environnants de Marka-Coungo pour les stocker à domicile et ensuite les revendre à Bamako (capitale de la république de Mali) au comptant à des grossistes.  De retour sur Marka-Coungo elles achètent les produits cosmétiques qui seront vendus à une clientèle féminine au comptant en détail et à crédit au marché de Marka-Coungo et de Fana.
Avec ce prêt elles espèrent réaliser un bénéfice de 30 000 FCFA chacune qui sera utilisé essentiellement à renforcer le fonds de commerce.
texts.en:
The members of the group Djekafo are married women averaging 23 years of age and three children. They live in traditional extended families with their husband, co-wives, children, brothers-in-law, parents-in-law, and other parents in the village of Marka-Coungo (Koulikoro region, Republic of Mali).

This group opted to buy and sell cosmetics, quinqueliba, and sometimes condiments. Quinqueliba is a plant used as a coffee substitute that has therapeutic properties. Renown for the quality of the goods they furnish, this group continuously increases its customer base.

And so, in order to maintain and satisfy these customers, the group members decided together to work with the Soro Yiriwaso loan program four years ago. After seven solidarity loans (group loans), all correctly repaid, the group is on its eighth loan, which will be used to buy 500 containers of ointment, 330 bottles of perfume of different grades, and a sizable quantity of quinqueliba.

They buy the quinqueliba in the villages surrounding Marka-Coungo and stock it at home, and then they resell it for cash in Bamako (capital of Mali) to wholesalers. On the way back to Marka-Coungo, they buy cosmetic products, which will be sold to women, cash or credit accepted, at the marketplaces of Marka-Coungo and Fana.

With this loan, they each hope to realize a profit of 30,000 francs CFA, which will be used essentially to bolster their working capital.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetic products and some herbal tea.

loans.name: Manuela De Jesus

texts.es: La señora Manuela  habita en el barrio Memorial Sandino, barrio que se ubica en la capital Managua, tiene 53 años de edad, esta casada, donde su esposo  se dedica a la venta de colchones y alquila cuartos, así mismo le apoya en los gastos del hogar, juntos tuvieron 4 hijos, de los cuales todos trabajan. Actualmente la señora Manuela se desempeña como sub -oficial mayor de la Policía Nacional, tiene 28 años de brindar su servicios a la policía y de apoyar a la seguridad de su país, ella durante muchos años se ha venido esforzando para lograr mejoras en su vivienda, ya que uno de sus planes es poder mejorar las condiciones de vida de toda su familia y por tanto es que seguirá trabajando en subir de cargo en su trabajo, de tal forma que le permita tener mayores ingresos, así mismo ella solicita la ayuda de AFODENIC para que se le pueda brindar financiamiento para mejorar el techo de su casa de habitación solicitando C$ 12,000.00   aun plazo de 12 meses.
texts.en:
Manuela lives in the Memorial Sandino neighborhood, located in the capital, Managua. She is 53 years old and married. She has a total of 4 children, they all have jobs. Her husband sells mattresses and rents out rooms while Manuela does her part to bringing in cash to cover all expenses. She works as a Sub Major Official for the National Police. She has held this national security position for 28 years and for many of those years she has been wishing to have enough money to make repairs to her home. Another major goal is to improve her family's living standards. She says she is willing to work even harder at her job in order to be promoted to better-paying positions. Currently, she is seeking help from AFODENIC to come up with C$ 12,000.00 to finance roof repairs; this loan will be paid back in 12 months.

Translated from Spanish by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase Zinc and other materials to repair the house's roof

loans.name: Hannah M.

texts.en:
Hannah M. O. has received no formal education. She is married and has 2 children, and her husband is in the yam business. Hannah has been selling yams in small quantities since 1998 to retailers at Praso market in Elmina, Ghana.

She is responsible for paying utility bills and other family expenses. She will use her loan to pay for transportation costs to areas where she can purchase yams less expensively. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to help her husband build a family house.

loans.use: Pay for transportation costs

loans.name: Hazel Ivania

texts.es: La señorita Hazel Ivania el barrio Enrique Bermúdez 380, barrió que se ubica en la capital Managua, tiene la edad de 22 años,  se encuentra soltera, actualmente se dedica a la venta de ropa y útiles escolares, aparte de tener su negocio trabaja en atención al cliente en la empresa DHL, donde su negocio lo inicio con su novio ambos recogieron para establecerlo, también la señorita Hazel esta estudiando en la universidad y uno de sus planes de vida es poder  finalizar sus estudios y hacer mas grande su negocio, por eso que en estos últimos años ha trabajado con  créditos que Afodenic otorga para invertirlo en su negocio, solicitando actualmente un monto de C$ 9,000.00 aun plazo de 10 meses para comprar mas mercadería para su negocio y poder de esta forma incrementar sus clientes, planes de futuro es poder ir diversificando sus productos y buscar nuevos segmentos de mercado.
texts.en:
Hazel Ivania lives in the town of Enrique Bermúdez 380, located in the capital, Managua. She is 22 and she sells clothing and school supplies. Besides running her own business, she also works for DHL as a customer service representative. Ms. Hazel is enrolled in college as well, and one of her goals is to have the required funds to pay for her education and expand her business. Herself and her boyfriend invested together to start the business and, lately, they have worked with Afodenic to obtain credit lines to finance their business. Currently, they seek C$ 9,000.00, to be paid within 10 months, that will be used to diversify their product line and seek new market opportunities.

Translated from Spanish by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase adults' and children's clothing

loans.name: Peace

texts.en:
Peace F. is married and has 2 children. She received schooling through junior high.

Peace has sold yams to local customers at Praso market in Elmina, Ghana since 2000. Her husband works as a policeman.

Peace uses her income to pay bills and other family expenses. She will use the loan to purchase more yams in larger quantities from the yam-producing area, which is several kilometers away. With the bigger profits from her business, Peace plans to help her husband build a family house.

loans.use: Purchase more yams in larger quantities

loans.name: Léa

texts.fr:
Née en 1973, Madame TCHANGAÏ Léa est mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Femme très dynamique et dévouée à son activité qui est la préparation d’une boisson fermentée appelée « Tchouk » faite à base de sorgho qui se fait de plus en plus rare sur le marché dû à une mauvaise saison agricole. Dans le souci de stocker le sorgho en vue de pouvoir préparer la boisson en période de pénurie, Madame TCHANGAÏ Léa sollicite un crédit pour arriver à ses fins. 
Ce crédit débloqué lui permettra de continuer son activité même en période de pénurie de sorgho et ainsi doubler son bénéfice pour mieux faire face à ses besoins et améliorer le revenu de la famille.
texts.en:
Born in 1973, Mrs. Léa TCHANGAÏ is married and the mother of 2 children. She's a very energetic woman who is very much devoted to her business. The latter consists in the preparation of a fermented beverage called « Tchouk », made out of sorghum, which is becoming hard to find on the market due to a bad agricultural season. Anxious to stock sorghum in order to be able to make the beverage during the shortage, Mrs. Léa TCHANGAÏ is seeking a loan to achieve this goal. This loan will enable her to continue her activity even during the period of sorghum shortage, and therefore, to double her profits in order to better support herself and improve the revenues of the family.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock sorghum to prepare a local beverage

loans.name: Djiguisseme (Soutien) Group

texts.fr:
Issue toutes de la communauté peuhl (Ethnie spécialisée dans l’élevage au Mali), les membres du groupe Djiguisseme sont en majorité des femmes mariées ayant en moyenne 24 ans et 2 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Marka-Coungo (Région de Koulikoro République du Mali).
Liées par des relations de parenté et professionnel, ce groupe fait essentiellement l’achat et la vente de lait et ses dérivés (lait frais, caillé, du crème et du beurre de vache).    
Le groupe Djiguisseme est à son septième prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe) avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso et tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Elles comptent acheter avec ce prêt, 700 litres de lait auprès des éleveurs sur place à Marka-Coungo et dans les villages environnants. Une partie du lait est vendue à l’état frais, et l’autre partie(caillée et les dérivés du lait)est vendue dans le marché de Marka-Coungo à une clientèle composée de résidents et de  grossistes venant des grandes villes telles que Bamako(capitale de la république du Mali), Fana et Koulikoro. Cette opération est renouvelée chaque 2 jours si bien la marge bénéficiaire est très importante.
Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen par cycle de 40 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour les dépenses de la famille et reste, renforcé le fonds de commerce.
texts.en:
All born into the Fulani community (an ethnic group specializing in raising livestock in Mali), the members of the group Djiguisseme are mostly married women who average 24 years of age and two children. They live in traditional extended families in the village of Marka-Coungo (Region of Koulikoro, Republic of Mali). Linked by ties of kinship and profession, this group essentially trades in cow's milk and milk products (fresh milk, curdled milk, cream, and butter). The group is on its seventh solidarity loan (group loan) with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso. All of the preceding loans have been correctly repaid. They intend to use this loan to buy 700 liters of milk from livestock farmers locally in Marka-Coungo and from surrounding villages. A portion of the milk is sold fresh, and the rest (milk products) are sold in the Marka-Coungo marketplace to customers composed of the residents and of wholesalers from big cities, such as Bamako (capital of Mali), Fana, and Koulikoro. This operation is repeated every two days if the profit margin is very large. They each envision realizing an average profit of 40,000 francs CFA per cycle that will be used to cover family expenses and the rest to boost working capital.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy milk

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
Elena es madre de 4 hijos de 5, 9,12 y 7 años. Ella inició el negocio debido a la falta de empleo, siendo madre soltera y teniendo un bajo nivel escolar era difícil encontrar un empleo fijo que le permitiera tener un ingresos suficiente para solventar los gastos de sus pequeños, por lo que comenzó hace 10 años con  la venta de frituras y dulces y poco a poco fue haciendo crecer su negocio, incorporando abarrotes hasta establecer su tienda.

Ella necesita un préstamo por 3,000MXN que pagara en 6 meses para mejorar su local y  comprar  más productos para su  negocio y así tener mas clientes.
texts.en:
Elena is the mother of four children, ages 5, 9, 12 and 7. She started the business due to lack of employment, as she is a single mother and doesn’t have a lot of education. This made it difficult for her to find stable employment that would provide enough income to meet the expenses of her small children. For this reason, ten years ago she started by selling fried foods and candies and little by little she made her business grow. She incorporated groceries until she established her store.

She needs a loan of 3,000 MXN, to be repaid in six months, to make improvements to her location and purchase more products for her business so she can attract additional customers.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improve her location.

loans.name: Gaoussou

texts.fr: Gaoussou est  informaticien  agé de 28 ans il est marié et pere de trois enfants.Apres une formation en maintenance informatique il a ouvert une  boutique où il vend du materiel informatique et des accessoires pour ordinateur et fait aussi  de la maintenance depuis au moins 3ans. Avec le pret sollicité il va renforcer son activité par l 'achat d' accessoires pour ordinateur.
texts.en:
Gaoussou, 28, is a computer tech. He is married and the father of three children. After training in computer maintenance, he opened a shop where he has been selling computer-related items and accessories and doing maintenance for at least three years now. With the requested loan he is going to boost his little business by buying computer accessories.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to add to his working capital

loans.name: Nana

texts.en:
Nana A. is single parent and has 2 children. She received schooling through the primary level.

Nana has been selling a variety of soft drinks at the chapel square in Elmina, Ghana since 1998. Nana uses her income to pay for her children's schooling and utility bills. Nana will use the loan to purchase a larger quantity of soft drinks to sell to her customers. With the bigger profits from her expanded business, Nana plans to invest in her children's education.

loans.use: Purchase larger quantities of soft drinks

loans.name: Améyo

texts.fr:
Mariée et mère de 4 enfants, Madame A. Améyo est née le 15 février 1975 à Togoville où elle fît ses études primaires et secondaires. Avide de gagner vite sa vie, elle ouvre un point de vente de produits de premières nécessités notamment les savons et détergeants, du lait, du sucre, des boites de conserves et autres dans le ville de Kpémé. Reconnue dans son milieu par les riverains dont leur demande en nouveaux produits ne cesse d’augmenter.
Pour pallier à ce manquement, elle sollicite un crédit en vue de s’approvisionner en nouveaux produits pour la satisfaction totale de sa clientèle et augmenter ainsi le niveau de son bénéfice qui se répercutera sur son niveau de vie.
texts.en:
Mrs. Améyo A. is married and the mother of four children. She was born on February 15, 1975 in Togoville, where she attended primary and secondary schools. Eager to rapidly earn a living, she opened a point of sale in Kpémé for staples such as soaps and detergents, milk, sugar, canned food, and other items. She's well known among her neighbors, who constantly request new products. To meet this demand, she's seeking a loan to purchase new products in order to fully satisfy her clientele and to increase her profit, which will improve her standard of living.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase goods for her point of sale

loans.name: Djiguiya (Espérance) Group

texts.fr:
Djiguiya est un groupe de l’association Yankadi composé de quatre femmes toutes mariées ayant en moyenne 29 ans et 2 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles traditionnelles élargies avec leur mari, des coépouses et les enfants dans le village de Marka-Coungo (Région Koulikoro République du Mali). Elles se sont connues par des liens de voisinage et de mariage et font en général le commerce de bois de chauffe. En plus du bois de chauffe, elles font également l’achat et la vente des différents articles tels les céréales et le charbon de bois.
 Dans le souci de constituer un stock important afin d’éviter les ruptures elles ont décidées ensemble d’intégrer le programme crédit de l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis une année. Après avoir correctement remboursé les deux précédents prêts solidaires (prêt de groupe) elles sont à leur troisième prêt.
Elles comptent utiliser ce prêt pour acheter et stocker du bois de chauffe destiné au marché de Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali). Les bois de chauffe sont achetés avec les paysans ayant un permis de coupe (à Marka-Coungo et dans les villages environnants) et stockés en brousse jusqu'à ce qu’elles obtiennent la quantité souhaitée. Ensuite elles cherchent des camions pour les acheminer sur Bamako où des grossistes achètent au comptant toute la cargaison. Au retour elles achètent des articles divers qui seront vendus à Marka –Coungo.
Avec ce prêt elles envisagent réaliser un bénéfice mensuel et moyen de 35.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour renforcer le fonds de commerce et aider les maris à subvenir aux dépenses de la famille. Elles ambitionnent créer une association pour la promotion et la sauvegarde des intérêts des vendeurs du bois de chauffe à Marka-Coungo.
texts.en:
Djiguiya is a group from the Yankadi association consisting of four women, all married and with an average age of 29 and two children each. They live in traditional extended families with their husbands, co-spouses and children in the village of Marka-Coungo (in the Koulikoro region of the Republic of Mali). They met through neighborhood and marriage ties, and mainly sell firewood. In addition to firewood, they buy and sell miscellaneous items such as cereals and charcoal. Keen to build up a decent stock in order to avoid shortages, a year ago they decided, as a group, to join the loan program of the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution. Having successfully repaid two previous solidarity loans (group loans), they are now on their third loan. They plan to use this loan to stock up on firewood to sell at the market in Bamako (the capital of the Republic of Mali). The firewood is bought in conjunction with peasants holding a wood-cutting permit (in Marka-Coungo and surrounding villages) and stored in the bush until the women obtain the desired quantity. They then arrange for trucks to take it to Bamako where wholesalers pay cash for the entire load. On the way back, they buy miscellaneous items to sell in Marka-Coungo. Through this loan they expect to make an average monthly profit of CFA 35,000, which will be used to strengthen their working capital and help their husbands meet the family expenses. Their goal is to create an association to promote and safeguard the interests of the firewood sellers in Marka-Coungo.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy firewood

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en:
Christiana A. is married and has 4 dependants. She received schooling through senior high. Christiana has been selling clothing and fabric since 2000 at the new market in Elmina, Ghana. Her husband works as a photographer.

Christiana uses her income to help her husband with the family expenses. Christiana will use the loan to buy more fabric for resale and to purchase plastic products to include in her trade. With the new profits from her expanded business, Christiana plans to complete the family house she started with her husband.

loans.use: Buy more fabric and add plastic products to her trade

loans.name: Ayetan

texts.fr:
Née à Anfoin en 1965, Madame T. Ayetan est mariée et mère de 2 enfants tous scolarisés dont les charges sont en partie couvertes par les revenus maigres de son activité qui n’est rien d’autre que la vente des produits de première nécessité (sucre, lait,savons, détergents, huiles et autres). Pour augmenter son revenu et mieux faire face à l’éducation de ses enfants Madame T. Ayetan sollicite un appui financier afin de s’approvisionner plus. 
Cet appui ainsi réalisé lui permettra d’augmenter son revenu et mieux faire face à l’éducation de sa famille et améliorer le niveau vie de sa famille. Accordons lui une chance de réaliser ses ambitions.
texts.en:
Born in Anfoin in 1965, Mrs. Ayetan T. is married and the mother of 2 children, both in school, whose school expenses are in part covered by the meager earnings from her business, which is simply the sale of staples (sugar, milk, soap, detergent, oil and so forth). To increase her income and better cope with educating her children, Mrs. Ayetan T. is asking for a loan so that she can add to her inventory.

This loan will allow her to increase her income and be able to pay for the education expenses of her family and improve their standard of living. Let's give her a chance to realize her dreams!

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: stocking her store with merchandise

loans.name: Yevgeniya

texts.en:
A married mother of two grown sons, Yevgeniya depends on her cosmetics sales business to make ends meet for her family. She lost her previous work and had to find ways to survive as the money she was making was not enough for her to live on. 
Ten years ago, she decided to start her own business in order to supplement her income. Yevgeniya has gained much valuable experience over the years and has established a good reputation as a business owner. She understands her product very well and is always fair to her customers. 
Yevgeniya has also been a good client with Nadiya Ukraine having repaid 23 different loans. She has requested an additional loan of 3,000 Grivnas to help purchase new inventory for her business. We are happy for this opportunity to further assist Yevgeniya as she works to support herself.

Note: this is a short term seasonal loan that will be repaid in a month.

loans.use: Inventory purchase

loans.name: María Del Rocio

texts.es:
Rocío inició el negocio para ayudar un poco a su esposo en los gastos de la casa y tener un empleo que le diera  ingresos necesarios para darles mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos. Comenzó hace 1 año su negocio, ante  la necesidad de tener un empleo sin descuidar la  a sus  hijos 
Fue que decidió empezar a vender blancos por catalogo, poco a poco fue adquiriendo  clientes y actualmente esto le ha permitido tener mejores ingresos.

Ella necesita un préstamo por 3,000MXN que pagara en 6 meses para  comprar colchas y cortinas y así poder tener un poco más de surtido de mercancía.
texts.en:
Rocio started the business to help her husband a little bit with the household expenses and to have some employment that will give her the necessary income to provide her children with a better quality of life. She started with her business 1 year ago when faced by the need to get a job without neglecting her children.

She decided to start selling home furnishings like bedding, curtains, etc. from a catalog. Slowly, she has been gaining customers and currently she is able to get better earnings.

She needs a 3,000MXN loan, which will be paid in 6 months, to buy bedspreads, drapes, and curtains and have a better variety of merchandise available.


Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying merchandise

loans.name: Koko

texts.fr: Issue d’une famille très pauvres et n’ayant pas eu la chance d’être scolarisé, Madame D. Koko est née en 1966, mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Dans le but de subvenir aux besoins de sa petite famille elle se lança très tôt dans le commerce de piment séché qui est une activité très génératrice de revenu surtout en période de pénurie. Mais pour pouvoir arriver à cela il faut au préalable acheter et stocker ; c’est dans le souci de la faire que Madame D. Koko sollicite un crédit. Ce prêt accordé lui sera très bénéfique puisqu’en période de pénurie elle peut doubler son revenu ce qui aura un impact très positive sur le niveau de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Coming from a very poor family and not having had the chance to attend school, Ms. Koko D. was born in 1966 and is a mother with three children. With the goal of providing for her small family, she got started very early on in the commerce of dried chili peppers. This is a business that generates very good income, especialy in times of shortages. But in order to be able to make it happen, buying and creating an inventory must occur first. With this concern in mind, she is requesting a loan that, when granted, will be very beneficial to her, since she can double her income in times of shortages, thus having a very positive impact on her family's standard of living.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To create an inventory of chili peppers to sell

loans.name: Gneleni (Veut Dire Bravoure) Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Gneleni (du nom d’une femme battante dans la légende bambara au Mali) est composé des six femmes ayant une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans et 5 enfants qui vivent dans des familles traditionnelles élargies avec leur mari, des coépouses, des frères et sœurs, les enfants et autres parents dans la ville de la sous-préfecture de Fana (région de Koulikoro République du Mali). Liées par des relations de travail et de voisinage ces femmes font exclusivement le commerce de pagnes wax (tissus très prisés en Afrique de l’ouest).
Dans le souci de satisfaire une clientèle de plus en plus croissante elles ont intégrés l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur huitième prêt de groupe (prêt solidaire), et tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
 Elles comptent payer 300 pièces wax à Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali) auprès des grossistes. Ces pièces de pagnes wax seront découpées en trois pagnes pour être revendus en détail, au comptant et à crédit dans les marchés de Fana, Konobougou, Dioïla, Massigui etc à une clientèle constituée essentiellement de femmes. 
Elles envisagent réaliser un bénéfice de 45.000 FCFA chacune et qu’elles utiliseront pour renforcer leurs fonds de commerce. Elles ambitionnent devenir des grossistes et nouer des relations avec une usine Hollandaise de fabrique de wax.
texts.en:
The group Gneleni (from the name of a woman fighter in the Bambara legend in Mali) is composed of six women who average 37 years of age and five children. They live in traditional extended families with their husband, co-wives, brothers, sisters, children and other parents in the city of the sub-prefecture Fana (Koulikoro region, Republic of Mali). Linked by ties of work and community, these women do commerce exclusively in 'Wax' pagnes (highly prized cloth in West Africa). Concerned about satifying a burgeoning customer base, the women have joined the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, with which they are on their eighth group loan (solidarity loan). All the preceding loans have been correctly repaid. They intend to pay for 300 lengths of pagnes in Bamako (capital of Mali) from wholesalers. These lengths of cloth will be cut into three and resold retail, cash or credit accepted, in the marketplaces of Fana, Konobougou, Dioïla, Massigui, etc. to customers essentially composed of women. They each envision realizing a profit of 45,000 francs CFA, which will be used to boost their working capital. Their ambition is to become wholesalers and to establish a relationship with a Dutch factory that makes 'Wax' pagnes.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy Wax pagnes

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth Y. is married and has 5 dependants. She received schooling through senior high. Elizabeth has been selling groceries like Milo and milk at Ensuekyer near Elmina, Ghana since 1993. Her husband works as a fisherman.

Elizabeth uses her income to pay for utility bills and other expenses. Elizabeth will use the loan to purchase more Milo, milk, sugar and other groceries to sell in her shop. With the new profits from her expanded business, Elizabeth plans to help her husband build a family house.

loans.use: Purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana is married with grown children. Her photo store called “Konica” prints photos; sells digital cameras, accessories, picture frames and albums; and offers photo services. Her business is located in downtown Kahovka. Svetlana’s been in this business for 8 years.

Svetlana is a serious and prudent business owner. Her perseverance together with lending services from “Nadiya Ukraine” has enabled her to gradually expand her business. Svetlana’s working capital has grown by 50,000 Grivnas since she received her first loan from “Nadiya Ukraine”. Her monthly net profit is about 2,500 Grivnas. Svetlana is requesting a loan of 3,500 Grivnas to increase her sales and profit. Her responsibility, stable business growth, and prompt payment record characterize Svetlana as a consistent and serious entrepreneur capable of loan repayment.

Note: this is short term seasonal loan that will be repaid in two months.

loans.use: Generate additional profit

loans.name: Audelia

texts.es:
Audelia inició el negocio para tener un ingreso extra, ya que su esposo percibe un sueldo bajo y los gastos de su casa iban creciendo además de los gastos escolares de sus 2 hijos de 13 y 5 años,  es por esto que ella comenzó hace 2 años con la venta de zapatos y poco después con la venta de productos de plástico para el hogar  y hasta el momento le ha ido muy bien combinando estas actividades.

Ella necesita un préstamo por 3,000 MXN que pagara en 6 meses para poder comprar mercancía ofrecer a sus clientes mejor calidad y surtido, y así incrementar  sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Audelia started the business to generate extra income, given that her husband’s salary is low and the household expenses kept growing, including the school-related costs for their two children ages 13 and 5. It’s for this reason that two years ago she started selling shoes, and shortly thereafter began selling plastic products for the home. To date, these combined activities have gone very well for her.

She needs a loan of 3,000MXN, to be repaid in six months, so she can buy merchandise to offer her customers a better quality and variety of goods and that way increase her earnings.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Améyo

texts.fr:
Née le 24 avril 1982 à Baguida et nantie d’un certificat d’aide accoucheuse, Mlle Y. Améyo est mariée et mère d’un enfant. Pour faire face à sa période de chômage elle décida alors d’ouvrir un point de vente de produits générique pour sa communauté puisqu’elle maîtrise un peu ce domaine. Ceci fait et avec le nombre des années qui passent la demande devient de plus en plus forte puisqu’elle est reconnu dans sa zone comme point de vente en produit générique. Mais ne pouvant pas faire face toute seule à cette demande croissante elle sollicite un appui financier pour lui permettre de s’approvisionner.
Ce crédit débloqué serait d’une grande utilité puisqu’il permettra d’augmenter ses revenus d’une part et mettre à la disposition de la population les produits génériques de premières nécessités.
texts.en:
Ameyo Y. is married and the mother of one child. She was born on April 24th, 1982, in Baguida, and holds a certificate as Midwife Assistant. To weather through a period of unemployment, she decided to become the source of sale for generic products (medicines) in her community, which has since become her specialty. This was accomplished over the past few years, and an ever increasing demand has made her the main source for these generic products in her area. She has been unable to meet all her customers needs and is therefore requesting a financial loan to allow her to purchase inventory.

This loan will be put to great use, allowing, on one hand, an increase in revenues and on the other hand, providing access for the local population to generic products of basic necessity.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and sale of generic products

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba G. is a single parent and has 4 dependents. She has received schooling through primary level. Aba sells foodstuffs at the new market in Elmina. She has being doing this since 1998. Aba uses her income for the payment of school fees and utility bills. Aba will use the loan to purchase more foodstuffs like groundnut paste for re-sale.

loans.use: purchase more foodstuffs like groundnut paste for re-sale.

loans.name: Jolidenw (Les Belles Créatures) Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Jolidenw sont en majorité mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 28 ans et 3 enfants vivant dans des familles polygames dans le village de Marka-Coungo (région de Koulikoro République du Mali). Elles se sont connues par des liens du commerce essentiellement du bois de chauffe, du charbon de bois et des condiments alimentaires.
Ce groupe de femmes, afin d’augmenter la taille de ses activités a décidé d’intégrer l’institution Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur huitième prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe) et tous les prêts précèdent ont été correctement remboursés.
Ce nouveau prêt sera utilisé pour constituer un grand stock de bois de chauffe auprès des paysans sur place à Marka-Coungo et dans les villages environnants. Les bois sont acheminés à Bamako (capitale du Mali) à l’aide de camions (10 tonnes) loués pour la circonstance et vendus au comptant aux grossistes. Au retour elles achètent les condiments alimentaires qui seront ensuite revendus sur le marché de Marka-Coungo en détail, au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée de femmes. Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 50 000 FCFA. Elles ambitionnent organiser un marché de bois à Marka-Coungo dans lequel des grossistes pourront venir s’approvisionner à tout moment.
texts.en:
The women of the group Jolidenw are mostly married and average 28 years of age and three children. They live in polygamous families in the village of Marka-Coungo (Koulikoro region, Republic of Mali). They know one another by commercial ties in essentially firewood, charcoal, and condiments.

This group of women, in order to expand their business, decided to join the institution Soro Yiriwaso, with which they are on their eighth solidarity loan (group loan). All of their preceding loans have been correctly repaid.

This new loan will be used to build up a large stock of firewood gotten locally from peasants in Marka-Coungo and from surrounding villages. The wood is taken to Bamako (capital of Mali) by truck (10-tonnes) rented for the occasion and is sold for cash to wholesalers. On the way back, they buy condiments that will then be resold retail at the Marka-Coungo marketplace, cash or credit accepted, to customers composed of women. They each envision realizing a monthly profit of 50,000 francs CFA. Their ambition is to organize a marketplace for firewood in Marka-Coungo, at which wholesalers will be able to come and supply themselves at any time.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy firewood and condiments

loans.name: Abdoulaye Samba

texts.fr: Mr abdoulaye samba A. est agé de 32ans il est marié et pere de deux enfants .Son activité principale est la fabrication de meuble en bois .Il a commencer à apprendre ce metier tres tôt apres l' école primaire.IL gere actuellement son propre atelier où il forme en meme temps des jeunes.Pour depanner sa machine il demande un pret.
texts.en:
Mr Abdoulaye Samba A. is 32 years old, married, and the father of two children. His main business consists in making wooden furniture. He started learning this job very early on after primary school. He currently runs his own workshop where he also trains youngsters. To fix his machine, he's seeking this loan.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a new machine

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret B. is a single parent and has 2 children. She received schooling through junior high. Margaret has been selling groceries and fishing supplies at Ensuekyer near Elmina, Ghana since 2000. Margaret uses her income to pay school fees and utility bills.

Margaret will use her loan to purchase more fishing supplies to fulfill the increased demand in the fishing community where her shop is located. With the new profits from her expanded business, Margaret plans to complete the house she started for her family.

loans.use: Purchase more fishing supplies for sale

loans.name: Getzamani Group

texts.es:
hola nosotros somos el grupo Getzamani, vivimos en la comunidad de Yusguare, estamos formados por tres integrantes dos mujeres y un hombre, los tres nos conocemos hace mucho tiempo y somos muy unidos, tenemos una cualidad que siempre nos hemos ayudado el uno con el otro y nunca dejamos que nos pase algo malo, nuestras familias estan muy unidas.
nosotros tenemos nuestros propios negocios como ser venta de empanadas y nacatamales, produccion y venta de tortillas y helados y paletas, todos realizamos estas actividades con el proposito de proveer el sustento a nuestras familias y asi poder cubrir con todas nuestras necesidades de nuestros hogares, en estos momentos necesitamos un credito para sacar adelante nuestros negocios.
texts.en:
Hello. We are the Getzamani Group, and we live in the Yusguare community. Our group is comprised of three members, two women and one man. The three of us have known each other for a long time, and we are very close. We have always helped each other, making sure that nothing bad happens to any of us, and our families are also very close.

We each have our own businesses such as selling empanadas and nacatamales (a Central American tamal: dough with a pork or chicken filling wrapped in plantain leaves then steamed or pressure cooked), making and selling tortillas, ice creams and popsicles. We all realize these activities with the aim of providing for our families and meeting the needs of our households. Currently, we need a loan in order to help our businesses grow.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cornflower, chicken and pork, vegetables, salt, cooking oil, lard, plantain leaves, ice creams, popsicles, etc.

loans.name: Salome

texts.es: Salome tiene 38 años, es madre de 3 hijos, vive junto a su esposo, quien le brinda su apoyo incondicional. Su actividad diaria es la venta de comida, y lo hace en la hora del desayuno y el almuerzo, ella vende desde hace 8 años. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es dar una buena atención a sus clientes y sobre todo que estos degusten de su buena sazón. Le es muy rentable, ya que es muy conocida por su zona y lo que es más, se encuentra en un lugar muy transitable y concurrente. Le va bien en su negocio de la venta de comida y esta muy satisfecha. Este es el primer préstamo con MFP. El dinero que solicita será para ampliar su negocio, ambientarlo  de una manera adecuada, para dar una mejor vista y mejor atención a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Salome is 38 years old, has 3 children and lives with her husband to whom she offers unconditional support. Her business activity is prepared food that is sold for breakfast and lunch. She has been doing this for 8 years. It is gratifying to her to provide excellent service to her customers so that they can enjoy her exquisite flavors. She has done well because she is a well-known person around her neighborhood, and the restaurant is located at a very busy spot in the city. Sales have been solid and she is very satisfied with the results. This will be the first loan from MFP. She wants to expand and better equip the business: a more functional restaurant will help her provide even better services to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand and improve her business

loans.name: Demihindo

texts.fr:
Mariée et mère de famille, Madame A. Demihindo est née le 25 août 1967. Ayant vite détecté  son talant de cuisine, elle décida d’ouvrir un petit restaurant dans un coin de la ville de Kpémé. Sa réputation et la qualité de son service font que le nombre de clients ne cesse d’augmenter. Dans le souci de stocker du céréale en temps d’abondance afin de l’utiliser en période où ça devient très coûteux; elle sollicite un crédit qu’elle compte utiliser en partie pour l’achat du céréale et le reste pour l’achat des épices et légumes à contre saison qui sont indispensables aux mets qu’elle fait. 
Ce crédit débloqué permettra de la redynamiser et augmenter son revenu pour une augmentation de son niveau de vie.
texts.en:
Married and the mother of a family, Mrs. Demihindo A. was born on August 25, 1967. Having discovered her talent for cooking at a young age, she decided to open a little restaurant in the town of Kpémé. Her reputation and the quality of her food cause the number of customers that come to her to continually grow. With a view to stockpiling cereals when they are abundant so as to rely on them when they become very expensive, she is asking for a loan that she intends to use in part to buy cereals and also to buy spices and vegetables in the off season—both of which are indispensable for the dishes she prepares.

Receiving this loan will allow her to increase her income so that she can improve her living conditions.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: stockpiling cereals

loans.name: Nieta (Essor) Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Nieta est un regroupement de dix femmes ayant en moyenne 24 ans et 4 enfants vivant en majorité dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Marka-Coungo(deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali). Unies par des relations de mariage, de voisinage et de parenté, ces femmes font le commerce du bois de chauffe et des condiments alimentaires.
Après six prêts solidaires (prêt de groupe) tous correctement remboursés, ce groupe est à son septième prêt avec le programme crédit de l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso.
Elles comptent acheter, 1200 litres de lait auprès des éleveurs de Marka-Coungo et des villages environnants. Elles revendent aux grossistes venant des grandes villes telles Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali)une partie et l’autre partie est vendue dans le marché de Marka-Coungo au bord de la route  nationale N°9 reliant Bamako à Ségou en détail et au comptant.
Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice de 40 000 FCFA par mois. 
Les membres du groupe Nieta veulent ouvrir une munie laiterie à Marka-Coungo.
texts.en:
The Nieta group is comprised of ten women who, on average, are 24 years old and have 4 children. Most of them live in large traditional families in the village of Marka-Coungo (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Linked by bonds of marriage, neighborhood and family, these women sell firewood and food products. After six solidarity loans (group loans), all repaid without problems, this group is seeking its seventh loan from the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution program. They intend to buy 1'200 liters of milk from farmers in Marka-Coungo and from the surrounding villages. They resell part of it to wholesalers coming from large cities such as Bamako (the capital of the Republic of Mali), the remaining part being retailed for cash at the market of Marka-Coungo, on the side of Highway 9, linking Bamako to Ségou. They count on making each a monthly profit of XOF 40'000 (ca US$ 80). The members of the Nieta group intend to open a dairy in Marka-Coungo.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy milk

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr:
Née le 10 juillet 1981 à Lomé, Mlle A. Afi est couturière de formation. Très tôt, ayant compris que les revenus de son activité arrivaient à peine à subvenir à ses besoins, elle décida de joindre à ça le commerce de sac de friperie qui depuis un certain temps est sollicité dans sa zone dû à leur qualité. Limitée par ses moyens, elle sollicite un appui financier afin d’augmenter sa capacité d’approvisionnement et de fourniture dans sa zone.
Tout ceci augmentera ses revenus et lui permettra d’améliorer sa condition de vie voire même d’ouvrir un atelier de couture et une boutique.
texts.en:
Born on July 10, 1981 in Lomé, Miss Afi A. trained as a dressmaker. Very early on, having found that the income from her business barely covered her needs, she decided to add the sale of used clothing which is much in demand where she lives, due to its high quality. Limited by her means, she is requesting financial aid so that she can expand her capacity for her businesses in her area.

This will raise her income and allow her to improve her standard of living, and perhaps even to open a sewing workshop and a shop.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchasing and selling used clothing

loans.name: Lomas  Del Consuelo Group

texts.es:
The Lomas del Consuelo Group is comprised of four entrepreneurial women from Guadalupe, Zacatecas, who joined together with the common goal of helping their families get ahead and offering them a better quality of life. They have a seamstress shop called “Emily”, and all four share a love for sewing given that it is a craft they learned from a young age. Aurelia was the founder of the shop, something she wanted to do for a long time, as it has always been her trade. She started 22 years ago sewing for friends and from there the idea was born to set up a sewing workshop. Juana María started in the shop three years ago, having been invited by the owner to join her in this activity. Esperanza started two years ago, becoming part of the business. Lourdes arrived at the shop three years ago as an apprentice, and she now makes her living sewing. These women need a loan of $12,000 MXN, to be repaid in six months, to buy new sewing machines so they can do their work more easily and of a better quality. With your help these ladies will get ahead!

Translated from Spanish by N Aviva, Kiva volunteer

El Grupo Lomas del Consuelo esta integrado por 4 mujeres emprendedoras de Guadalupe, Zacatecas, que se unieron con un fin en común sacar adelante a sus familias y ofrecerles mejor calidad de vida, ellas tienen un taller de corte y confección llamado “Emily” las 4 comparten además el gusto por la costura ya que es un oficio que aprendieron desde pequeñas. Aurelia fue la iniciadora de este taller tenia la inquietud de poner un taller de costura ya que este siempre ha sido su oficio. Comenzó hace 22 años haciendo costura entre sus amistades y de ahí nació la idea de poner el taller de costura. Juana María comenzó hace 3 años en el taller de costura por invitación de la propietaria del taller para tener una actividad. Esperanza comenzó hace 2 años formando parte de este taller de costura. Lourdes hace 3 años llegue al taller de costura como aprendiz y ahora ya gana un sueldo en la costura. Ellas necesitan de un préstamo por $12,000 que pagaran en 6 meses para comprar maquinas de coser nuevas y poder hacer su trabajo mas ágil y con mayor calidad. Con tu apoyo ellas saldrán adelante!!!

loans.use: Buy sewing machines

loans.name: Sabougnouma (Porte Bonheur) Group

texts.fr:
Les dix femmes du groupe Sabougnouma (toutes mariées) ont en moyenne 30 ans et 4 enfants et vivent dans des foyers polygames dans le village de Marka-Coungo (Région de Koulikoro République du Mali)
Liés par des relations essentiellement commerciales, les membres de ce groupe font à majorité le commerce des condiments alimentaires. En plus du commerce elles font de temps à autres la restauration.
Afin de développer leur commerce ces femmes ont décidé de collaborer avec le programme crédit de l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant 4 ans.  Après avoir correctement remboursé les sept premiers prêts solidaires (prêt de groupe) elles sont à leur huitième prêt et comptent l’utiliser pour acheter, 250 kg d’oignon, 400 kg de sel de cuisine, 200 kg de concentrée de tomate dans les différents marchés de Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali).
Les articles ainsi achetés sont revendus dans le marché de Marka-Coungo à une clientèle essentiellement composée de femmes au comptant en détail et à crédit.
 Elles espèrent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen de 30 000 FCFA par mois qu’elles se projettent d’utiliser pour les frais de santé et d’éducation des enfants.
texts.en:
The six members of the group Sabougnouma are all married women who average 30 years of age and four children. The live in polygamous households in the village of Marka-Coungo (Region of Koulikoro, Republic of Mali). Linked by essentially commercial ties, most of the members of this group trade in condiments. In addition, they sometimes do catering. In order to develop their commerce, these women decided to collaborate with the loan program of the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso four years ago. After having correctly repaid the first seven solidarity loans (group loans), they are on their eighth loan and intend to use it to buy: 250 kg of onions, 400 kg of kitchen salt, and 200 kg of tomato paste, all from different marketplaces in Bamako (capital of Mali). The goods thus purchased are resold retail, cash or credit accepted, at the Marka-Coungo market to customers essentially composed of women. The group members each hope to realize an average profit of 30,000 francs CFA per month that they plan to use for covering the costs of health care and education for the children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy condiments

loans.name: Mamadou

texts.fr: Mamadou D. est un commerçant agé de 25 ans  il est célibataire .son activité principale est la vente de produits de premiere necessité  sourtout des denrées alimentaires .Il est societaire de la caisse depuis 3 mois  .Avec le pret sollicite il renforce son activite par l achat de quantite importante de marchandises.
texts.en:
Mamadou D. is a businessman who is 25 years old. He is single. His primary activity is to sell basic goods, especially food. He is a member of the cooperative since 3 months ago. With the loan he will reinforce his activity by buying a large quantiity of merchandise.

Translated from French by Isabelle Barres, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Loan capital

loans.name: Justice

texts.en:
Justice I. O. is 34 years old. He is single, and he has one child who is currently in school. Justice is a dealer of bicycle parts in the community where he lives, which is a Ashiaman community. More specifically, he sells used bicycles, but he also provides bike-related repairs and service for his customers. He buys his supplies at wholesale prices from importers at the Tema harbor of Ghana, and he sells the goods to his customers at retail prices. He explains that selling bicycle-related items is a very lucrative business because most of the workers and school children in his area ride their bicycles to their place of work and/or school.

Now, he is seeking a loan to increase his inventory of bicycle parts in order to better provide for his customers. Further, he is hopeful that the loan proceeds will enable him to increase his savings so that he can expand his shop and support his child in school.

He is a member of the community group known as "Bamali Sha Allah" (without God, you can do nothing) Trust Group. In this group, members agree to guarantee each others' loans as social collateral to ensure that their respective loans are promptly repaid. His picture was taken when he was at one of their group meetings.

loans.use: The meet his customers' demands by increasing his inventory of used bicycles and bicycle parts.

loans.name: Afiavi

texts.fr:
Madame A. Afiavi est mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Née le 17 août 1959, elle fit ses études primaires qu’elle abandonna très tôt pour se lancer dans le commerce puisqu’elle devait prendre en charge ses petits frères et sœurs. Avec un grand nombre d’année passé dans le commerce de charbon de bois, elle sollicite aujourd’hui un crédit en vue d’ouvrir un autre point de vente puisque la demande devient de plus en plus forte.
Ce crédit ainsi débloqué l’aidera beaucoup à augmenter son chiffre d’affaire et à améliorer la vie de sa petite famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. Afiavi A. is married and the mother of 4 children. Born August 17, 1959, she began primary school but dropped out early on to begin earning money since she had to be responsible for her little brothers and sisters. Having spent a lot of years selling charcoal, she is requesting a loan that will allow her to open another sales point since demand is always growing.

This loan, once received, will help her increase her turnover and improve the life of her little family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: stocking and re-selling charcoal

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en:
Mariama Z. is a 47-year-old married woman. She and her husband have six children, all of whom are currently in school. To support her household, she sells food stuffs such as maize, bags of millet, beans, groundnuts and gari to her loyal customers in her neighborhood. 

She explains that selling such food products has proved to be a very lucrative business. As a result, she is now seeking a loan to expand her inventory, which she believes will enable her generate more income in order to better support her family. 

Mariama is a member of the group known as "Bamali Sha Allah" (without God, you can do nothing) Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee each others' loans as social collateral to ensure that their respective loans are promptly repaid. Her picture was taken at one of their group meetings.

loans.use: The expand her inventory by purchasing additional food stuffs (e.g., maize, millet, groundnuts, gari and beans).

loans.name: Kadiatou Fofana

texts.fr:
Agé de 40 ans Madame K. F. est veuve depuis 2001 qui vit dans une famille nucléaire avec ses deux (2) enfants dans la ville de la sous-préfecture de Fana (région de Koulikoro République du Mali).
Avec le décès prématuré de son conjoint, elle devient l’unique soutien de la famille d’où l’intensification de ses activités économiques à savoir l’achat et la vente de chaussures (en plastique, en cuir etc), de sacs à main et de produits cosmétiques depuis maintenant 5 ans. Elle dispose d’une boutique au grand marché de Fana où défilent à longueur de journée les dames et quelques hommes.
Pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante et exigeante, elle rentre en relation avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso (qu’elle connue à travers une amie) avec qui elle est à son premier prêt individuel. 
Elle compte utiliser ce prêt pour acheter, 100 paires de chaussures (de différentes sortes) pour hommes et femmes et 150 sacs à main pour les femmes auprès des grossistes du grand marché de la ville de Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali). 
Madame K. F. effectue ses ventes, en détail, au comptant et à crédit (payable mensuellement) à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Les activités de vente sont importantes en cette période de l’année en raison de la proximité de la fête de tabaski.
Avec ce prêt K. compte réaliser 35.000 FCFA de bénéfice par mois qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour subvenir aux dépenses (frais de nourriture, de santé et d’éducation) de ses deux orphelins.
texts.en:
Madame K. F. is 40 years old and has been a widow since 2001. She lives in a nuclear family with her two children in the city of the sub-prefecture of Fana (Koulikoro region, Republic of Mali). With the premature death of her husband, she became the only breadwinner, thus the intensification of her work, namely buying and selling shoes (made of plastic, leather, etc.), handbags, and cosmetics over the last five years. She has a shop at the grand marketplace of Fana, where women and some men come and go all day long.

To satisfy better her demanding and burgeoning customer base, she is re-associating herself with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso (that she got to know through a friend) with which she is on her first individual loan. She intends to use this loan to buy 100 pairs of shoes (of different sorts) for men and women and 150 handbags for women, from wholesalers of the grand marketplace of the city of Bamako (capital of Mali).

Accepting cash or credit (payable monthly) for her goods, Ms. K. F. makes her sales at the retail level to customers composed of men and women. Sales activity is high during this time of year because the Feast of Tabaski is approaching.

With this loan, she intends to realize 35,000 francs CFA of profit per month that will be used essentially to provide for her two orphans (in terms of the costs of food, health, and education).

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy shoes and handbags

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es: Luisa, de 52 años de edad, es madre soltera, vive junto a su único hijo que está cursando estudios superiores. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa, como también trabaja como secretaria en la municipalidad de Pucallpa, Luisa viene realizando la venta de ropa desde hace ya 2 años, lleva sus prendas por distintos lugares de su zona. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que se relaciona más e intercambia ideas con sus clientes. Le es rentable, ya que cuenta con una clientela selecta que requieren de estas prendas. Le va muy bien, se siente satisfecha y con ganas de seguir creciendo. Es su primer préstamo con MFP. Con el dinero solicitado comprará más ropa para niños y adultos, y posteriormente alquilar un local para poner su tienda/Boutique.
texts.en:
Luisa is 52 years old and a single mother. She lives with her only child who is a university student. Luisa works selling clothing and also works as a secretary for the city government of Pucallpa. She has been selling clothing for two years and takes her garments to different places in the area. What she likes most about her work is the relationships and exchange of ideas with her clients. The business is profitable because she has a select clientele that requires these garments. Things are going well for her and she feels satisfied and has the desire to continue to grow. This is her first loan with MFP. With the money that she is requesting she will purchase more clothing for children and adults and later rent a locale where she will open her boutique.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing to sell

loans.name: Kadiatou M

texts.fr: Kadidiatou M D., 36 ans, mariée, 04 enfants  en charge est membre du banc villageois de Sinthiang Coundara depuis 4 ans et demi. Son activité consiste à acheter des arachides qu’elle décortique et transforme en pâte d’arachide pour vendre. Ses revenus lui permettent de participer aux dépenses familiales. Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Kadidiatou M D., age 36, is married and has four children in her care. She has been a member of the village loan group of Sinthiang Coundara for four and a half years. Her business consists of buying peanuts that she husks and then transforms into peanut butter to sell. Her income enables her to help with family expenses. The loan she is requesting will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy peanuts, firewood, and buckets and to hire help

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria A. is a 36-year-old married woman with four kids. She owns and operates a grocery shop in her neighborhood, where she sells items such as rice, sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, soft drinks, and powdered milk.

At present, she is seeking a loan to expand her inventory; specifically, she is hoping to purchase more bags of rice, sugar, and body and hair creams, as well as cartons/crates of vegetable oil and soft drinks. In turn, she is optimistic that she can save more money to support her children while they attend school.

Victoria is a member of the group known as "Bamali Sha Allah" (without God, you can do nothing) Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee each others' loan as social collateral to ensure that their respective loans are promptly repaid. Her picture was taken at one of their group meetings.

loans.use: The increase her grocery store's inventory by purchasing more bags of rice, sugar and creams, and cartons/crates of vegetable oil and soft drinks

loans.name: Michel

texts.fr: Michel D. est âgé de 37 ans, marié et père de 3 enfants tous sur les bancs de l’école. Il est conducteur de taxi moto depuis 5 ans. Sa moto étant usée n’arrive plus à répondre parfaitement à ses exigences. Pour se faire, Michel désire acheter une nouvelle moto pour relancer son activité
texts.en:
Michel D. is 37 years old, married, and the father of three children, who are in school. He has been a motorbike taxi driver for five years. His worn out motorbike can no longer fulfill his needs very well. And so Michel would like to buy a new motorbike to reinvigorate his business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Johnson

texts.en:
Johnson A. K. is a 38-year-old married man. He and his wife have two kids, both of whom are currently in school. Johnson is a dealer of plumbing materials and food stuffs; to illustrate, he sells maize, which he receives from local farming communities. Notably, he has been in this line of business for 6 years and, over that course of time, he has developed a loyal customer base.

He buys his supplies at wholesale prices and he then sells such supplies to his customers at retail prices. Now, he is seeking a loan to increase his stock of plumbing materials, including pipes and sinks. In turn, he hopes that he will generate greater income in order to expand his shop.

Johnson is a member of the group known as "Bamali Sha Allah" (without God, you can do nothing) Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee each others' loans as social collateral to ensure that their respective loans are promptly repaid. His picture was taken at one of their group meetings.

loans.use: The increase his inventory of plumbing materials and to eventually expand his shop

loans.name: Komi

texts.fr: Komi T. est un conducteur de taxi moto à Womé, un village situé à environ 130 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Agé de 40 ans il est marié et père de 3 enfants. La moto qu’il conduit n’étant pas de sa propriété, il désire par ce crédit acquérir sa propre moto afin de gagner plus pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Komi T. is a motorbike taxi driver in Womé, a village located about 130 km from Lomé, the Togolese capital. He is 40 years old, married, and the father of three. The motorbike he drives is not his own, so he would like to use this loan to acquire one of his own in order to earn more to provide for his family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Téning

texts.fr: Téning Wagué, 38 ans, mariée, 02 enfants  en charge est membre du banc villageois de Sinthiang Coundara depuis 5 ans et demi. Elle veut acheter des arachides qu’elle va décortiquer et transformer en pâte d’arachide pour vendre sur une table avec d'autres produits comme des légumes et du poisson séché. Elle veut renforcer son activité qui lui permet de participer aux charges familiales. Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Téning Wagué, 38 years old, is married and is taking care of 2 children. She has been a member of the village bank Sinthiang Coundara for 5 1/2 years. She wants to buy peanuts that she will transform into peanut butter to sell on a table with other products such as vegetables and dried fish. She wants to reinforce her activity to contribute to the family expenses. The loan that she is requesting will be reimbursed in 6 months in only one repayment.

Translated from French by Isabelle Barres, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw materials to make peanut butter

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet O. is a 44-year-old married woman. She and her husband have two children, both of whom have completed school. She started trading goods four years ago, and she truly enjoys selling goods. More specifically, she trades clothing materials, and she believes in hard work and dedication when it comes to her business. She explains that she has gained a great deal of marketing experience ever since she started her business, making her one of the most successful traders in the Ashaiman market.

Now, she is seeking a loan to increase her capital so that she can purchase more clothing materials and thereby better serve her customers.

Janet is a member of the group known as the "Knowledge" Trust Group. Members in this group not only provide support for one another as they repay their loans, but they also guarantee each others' loans to esnure that such loans are promptly repaid. Her picture was captured when she was at one of their group meeting.

loans.use: The increase her inventory of clothing materials

loans.name: Yao

texts.fr:
Né le 14 avril 1974, Monsieur K. Yao est marié et père de 2 enfans. Mécanicien de profession, voyant les revenus de sa profession insuffisant, il décide de joindre le transport en commun à l’aide d’une moto communément appelé Taxi moto qui est un secteur florissant dans notre économie à son activité principale. Pour réaliser ses ambitions, il sollicite un crédit afin d’acheter une moto et se relancer dans ce secteur de taxi moto.
Ceci l’aidera à accroître ses revenus ainsi il contribuera à améliorer les conditions de vie très misérables de sa famille.
texts.en:
Born on 14 April 1974, Mr. Yao K. is married and is the father of 2 children. A mechanic by profession, and seeing that the income from his job is insufficient, he has decided to go into public transportation with the help of a motorcycle, commonly called a Taxi moto. This is a flourishing sector in the local economy, and he intends to pursue this as his principal activity. To realize his ambitions, he is asking for a loan in order to buy a motorcycle and to launch himself in the motorcycle taxi sector. This will help him increase his income, and thus contribute to improving the miserable living conditions of his family.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Kossi
