texts.fr: Kossi G. est revendeur des habits prêts-à-porter à Wome, un village situé au nord-ouest de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Agé de 37 ans, il est marié et père de 2 enfants. Afin répondre aux demandes de la clientèle, il espère avec ce crédit s’approvisionner alimenter sa boutique.
texts.en:
Kossi G. sells ready-to-wear clothes in Wome, a village located to the north west of Lomé, the Togolese capital. He is 37 years old, married and the father of two children. In order to meet customer demand, he is hoping to use this loan to buy supplies for his shop.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothes for resale

loans.name: Sadio Aissatou

texts.fr: Sadio Aissatou Baldé, 51 ans, mariée, 07 enfants  en charge est membre du banc villageois de Sinthiang Coundara depuis 3 ans et demi. Elle veut renforcer son commerce en approvisionnant sa boutique en piles, lait gloria, cigarettes, thé, huile végétale, huile de palme et autres petits condiments.  Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Sadio Aissatou Baldé is 51 years old, married, has 7 children in her care, and has been a member of the village loan group of Sinthiang Coundara for three and a half years. She would like to strengthen her business by stocking her store with batteries, Gloria milk (a brand of powdered milk), cigarettes, tea, vegetable oil, palm oil, and other small condiments. The loan she is asking for will be reimbursed at the end of six months in a single payment.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise for a retail store

loans.name: Christian

texts.en:
Christiana A. is 30 years old, and she is the mother of two children: one child has completed senior high school, while the other is still in school. She is very hard-working, and the income she generates from her business is critical to her family's well-being. More specifically, she trades in charcoal in her neighborhood. Charcoal, she explains, is a very popular source of energy for cooking purposes in nearly every Ghanaian home. Christiana obtains her supply of charcoal from the surrounding villages of Jamani in the Eastern region of Ghana (where she lives), and she sells such charcoal at retail prices to her customers.

Now, she is requesting a loan to buy charcoal in bulk to thereby increase her inventory of charcoal. Moreover, she hopes that the loan proceeds will enable her to increase her savings in order to pay for her children’s school fees.

Christiana is a member of the community group known as the Knowledge Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee each others' loans as social collateral to ensure that their respective loans are promptly repaid. Her picture was taken at one of her group's meetings.

loans.use: To expand her inventory by purchasing charcoal in bulk

loans.name: Yaovi

texts.fr:
Né le 1er décembre 1973, Monsieur H. Yaovi est marié et père de 3 enfants tous scolarisés. Elever de volaille dont le rendement devient faible ses derniers temps dû à la grippe aviaire qui a détruit la grande partie de sa volaille. Dans le souci de changer d’activité, il sollicite un crédit en vue de s’acheter une moto neuve et en faire un taxi moto qui est un secteur florissant de nos jours.
Ce crédit débloqué lui permettra d’avoir un métier un peu plus stable et faire face aux besoins de sa famille et ainsi changer son niveau de vie actuelle. Accompagnons le ainsi à sortir de sa situation de crise qu’il traverse suite à la peste aviaire.
texts.en:
Born on 1 December 1973, Mr. Yaovi H. is married and has 3 children, all in school. He is a poultry farmer whose yield has recently become low due to the avian flu, which has destroyed a large portion of his poultry. In the hope of changing his business, he is asking for a loan in order to buy a new motorcycle and to turn it into a motorcycle taxi, which is a flourishing business sector these days. This loan will allow him to have a more stable profession and meet the needs of his family, and thus change his current standard of living. Let us help him get out of the crisis situation he has been in following the avian flu.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac S. is a 39-year-old married man. He and his wife have two children, though he bears the entire financial burden of providing for his family. To that end, he owns and operates a grocery store where he sells items such as rice, sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, body and hair cream, and powdered milk.

At present, he is hoping to expand his business to better meet his customers' demands because they are constantly requesting items that he does not have in stock. Therefore, he is seeking a loan to increase his inventory by buying more bags of rice, sugar, body and hair cream, as well as cartons of vegetable oil. Accordingly, he hopes to see an increase in sales to thereby enable him save more money for his children’s education.

Isaac is a member of a community group known as the Knowledge Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee each others' loans as social collateral to ensure that their respective loans are promptly repaid. His picture was taken when he was at one of their group meetings.

loans.use: To meet customer demand by increasing his inventory (i.e., by purchasing additonal rice, sugar, vegetable oil, and body and hair cream)

loans.name: Marian Celestin

texts.en:
Marian Celestin N. is a 51-year-old married woman with one child. She is very hard-working, and she is committed to providing financial support for her family through her entrepreneurial skills. To that end, she has a business whereby she trades charcoal and maize in her neighborhood. She explains that charcoal is a very popular source of energy for cooking in nearly every Ghanaian home. Marian obtains her supply of charcoal and maize from the surrounding villages of Jamani in the Eastern region of Ghana, and then she sells such charcoal and maize at retail prices to her customers.

She is currently seeking a loan to increase her inventory by purchasing charcoal and maize in bulk. In turn, she hopes that the loan will enable her to increase her savings in such a way that she can pay for her family's living expenses.

Marian is a member of the community group known as the Knowledge Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee each others' loans as social collateral to ensure that their respective loans are promptly repaid. Her picture was taken at one of her group's meetings.

loans.use: The increase her inventory by purchasing a bulk supply of charcoal and maize.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith T. F. is a 28-year-old married woman. She and her husband have one child who is currently in school. She is a petty trader, and she has been in the trading business for the past 4 years. More specifically, she trades in spices such as peppers and onions at a table in the local market. Judith proudly states that her business has enabled her to support her child's school expenses.

Even so, she is seeking a loan to expand and improve her business by increasing her inventory. In particular, she would like to buy more bags of peppers and onions. Accordingly, she hopes to double her savings to continue to take care of her child in school and to cover other family expenses.

Judith is a member of the community group known as the Knowledge Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee each others' loans as social collateral to ensure that their respective loans are promptly repaid. Her picture was taken at one of her group's meetings.

loans.use: To expand and improve her trading business by purchasing additional bags of peppers and onions.

loans.name: Salimatou

texts.fr: Salimatou N., 20 ans, mariée, 02 enfants  en charge est membre du banc villageois de Sinthiang Coundara depuis 5 ans et demi. Son activité consiste à acheter des arachides qu’elle décortique et transforme en pâte d’arachide pour vendre. Elle veut renforcer son activité. Elle sollicite un  prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Salimatou N. is 20 years old, married, has 2 children in her care, and has been a member of the village loan group of Sinthiang Coundara for 5 and a half years. Her business consists of buying peanuts, which she shells and transforms into peanut paste for sale. She would like to strengthen her business. She is asking for a loan which will be reimbursed at the end of six months in a single payment.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy peanuts, wood, buckets, and to pay for labour

loans.name: Gifty

texts.en:
Gifty A. is a 30-year-old single woman with one child who is currently in school. She is a seller of pharmaceutical products, including antibiotic drugs, pain killers, and blood tonics. She sells such pharmaceuticals at the local market in Ashaiman, where she lives with her family.

She proudly states that most people in her community buy their pharmaceutical products from her because of the current national health insurance policy being implemented by the government of Ghana. Even so, she is seeking a loan to increase her supply of pharmaceutical drugs to better meet the needs of her customers. In doing so, she hopes to generate enough income to pay for her child's education.

Gifty is a member of the community group known as the “Ultimate” Trust Group. In this group, members not only provide support for one another in their efforts to repay their loans, but they also guarantee each others' loans as social collateral to ensure that their respective loans are promptly repaid. Her picture was taken at one of their group meetings.

loans.use: To meet customer demand by increasing her supply of pharmaceutical drugs

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose A. is a 56-year-old divorced mother of two children, both of whom are currently in school. For the past twenty five years, Rose has been a trader at the local market of Tema in Ghana. More specifically, she is food vendor operator who sells porridge (koko and masa). She notes that many Ghanaians enjoy this food, especially in the morning, and that most students eat this food (which they call "sha bra," meaning "sharp brain") because it is very affordable.

With her 25 years of experience, however, she is convinced that her business can really excel with an increase in capital. As such, she is seeking a loan to increase her inventory by purchasing an additional stock of firewood and food stuffs such as sugar, beans, groundnuts, millet, and wheat. Moreover, she hopes to use any remaining loan proceeds to finance her children's education.

Rose is a member of the community group known as the Ultimate Trust Group. In this group, members not only provide support for one another as they try to repay their loans, but they also guarantee each others' loans as social collateral to ensure that their respective loans are promptly repaid. Her picture was taken at one of their group meetings.

loans.use: To increase her inventory by purchasing additional firewood and food stuffs (e.g., sugar, beans, and wheat)

loans.name: Francis' Group

texts.en:
Francis A. is a 58-year-old businessman. He is married with three kids, and he is very dedicated to his work because he supports his family with proceeds from his business. He owns and operates a grocery shore where he sells items such as rice, evaporated milk, canned foods, drinks, assorted cooking oils, washing powder, toilet soaps, candy, and biscuits at the local market of Ashaiman. 

Now, he is seeking a loan in order to expand and improve his business. Specifically, he would use the loan proceeds to purchase grocery store items (e.g., rice, milk, and spices) in bulk. In turn, Francis hopes to save more money so that he can pay for his children's education. 

Francis is a member of the community group known as the "Ultimate Trust Group." In this group, members not only provide support for one another as they try to repay their loans, but they also guarantee each others' loans to ensure that their respective loans are promptly repaid. His picture was taken at one of his group's meetings.

loans.use: To expand and improve his grocery store by purchasing additional items (e.g., rice, milk, and spices) in bulk

loans.name: Maku

texts.en:
Maku T. is a 60-year-old married woman. She and her husband have six children, all of whom are married. With her business, Maku has been able to support her family from a financial standpoint. Specifically, she is a food vendor, and she sells kenkey and maize. (Kenkey is prepared from milled maize grains: it is cooked and then eaten with hot pepper and fried fish.)

She proudly states that she has many loyal customers because many Ghanaians enjoy kenkey for breakfast, lunch and/or supper. Nevertheless, she is seeking a loan in order to buy more raw materials for her operation, including bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood. Accordingly, she hopes to increase her savings to enable her husband to embark on their building project.

Maku is a member of the community group known as the Favour Trust Group. In this group, members not only support one another as they try to repay their loans, but they also guarantee each others' loans as social collateral to ensure that their respective loans are promptly repaid. Her picture was taken when she at one of her group's meetings.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business by purchasing additional raw materials (e.g., maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood).

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose T. is a 40-year-old married woman. She and her husband have nine children, three of whom are currently in school. For the past ten years, Rose has been trading at the local market of Tema in Ghana as a food vendor. More specifically, she is food vendor operator who sells porridge (koko and masa). She explains that many Ghanaians enjoy this food, especially in the morning, and that students often eat her food (which they call "sha bra," meaning "sharp brain") because it is very affordable.

With her 10 years of experience, however, she is convinced that her business can excel even more with an increase in capital. To that end, she is requesting a loan to expand and improve her business by increasing her inventory (i.e., by purchasing additional beans, groundnuts, millet, wheat, sugar, sorghum, firewood, etc.). Moreover, she plans to use a portion of the loan proceeds to finance her children's education.

Rose is a member of the community group known as the Favour Trust Group. In this group, members not only support one another as they try to repay their loans, but they also guarantee each others' loans as social collateral to ensure that their respective loans are promptly repaid. Her picture was taken when she at one of her group's meetings.

loans.use: To increase inventory by purchasing raw materials (e.g., sugar, millet, sorghum, and firewood) used in her business

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace A. is 32 years old and a married mother with one child. Currently, the child is in school. Grace operates a restaurant and is also a baker, who bakes bread and cakes and supplies them to her loyal customers. She has 2 years of experience in the field. She wants to add to her existing business, such as by selling spring rolls which she says customers want for breakfast. She therefore wants to use the loan to buy more bags of rice and flour, vegetables, eggs and assorted meat to expand her operation.

She is a member of the group called ‘Favor’. Members in this group agree to guarantee and support one another to repay the loan. Her picture was taken when she was visited.

loans.use: To purchase bags of rice and baking flour

loans.name: Godson

texts.en: Godson Degaulle is forty-eight years old. He is married with two kids. Godson has been a taxi driver for the past ten years. This has been his major occupation and the main source of livelihood for his family. He drives passengers from the local lorry station to nearby towns at a  fare of 30 pesewas per person. However, his business has been in crisis of late because his car has broken down and he needs money for repairs. With the loan, Godson wants undertake effective repair works on his car to enable him to resume his business and get his kids back to school. He is a member of a borrowing group called Ultimate Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access loans and support one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: The purchase of spare parts to repair his taxi cab.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John K. T. is 48 years old. He married and a father of three kids. Currently, the kids are in school. He has been in a furniture and interior decoration business for six years. He is a specialist in dining table and chair sets, beds, stuffed chairs, kitchen decorations, etc. His experience, skills and designs are high class. He designs various kinds of styles that give his customers a new look in their homes, offices, kitchens, etc. He hopes to increase his savings to provide his children with a quality education.

He is a member of the community group called Favor Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access and repay the loan. His picture was taken when he was visited at their group meeting.

loans.use: Purchase  increased supplies of furniture and upholstery materials like linen, threads, thimbles, glue, designer materials etc.

loans.name: Juana Nicolasa

texts.es: Juana Nicolasa Gutiérrez Cuá, guatemalteca, con residencia en el paraje Panimá final de la zona 1 de este municipio de Totonicapán, ella es una mujer soltera, en la cual desde sus 20 años de edad viene realizando dicha actividad en la venta de productos de la canasta basica con los ingreso que obtiene ella contribuye a los ingresos de su familia  (productos de consumo diario o abarrotería)en ASDIR solicita un credito para incrementar su capital y surtir su tienda especialmente en estas epocas de fin de año contar con varios productos que pueda satisfacer las necesidades de los clientes  .
texts.en:
Juana Nicolasa Guitierrez C. is Guatemalan with a residence in Panima Final located in Zone 1 in the municipality of Totonicapan. She is a single woman, who in her 20 years of age she has been carrying a business selling basic needs products. The income she obtains is directed towards the family income (for products of daily use, or groceries). She requests a loan from ASDIR to incrase her working capital and to restock her store, especially during this season of year-end, so that she can have the products to satisfy the necessities of her clients.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase products of everyday needs.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca N. is 45 years old and a married mother with four children. All her children are currently in school.

Rebecca treks to farming communities to purchase products and retail them in the town market. She says the price of commodities is on the rise and she therefore wants to use this loan to buy more bags of local rice to avoid price hikes and frequent travels. She hopes to increase her savings in order to support her husband in paying the children’s school fees.

Rebecca is a member of the group called Gold. Members agree to guarantee for one other as social collateral and assist each other in repaying the loan.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of local rice.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos C. C. vive en su vivienda propia en la zona de Pasankeri, área suburbana de esta ciudad con su esposa, la señora Mercedes Arteaga y sus dos hijos.
Carlos trabaja como empleado de la construcción, es contratista independiente, su esposa es ayudante de cocina en un restaurante de la zona.
Debido al desnivel de su propiedad, Carlos ha realizado la excavación de su terreno para nivelar el mismo con la calle.
El crédito solicitado será para la construcción de un muro de contención, esto permitirá estabilizar la vivienda.
Esta es la primera vez que solicita préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente, por lo tanto, puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Carlos C. C. lives in his own home in the Pasankeri zone, a suburban area of this city, with his wife Mercedes Arteaga and his two children.

Carlos works as a construction worker, he is an independent contractor, and his wife works in the kitchen of one of the zone’s restaurants.

Due to the uneven nature of his property, Carlos has excavated his land to make it level with the street.

The loan he is requesting would be used to build a retaining wall, which would allow him to stabilize his house.

This is the first time he seeks a loan, and the socioeconomic analysis conducted qualifies him favorably for access to credit.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a retaining wall.

loans.name: Araceli

texts.en:
Araceli J. C. is a member of the Wiracocha (“Sun God”) Village Bank. She is married with one 16-year-old son and a baby on the way. 

Araceli runs an educational daycare center for children ages 0-6 in Santa Elena, a village outside of the city of Ayacucho, Peru. She has been in this business for the past four years, and her business has grown bit by bit. She used to run the center from her home, then moved to another facility when the daycare outgrew her home. Now, she is planning to open an even larger daycare center in the center of Ayacucho. She is currently in the process of formalizing her business, along with her investment partner.

Araceli is requesting a loan of 1000 soles ($325 USD) to buy rugs and ceramic tile for her daycare center. She says it will be a different kind of daycare, more responsive to the needs of a modern family. She will pick up kids at their homes so their parents don’t have to worry about dropping them off, and also plans to offer educational classes for expectant mothers. 

Araceli’s baby is due on November 24th. She jokingly calls him her “first student.” She hopes to see her business grow more and more in the future so that she can continue to support her children and their education. Her older son hopes to go to medical school in Lima next year.

loans.use: Buy carpeting for daycare center

loans.name: Maria Del Rosario

texts.en: Maria Del Rosario U. F. is a member of the community bank Las Gaviotas, which means “the seagulls” in Spanish. Rosario has invested in a telephone business. She has an employee who works at a store and sells telephones and phone plans. With her loan of 1500 soles, she will continue investing in her business. She is currently saving to be able to have a more comfortable life and to continue investing.

loans.use: With her loan of 1500 soles she will continue investing into her business

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a member of the Despertar ("Awaken") Communal Bank. She is 38 years old and lives with her husband and their five children. She has a stand in the Miraflores market (located on the outskirts of the city of Ayacucho) where she sells dry goods every day. She also has another stand, administered by her son, where she sells grains. Her son works at the stand in the morning and studies in the afternoons.

Elizabeth needs a loan of 2400 soles to buy fruitcake and milk for the Christmas season.

Elizabeth dreams of buying a car to use for passenger transport and for her children to complete their education.

Translated by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva volunteer

Elizabeth es socia del Banco Comunal Despertar. Elizabeth es conviviente, tiene 38 años y 5 hijos, Elizabeth tiene un puesto en el mercado Miraflores que se ubica en las afueras de la ciudad de Ayacucho, en donde vende abarrotes, actividad que realiza todos los días. Además Elizabeth tiene otro puesto en donde vende cereales, este negocio esta administrado por su hijo quien atiende por las mañanas y por las tardes estudia. Elizabeth necesita un préstamo de 2400 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de panetones, leches para la campaña navideña. Elizabeth sueña con comprar un carro para realizar transporte urbano y que sus hijos culminen sus estudios.

loans.use: Buy fruitcake and milk

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.en:
Maria is a member of the Despertar ("Awaken") Communal Bank. Maria is 40 years old and lives with her husband and her four children. She has a store in the Sarita Colonia Gallery, on a street near the central market in Ayacucho. She and her husband sell a variety of clothing. Maria also sells mazmorra (a tradition Peruvian dessert made from purple corn gelatin, pineapple and other fruits) at night in front of her store.

Maria needs a loan of 2000 soles to buy pants, jackets, sweaters and women's shirts.

Maria dreams of opening additional locations and of building another level onto her home.

Translated by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva volunteer Maria es socia del Banco Comunal Despertar. Maria es conviviente, tiene 40 años y 4 hijos, Maria tiene una tienda en la galería Sarita Colonia, que se ubica en una calle cercana al mercado central de la ciudad de Ayacucho, en donde vende ropa variada, actividad que realiza con el apoyo de su esposo. Además Maria por las noches vende mazamorras en la puerta de su tienda. Maria necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de pantalones, casacas, chompas, blusas. Maria sueña con tener otras sucursales, construir otro piso mas en su casa.

loans.use: Buy pants, sweaters, jackets and shirts

loans.name: Arrieros Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Arrieros esta integrado por personas que viven en el distrito D. Carmen Alto que se encuentra en L. ciudad D. Huamanga, zona tradicional en donD. antiguamente vivían los arrieros y también es una zona artesanal en donD. se elaboran textiles, nombre que adquiere el Banco Comunal. 
El Banco Comunal Arrieros se inicia con 16 socias, muchas D. ellas fueron invitadas por L. promotora, algunas D. las socias son vecinas y familiares.
Las socias realizan diferentes actividades como venta D. comida, cereales, quesos, carnes, animales menores, abarrotes y algunos son artesanos textiles.
Muchas D. ellas venden sus productos ambulatoriamente, D. casa en casa, sus talleres se ubican en sus domicilios y las ventas los realiza en los mercados D. L. ciudad D. Huamanga.
Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos D. 300, 600, 900 soles, haciendo un total D. 9500 soles en el Banco Comunal.
Los prestamos será invertidos en L. compra D. cerdo, carnero, trigo, cebada, arroz, azúcar, quesos, tintes, lanas.
Los sueños D. las socias es ampliar sus negocios, establecer su negocio en un solo lugar  y sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank 'Arrieros' is maD. up of people who live in the district of Carmen Alto, which is located in the city of Huamanga, a region where muleteers have traditionally lived. It is also an artisan region where textiles are maD.. This is why the Bank is called as it is. The Communal Bank 'Arrieros' was started by 16 members; most of them were invited by the leader. Some of the members are neighbors and family members. The members perform many different activities such as selling food, cereals, cheese, beef, young animals, groceries and some are textile artisans. Many of them sell their products door to door; their workshops are located at their homes, and they also sell their goods at the market of the city of Huamanga. The members need different amounts of money (300, 600, 900 Soles); a total of 9500 Soles for the Communal Bank. The loans will be invested in purchasing pigs, goat, wheat, flour, rice, sugar, cheese, ink, and wool. The dreams of these members is to expand their businesses, to establish a store in a permanent address, and for their children to be professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase pigs, goat, wheat, flour, rice, sugar, cheese, ink, and wool.

loans.name: Blanca Nubia

texts.es:
Su Nombre es Blanca Nubia Olivia López su estado civil es casada, ella tiene 53 años de edad, Doña Blanca tiene una hija de 33 años de edad, que trabaja por cuenta propia y no depende de su mama, su compañero de vida labora como albañil, los propósitos que ella tiene es de establecer un local donde obtenga mas ingresos y proporcionar mejoras para ella como lo es la compra de un electrodoméstico como seria una refrigeradora pues la que posee no es de su pertenecía sino de las diferentes casas que le distribuyen el producto como la coca -cola  y pepsi y entre sus propósitos esta obtener sus artículos para su hogar ahorrando lo poco que obtiene en sus ingresos.

La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta de pollo y venta de jugos, gaseosa y  cerveza el tiempo que lleva en este negocio es de 4 años, ella inicia este negocio por motivación propia ya que siempre le ha gustado actuar de forma independiente y buscar el medio para sobrevivir e inicia con la venta de pollo del cual recibe ingresos y decide colocar otro negocio con la venta de gaseosas, jugos y cerveza ya que esta representa una fuerte demanda en su casa de habitación que esta ubicada en león en la siguiente dirección barrio de subtiava de la Texaco guido 3 ½ cuadra al norte, la solicitud de su financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para estar de esta manea activa en su negocio necesita incrementar mas en los productos de coca- cola, pepsi y cerveza por lo que tiene que tiene que satisfacer los diferentes gustos de sus clientes y recurre a este financiamiento por medio de la empresa Fundación León 2000 que le ha brindado su ayuda en los créditos.
texts.en:
Her name is Blanca Nubia Olivia López, she is married, 53 years old, and has a 33 year old daughter who works for herself and does not depend on her mother. Her lifetime partner works in construction. Her goal is to establish a locale where she can earn a greater income, and make improvements such as buying a refrigerator because the one she uses now does not belong to her but to the different houses that distribute such products as Coca-Cola and Pepsi to her. Her intentions include obtaining household products for her home by saving the little she earns.

The business she dedicates herself to is the sale of poultry, as well as juices, sodas, and beer. She has been in business for four years, having started by her own motivation as she has always liked to work independently and find her own way to survie. She started with poultry sales which generates income, and then decided to start another venture with the sale of sodas, juices and beer as these are in high demand in her hometown of León. Her reason for requesting a loan is for working capital to stay active in her business, as she needs to increase the quantity of Coca-Cola and Pepsi products she stocks to satisfy the different tastes of her customer base. She turns to this financing by way of the Fundación León 2000 which has provided her with loan assistance.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Madeley

texts.en:
Madeley is a member of the Despertar ("Awaken") Communal Bank. She is 33 years old and is married with four children. She runs a ceviche bar located on Bellido Street. Her restaurant specializes in ceviche, a traditional Peruvian dish made with raw fish and lemon. She has two employees, and her restaurant is open until 11pm.

Madeley needs a loan of 800 soles to buy a counter and chairs. She dreams of having her own investment capital for her business and of providing her children with a good education.

Translated by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva volunteer

Madeley es socia del Banco Comunal Despertar. Madeley es casada, tiene 33 años y 4 hijos, Madeley tiene una cebichería bar en un local alquilado ubicado en el Jr. Bellido, la especialidad de su restaurante es el cebiche (plato típico peruano elaborado con pescado y limón), para lo cual cuenta con 2 personales, y por las tardes funciona el bar hasta las 11 de la noche. Madeley necesita un préstamo de 800 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de mostrador y sillas. Madeley sueña con tener un capital propio y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.

loans.use: Buy a counter and chairs for ceviche restaurant

loans.name: Jesús

texts.es:
Jesús es socia del Banco Comunal Despertar.
Jesús es viuda, tiene 67 años y 8 hijos, Jesús vive con uno D. sus hijos, Jesús venD. leña en la casa donD. vive, la leña lo manda hacer en Ccejelambras para lo cual contrata a peones luego lo transporta a la ciudad D. Ayacucho en un carro alquilado. Además en algunas oportunidades venD. ropa a pedido en algunas ferias.
Jesús necesita un préstamo D. 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. árboles D. eucalipto.
Jesús sueña con tener una casa propia, mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Jesús is a member of the Awakening Communal Bank. Jesús is 67 years old, a widow, and has 8 children. She lives with one of her children and sells firewood from her home. She hires laborers to chop trees into firewood in Cejelambras and then transports it to the city of Ayacucho in a rented car. Sometimes she also sells clothing in some markets. Jesús needs a loan of 2,000 soles ($650), which will be invested in the purchase of eucalyptus trees. Jesús dreams of having her own home and improving her business.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy eucalyptus trees

loans.name: Teofila

texts.es:
Teofila es socia del Banco Comunal Despertar.
Teofila es casada, tiene 31 años y 3 hijos, Teofila viaja a la ciudad de Cañete todos los fines de semana que se ubica a 6 horas de la ciudad de Ayacucho, en donde vende cereales y de Cañete compra frutas como fresa, pepino que vende en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Ayacucho. Además Teofila tiene un establo en la ciudad de Cañete y junto a su esposo se dedican al engorde de ganado vacuno.
Teofila necesita un préstamo de 800 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cereales variados.
Teofila sueña con construir su casa, ampliar su negocio y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Teofila is a member of the Community Bank "Despertar" (meaning, Awaken).

Teofila is married, she is 31 years old and she has 3 children. Teofila travels to the city of Canete on the weekends, located 6 hours from the city of Ayacucho, where she sells cereals. And from Canete she purchases fruits such as strawberries and cucumbers which she then resells in the great markets in the city of Ayacucho. In addition, Teofila has a stable in the city of Canete and together with her husband they raise cattle.

Teofila requires a loan amounting to 800 soles, funds that will be invested in the purchase of various cereals.

Teofila dreams of building a house, expanding her busienss and providing a good education for her children.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TTeofila requires a loan of 800 soles, funds that will be invested in the purchase of various cereals.

loans.name: Teofila

texts.es:
Teofila es socia del Banco Comunal Despertar.
Teofila es conviviente, tiene 25 años y 1 hijo, Teofila tiene una tienda en el Jr Grau que se encuentra cerca al mercado central de la ciudad de Ayacucho, en donde vende ropa de niños, su mercadería lo adquiere en la ciudad de Lima. Además Teofila junto a su esposo tienen una mototaxi con el cual su esposo realiza transporte publico.
Teofila necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de polos, pantalones.
Los sueños de Teofila son tener casa propia, un local propio para realizar su negocio y la educación de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Teofila is a member of the Community Bank "Despertar" (meaning, Awaken).

Teofila is married common-law, she is 25 years old and has one son. Teofila has a store in Jr. Grau which is located near the central market in the city of Ayacucho. She sells children's clothing ans she acquires her mechandise in the city of Lima. Teofila, together with her husband, also has a motorcycle taxi which he drives, providing public transport.

Teofila requires a loan in the sum of 1000 soles, funds which will be invested in the purchase of polo shirts, and slacks.

Teofila's dream is to have her own home, to have her own store where she can carry out her business, and to provide an education to her children.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Teofila requires a loan of 1000 soles, funds which will be invested in the purchase of polo shirts and slacks.

loans.name: Vilma Margot

texts.en:
Vilma Margot is a member of the Wiracocha (“Sun God” in Quechua) Village Bank. She is 58 years old and has five adult children, one of whom still lives with her. Her husband died recently after a long period of illness, so Vilma Margot is now a widow.

Vilma Margot works at the Regional Health Authority in the city of Ayacucho and also sells cosmetics and women’s clothing in her free time. Most of her clients are friends, family members and co-workers. She is requesting a loan of 1400 soles to buy more women’s clothing to sell. She buys brand-name clothing new in Lima and brings it to the city of Ayacucho, which is about 9 hours away.

In the future, Vilma thinks about opening up a store of her own. Her daughter used to own her own store, but had to close it due to the expenses resulting from her father’s illness. Vilma would also like to sell a wider variety of merchandise, though she is also thinking about retirement.

She has been working with FINCA Peru for just under one year and says it has been a good experience that has helped her get out of some tough situations.

loans.use: Buy women's clothing

loans.name: Agustin

texts.es: El Señor Agustin de 38 años de edad, soltero, esta solicitando su credito # 4, el cual utilizara para cambiar las paredes de su vivienda y parte del techo, tiene 1 hijo de 18 años estudiando la secundaria, su hijo vive con su mamá pues estan separados, sin embargo esta pendiente de las necesidades pasando una pension alimenticia. El Señor O. Trabaja en el Hospital de la Esperanza-Rama, Zelaya Central, como auxiliar de enfermeria, con 21 años de servicio, por razones de trabajo vino la separacion con su esposa; ha sido un excelente cliente, muy querido por sus compañeros de trabajo, manifesto que continuara con sus creditos ya que AFODENIC es una financiera que sí apoya a los sectores mas vulnerables. Su mayor sueño es contar con una vivienda digna para su familia, aunque no vive con su hijo es el patrimonio que le dejará.
texts.en:
Agustin is 38 years old, single, and seeking his 4th loan, which he will use to change the walls in his home and part of the roof. He has one 18-year old son who is studying in secondary school. His son lives with his mother, as they are separated. Despite this, he is aware of his son’s needs and pays support. Mr. O. works in the Esperanza-Rama Hospital, Zelaya Central, as an infirmary assistant. With 21 years of experience, work reasons caused his separation from his wife. He has been an excellent client, very well-liked by his workmates, and tells us that he will continue with his credits since AFODENIC is a financial institution that supports the most vulnerable sectors. His greatest wish is to provide a dignified home for his family and, even though he doesn’t live with his son, it’s the asset that he will leave to him.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For house remodeling (walls and part of the roof).

loans.name: Damarys Johanna

texts.es: La Sra. Damaris habita en un barrio de la capital que se llama Laureles Norte, desde su juventud, tiene 32 años de edad, con un niño de 7 años de edad que esta estudiando la primaria, su esposo trabaja como albañil por cuenta propia, y abecés por contrato es un trabajo muy agotado pero se gana bien, doña Damaris trabaja en servicios domésticos desde hace dos años, pues se le había dificultado encontrar trabajo ya que las plazas están llena. Con la solicitud de préstamo lo quiere para infraestructura para levantar dos paredes de su vivienda e ir quitando las paredes de madera que tiene actualmente para esto va a comprar piedra, arena, cemento y hierro. Su mayor anhelo es poder tener una vivienda digna donde pueda tener seguridad su familia,  ya que su vivienda es muy humilde pero gracias al  préstamo que AFODENIC le ha otorgado desea poder ver sus casa terminada.
texts.en:
Damaris lives in a city neighborhood called Laureles Norte, where she has lived since she was young. She is 32 years old and has a 7-year old child who is in primary school. Her husband is self-employed as a construction worker, and he sometimes works on contract. It is hard work but brings good earnings. Damaris has worked as a housekeeper for two years, since she had trouble finding other work due to few opportunities. With the request for a loan, she would like to fix the infrastructure in her home to build two new walls and take out the wood ones that she currently has. To do this, she will buy stone, sand, cement and iron. Her greatest wish is to have a dignified home where her family can live securely, given that her dwelling is very humble but thanks to the loan that AFODENIC granted she hopes to see it completed.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to build two walls.

loans.name: Marcos Tulio

texts.es: El Señor Marcos Tulio de 41 años de edad, trabaja como agente de seguridad en el Hospital Carlos Roberto Huembes de La Esperanza, Rama desde hace 14 años, tiene 3 hijos, 1 estudiando la secundaria y 2 la primaria.  Su compañera tambien trabaja y con el salario de ambos hacen frente a la educacion de sus hijos. Esta solicita a AFODENIC su credito # 7, el que utilizará para embaldosar el corredor de su casa, y brindarle mejores condiciones a sus hijos, sus creditos anteriores los ha invertido en mejorar su vivienda, demostrando que su record crediticio ha sido excelente durante los 6 creditos anteriores.        Sus compañeros de trabajo le tienen mucha consideracion y estimacion por su comportamiento, honradez y servicial son los atributos que tiene.  El deseo de don Marcos es brindar a sus hijos una vivienda digna con las condiciones necesarias y que estos continuen estudiando para ser profesionales en el futuro.
texts.en:
Marcos Tulio is 44 years old and works as a security guard at the Carlos Roberto Huembes de La Esperanza Hospital. He has 3 children, one of them is studying in secondary school and the other two are still in primary school. His spouse also works and with their combined salaries they can pay for their children's education. Marcos is requesting his 7th loan with AFODENIC, which he will use to make repairs in his house, and provide better living conditions for his children. He invested his previous loans in his house, demonstrating his excellent credit record with all prior 6 loans. Marcos's colleagues at work have a lot of respect for him, and say he is an honorable and hardworking man. His dream is to provide a well maintained and dignified home for his children so that they can continue in their studies and become professionals in the future.


Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To make necessary repairs to his home and continue to provide a good quality of life for his children.

loans.name: Maribel Rocio

texts.en:
Rocío is a member of the VilL. Huatatas Village Bank. She is 32 years old, married, and has two children who are 8 and 5 years old. Her older child is currently in school, while the younger one is in daycare.

Rocío runs a small potato processing plant from her home. She buys potatoes in bulk from the growers themselves, then peels and chops them using her processing machine and sells them to local chicken eateries and other restaurants, ready to be maD. into French fries. She adjusts the cut according to each restaurant’s preferences.

Rocío is requesting a loan of 600 soles to buy potatoes. The price of potatoes has gone up by almost 100% recently, from about .60 soles/kilo to 1.20 soles/kilo, so this loan will allow Rocío to buy about 400 kilos of potatoes.

In the future, Rocío hopes to expand her business. She would like to acquire a bigger space to work in, since her house is a bit cramped. She would then like to process more potatoes to begin working on an industrial level.

Rocío has been working with FINCA for about a year and has been a very responsible client. Her husband is also a member of a FINCA village bank, and has been working with the institution for several years now.

loans.use: Buy potatoes

loans.name: Seccelambras Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Ccejelambras esta integrado por socias que viven en L. comunidad D. Ccejelambras que pertenece al distrito D. Tambillo que se ubica a dos horas D. L. ciudad D. Ayacucho, actualmente L. comunidad se dedica a L. agricultura, produciendo en mayor cantidad L. papa y en menor cantidad L. crianza D. animales.
Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como L. venta D. comida, abarrotes, agricultura y L. crianza D. animales. Como es el caso D. Victoria Q. es viuda tiene 6 hijos ya mayores D. edad, Victoria se dedica a L. venta D. comida en el anexo D. Qechcca, con este negocio educa a sus hijos, aunque L. situación es difícil para elL. siempre hubo que comer, desD. que es socia del Banco Comunal aprendió a ahorrar, Victoria necesita un préstamo D. 1000 soles dinero que sera invertido en L. compra D. víveres para su negocio, Victoria sueña con tener una tienda D. abarrotes.
Por otro lado Simona C. es casada, tiene 6 hijos, Simona se dedica a L. venta D. cereales actividad que aprendió D. su mama, Simona sueña ahorrar para tener una bodega, Simona necesita un préstamo D. 600 soles dinero que será invertido en L. compra D. cereales variados.
Mientras que Zenaida es separada, tiene 1 hijo, Zenaida venD. comida en su casa a los trabajadores del gas D. camisea, una oportunidad para hacer crecer su negocio, Zenaida necesita un préstamo D. 600 soles dinero que será invertido en L. compra D. víveres al por mayor, Zenaida sueña con tener un restaurante en L. ciudad D. Ayacucho.
Como ellas las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos D. 300 soles, 600 soles, 900 soles, 1000 soles haciendo un total D. 13100 soles en todo el Banco Comunal.
Sus prestamos serán invertidos en L. compra D. arroz, azúcar, aceite, fideo, trigo, cebada, maíz, animales menores.
Las socias mencionan que aprendieron a ahorrar y sobre todo les gusta las capacitaciones que reciben que les ayuda en su vida diaria.
texts.en:
The Community Bank "Ccejelambras" is maD. up of members that live in the community of Ccejelambres which is in the district of Tambillo, located two hours from the city of Ayacucho. The community is mainly agricultural, producing mostly potatoes and in a lesser capacity livestock.

The members carry out different types of businesses such as the sale of foods, convenience stores, agriculture and raising livestock. As with the case of Victoria Q., a widow and mother of 6 grown children, she sells foods in downtown Quechcca. With this business she sent her kids to school, and although the situation was difficult there was always something to eat. Since she has been a member of the Community Bank, she has learned to save money. Victoria requires a loan amounting to 1000 soles, funds which will be invested in the purchase of grocery products for her business. Victoria dreams of having a convenience stO..

On the other hand Simona Callanaupa is married and has six children. Simona's business is selling cereals, a business that she learned from her mother. Simona dreams of saving enough to set up a convenience stO.. Simona requires a loan of 600 soles, funds which will be investe din the purchase of various cereals.

Meanwhile, Zenaida is separated and she has one sone. Zenaida sells food from her home to the natural gas workers fo Camisea, an opportunity to make her business grow. Zenaida requires a loan amounting to 600 soles, funds which will be invested in the purchase of wholesale products. Zenaida dreams of having a restaurant in the city of Ayacucho.

The other members require loans of different sums: 300 soles, 600 soles, 900 soles, and 1000 soles, totalling 13100 soles for the membership of the Community Bank.

The loans will be invested in the purchase of rice, sugar, cooking oil, pasta, wheat, barley, corn, and small animals. The members maD. mention that they learned how to save money, and above all they are grateful for the loans that they receive, helping them in their daily life.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase grocery products, various cereals, and other merchandise.

loans.name: Khanlar

texts.en:
Khanlar lives in Khachmaz. He was born in 1970. He is married and he has 2 children. 

Khanlar has a business where he transports vegetables and fruits to villages to sell. He has been in this business for 4 years. 

Now he needs a loan of 970 AZN so he can buy more fruits and vegetables to sell. This will help him to improve his business.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Yegana

texts.en:
Yegana was born in 1978. She lives in Khachmaz. She is single.

Three years ago she started her own business, a beauty salon.

Now she needs a loan of 970 AZN so she can enlarge her beauty salon. She wants to buy chairs, mirrors, and hairdryers. This will allow her to improve the services she gives to her clients.

loans.use: To grow the beauty salon

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase fuel

loans.name: Parigul

texts.en:
Parigul A. is 53 years old. She is a widow and she has two children. 

Her business is raising cattle. Each day she herds and allows the tame cows to graze on beautiful pasture land. She has been dedicated to this business for the last ten years. 

Parigul also works as a member of a cleaning staff. 

She works very hard at both jobs so she can offer her dearest children an adequate education. She wishes to give each of them the opportunity of higher education. 

Parigul now wishes to buy calves that she can breed. For this reason, she is asking for a loan of 600 Somoni, which will be repaid in a period of 12 months. 

Let us help this industrious mother make her dreams come true; help her see her her beloved children as professionals with a bright future.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Gulsara

texts.en:
Gulsara C. is an entrepreneur from Shahrituz, Tajikistan. She is a divorced mother of five children. Her children are the reason for her daily fight for a better life. 

She is the only breadwinner in her family. She has a business selling women's national dresses and trousers. She has her stand in the famous local market, “Inom.” 

Gulsara is very hard-working woman. She always achieves all her goals and overcomes difficult challenges with her natural optimism. 

She is now requesting a loan of 1,000 Somoni ($300 USD) for the term of 4 months. She will use the loan to re-stock her inventory. She hopes to purchase more merchandise at affordable wholesale prices for further retail sale. 

Gulsara's only dream is to ensure her children have a good education and to make them happy. We believe Gulsara’s integrity and the consistent growth of her venture over past years can guarantee further expansion of her trade and timely loan repayment. The well being of this family is in your hands.

loans.use: To purchase women's national dresses and trousers

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Mambo (greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 40-year-old Flora N. from Mwanza, a beautiful city on the shores of Lake Victoria. (Lake Victoria is famous not only because it is one of the largest lakes in the world, but also because it feeds the Nile River, a very important source of life for Africa.) Flora is married and has one child who is 17 years old.

Since 2007 Flora has been selling traditional clothing worn by Tanzanian women, called vitenge. Kitenge (the Swahili plural is vitenge) is a cotton fabric with wax print that is printed by using rotary printing machines. Kitenge is a communicating textile--the various colors, patterns, writings, and symbols represent moods, feelings, cultures, and traditions of native African people. Flora works at the business 9 to 12 hours a week, 6 days a week. She is requesting a loan of $400 in order to purchase additional vitenge in bulk for resale. Flora thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, so they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use their equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional vitenge in bulk for resale

loans.name: Gulbala

texts.en:
Gulbala is married with two children. He was born in 1955. 

He lives in the Khachmaz region, in a village called Garachay Djek. 

Gulbala raises cattle for a living. He has been in this business for the last five years. 

He now needs a loan of 970 AZN so he can buy 2 calves to breed.

loans.use: To buy 2 calves

loans.name: Buri

texts.en:
Buri H. is 54 years old. She is married and the mother of 3 children. 

Buri is a farmer. Her business has been able to support her children and provide a house for her family. On her land, she plants crops like wheat, onions and potatoes. She also raises cattle on the land. 

Buri buys calves in the market at a low price, feeds them, and then resells them in the same market at a higher price. Her younger son helps her with the business. Buri and her son grow enough crops to feed the family and to sell on the market to help the family earn a living. 

Today they are applying to IMON for a loan. Buri hopes to produce a rich crop yield, which she can sell in the market at attractive prices. She is therefore requesting a loan of 500 Somoni ($150 US Dollars) for the term of 12 months. Buri is planning to purchase fertilizer and to better maintain her cattle with the loan. 

Let’s support this courageous woman.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and maintain cattle

loans.name: Azamjon

texts.en:
Azamjon K. is 33 years old. He is married with 2 children. He became a father for the first time 10 years ago. This helped him to better understand the sacrifice and hard labor of the women of the house.

Azamjon works in agriculture. He has always been a very efficient worker. He grows potatoes and onions; he has been farming these crops for 11 years. 

For many years Azamjon has dreamt of building his own house. This is why he works from early morning until late at night. He hopes that someday his dream will come true. 

Today he wants to borrow 500 Somoni ($150 USD) for the term of 7 months. He will use the loan to buy bags to keep his onions and potatoes. He will also use part of the loan to hire workers. 

His goal is to sell the potatoes and onions pre-packaged in the bags at a higher price. 

This request is to help make a dream come true. Azamjon is asking for help from your generous heart.

loans.use: To purcahse bags to kepp potatoes and onions.

loans.name: Muška

texts.en:
A Kiva Fellow recently interviewed Muška. To see a clip from the interview, check out the youtube video at: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fvo6j84FKZ8

Muška was born in 1950. She lives in Srebrenica, a village devastated by the Bosnian war in 1995. In 1995, she was deported first to Tuzla and then to Sarajevo, where she lived until 2001. Her family was one of the first to return to her neighborhood. She now lives in Srebrenica with her husband, on a farm where she raises cows and turkeys and grows vegetables. She has two sons, both of whom are married and one of whom has children. In addition to farming and taking care of her animals, she often watches her grandchildren during the day, because their mother is a law student at a local university.

Muška requests a loan of 600KM from Women for Women, International to purchase the seeds and materials to grow and prepare a special corn-based product. The product is a mix of corn and grasses, and can be stored to feed cattle in the winter time. This is considered a specialty food for cattle, and is in high demand in Srebrenica. 

Muška’s loan will be guaranteed by her daughter-in-law, Tifa Efendić.

loans.use: To buy farming supplies

loans.name: Kholmamat

texts.en:
Kholmamat S. is 58 years old. He is married and he has three independent children. 

Kholmamat is a farmer. He has been working in agriculture for ten years. In this time he has gained much experience and a love for the land. He began cultivating his land through his own efforts and has gradually gotten ahead in life. He has been growing such crops as wheat, onions and potatoes. Each year he has produced a yield sufficient for both the family to consume and for Kholmamat to sell in the market. 

The business is his main source of income. While it generates a stable income, it also requires considerable funding. This is especially true because Kholomamat wants to grow the farm. He currently has an orchard and dreams of building a workshop so he can process fruits and vegetables. 

Today he is asking for a loan of 700 Somoni ($225 USD). Kholmamat would like to use this loan to buy supplies for the harvest and to improve production. This will allow him to increase the quality of his yield and his earnings at the time of sale. The loan will be repaid in 6 months. 

Kholmamat and his family are counting on your help. He thanks all those supporting him and promises to repay the loan in time.

loans.use: To purchase supplies

loans.name: Adela

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 32-year-old Adela M. from Mwanza, the beautiful city on the shores of Lake Victoria (Lake Victoria is not only famous for being one of the largest lakes in the world, but also for the fact that it feeds the Nile River, a very important source of life for Africa). She is married with 4 children, between the ages of 7 and 15. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting 1 dependant because his parents are unable to properly care for their son.

Since 2006, Adela has been running a clothing store that sells items from vitenge (traditional African clothing) to business suits, and from purses to undergarments. She works at the business for 9 to 12 hours a day, 6 days a week and is assisted by her husband. She is requesting a loan of $425 in order to purchase additional inventory in bulk. Adela thanks you for her support!

ABOUT SELFINA:

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory in bulk

loans.name: Davronjon

texts.en:
Davronjon is a very hardworking and responsible entrepreneur. He and his family live in Dushanbe, Tajikistan. He is not married, but despite his young age he already supports his parents. 

Davronjon works in the central city market, selling men’s clothing (jeans, jackets, shirts) and women's national dresses. His business is characterized by stability and consistent growth. He has been working in the market for 4 years. Currently, his net profit is about $200 per month. Davronjon likes to work for himself. His business has been the main source of income for his whole family. 

Today Davronjon would like to ask for a loan of 2500 Somoni ($750 USD) for the term of 6 months so he can purchase inventory from wholesalers and increase the assorted merchandise in his store. 

We believe Davronjon’s drive for success will help this young entrepreneur succeed and thrive in business. You can be an important part of the growth of Davronjon’s business.

loans.use: To purchase new goods to sell

loans.name: Heybat

texts.en:
Heybat is married with two children. He was born in 1963. He lives in Khachmaz.

Six years ago he started a farming business. He built an orchard.

Now Heybat needs a loan of 970 AZN so he can enlarge his fruit orchard. He wants to buy seedlings of apple and pear trees so he can expand the orchard.

Heybat's son is shown in the picture.

loans.use: To purchase seedlings

loans.name: Saidat

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 35-year-old Saidat S. from Mwanza, a beautiful city on the shores of Lake Victoria. (Lake Victoria is famous not only because it is one of the largest lakes in the world, but also because it feeds the Nile River, a very important source of life for Africa.) Saidat is married and has 5 children between the ages of 8 and 19. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting 1 dependent because he is an orphan.

Since 1989 Saidat has been raising and selling ducks. She works at the business for 5 to 8 hours per day and is assisted by her husband. Saidat currently earns about 150 USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of $400 in order to purchase additional ducklings. Saidat thanks you for supporting her business!

ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, so they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use their equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional ducklings

loans.name: Hamisa

texts.en:
Mambo (greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 35-year-old Hamisa R. from Mwanza, a beautiful city on the shores of Lake Victoria. (Lake Victoria is famous not only because it is one of the largest lakes in the world, but also because it feeds the Nile River, a very important source of life for Africa.) Hamisa is married and has 3 children between the ages of 7 and 12.

Since 2006, Hamisa has been selling traditional clothing worn by Tanzanian women, called vitenge. Kitenge (the Swahili plural is vitenge) is a cotton fabric with a wax print that is printed by using rotary printing machines. Kitenge is a communicating textile--the various colors, patterns, writings, and symbols represent moods, feelings, cultures, and traditions of native African people. Hamisa works at her business 1 to 4 hours a day and is assisted by her sister.

Hamisa currently earns about $25 a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of $400 in order to expand her business by purchasing additional vitenge in bulk, and to diversify her business by purchasing shoes and kanga. A kanga is a piece of printed cotton fabric, often with a border along all four sides. It is printed using the silkscreen method with its colorful pattern in frames. A kanga is a very useful item because it can be used as as either a wrap-around or a towel. Hamisa thanks you in advance for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, so they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use their equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional vitenge in bulk and to buy shoes and kanga in order to diversify her business

loans.name: Akouavi

texts.fr: Agée de 45 ans, Madame A. Akouavi est une revendeuse d’amande de noix de cooc depuis plus de 15 ans. Elle est une veuve ayant 5 enfants à charge. Aujourd’hui, les besoins de son ménage ne cessent d’augmenter alors que son pouvoir d’achat ne suit pas le même rythme. Dans l’optique d’accroître son revenu afin d’améliorer les conditions et niveau de vie des membres de son ménage, Madame A. Akouavi se propose de renforcer son commerce pour en dégager une rentabilité maximale. Malheureusement, elle ne dispose pas de fonds propre. C’est pour cela qu’elle sollicite un crédit devant lui servir de fonds complémentaire indispensables pour mieux rentabiliser son activité.
texts.en:
Mrs. Akouavi A., 45, has been selling coconut meat for more than 15 years. She is a widow raising 5 children. Today, the needs of her little household never cease to grow greater whereas her purchasing power does not progress at that same rhythm.

With a view to growing her income so as to better the living conditions of the various members of her family, Mrs. Akouavi A. is proposing to reinforce her business so as to get the maximum benefit from it. Unfortunately, she does not have her own savings. For that reason, she is requesting a loan to serve as complementary funds in order to make her business more lucrative.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of coconuts and sale of their meat

loans.name: Kayi

texts.fr: Agée de 38 ans, Madame A. Kayi est une revendeuse de céréales très dynamique et dévouée. L’année dernière, elle a sollicité et obtenu un crédit qu’elle a déjà soldé. Grâce au bénéfice qu’elle a dégagé de son activité de stockage et de vente de céréales, elle a pu assurer la formation de sa fille, la scolarisation de ses enfants et entreprendre des travaux de construction sur un terrain qu’elle avait acquis. Dans le souci d’offrir des conditions de vie meilleures aux membres de son ménage, Madame Kayi décide d’augmenter son pouvoir d’achat. C’est pour cette raison qu’elle sollicite un crédit qui lui servira de fonds de roulement indispensable à la rentabilité de son affaire.
texts.en:
Mrs. Kayi A. is a very energetic and devoted cereals reseller. Last year, she asked for, and was granted, a loan that she has already repaid. With the profit she made from her business stocking and selling cereals, she was able to provide for her daughter education, send her children to school and start construction work on a lot she bought. Anxious to offer better living conditions to the members of her household, Mrs. Kayi wants to increase her purchasing power. For this reason, she's seeking a loan to be used as the working capital indispensable to the profitability of her business.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cereals stocking and resale

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Mambo (greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 37-year-old Asha Kasanqu from Mwanza, a beautiful city on the shores of Lake Victoria. (Lake Victoria is famous not only because it is one of the largest lakes in the world, but also because it feeds the Nile River, a very important source of life for Africa.) Asha is married and has 4 children between the ages of 2 and 17. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting one other dependent.

For the past 2 years Asha has been running a mama lishe. A mama lishe is a restaurant or café in Tanzania that usually consists of a rough wooden table and some long wooden benches. The food is all local: rice, ugali (a hot sticky dough made from maize flour), and plantains (cooked savory bananas), all served with beans, vegetables, meat, and a variety of sauces. I was happy to discover she also serves up my favorite Tanzanian delight, vitumbuwa. Vitumbuwa is made out of rice, sugar, water, and eggs (optional), and is deep-fried to create a slightly sweet, puffy yet dense pancake of sorts. It is a "must try" if you ever find yourself in Tanzania!

Asha works at her business 6 days a week. She currently earns about $75 a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of $400 in order to purchase ingredients for her menu items at her mama lishe, including rice, sugar, and cooking oil. Asha thanks you for supporting her business!

ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, so they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use their equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients (such as rice, sugar, and cooking oil) for her restaurant

loans.name: Neyo

texts.fr: Née le 14 février 1958 à Agbanakin, Madame D. Neyo est une veuve ayant 5 personnes à charge. L’achat, le fumage et la vente de silure noire qu’elle a entrepris depuis plus de 32 ans lui permettait de subvenir aux besoins de son ménage. Mais aujourd’hui, avec le phénomène de vie chère, elle joint difficilement les deux bouts. Elle se propose d’augmenter son pouvoir d’achat afin de mieux rentabiliser son activité pour faire face aux multiples besoins de sa famille. Ne disposant pas de fonds propres, elle sollicite un crédit qui lui servira de fonds de roulement indispensable à la stabilité et à la sécurisation de son revenu.
texts.en:
Born on February 14, 1958 in Agbanakin, Ms. Neyo D. is a widow who is responsible for five people. Buying, smoking, and selling black catfish has been an enterprise of hers for 32 years. It used to allow her to support her household needs. But today, with the unusual high cost of living, she has difficulty making both ends meet. She has the idea to increase her buying power to make her business more profitable. This would in turn enable her to cope with multiple family needs. Lacking the working capital, she is requesting a loan as the operating funds necessary for stabilizing and securing her income.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To smoke and sell fish

loans.name: Aissa

texts.en:
Mambo (greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 40-year-old Aissa K. from Mwanza, a beautiful city on the shores of Lake Victoria.(Lake Victoria is famous not only for being one of the largest lakes in the world, but also because it feeds the Nile River, a very important source of life for Africa.) Aissa is married and has 4 children between the ages of 15 and 24. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting 2 dependents who were orphaned when their parents passed away due to HIV/AIDS.

Aissa is quite the entrepreneur--she has been running both her general store and her hair salon since 2006. At her general store, she sells an assortment of items from vitenge (traditional Tanzania cloth) to detergent to beauty products. At her salon, she offers a wide variety of services from haircuts to weaves. She works at her two businesses 9-12 hours a day and is assisted by her husband and children. Aissa currently earns about $150 a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of $400 in order to expand both of her businesses. Aissa thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, so they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use their equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To expand her grocery store and hair salon

loans.name: Aubine

texts.fr: Agée de 30 ans, Madame K. Aubine est une veuve ayant 3 enfants à charge. Depuis plus de 5 ans, elle s’est lancée dans la vente de condiments et légumes grâce à laquelle elle subvient aux besoins des enfants. Aujourd’hui, avec la multiplication des besoins du ménage, le phénomène de la vie chère et son faible pouvoir d’achat, elle ne parvient même plus à satisfaire aux besoins élémentaires de ses bouches à nourrir. Au même moment sa clientèle augmente mais son faible pouvoir d’achat ne lui permet pas de la satisfaire pour bien rentabiliser son activité. Pour toutes ces raisons, elle sollicite un crédit pour renforcer son commerce et répondre aux besoins de son ménage.
texts.en:
Mrs. Aubine K., 30, is a widow raising 3 children. For more than 5 years, she has been selling condiments and vegetables, from which business she supports her family. Today, as the needs of her household are growing, with living costs high and her buying power reduced, she can no longer manage to make ends meet so as to cover the most basic expenses of her brood. At the same time, her clientele is growing but her low buying power does not allow her to meet their needs and make her business really profitable. For all these reasons, she is requesting a loan to bolster her business so she can support her household adequately.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: sale of vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Mambo (greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 44-year-old Christina M. from Mwanza, a beautiful city on the shores of Lake Victoria. (Lake Victoria is famous not only for being one of the largest lakes in the world, but also because it feeds the Nile River, a very important source of life for Africa.)

Christina is married, with one child who is 21 years old. Christina has been running a hair salon since 2005. She works at the business for 9 to 12 hours a day and is assisted by her husband. Christina currently earns around $75 from her business. She is requesting a loan of $400 in order to buy additional equipment, such as hair dryers, for her salon. Christina thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, so they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use their equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy additional equipment, such as hair dryers, for her salon

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Mariée et mère de 2 enfants, Madame K. Afi est une femme dévouée et très dynamique qui a entrepris la commercialisation de maïs et de gari depuis 16 ans. L’année écoulée, elle a bénéficié d’un financement qui lui a permis de renforcer son commerce. Aujourd’hui, elle a soldé son crédit et a à son actif 2 lopins de terre. Dans la perspective d’augmenter son bénéfice en vue d’entreprendre des travaux de construction, elle décide d’augmenter son pouvoir d’achat en sollicitant de nouveau un crédit. Ce prêt lui servira de fonds de roulement complémentaire indispensable à une bonne rentabilité de son activité.
texts.en:
Ms. Afi K. is married and the mother of two. She is a very energetic and devoted women whose undertaking has been the commercialization of corn and gari (granulated cassava root) for sixteen years. In the previous year, she benefited from financing that enabled her to bolster her business. Today, she has paid off her loan and is actively working two patches of land. From the viewpoint of increasing her profit for construction purposes, she decided to increase her buying power by requesting a new loan. This loan will serve as added working capital that is indispensible in making her business really worthwhile.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To create an inventory of grain and gari for sale

loans.name: Kodjo

texts.fr: Agé de 29 ans, Monsieur G. Kodjo est un maître menuisier qui a ouvert son atelier depuis 4 ans. Il est marié et a 4 personnes à charge. Bien que sa clientèle ait triplé, il n’est pas en mesure de satisfaire celle-ci pour assurer de meilleures conditions de vie aux membres de son ménage. En effet, Monsieur G. a un pouvoir d’achat extrêmement faible qui ne lui permet pas de se procurer de matériel de travail en quantité suffisante. Dans le souci de satisfaire sa clientèle afin de dégager d’important profit pour sortir sa famille de l’extrême pauvreté, il sollicite un crédit pour acheter des planches et troncs d’arbres afin de réaliser des travaux d’ameublement.
texts.en:
Mr. Kodjo G. is a master furniture maker who opened his workshop 4 years ago. He's married and has 4 persons to support. Although his clientele has tripled, he cannot meet their demand in order to ensure better living conditions to the members of his household. Indeed, Mr. G. has an extremely low purchasing power, that does not enable him to buy materials in sufficient quantities. Anxious to meet customer demand in order to make significant profits to get his family out of extreme poverty, he's seeking a loan to buy planks and trunks to make furniture.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy planks and trunks to make and sell furniture

loans.name: Mariamu

texts.en:
Mambo (greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 28-year-old Mariamu S. from Mwanza, a beautiful city on the shores of Lake Victoria. (Lake Victoria is famous not only for being one of the largest lakes in the world, but also because it feeds the Nile River, a very important source of life for Africa.)

Mariamu is single, with one child who is 7 years old. She has been running a used clothing store since 2007. Second-hand clothes journey across the oceans from America and Europe.
